Summary

The Payroll & Business Analyst will develop a robust understanding of all business unit regulatory standards, in order to ensure governance and compliance.

Manage all garnishments, deductions, and Paid Time Off (PTO) balances in ADP Workforce Now.
Manage ACA compliance within Workforce Now.
Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in payroll.
Assist with the maintenance of fixed assets including processing additions, dispositions and running monthly depreciation.
Reconcile bank accounts including checking, payroll and lockbox accounts.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications and Skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Outstanding interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills.
·Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.
Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
Experience using ADP Workforce Now preferred.
Must possess thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite.
Ability to develop strong trusting relationships, in order to gain support and achieve results, within a diverse group of employees, ranging from a field environment to a corporate setting.
Flexibility and ability to interact with employees at all levels.

Education:

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Business Administration or related field preferred.
Minimum 5 years’ of experience in a corporate environment preferred.
Minimum 5 years’ of experience in Payroll preferred.

Business Requirements Analyst

Position Summary: The Business Requirements Analyst is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and documenting the requirements for a new software system. They will work closely with stakeholders, both internal and external, to ensure that the software system meets the business needs and is delivered on time and within budget. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical and communication skills, with a keen eye for detail.

Key Responsibilities:

Requirements Gathering: Conduct interviews, workshops, and observation sessions with key stakeholders to gather detailed requirements for the new software system.

Documentation: Create clear, concise, and comprehensive requirement documents, including use cases, functional specifications, and data flow diagrams.

Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with project managers, developers, QA teams, and other stakeholders to ensure that requirements are understood and can be effectively translated into technical specifications.

Validation: Ensure that the documented requirements align with the business objectives and validate them with the stakeholders.

Requirements Management: Maintain and update requirements as changes occur during the development process, ensuring that all changes are properly documented and communicated.

Analysis: Identify gaps between current processes and the proposed software system, recommending solutions or changes as necessary.

Prioritization: Assist in prioritizing features and requirements based on business value, risks, and dependencies.

User Acceptance Testing (UAT): Support the QA and testing teams by providing clarity on requirements and assisting in the development of test cases. Participate in UAT to ensure the system meets business needs.

Continuous Improvement: Keep abreast of industry best practices and methodologies to improve the requirements gathering and documentation processes.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in business analysis or a related field.
Strong understanding of software development lifecycles and methodologies.
Proficient in requirement management tools like JIRA, Confluence, or similar.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Certification in Business Analysis (e.g., CBAP, CCBA) is a plus.

Business Analyst

Are you a tech enthusiast who loves solving complex problems?
Do you have a keen eye for detail and excellent analytical skills?
Would your friends describe you as a self-starter who takes pride in your work and enjoys collaborating with others?

If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you at The Greentree Group!

WHO WE ARE

The Greentree Group is a dynamic, innovative, and thriving company that specializes in delivering advanced technology solutions to federal, state, and commercial clients. With a team of highly skilled professionals, we provide cutting-edge services and are always pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.

What sets us apart is our commitment to excellence and our passion for the work we do. At The Greentree Group, we are driven by a shared sense of purpose and a desire to make a difference in the lives of people around us. Whether it's helping our clients achieve their goals, developing innovative solutions to complex problems, or giving back to the community, we are dedicated to making a positive impact.

We also believe in investing in our people and providing them with opportunities for growth, development, and advancement. We offer a dynamic and supportive work environment, a culture of continuous learning, and a wide range of benefits and perks that promote work-life balance and personal well-being.

Whether you're a seasoned expert or just starting out in your career, if you're passionate about technology, committed to excellence, and eager to take on new challenges, we want to hear from you!

ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY

As a Business Analyst, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and collaborate with a talented team of professionals in support of a client in the Tallahassee, FL area. Your role will be responsible for monitoring and evaluating software development and system modernization activities in a state-wide implementation effort. Join us and be part of our mission to make a difference!

SOME RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:

Research, understand, and interpret functional and nonfunctional requirements to include business and stakeholder requirements, data and information requirements, data integration, metadata, data quality, service levels and performance.
Articulate technology in terms stakeholders can understand, and articulate business concepts and processes to the technical team.
Participate in developing business cases, defining high level business objectives, and developing key success factors for solution delivery.
Manage and maintain the Project Risks, Action Items, Issues, Deliverables and Decisions (RAID) log and other Project logs.
Review test plans for acceptance testing to meet user-defined requirements, as directed by the Department.
Oversee and assist the team with testing on system changes by executing test scenarios and record the test results, defects, and resolution of defects.
Provide analytical research and complete tasks.
Review project deliverables and tasks for accuracy, completeness, and quality.
Provide post-implementation support.
Participate in weekly and monthly status meetings, project meetings, and stakeholder meetings.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field and technical knowledge and understanding of information technology infrastructure and software development practices and techniques. Relevant experience on a year-to-year basis can substitute for specific degree requirement.
Minimum of three years of experience gathering, documenting, and managing business and technical requirements for system implementation.
Minimum of three years of experience collecting and analyzing data, and software process evaluation and improvements.
Minimum of three years of experience working both independently and as a member of project team, in the analysis, design, development and implementation of a complex system implementation.
Minimum of three years of experience in developing detailed project documentation and presentations.
Minimum of three years of experience assisting customers with development of business cases with application testing and implementation.
Minimum of three years of experience in meeting facilitation and documentation.

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Experience providing consulting services to a government client or agency.

SUMMARY: VSE Aviation is seeking an experienced candidate for its manager of financial shared services role. This role reports to the segment controller and leads a team of shared services accounting professionals. This role will be responsible for general ledger accounting including month-end close, account reconciliations, and analyses. As the leader of the shared services team, the candidate will be a key player in financial audits, developing team members, leading the financial integration of new acquisitions, and working closely with various business units to provide required financial information and analysis that support the growth of our business.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Responsible for general ledger accounting including month-end close, account reconciliations and analyses.
Maintain an internal control structure that ensures the integrity of information maintained in all financial areas.
Responsible for the financial integration of new acquisitions
Develop staff by managing performance, setting goals, providing ongoing training, and maintaining strong employee relations.
Report on the financial results of operational activities to senior leadership and other department heads
·Prepare invoicing schedules for new contracts; process monthly invoices to clients and funders according to the invoicing schedule; ensure accurate accounting and revenue recognition.
Manage set-up of new clients, new client revenue contracts, and projects in accounting software,
Contractual validation of funding, funds set up, determine funding calculation, monthly reconciliation of all funds, monthly reporting of funding to internal and external customers, analyzing of all funds and follow up on potential overspends.
Provides monthly financial support to the business by compiling monthly financial reports and processing and posting all accounting activity, including month end journal entries/accruals; assure all expenses are recorded in the month incurred; distribute departmental performance reports; analyze spending variances.
Provides business analysis with particular emphasis in understanding the supported business.
Assists directors and managers with the financial management of their departmental expenses.
The role works closely with the supplier contract manager to ensure proper funding, back up and beginning and ending dates.
The role also works closely with sales finance teams to ensure proper fund annual budgeting, management, and reconciliation.
Work with business unit leaders for the completeness and accuracy of the material inputs to the company financial model and overall business strategy
Be a proactive leader in seeking to improve the accuracy and efficiency of the organizations’ procedures, compliance activities and systems.
Streamline inefficiencies within the organization; develop systems and processes that minimize the number of resources to complete tasks, while maintaining the strongest level of internal controls.
In charge of the set-up and approval of all funds
Provide training to the areas of accounts payable, accounts receivable, monthly reconciliations, journal entries, etc.
Monthly, quarterly, and annual fund reporting to internal and external customers
Lead the communication and data flow to auditors for the annual financial and internal control audits.
Other duties as assigned.

Bachelor’s Degree (Degree: Accounting/Finance)
CPA Eligible
7 years of relevant/technical work experience and 4-7 years of leadership experience
Or an additional 3 years of specific work experience in lieu of degree.
·Proven experience building, developing, mentoring, and inspiring a high-performance professional accounting team.
Good understanding of financial reporting
Knowledge of US GAAP
ERP and consolidation system experience (HFM/Oracle/Essbase (SmartView))
High proficiency with Microsoft Excel
Applicable work experience in a high-pace environment and willingness to have a high diverse set of tasks and responsibilities.

Business Applications Analyst

Anticipated Salary Range: $58,000.00 – $65,000.00 per year

Closing Date: November 30, 2023

About Us

The Division of Rehabilitation and Liquidation (Division) is one of 13 divisions within the Florida Department of Financial Services. It serves as the Receiver of insurance companies that are placed in receivership, primarily for purposes of rehabilitation or liquidation. Under an order of rehabilitation, the Receiver seeks to remedy the problems that resulted in the company being placed into rehabilitation. In liquidation, the Receiver collects all assets of the company and ultimately distributes the available assets to claimants under a statutory prioritization. In both instances, the Receiver is responsible for conducting business on behalf of the company that has been placed in receivership. This process entails providing an array of services which include Accounting, Claims, Legal, Information Technology, Asset Recovery, and Administrative Services functions.

Position Summary:

The Division is seeking a Business Applications Analyst. This position is responsible for performing complex business systems analysis and supports business applications. The duties and responsibilities of this position include the following:

Reviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and end user requirements.
Performs requirements analysis that supports the automation of specific business processes.
Produces documentation for requirements specifications, process flow diagrams, system interface descriptions, implementation plans, project plans, and project status.
Provides project management services for business applications development projects, business analysis activities, and IT systems procurement efforts.
Analyzes and determines compatibility of business applications, new designs, or modifications with other systems.
Serves as a liaison between management, supervisors, end users and Information Technology staff.
Provides oversight and reporting for the procurement, execution, and performance of IT provider contracts.
Assess, implement, and provide support for third party software applications for use by Division employees.
Monitors performance of computer programs post implementation.
Train end-users or technical support staff on usage of business application programs.
Travel for receivership operations, if required, and performs other duties as needed.

Salary Range:

The hiring salary range for this position is $58,000.00 – $65,000.00 per year.

Minimum Qualifications:

A bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, management information systems, information systems, computer engineering, mathematics and three years’ experience in computer software development, software quality assurance, software project management, management information systems, web design, information systems, or
Professional experience as described above may substitute on a year-for-year basis for the required education.

Preference(s):

Preference will be given to applicants with experience in one or more of the following:

Insurance claims and/or policy administration systems
Accounting systems
Content management systems
Workflow systems

Employment Requirements:

In compliance with federal law, individuals selected for hire will be required to confirm their identity and eligibility to work in the United States.
In accordance with Florida Statutes 110.1128, the Division must verify male applicants have registered with the Selective Service System or have proof of registration exemption to be eligible for employment or promotion with the Division. If registration or exemption cannot be verified, male applicants are not eligible for hire. If currently employed by the Division, this law prohibits the promotion of such person. This requirement also applies to any male who has legally or illegally entered the United States. To check the status of your registration, obtain proof of exemption, review requirements for transgender people, or for general information about the Selective Service System, please visit www.sss.gov.

Why Join Our Team?

The vision of the Receiver is to be a recognized and respected leader in the efficient administration of insurance receiverships. To accomplish this goal, the Receiver is comprised of a talented workforce that is dedicated to providing quality service that maximizes value for the public. Joining our team will provide the opportunity to experience the following benefits:

A welcoming and open environment that fosters a sense of belonging, purpose and innovation.
Meaningful and challenging work that improves the quality of life for the citizens of Florida.
Shared values of service, teamwork, excellence, accountability, diversity, innovation and integrity.
A comprehensive benefit package that includes medical, dental, vision, life and other supplemental insurances, retirement and flexible spending accounts, front-loaded paid time off, and more.
A culture that supports flexible work schedules, community service and the recognition of employee contributions.
A commitment to training and development through continuous education and collaboration.

For more information, please visit our website at http://www.myfloridacfo.com/division/receiver/.

Company Overview

Who is Costa Farms? We’re one of the world’s largest horticultural growers—but without an ego to match our acreage. Our headquarters are in Miami, Florida, where we were founded in 1961. Costa Farms started on just 30 acres, and over the last 60 years, we’ve grown to more than 5,000 acres around the world. We have farms in North and South Carolina, Central and South Florida, and the Dominican Republic, plus an office in China. Costa Farms now employs nearly 6000 engineers, marketers, accountants/analysts, human resources professionals, and of course, growers and plant scientists!




Here at Costa Farms, we live by the values of H3: being Humble, staying Hungry, and always Hustling. The team rallies to the mission of being a lean, green, growing machine dedicated to enriching the world by bringing plants into everyone’s life.




True to that mission, we grow more than 1,500 plant varieties. Driven by the spirit of innovation, the team is always testing new plants and developing new solutions to make it easier for retailers and plant parents to enjoy plants. We’re also continuously testing different ways of growing our plants to increase quality and improve their ecological footprint as one aspect of our many sustainability efforts.




We cultivate plants, as well as a winning culture. Join the team, and you’ll find opportunities to learn and grow. You’ll collaborate with other driven, determined people who together keep Costa Farms an industry leader. You’ll support and be supported by a team that cares about each other, our customers, our consumers, and our community.




You’ll also find right away that Costa Farms is committed to providing a diverse environment. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, disability, age, military status, marital status or veteran status, or any other group status protected by federal, state, or local law.

DESCRIPTION

The Financial Analyst will be responsible for all aspects of operational data analysis, from meeting with internal stakeholders to define and gather requirements, to the delivery of insightful and actionable analytics. The analyst is tasked with building/reporting of KPIs, dashboards, scorecards, statistical models, and ad hoc analytics to ensure that business performance is measurable and reported in a timely manner. Extraction, cleansing, and transformation of data are all necessary functions to aid the analyst in their daily activities. This role will support business operations and reside in the financial planning and analytics department.

DUTIES

Provide internal key stakeholders with analytical insight to support business decisions and help meet company objectives.
Extract, cleanse and transform data from the company’s ERP systems to provide actionable results.
Design, develop, and maintain analytical dashboards to optimize labor planning using PowerBI and additional reporting systems.
Support the Operations Team in the implementation of KPI’s to help leaders make data-driven decisions about their workforce (i.e, turnover, operational productivity, financial drivers, performance management).
Play a key role in the budgeting of operational expenses for the company.
Partner with internal cross-functional teams for performance reviews, deep dives, and other support requests as they arise.
Continuously look for opportunities to improve processes, identify issues and provide recommendations to the Operations teams to increase efficiency.
Support the FP&A function with Ad-Hoc reporting and analysis as requested.

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in business administration or related analytical field (ie Business Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math/Statistics, Management Information Systems) required.
3+ years in analytical role required.
Bilingual – fluent English and Spanish verbal and written communication skills.
Experience with visual dashboarding tool (PowerBI), Tableau, or similar tool is preferred.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, with a strong emphasis on Excel required.
Experience with Microsoft Power Platform preferred.
Superior organizational, self-motivation and problem-solving skills.
Ability to effectively operate both independently and as part of a team.
Ability to manage projects/tasks to ensure successful delivery projects on time.
Ability to work through technical obstacles as they arise.



WORKING CONDITIONS & PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Schedule is Hybrid with mandatory Tuesday and Thursday days in Office with occasional additional days when needed.
Occasional travel may be requested.
Problem solving, oral/written communication, analytical ability, calculating, concentration, & interpersonal abilities are expected.
Eye/hand coordination, typing, handling, & wrist motion continuously
Bending, reaching, stretching, standing, & walking occasionally

The Systems Analyst II is a position within the Internal Consulting team across business analysis, system analysis, and process consulting job families. Systems Analyst II have some industry and technology experience, but are not independent practitioners. They support Senior Systems Analysts or BSA Managers on the project workstreams. Majority of the work activities are delivery focused e.g. requirements gathering workshops, documentation, test script development etc. Systems Analyst II should have strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving skills. They should also have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

Essential Functions:

Liase with internal and external customers to gather, document and analyze detailed business / system / product requirements needed by Technology teams to deliver projects.
Identify gaps in requirements and following up with stakeholders to resolve gaps, communicate requirements clearly using a variety of formats (e.g., user stories, acceptance criteria, functional"
Develop technical, functional, and strategic artifacts such as solution diagrams, business requirements, and business cases to support delivery of the projects across the SDLC.
Become a subject matter expert in the Subway ecosystem and develop the ability to explain technical concepts in simple terms to business stakeholders.
Plan, prioritize and manage project scope and product feature backlog and development of requirements and user stories where appropriate.
Work closely with internal and external customers and stakeholders, including any third parties to gather business requirements and define software functionality, throughout the release lifecycle, from inception to general release to ongoing support. May also work with internal and/or external development teams and vendor partners to deliver project objectives.
Support the project and program managers to ensure that the projects are delivered on budget and on time
Contribute to the Internal Consulting practice development initiatives such as training, intellectual capital development, benchmarking, training, and recruiting etc.
Validate all requirements, stories meet acceptance criteria, has the appropriate acceptance tests and accept requirements and stories as appropriate only if it passes all validations
Adapt to changing expectations and project demands. Develop a client first mindset. Become well versed in the internal consulting methodology and frameworks. Be flexible to be utilized >90%.
Skills & Abilities:

Bachelors Degree - Business, Computer Science, Engineering or other technical discipline or equivalent experience.
SCRUM Product Owner Certification Preferred. PMI certification or equivalent preferred
"2+ years’ overall experience in Consulting, IT services, and other Technology / Engineering functions.
1+ years’ experience as a Product Owner, Project Manager, Product Management or Business Analyst"
Passion for working in the QSR / Retail CPG industry and staying current with technology trends
Understanding of software development lifecycles (i.e. Agile, SCRUM, Waterfall, Iterative). Experience working with offshore and onshore development teams in Agile and Scrum methodologies using industry-standard tools (e.g., JIRA, TFS)
Strong influential communication skills (verbal, written and presentation), with the ability to exert influence and meet commitments in a highly matrixed organization
Prior experience in a technical domain / consulting preferred with ability to successfully adapt to changing priorities.
Ability to anticipate risks and devise solutions in the moment. Comfort with ambiguity, frequent change, or unpredictability.
Market research skills, including a curiosity for new technology products and trends, and the ability to explain their business value and impact.
Ability to liaise with disparate stakeholder groups and align them toward common goals and outcomes.

Support Operations, Sales and Finance departments with best in class process improvement through the latest technologies. Capable of gathering requirements and interacting with the business in non technical terms.

Devise or modify procedures to solve complex problems considering system processes, operating limitations and business risks.

Perform gap analysis, defect identification and tracking, and manage issues and risks to closure.

Create and present reports to senior management to support recommendations.

Intesa Sanpaolo is the banking group leader in Italy. Assisting more than 14,6 milion of retail customers through a network of 5360 branches, it significantly supports the development of Companies and gives an important sustain to the country's growth. In support of the Global Relationship Manager (GRM) Financial Sponsors International, the Business Analyst will:

Support the GRM in all tasks related to developing new and expanding existing relationships with Private Equity clients

Procurement.

Calling all innovators – find your future at Fiserv.

We’re Fiserv, a global leader in Fintech and payments, and we move money and information in a way that moves the world. We connect financial institutions, corporations, merchants, and consumers to one another millions of times a day – quickly, reliably, and securely. Any time you swipe your credit card, pay through a mobile app, or withdraw money from the bank, we’re involved. If you want to make an impact on a global scale, come make a difference at Fiserv.

Job Title

Technical Business Analyst

Finxact, a Fiserv Company, brings innovation to the core of banking and provides a next generation core platform. Our mission is to redefine core processing and our commitment is to be the best at what we do.

What does a successful Technical Business Analyst do?

The Technical Business Analyst’s role is to provide technical support to the Integrated Solutions team including, but not limited to, spinning up development, UAT, and demo environments, working with internal resources to develop standardized procedures to make the ecosystem integration process a delightful experience for both internal and external resources, and writing detailed procedures and tutorials.

What you will do:

The type of activities expected to be performed at this level include but are not limited to:

Obtaining and maintaining an in-depth understanding of Finxact’s technology and its underlying architecture.

Developing innovative solutions centered around the Finxact Core to solve complex business problems.

Become SME of application eco-system and provide training to employees or clients on features and integrations.

Communicating complex technical concepts to a variety of audiences.

Build and maintain key business relationships (internal and external), culture, and common commitment across the product eco-system.

Creating a culture of learning and collaboration across the ecosystem.

Leading and participating in troubleshooting exercises for partner integrations.

Supporting the technical design process by participating in the analysis of technical application requirements.

Utilizes systems and data to resolve business issues in the most effective and productive manner.

Participating in execution and documentation of tests.

What you will need to have:

5 – 10 years financial services experience.

Knowledge and/or experience with a variety of banking applications and detailed understanding of those interactions.

Software implementation and configuration background.

Experience in API and software development.

Experience working with a cross-functional team.

Experience managing multiple projects and priorities simultaneously.

Ability to provide remote support for our bank customers during live and post live implementations which may include issue resolution and manual maintenance.

What would be nice to have:

Project management or product owner experience a plus.

Familiarity with Agile methodologies and practice is a plus.

This role is not eligible to be performed in Colorado, California, New York or Washington.

Primo Water Corporation is seeking an experienced Business Analyst/Product Owner with a strong background in web development and e-commerce platforms to join our dynamic team. Who We Are
Primo Water North America is America's favorite water, coffee and filtration solutions provider-reaching customers when, how and where they need water and creating customers for life by making better-for-you beverages easy.

One of North America's largest bottled water companies, we deliver safe, great-tasting water to homes, businesses and retail locations across the U.S. and Canada via 12 regional brands and three national brands - Alhambra, Canadian Springs, Crystal Rock, Crystal Springs, Deep Rock, Hinckley Springs, Kentwood Springs, Labrador Source, Mountain Valley Water, Mount Olympus, Nursery, Primo, Sierra Spring, Sparkletts and Vermont Pure.

In North America, we provide direct delivery to more than 1.6 million homes and business locations, and over 13,000 retail locations across 42 U.S. states and Canada, covering 90% of the U.S. population and 80% of the Canadian population. We are also proud to provide more than 22,000 water exchange and refill locations.

Job Title: Sr SAP Business Analyst, Info Systems
Job Description:
Make a Difference in YOUR Career!

Our vision is both simple and ambitious: to put our drinks on every table.

We are the leading global independent beverage solutions provider. We serve a broad range of national and international retailers as well as Global, National and Emerging (GNE) brands. Our products are distributed worldwide from our production sites in Europe, North America, and Australia. Although our own branding may not appear on the labels of the beverages we produce, there is a good chance you are reading this while sipping one of our drinks.

Our ambition is to continually improve and it’s what keeps us at the top of our game. We are solutions-based. We are innovative. We seek out new challenges and conquer them. This is our company ethos, but it’s our people’s too: Refresco is at the cutting edge of a fast-moving industry because we have passionate people pushing the boundaries of what’s best.

Stop and think: how would YOU put our drinks on every table?

Position Description

The Sr SAP Business Analyst, Info Systems is the liaison between the business community and the IT groups operating as subject matter expert for the systems and processes used. The role is heavily focused on understanding the current state of key business processes and owning change which enhances the use of system capabilities, drives process standardization, and promotes industry best practices. It requires a high-level understanding of systems, industry, and end-user requirements. This position reports to the Manager of Systems Governance & Analysis within the Information Systems Project Management Office (PMO).

Essential Functions:

Elicit and analyze business needs for system capabilities, enhancements, or reporting to document the process and desired solution attributes
Driving streamlining of integrated business processes, to improve automation, data capture, and analysis across all business functions.
Facilitate workshops to identify and document current and future state business process including detailed requirements (table/field definitions, process logic).
Own the process to collect, manage, and execute business requirements from design to post-implementation, including training/support.
Collaborate with users and IT to establish and enhance understanding of business processes in our systems.
Participate in cross-functional project teams, collaborating with application and business teams for all projects.
Responsible for post-acquisition data migration conversion reconciliations and governance as part of the Integration projects, to meet external SOX audit requirements.
Partner with team members to develop project schedules, reports, and documentation. May be required to act as project managers for quick win projects and/or provide direction to others in the team.
Own the development, documentation, and communication of business system rules, definitions, structures, and processes; responsible for creation and upkeep of process-based testing scripts.
Drive SAP best practices into all solution design.
Conduct root cause analysis of system defects through engagement of technical and business teams to identify, sequence, and implement solutions that prevent a recurrence.
Serve as a subject matter expert for the systems governance process; provide training and support on appropriate practices for documentation of the business process, business requirements, and test plans
Conduct User Acceptance Testing of system enhancements and new applications, including initial root cause analysis of failure.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's Degree in Business with a preference for Accounting, Finance, or Computer Science majors (CPA or pursuing preferred) or a similar discipline.
Minimum of 4 years of relevant experience in finance, procurement, supply chain, or business analysis
Minimum of 1 year of experience relevant to source-to-pay, plan-to-inventory, order-to-cash cycles, or record-to-report.
Exposure to the business functions of a manufacturing enterprise from an operation, finance, supply chain, or business analysis perspective desired.

Required Skills and Competencies:

Comfortable operating in a dynamic, complex, and changing environment
Able to work independently, adapting as necessary in a change-oriented culture, elevating conflicting priorities for clarification as they arise
Strong written and oral communication skills
Strong desire to solve complex business problems through an understanding of business processes, ERP structure, business strategy, and system capabilities
Ability to propose and evaluate solutions to satisfy business needs
Intermediate finance and analytical skills with a basic understanding of IFRS/US GAAP
Strong collaborators who are comfortable working with cross-functional teams

Position-Specific Travel/Work Requirements:

May be required to travel up to 15% - 20% of the time based on business needs
Must comply and acknowledge the "Refresco Home-based Job Requirements" policy reviewed during new hire's onboarding.

A Career with Refresco

Refresco offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits, which include:

Medical/dental/vision insurance
Life insurance
401(k) savings plan with company match
Paid holidays and vacation
Well-being benefits
Discount programs

Join Refresco TODAY and enjoy a rewarding CAREER!

Description:

Inter Miami CF seeks a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to lead, control, and generate partnership packages for prospects and partners. This person will evaluate, analyze, and propose value propositions based on market and industry trends. The BI Analyst will also help administer and maintain the Club’s CRM and asset inventory system, while working to organize and model research, customer and financial data to support business decisions, sales, and go-to-market strategy. The role is responsible for ensuring accurate data in our system to support analysis.

Requirements:

Essential Duties & Responsibilities:

Create customized sponsorship packages for IMCF partners and prospects. This involves continuous communication and coordination with the Business Development (BD) department, PA team and the BI analyst to gather sufficient insights for tailoring proposals to each partner and category. This includes both physical on-site assets and digital assets for partners.
Co-Responsible for managing TRAK system/platform. TRAS is a software that captures all the commercial activities of the Business Development (BD) department, as well as the club's retail inventory and the control of the activation of sponsorship packages /assets by the PA (Partnership Activation) team.
Responsible for controlling and creating commercial assets, ensuring they are correctly included and utilized in sponsorship packages and proposals: 1)Continuously maintain and update the catalog of assets, ensuring all information is recorded in TRAK platform. 2) Monitor inventory of commercial assets, their usage, and their availability.3) Ensure that commercial assets are implemented and delivered as agreed upon.
Stay informed about industry trends by generating benchmarks and best asset creation and activation practices.
Identify new value propositions and projects for partners/prospects by collaborating with other club areas and staying up to date on new possibilities for club assets.
Act as a liaison between Business Development teams, BI Teams, and Partnership team regarding creating, controlling, and implementing sponsorship assets.
Act as a liaison between the club and the league (MLS, Leagues Cup, etc.) to ensure the delivery and implementation of assets.

The Business Analyst will turn data into actionable insights to improve our business process and help create and manage our business intelligence infrastructure. Collaborate with stakeholders across various business units to understand their information needs and requirements

Utilize Power Query M language for data transformation within Power BI.

Overview:
The Technical Business Analyst performs process automation, report writing and data analysis duties. In this role the Technical Business Analyst has a key role in identifying and determining which techniques should be used for each project based upon size, complexity, and stakeholders. Exercises initiatives, discretion, strong interpersonal skills and independent judgment with respect, in making recommendations that can impact an entire project or system. Assignments require advanced skills and knowledge of hardware, software and system data.

Principal Duties & Responsibilities:
Documents new processes and updates current documentation of computer systems, programs and implement new procedures as needed.
Works with stakeholders from the different business units, third party processors or support teams to ensure design specification and users functionality meets the needs of management decision support functions and those of our user base.
Tests programs and operational procedures and provides basic technical training and support in problem resolution for our user base.
Applies systems analysis techniques and procedures to determine hardware, software, or system functional specifications, which are essential to the sound business operations of the bank.
Analyzes, documents, creates, designs, tests and develops or modifies computer programs and operating systems working with end users to ensure user design specifications.
Creates, designs, writes codes, maintains and modifies scripts for data extraction, business process automation and report creation from business intelligence systems.
Works closely and effectively with management throughout the organization, providing technical guidance in business process planning and deployment.
Responsible for creating and maintaining operational procedures and process flowcharts for banking and business applications used by the institution.
Works closely with users and other Analysts to strategize the analysis, planning, development and implementation of new systems, hardware, software, technologies and business intelligence initiatives.
Performs data mining and creates reports for management decision support using the bank’s data analysis business intelligence and report writing tools.
Recommends and designs process for monitoring system activities automatically as well notification mechanisms and follow up action workflow.
Works closely with project managers in assessing cross product and operational impacts of proposed projects to be implemented.
Participates in the planning and executing application testing and implementation.
Backup resource for processing IF4 posting files.
Backup resource for handling Core mass update requests using Navigator’s MAP feature as needed.
Maintains confidentiality and keeps a professional demeanor at all times.
Maintains compliance with established thresholds for Regulatory Excellence key risk indicators.
Qualifications:
2-4 years experience on Business Intelligence, MS SQL Server – SSIS - ETL Processes, SSRS required.
Comprehensive banking experience preferred.
Experience with Power BI preferred.
Possesses a blend of strong banking business and high skill level proficiency using technical business analysis software.
Proficient in the use of data mining tools; SSRS or Power BI a plus.
Experience with ETL, SSIS, Data mapping, SQL and Stored procedures
Ability to manage multiple assignments and tasks simultaneously.
Demonstrated communication skills, both written and verbal, with experience communicating technical information and complex research findings to non-technical audiences across multiple modes; presentations, data visualizations, evaluation reports, and/or briefs.
Good interpersonal and phone skills.
Must be able to work in a team.
External client interaction (meetings, networking etc), accomplishment of goals, accuracy and regulatory compliance are critical functions of this job.

Required Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field and Banking experience, preferably with the Fiserv Premier Application Suite.

The Business Systems Analyst is responsible for performing a variety of business system support activities at the Boca Raton facility.

*
ESSENTIALS OF THE JOB*:

Function as a technical resource to facilitate the various stages of the data solutions life cycle including: Investigation, Analysis, Design, Testing, Installation, Maintenance and Training.

Sales Business Analyst, Fragrance
Coral Gables, FL, US
Fixed Term


The story of Cartier is founded on audacity and passion. For more than 170 years we have embraced a bold, pioneering spirit that continues to inspire our teams across all Métiers from our boutiques to our workshops and corporate offices. Our 9000+ colleagues of 105 nationalities are united by a shared independent spirit and commitment to excellence, striving to continuously enrich our Maison’s heritage by pushing the boundaries of creativity.



MAIN PURPOSE:

The Sales Business Analyst, Fragrance is mainly responsible for supporting the Commercial and Marketing Fragrance teams at the headquarter offices located in Coral Gables, FL. This includes activities that will support all channels across Latin America consisting of Cartier exclusive Boutiques, Local Market stores and Travel Retail doors. This role requires strong analytical skills in order to consolidate data figures received from our retail partners along with an expertise in excel, the ability to adapt quickly and multi-task. This role also requires great communication/follow-up skills, attention to detail with a curiosity to learn and find ways to improve reporting and promote agility. The Fragrance Coordinator must enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, be proactive, and bring a passion for numbers that will help drive the Fragrance strategy forward.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES




Job Accountabilities

Collect Sales Figures from all Retail Partners and consolidate into one report on a monthly basis; follow up as needed to ensure data is collected on time.
Create Reports of Sales Figures that contain analysis of trends and identifies opportunities so Sales and Marketing Managers can make quick business decisions.
Analyze and report on Monthly Business Reviews for our Boutique business; share results with Sales & Marketing Managers and immediately raise any call to actions
Gather and send partner invoices to Accounts Receivable to ensure credits are issued to partners on a timely manner; follows up and escalates as needed to avoid delays.
Documents all expenses to ensure the budget is respected and creates/adjusts POs as needed.
Build strong relationships with cross functional teams including sales, marketing, accounts payable and accounts receivable to ensure normal day to day activities run smoothly.
Build and maintain a visual database to track visuals on display by point of sale across the region including measurements, current campaigns and expiration dates.
Manage the entire process to change visuals anytime there is a new campaign and update in visual database as needed.
JOB PROFILE
Bachelor’s Degree in Business or related field.
3+ year of experience in data analysis or related role.
Experienced with Microsoft Excel (can perform complex functions).
Fluent in both English and Spanish.
Service & details oriented.
Multitasking and time management skills.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
People-oriented and team player.
Able to adjust to different style of people, culture, background, etc.

Job Title: Retail Financial Analyst, Business Analysis & Reporting

Publix Super Markets tops the list of privately-owned supermarkets in the US. We are privately-owned, hold no long-term debt and continue to grow year after year. Commitment to Publix and our mission

Position Summary:

The IT Business Analyst position is a full-time employment opportunity. Reporting to the Business Analyst Manager. The position is in Winter Park, Florida. This position is a critical role as part of the Business Analyst team. Business Analysts are responsible for analyzing business software needs, developing, refining, and documenting high-quality requirements for the company’s software products.

Essential Job Duties:

Elicit requirements from key stakeholders determining business needs and success factors.
Translate business needs into business requirements, and system design.
Scoping projects setting expectations.
Implement best practices for software requirement writing, following industry standards (User Story).
Ensure business solutions meet strategic goals.
Ensure requirements meet quality standards with business management approvals.
Demonstrates an advanced understanding of technical processes, architecture, environments, problems, and solutions.
Ensure plans are in place for adequate testing, deployment and ensures any issues are communicated and resolved.
Works with the business planning appropriate scheduling, communication and training systems are implemented.
Document decisions and supporting reasons for the actions made at design meetings.
Identify and communicate project risks to the project manager.
Facilitate knowledge transfer by presenting results of analysis and deliverables to project teams.
Maintain functional and user interface standards in the design of user interfaces, including screen layout, access, and navigation.
Ensures all application requirements are documented for HIPAA compliance, SOX compliance and software security vulnerabilities.
Requirements:


Additional Job Duties (include but are not limited to):

Partner with business users to obtain requirements.
Partner with business users to conduct user acceptance testing and ensure business sign-off.
Analyze data in support of business requests.

Leadership Competencies:

Plays a lead role in interacting with business customers eliciting requirements.
Demonstrates a strong understanding and knowledge of project management functions and processes.
Lead projects (under the overall leadership of a manager) with responsibility for work direction of less experienced team members.
Collaborate with team members to elicit, analyze, and evaluate information from multiple sources.
Demonstrates expertise in project management techniques, project documentation, and business communication as required by the project.

Minimum Requirements:

5 – 7 years of experience in software requirements development and management
Expertise in software requirements quality and traceability concepts
Familiarity with Jira, Xray, SQL Server - .NET and Snowflake experience preferred

Education:

Bachelor's Degree is required

All education must be conferred by a regionally accredited or approved nationally accredited institution. All candidates must provide proof of higher education (official transcripts) upon request.

Physical Requirements:

Physical Demands: While performing the duties of the job, the employee is regularly required to use hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee requires dexterity in using telephone, computer keyboard, mouse and calculator while seated at a desk. The employee is frequently required to stand, walk, and sit. The employee may frequently move to interact with fellow employees and/or clients. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

Communication Skills: While performing Duties of the job, the employee is required to read and comprehend instructions, correspondence, and memos. The employee requires the ability to write effective and detailed correspondence and to effectively present information both in one-on-one and small group situations.

Mental Demands: While performing duties of this job, the employee is required to deal with stress associated with a fast-paced work environment and multiple priorities/tasks. The employee will be required to make judgment decisions and adapt to changing work situations, grasp and apply new ideas, communicate with various personalities at all levels and can apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed instructions.

Work Environment: While performing duties of this job, the employee is required to work in an office environment, and the noise level is usually moderate to loud.

Communicate on a daily basis on ticket progress and let Developers / Support team know what the issue is where the issue is and document the requirements to fix the issue so the production support developers can fix the issues.

Date: Nov 16, 2023
Location: Miramar, United States, Florida, 33025
Company: Teva Pharmaceuticals
Job Id: 51810
Who we are
Together, we’re on a mission to make good health more affordable and accessible, to help millions around the world enjoy healthier lives. It’s a mission that bonds our people across nearly 60 countries and a rich, diverse variety of nationalities and backgrounds. Working here means working with the world’s leading manufacturer of generic medicines, and the proud producer of many of the products on the World Health Organization’s Essential Medicines List. Today, at least 200 million people around the world take one of our medicines every single day. An amazing number, but we’re always looking for new ways to continue making a difference, and new people to make a difference with.
The opportunity

Teva Pharmaceuticals USA, Inc. is seeking an IT Business Process Analyst III (Miramar, FL) to be responsible for understanding the intended business use of IT systems and partner with those stakeholders to achieve the business needs as implemented in the IT systems. Involved in full life cycle management of the systems (SDLC) from definition of business and technical requirements, determining the best technical solution, development, and testing activities during the system implementation and life cycle management, maintenance and support of all systems in scope.

Manage the various vendors supplying systems technology for all systems in scope.
Support projects outside of the business stakeholder area as talents across the R&D Clinical IT area are most efficiently leveraged.
Employ critical thinking to understand the business processes, partner with the business stakeholders, and serve as IT liaison on site for any business need or query.
Support the business in other work streams such as: Inspections, Testing, Integration, Reporting, Validation, and Change Management activities, in addition work closely with different functions in the organization to support the ongoing activities (procurement, YR, finance, legal).
Accountable for planning and execution of annual operations plan for systems in scope in alignment to the global R&D IT AOP including budgeting and project planning/scheduling.
Ensure and execute E2E IT Project Management throughout project lifecycle from initiation to execution, including URS definition, Scope, Risks, Resources, Costs, and Timelines as well as coordinating with other technical resources (e.g. information security, 3rd party IT vendors, ITO, etc.).
Provide daily and routine support, monitoring, handling simple and complex issues raised by end users.
Serve as liaison between the vendors and users for effective communication for resolution of issues including designing and conducting tests and support for the mechanisms to troubleshoot or verify correctness of fixes.
Analyze code development for strategic changes and bug fixes for legacy Java applications using Java, SQL, JavaScript, and Tomcat.
Create applicable GxP required documentation including design and testing specifications, installation instructions, and the necessary steps to support the system once implemented.
Telecommuting is permitted 2 days per week.
Your experience and qualifications
Requires a Bachelor’s degree or foreign academic equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, Electrical/Electronics Engineering, or a related field.
Plus 3 years of experience in the job offered or 3 years in a related occupation including Business Application Analyst, Software Engineer, or related experience.
Position requires 2 years of experience with SDLC, GxP, and SQL.
40hrs/week.

Project Management skills

Strong relationship skills both internal and external (vendor)

Extensive experience in analyzing HRIS and HR performance metrics

Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills
Experience in documenting processes, as well as performing diagnostic tests and audits

Mad Mobile is leading the charge in building the next generation of retail and restaurant experiences. In today's rapidly evolving market, customer expectations continue to change, and Mad Mobile is at the forefront of innovation. We empower customers to engage and purchase from brands seamlessly, whether they're in-store, outside the four walls, or on the go. Our platform already supports some of the biggest brands, and we're always looking for new ways to engage with Customers, increase in-store productivity and ultimately drive transactional value. If you're passionate about creating exceptional experiences and shaping the future of retail and restaurants, Mad Mobile is the place for you!

About the Role:

Mad Mobile is looking for a unique individual who can jump in and quickly add value for our product and our customers. Since launching Concierge, Mad Mobile has won five highly-recognized industry awards ranging in Operational Efficiencies to Customer Engagement. The Sr. Business Analyst is a key role in the organization, working closely with Product Managers and other stakeholders to ensure Concierge requirements are documented and articulated across the team.

Our Retail team is focused on building the next generation of retail experiences for in-store, curbside pickup, remote shopping, and self-checkout. You’ll have a major influence in how software creates a modern experience for customers in retail, whether they’re shopping online or in-store. You’ll be crafting software experiences that make digital interactions tangible and building solutions that make customer interactions memorable. We believe that incredible product design is about creating memorable experiences for both staff and customers and we’re looking for someone who feels the same.

Role will be located in Tampa, FL

We are looking for someone who has:

Work closely with Product Managers to understand the product strategy in order to create and document business and functional requirements for features on the product roadmap
Elicit product feature requirements using customer / user interviews, document analysis, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis and workflow analysis
Collaborate with product designers to design experiences that meet the business needs and requirements
Create industry standard business requirement documentation that will feed into the product development lifecycle
Interpret customer business needs and translate them into software development requirements
Document and maintain the Product Library including Product definition / usability guides, process flows and detailed requirements
Regularly conduct internal and external product demos

You may be a good fit if you have these additional skills and/or educational background:

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Information Sciences or equivalent degree and experience required
5+ years’ experience in developing industry standard Business Requirements and Technical Specifications
Strong technical background with enterprise Retail experience
Must have strong communication skills, both verbal and written, a strong attention to detail and exceptional organizational skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team, the ability to manage time and resources to meet assigned deadlines
Ability to take strategic guidance on product direction and convert it into actionable designs and product development

Our core values:

Customer – WE believe that our customers deserve the best from us every day.
Accountability – WE take ownership and make things happen.
Teamwork – WE win as a team and have fun doing it.
Innovation – WE innovate, inspire, ignite the future!
Integrity – WE are honest, ethical, and trustworthy.

Why Mad Mobile?

Mad Mobile is the #38 fastest-growing company in Florida and #9 on the Tampa Bay Times Top 100 Workplace List. We’re proud of our culture and promote diversity and a healthy work-life balance.

What about the benefits you ask?

At Mad Mobile, we're committed to taking care of our employees right from the start. That's why there's no waiting period for our plans – they kick in from day one. We're proud to offer market leading benefits for medical, dental, and vision and cover a generous amount of your premiums. To make sure you're off to a great start, we even provide you with a $1000 HSA contribution (prorated based on your start date and split into two payments).

Additionally, we provide a 401(k) plan with a matching contribution of up to 6%, and the best part is you're fully vested from day one. At Mad Mobile, we're not only building the next generation of in-store experiences; we're also building the next generation of incredible teams.

Are you interested in working for a Fortune 100 retailer? Do you want to be able to apply your analytical knowledge and experience to help solve constantly changing business and customer facing opportunities? As a Consultant on the Business Analytics team you will be supporting Publix with Marketing measurement and data science methodologies that support decisions and create solutions related to the financial performance of Publix, its products and services, Publix Marketing campaigns, and customer behavior data.

This position consults with business partners across the organization to provide research based recommendations in support of strategic decisions for Publix. This includes managing the development and deployment of analytical solutions by researching and gathering data, performing financial analyses to glean insights, software coding and training end users on the use and interpretation of these solutions. The Business Analytics Consultant reports to the Manager of Marketing Business Analytics & Data Science.

Additional responsibilities include:
Utilizing data mining and discovery techniques to aggregate data and search for insights.
Extracting and aggregating sales data from our data warehouses and joining it to other business and customer data to uncover insights and key business drivers.
Focusing on the methodical exploration of Publix’s data to insure business intelligence and predictive analytics techniques used to examine historical store and customer transaction data provide insights into how a business area, store, campaign, or item performed over time and/or in the future.
Conducting statistical analysis to determine trends and significant data relationships by using predictive software to create regression models (linear, logistic, Bayesian, stepwise, etc.), decision trees, correlation analysis, random forest models, and time series analysis.
Determining appropriate coding language to utilize based on the source and analytical methodology that needs to be applied.
Selecting the appropriate data, statistical models, financial measurement approach and test methodologies necessary to help tell the business how to merchandise, market, grow, and target customers and stores.
Developing user interfaces and self-service applications to support customer usage of the Analytical Solution. This includes decisions related to the user interface design with the appropriate options so the end user can access needed data, reports, graphs, tables, insights, and recommendations with minimal training.
Developing and implementing analytical solutions that address business questions faced by decision makers throughout Publix, and translating the outputs of those solutions into actionable tools, insights, and recommendations that can be highly trusted by decision makers to influence decision making for a mixture of high and low profile projects.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Analytics, Data Science, Business, or another analytical field from an accredited college or university or its equivalent
3 years of analytics, or similar analytics field work-related experience
At least one (1) year experience writing SQL
At least one (1) year experience writing R code or similar functionality within other statistical tools
Knowledge of data and analytics utilizing market business intelligence
Ability to apply the appropriate advanced mathematics and statistics methods to large data sets, including, but not limited to, regression models (linear, logistic, Bayesian, stepwise, etc.), decision trees, correlation analysis, random forest models, cluster analysis, k-means, sum of squares, and time series analysis
Knowledge of and ability to apply Information Systems design methodologies, testing, processes and coding languages
Ability to develop advanced data algorithms
Database architecture skills
Ability to develop data visualizations
Knowledge of and an ability to apply research best practices, including secondary research process and methods
Ability to develop research based recommendations
Basic knowledge of Alteryx and the Alteryx Server or similar Business Intelligence (BI) Tools
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Ability to demonstrate critical and strategic thinking skills, including decision making skills
Project management skills
Ability to quickly develop an understanding of new information and processes
Ability to demonstrate leadership skills
Excellent written and verbal communications skills
Ability to demonstrate teamwork and collaboration skills, including strong interpersonal and emotional intelligence skills
Ability to persuade others using logical debate
Ability to work under minimal supervision and be self-directed with workload
Ability to demonstrate initiative by taking responsibility for learning new skills and processes
Willingness to travel up to one week at a time with overnight stays
Ability to work a variable work schedule as needed including nights, holidays, weekends, and extended hours to meet deadlines

Position Overview:

The Senior Business Intelligence Analyst is a key member of our business intelligence team, responsible for transforming complex data sets into actionable insights that drive informed business decisions. This role requires a seasoned analyst with a strong background in data analysis, reporting, and business intelligence tools. The successful candidate will collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements, design effective analytical solutions, and contribute to the strategic goals of the organization.

Job Responsibilities:

Data Analysis and Reporting:

Conduct in-depth analysis of large and complex datasets to extract valuable business insights.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate key performance indicators (KPIs) to stakeholders.
Collaborate with business users to understand reporting needs and translate them into actionable analytics.

Business Intelligence Tools:

Utilize advanced analytics tools and technologies to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data for analysis.
Stay current with industry best practices and emerging trends in business intelligence and analytics tools.
Assist in the selection, implementation, and optimization of BI tools to meet organizational requirements.

Data Quality and Governance:

Implement and maintain data quality standards to ensure accuracy and reliability of business intelligence outputs.
Collaborate with data governance teams to establish and enforce data quality policies and procedures.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Work closely with stakeholders from various departments to understand business objectives and requirements.
Provide analytical support to different business units, including sales, marketing, finance, and operations.

Ad Hoc Analysis and Special Projects:

Conduct ad hoc analyses to address specific business questions or challenges.
Participate in special projects that require advanced analytical skills and a strategic mindset.

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Statistics, Information Systems, or a related field; advanced degree is a plus.
Proven experience (5 + years) as a business intelligence analyst or in a similar analytical role.
Proficient in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Strong SQL skills for data extraction and manipulation.
Familiarity with ETL processes and tools.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.
Effective communication skills to convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders.

The Business Analyst is responsible for reporting, business process review, and data analysis relating to activities ensuring operational effectiveness. The BA will assist management by developing and maintaining reporting tool and processes, querying and analyzing data, identifying root causes, recommending and supporting decision making. The BA owns project goals by developing project plans, establishing deadlines, monitoring milestone completion, providing timely reporting of issues that impact progress and resolving conflicts – including, the documentation and prioritization of assignments.

Develop and maintain new and existing reporting tools, databases, and processes
Analyze various types of data and processes in a versatile manner and professionally present findings and recommendations
Query and manipulate data to root cause, trend, summarize findings, and offer recommendations.
Identify defects and improve departmental performance by supporting quality, operation efficiency, and production goals thru reporting
Work departmentally and interdepartmentally to recommend and implement modifications to existing reporting functions
Report and present findings based on data analysis and other project assignments
Communicate with all levels of the organization, including technical staff, internal non-technical staff, testing teams, and business stakeholders
Review technical specifications to ensure business requirements are adequately reflected in technical planning documents
Ensure all work is completed in accordance with regulatory, compliance and corporate requirements
Trend and compare analyses against departmental and corporate standards
Recommend changes to address deficiencies and/or further improve and streamline performance based on analysis findings
Recommend, develop, and implement effective reporting tools for the department
Prepare routine reports as needed (financial, quality, production, operational efficiency, etc.)
Track and report updates on individual work assignments and other projects within established timeframes
Work directly with appropriate members of the department and other Healthfirst business units to understand project concepts, objectives and approach
Assess and prepare to address the operational impacts, workflow, and training issues of the assigned project(s)
Ensure post implementation accuracy
Provide project and informational updates to management as available and/or assigned.
Collaborate with business units to understand strategic goals and promote an environment conducive to creativity, change and information exchange
Additional duties as assigned

Minimum Qualifications:
High School Diploma or GED from an accredited institution
Experience with in-depth data querying and manipulation of data to assist with root-causing, trending and summarization of projects presented to various level audiences
Experience with MS Excel functions that include working with large data sets, creating standardized reports (across multiple spreadsheets), utilizing vLookups and advanced functions/formulas, creating, using and interpreting pivot tables, filtering and formatting
Experience gathering and communicating complex analytical business requirements in a simple and easy to understand manner to other staff
Experience in creating and running complex queries using SAS, SQL or other programs (i.e. Visual Basic coding, etc.)

Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or higher from an accredited institution.
Relevant work experience within the healthcare industry (such as a managed care organization, commercial health insurance plans, hospital, etc.)
Experience with MS Access functions that include to running queries, Macros and building tables for reporting purposes
This is a collaborative team environment. You must be able to effectively work with others, provide and implement project solutions while understanding process flows
Demonstrate consistent multi-tasking skills and planning for prioritizing workload within tight deadlines.

Compliance & Regulatory Responsibilities: See Above
License/Certification: NA

What you'll do

In a few words… Abarca is igniting a revolution in healthcare. We built our company on the belief that with smarter technology we are redefining pharmacy benefits, but this is just the beginning...

The Data Analytics team leads the creation and management of standard reports for all Abarcans and clients to use. They review the raw data to supply updates for audits, create predictive models, and identify potential operational and clinical opportunities.

As our Business Analytics Specialist you will be playing a key role across the full project lifecycle for Health Analytics projects; from analyzing business requirements, up to developing, testing, deploying, training, and supporting users on analytics solutions that meet those requirements, you get to analyze it all to your heart's content. Other duties will include the analysis of data to provide insight and recommendations for business decisions and the performance of data validation to ensure accuracy and appropriateness of analytic models. You will be a integral component of the organization's Health Intelligence department, delivering valuable information by way of Intelligence and Informatics, and providing direct support to diverse internal departments such as Client & Pharmacy Partnerships, Clinical, Finance and Members.

The fundamentals for the job…

Analyze data from healthcare claims to assess trend performance and investigate potential operational and clinical opportunities.
Perform root-cause analysis of issues identified in reports; this will require a comprehensive understanding of overall business.
Communicate results to clients and staff; communication of results includes well-organized presentations reflecting analytic methods used, key decision points and sufficient detail to support comprehension of the analysis.
Report/Query testing and development.
Collaborate closely in all aspects of projects with stakeholders (business analysts, subject matter experts, and all client levels) to develop key Decision Support initiatives.
Develop proper processes for data collection, data mining, data standardization and analytics; initiate data management and identify proper use of analytics tools.
Combine business knowledge and technical expertise to assist customers and evaluate or manage business issues through data.
Partner with business intelligence team to define and support functional and/or architectural requirements for information delivery: participate and sometimes lead the planning, design, and creation of both, standard and ad-hoc reports, Dashboards and Scorecards.
Ensure projects' data integrity, including data extraction, storage, manipulation, processing, and analysis. Verify the completeness, timeliness, and accuracy of data warehouse information.
Work with business owners and technical resources to identify and handle any quality issues that may arise.
Provide production support to end users based on the timeless fashion of timeliness.
Work closely with the business intelligence team to determine appropriate data warehouse architecture and data modeling designs to maximize benefits.

What we expect of you

The bold requirements…

Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Business, Statistical Analysis, Healthcare Management, or a related field (In lieu of a degree, equivalent relevant work experience may be considered.)
3+ years' experience in a role requiring information analysis, SQL Querying and various forms of report deliverables.
Experience with healthcare utilization reporting, claims, membership, provider data, and standard Healthcare metrics.

Experience with development of KPIs, dashboards and departmental scorecards.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
We are proud to offer a flexible hybrid work model which will require certain on-site work days (Puerto Rico Location Only)

Nice to haves…

Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI.

Physical requirements…

Must be able to access and navigate each department at the organization's facilities.
Sedentary work that primarily involves sitting/standing.
