Job Summary:
The Business Analyst is responsible for developing, maintaining, monitoring and management of comprehensive data system to support service line within the NCH Healthcare System. These systems are used to perform analysis and research studies as required by Senior Management. The position must also ensure data quality and integrity in these financial and decision support systems. The Business Analyst is responsible for coordination of systems information to ensure that the System can report on critical information and complete project assignments on a timely and accurate fashion. Additionally, the Business Analyst is responsible for preparing worksheets and supporting documentation for the preparation of the Annual Audit, Forecast and Federal tax returns.

Responsible for providing financial and cost accounting analysis from both the physician group as well as the hospital.

Responsible for various misc. yearly reports.

30% Organizes, conducts, and facilitates cross-functional team meetings for moderate to complex projects and initiatives. Consults with project stakeholders to develop plans for user requirements (assessment process, workflow, reporting requirements).

THE OPPORTUNITY:

We are seeking a highly motivated and analytical Operations Data Analyst to join our team and support our Senior Vice President (SVP) of Operations in overseeing our diverse network of Grower processing facilities. This role plays a crucial part in gathering, analyzing, and presenting data to enable informed decision-making and process improvements within our operations department. As a Data Operations Analyst, you will work closely with the SVP of Operations to provide valuable insights, streamline operations, and enhance overall efficiency.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Compilation and Analysis:
Collect, organize, and validate data from various sources, including internal databases and external resources.
Conduct thorough data analysis to identify trends, performance metrics, and areas for improvement.
Develop and maintain data models and dashboards for real-time monitoring and reporting.
Report Generation and Presentation:
Create detailed reports and presentations using tools like Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and other data visualization software.
Translate complex data into clear, concise, and visually appealing presentations that can be easily understood by non-technical stakeholders.
Performance Metrics Tracking:
Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess the operational performance of our Grower processing facilities.
Work with the SVP of Operations to establish benchmarks and set targets for improvement.
Process Optimization:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify operational inefficiencies and areas where improvements can be made.
Propose data-driven solutions to optimize processes and increase productivity.
Documentation and Reporting:
Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of data sources, methodologies, and analysis processes.
Regularly report findings and progress to the SVP of Operations and other stakeholders.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor’s degree in business, Operations Management, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills and proficiency in Microsoft Excel, data modeling, and data visualization tools.
Excellent presentation and communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information to a non-technical audience.
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.
Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and meet deadlines.
Prior experience in data analysis and operations support is a plus, but not required.
Experience in business intelligence tools (Power BI, Tableau) would be a plus.
Exposure to Lean Manufacturing would be preferred.

This Data Operations Analyst role provides a unique opportunity to work closely with senior leadership, contribute to the optimization of our Grower processing facilities, and have a direct impact on our company's success. If you are a dedicated and detail-oriented individual with strong analytical and presentation skills, we encourage you to apply for this exciting position and be part of our dynamic operations team.

Job Description:
The Business Operations Analyst position plays a critical role in ensuring that the flow of purchase orders, inventory receipts, customer invoices, and supplier invoices are processed in an accurate and efficient manner. This position will provide support to 4 critical departments: Customer Service, Purchasing, Chain teams, and Warehouse/Operations. The analyst will act as a bridge between all cross functional areas, providing coordination and communication between these teams. In this capacity, the analyst is responsible for ensuring that invoicing and receipt of inventory is accurate and timely. They are also responsible for maintaining all required documents with the bonded third-party warehouse as required by corporate accounts payable and the state of Florida’s DBPR.

Daily Job Functions:
Inventory
Processing Gallo Advance Ship Notices for Tampa warehouse and Pass-Thru orders
Building receiving documents for Tampa warehouse team
Receiving inventory into the AS400 for Tampa warehouse
Resolve inventory discrepancies and process inventory adjustments as needed
Furnish inventory reports, allocated item lists, and product return reports to sales

Chain Direct-Ship Customers
Verifying PO’s and receiving into inventory Pass-Thru orders
Ensuring accuracy of pricing on Pass-Thru purchase orders prior to billing
Billing Pass-Thru warehouse invoices to chain customer accounts
Verifying BOL’s after shipment to correct and receiving and invoicing discrepancies

Accounts Payable
Invoice cost analysis and revisions
Submitting prior day inventory receipts to A/P in St. Paul
Final processing of daily Gallo invoices for A/P in St. Paul
Reviewing invoice discrepancies related to FOB and Freight

ALDI/ABC Specific Functions
Assist in order analysis and processing of new purchase orders as they are received daily
Generating ALDI M&W delivery documents for bonded 3PL to ALDI warehouses
Processing inventory receipts to bonded 3PL and generating transfer documents
Bill of Lading processing and generating final transfer documents
Billing invoices for individual purchase orders
Reconciling M&W physical inventory with inventory in Warehouse 2 in AS400
Verifying BOL’s after shipment to correct and receiving and invoicing discrepancies

Additional Functions
Setup of all new suppliers and products
Daily analysis of potential billing issues related to product and gross profit
Providing reporting and analysis as requested by GM, Director of Trade Development, and Director of Operations

JOB DESCRIPTION


You have 3 or more years' experience in Banking / Financial services, with strong Payments knowledge and / or prior experience in driving large scale strategic projects. Additionally, you are well versed with Agile methodology and experience in driving projects under the said framework, with strong Project management skills and ability to work independently. This is the team for you.

As a Business Analyst – Senior Associate in Transformation Design & Delivery at JPMorgan Chase, you will partner with Operations, Sales, Product, Client Service & Implementations, and Technology in developing the build out and adoption of new, emerging payment rails globally. These emerging payment rails, such as Real-Time Payments, Push to Card/Wallet, and Pay by Bank/Alias, provide our customers with more modern ways to initiate instant payments that better meet their needs.

You are expected to drive initiatives under stringent timelines and in a fast-paced dynamic environment. You will also need strong communication and influencing skills, strategic thinking, collaboration with multiple impacted teams, flexibility, and will need to be result driven.

The Transformation Design & Delivery team is part of the Payment Operations organization supporting Corporate and Investment Bank-wide transformation and change programs and platforms. Our mission statement is powerful yet simple: ‘build things better and build better things’. Ensuring that the things we build have been properly thought through, are high quality, sustainable and delivered quickly. We are focused on identifying opportunities to build more innovative things, often across products and lines of business, where we can bring the organization together to define solutions/builds which are broader reaching.

Job Responsibilities

Business Analyst for defining the business requirements for development and commercialization of new product capabilities
Articulate and document process flows including customer interactions and Operations intervention
Cover functional and non-functional requirements including but not limited to Product features, Operational requirements, Regulatory and Compliance requirements, User Interface, Client reporting, Sanctions, Resiliency and Scalability. The requirements must be able to cater to current expectations and allow scalability for future changes in business mode
Perform impact analysis for business initiatives to determine key business groups that will consequently be required to undergo technical or operational process change
Partner closely with Product and Technology partners to help define globally consistent platform architecture
Conduct gaps analysis as required to determine degree of change emergent from business initiatives
Work with UAT team to determine the testing strategy and ensure thorough testing of all capabilities
Tracking the overall progress of an initiative and identify any possible red flag and collaborating with various stakeholders for resolution of the issues to ensure timely completion of the projects
Drive Operations readiness to support new product roll out by ensuring documentation of process flows, operational procedures, training, user entitlements, clearly defined roles and responsibilities and establishing escalation matrix
Anticipate internal and external factors impacting the global payment strategy and implementing plans to mitigate risks and capitalize on opportunities
Defect analysis, prioritization and exploring alternative solutions

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills

3 or more years' experience in Banking / Financial services
Versed with Agile methodology and experience in driving projects under said framework
Strong Project management skills and ability to work independently
Strong problem solving, collaboration, communication and interpersonal skills with proven ability to influence stakeholders without direct authority
Strategic thinker with ability to define future state business model and drive execution to that effect
Ability to multi-task and manage and deliver competing priorities
Attention to detail with logical thought process
Self-motivated, tenacious with excellent time management/prioritization skills
Experience in designing, delivering & presenting executive level content
Adept at working in matrix organization and dynamic high performance teams
Leverages the organization to deliver results quickly

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills

Strong Payments knowledge and / or prior experience in driving large scale strategic projects is preferred

Business Data Analyst

Position Description
We're a passionate team of tech enthusiasts and professionals on a mission to reshape the future. We've got everything from cutting-edge projects that challenge your skills to a supportive and inclusive work environment that fuels your growth. Plus, we offer unparalleled opportunities for professional development, empowering you to stay at the forefront of the ever-evolving tech landscape.

We are seeking to hire a seasoned Business Data Analyst to join our team. The Business Data analyst will perform routine business analysis such as elicitation of data and analytics requirements and creating business/technical documentation, logical/canonical data model, as well as performing data profiling and analysis, data mapping, data quality checking and investigation, and participate in the test process of the final solution.
This opportunity requires that the selected candidate be onsite at Fort Lauderdale, FL location a minimum of 3 days per week.

Your future duties and responsibilities

Act as a bridge between the technology domain and the business domain of an organization.
Responsible for eliciting, understanding, interpreting, and representing business requirements and acting as the conduit between the customer and technical teams to ensure requirements are understood.
Provide subject matter expertise on the use of data as well as educate teams on business model, metadata, and standards.
Responsible for understanding source systems and their data models.
Develop source to target mappings for data lineage.
Document source architecture to include data flows.
Responsible for analyzing data to validate business domains and requirements.
Responsible for data profiling and ensuring data quality requirements are accurate and complete.
Act in an advisory capacity in data model reviews, architecture approach and solution design to ensure high quality deliverables.
Responsible for partnering with management and business units on innovative ways to successfully utilize data and related tools to advance business objectives.
Works with governance council to establish data governance standards and guidelines.
Assist with business data lake testing / experimentation.
Assist with coordinating data dictionary completions.
Mentor Project DA resources

Required qualifications to be successful in this role

Bachelor's degree in business administration, Computer Science, or related field
More than 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst
Strong background in data analysis. prior experience as a Business Data Analyst mandatory
Strong SQL and experience with data mapping, validation, cleaning, and manipulation
Experience with the elicitation of requirements and utilizing the requirements to create business documentation (BRD's/ FRD's)
Prior experience working in an Agile project team is a must.
Backlog development / Backlog refinement / Sprint planning experience
Experience using Azure boards and Azure DevOps is a plus (Jira or an equivalent platform is acceptable)
Excellent verbal and written communication skill and Interpersonal and consultative skills
Analytical thinking and problem solving
Knowledge of the business and technology structure

Founded in 1976, Bankers Insurance Group has grown from a small local company to a diverse corporation known for its innovative insurance products and superior customer service. Bankers Insurance offers a variety of property and casualty products and services. The company writes personal and commercial coverage, including homeowners, flood, excess flood, business owners, and specialized products. New products are currently in development to meet evolving personal and business insurance needs. Insurance and financial services remain at the core of our business, and we are proud of our more than 45+ year track record of expertise and service. We recognize the changes taking place in our domestic and global economy, as well as our society. We strive to respond to those changes with a spirit of understanding, growth, innovation, and entrepreneurship, developing new products, services, and partnerships

Our Core values include:

Collaboration: working together is critical to achieving organizational goals.

Innovation: growth happens when we can absorb and implement new ideas that provide unique solutions and superior customer service.

Performance: we believe in providing our employees with the tools and support they need to grow, succeed, and make an impact.

Trust: we build and maintain trust with our employees and clients by embodying integrity, transparency, and ‘doing the right thing.’

Company Value Statements

Acting with the highest level of honesty, trust, character, and transparency.

Approaching every challenge with creative energy, discovering unique solutions to maximize success; focus on creating and delivering compelling customer value.
Belief in the power of a diverse workforce and in creating a positive impact on both the environment and our community.

Summary/Objective

The Business System Analyst (BSA) is responsible for the inception, creation, and maintenance of all Business Requirements documentation that accurately defines the customer business need and enables various interdepartmental teams to create quality solutions. The primary objective for this associate is to partner and collaborate with the business to accurately capture all relevant business processes, documentation, and information and translate it into graphical and textual representation for various interdepartmental teams to build a solution. The BSA will participate in the functional certification of all system components to ensure accuracy and adherence to requirements documentation. The Business System Analyst supports Property and casualty Insurance products.

Essential Functions

Create written and graphic documentation to capture Business Requirements as necessary.
Maintain Business Requirements throughout the entire project lifecycle
Create and maintain strong relationships with Business Partners
Create and maintain strong relationships with various interdepartmental teams (IT, Distribution, Underwriting, Specialty Insurance, Legal, etc.)
Work closely with the Product Management team to manage any required changes in scope.
Participate in Testing and Functional certification process.
Assist in troubleshooting issues including making database corrections, generating queries, and verifying information. May provide training to end-users on system functionality and limitations.
Provides AS400 Control file support in different environments including production
Innovative in solving problems and identifying, proposing, and executing solutions
Work on projects and assignments as requested by management

Required Education and Experience

Ability to gather and document business requirements, follow standard practices for the Requirements Gathering Process, and commit to ensuring that systems delivered are of high quality and meet all customer requirements.
Advanced interpersonal and communication skills
Excellent analysis and interviewing skills.
Highly familiar with Software Development Lifecycle Methodology (SDLC).
MS Office (proficient/expert in Word, Excel, and PowerPoint).
Ability to work either independently or closely with others as the needs of the project dictate. Must maintain a customer service and quality focus at all times.
Must be highly adaptable to perform in a fast-paced environment.
Associate degree or equivalent work experience.
A minimum of 2 years experience in the Insurance industry.

Preferred Education and Experience

Experienced in Iterative or Agile Development Methodology.
Knowledge of Programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, etc.
Prior experience in a BSA role in a mature Information Technology organization.

As a member of our team, the analyst will focus on helping solve organizational problems by analyzing processes, workflows, and systems by identifying opportunities and areas of improvement. Stonehill is looking for a candidate who is looking to work in a fast-paced, hard-working environment with the opportunity to expand their skill sets and grow within the company.

Identify opportunities for process improvement and recommend solutions

Excellent grammar and spelling

2+ years of high-quality content writing/editing experience

Do you have previous experience working within the Manufacturing and Distribution modules for JD Edwards (JDE)? Are you looking for an opportunity where you can play an integral role in helping shape and propel a business forward? Do you lay awake thinking of ways to translate business requirements into actionable solutions?




If you answered yes to these questions, let’s talk!




The ASSA ABLOY Door Group is growing and to support that growth, we are looking to add an experienced JD Edward (JDE) Business Analyst to our Team.




This role will be based on-site out of one of our regional manufacturing facilities preferably in Orlando, Florida, Carol Stream, Illinois, Mesquite, Texas or Austell, Georgia.




ASSA ABLOY is a global leader in opening access solutions, dedicated to helping our customer’s needs for security, safety, and convenience. Our Group focuses on the manufacturing of hollow metal doors and frames within the commercial market catering to such industries as hospitality, healthcare, aerospace and defense, sports stadiums and educational markets.




Come see who we are at: https://www.assaabloy.com/group/en/about-us




We are growing and there has never been a more exciting time to join us!




What you would do as JDE Business Analyst

You will play an integral role in coordinating the development and documentation of consolidated Door Group standard operating procedures, broadly for distribution through manufacturing practices in JDE. The role will drive the implementation of these standards while working as a part of the various JDE implementation and production support project teams.




You will also:

Work within the JDE implementation and support projects as a functional lead and subject matter expert, participating in implementation for a broad spectrum, (Order to Cash, Procure to Pay, Inventory Management, Plan to Manufacture).
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather and document system requirements.
Analyze existing business processes and identify areas for improvement and optimization.
Help to design, develop, document, and implement JDE solutions to address business needs.
Configure and customize JDE applications to align with business requirements.
Perform system testing, quality assurance, and troubleshooting to ensure smooth JDE operations.
Provide end-user training and support to ensure effective utilization of the JDE system.
Keep up-to-date with JDE enhancements and best practices to recommend system improvements.
Partner closely with cross-functional teams to develop and nurture positive working relationships with all enterprise applications teams and with other business and IT teams.
Special projects as assigned.
Actively participates in providing a safe and harmonious working environment for all employees.
Assures compliance with federal, state, local and corporate governance policies, regulations and laws, AADG programs and policies and the ASSA ABLOY Code of Conduct



The skills and experience you need:


Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Technology, or a related field
Proven experience as a JDE Business Analyst or similar role
Previous working knowledge on JD Edwards (JDE) and familiarity with Manufacturing and Distribution modules.
Excellent influencing and interpersonal skills with a customer-centric focus
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a fast-paced environment with the ability to meet deadlines.
Ability to present ideas to all levels of the organization and ability to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Previous understanding of operational processes in a manufacturing environment and experience supporting either a highly configured product or an engineered to order environment is highly desired.
Previous experience with using MS SQL and the ability to write SQL queries is a plus.
Exposure to DSI dcLINK data collection, Gentran EDI Software, SAP Business Objects, Docpath / JetForms forms printing, imaging systems (TransformAP), and credit card collection systems preferred.
Approx. travel (less than 15%) within the continental US and Canada.



What we offer

We are passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here is what we have to offer:

Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
Variety of benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401(k), Flexible Spending, discount portal, recognition and well-being programs … to name just a few!



We review applications regularly, so don’t wait!

We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us.

To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post.

If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Stephanie Mandato, Senior Talent Acquisition Manager at stephanie.mandato@assaabloy.com




Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!

Job Accountabilities

As the Business Analyst - Supply Chain for the CAPP Division, you will be responsible for managing the metal material planning, procurement, and delivery to ensure the efficient and effective movement of materials from suppliers to the appropriate CAPP Sites. You will play a critical role in optimizing the supply chain processes by identifying and addressing bottlenecks, risks, and opportunities for improvement and support the organization's supply chain needs to run smoothly and efficiently to ensure a profit, material continuity.

Key Responsibilities:

Metal Material Management
Responsible for planning, purchasing, and monitoring the metal materials, track to production volume, monitor customers' purchase trends and determine the CAPP Metal needs by utilizing forecast inputs from Sales, other customer knowledge, information, market studies, historical information, market data, sourcing feedback/guidance and collaboration efforts with cross-functional teams.
Accountable to coordinate activities related to the planning and procurement of raw materials and contribute to the global balancing of Materials within Global Planning, ensuring efficient and effective procurement & inventory practices and optimizing the balance between quality, service, reliability, and cost.
Align and collaborate with Metals Sourcing to determine Metal Suppliers per Metal Specifications, tonnage, timing to ship, timing to receive, logistics and handle purchase order management based on the allocations defined.
Monitor supplier performance and assist sourcing with managing supplier relationships to ensure that materials are delivered on time and meet quality standards. Ensure Material deliveries are on time and work with appropriate stakeholders to uphold material continuity and on-time delivery.
Analyze data and methods to predict and improve a company's delivery of products and services to its customers. Manage and oversee the calculation of metal needs and be the SME for metal specification communications among cross-functional teams.
Extract and manage, monitor and all reports regarding Metal Planning, Deliveries, Specification, and overall strategy of metal materials.
Identify and mitigate supply chain risks, such as disruptions in supply, transportation, or demand, and implement contingency plans as needed. Publish key reports of Mill Tonnage supply Monthly, Post tons required, purchases and allocations by mill and ending coil tonnage each month.
Identify and support continuous improvement opportunities to reduce material leadtimes, specification segmentation, and improve efficiency to supply chain and operational process; Contribute to the development of business system initiatives and enhancements.
Inventory Management
Conduct demand forecasting and inventory planning to ensure that materials are available when needed and in the appropriate quantities.
Collaborate with key stakeholders and subject matter experts within each business unit to develop and implement appropriate inventory strategies and forecasting processes.
Maintain the required inventory to run the production and sales process smoothly, having material available, improve order fulfillment, right amount of stock and mitigate having the wrong inventory on hand.
Support supply chain metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure and monitor performance of material in inventory and supplier inventories.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements related to the supply chain.
Sales Inventory & Operations Planning (SIOP)
Support the setup and implementation of a scalable, sustainable process for Sales, Inventory and Operations Planning process. You will work with account managers, operations personnel, financial analysts, and senior leadership as we continue to define and develop SIOP to support an integrated business planning. Coordinate and support reviews as required and identify obstacles and roadblocks to implementing SIOP, develop and communicate possible solutions.
Drive transparency, accountability, and continuous improvement through solutions to track key assumptions, inputs, and outputs; Provide business data analysis to support and implement new business initiatives.
Job Requirements

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, logistics, business administration, or related field
Minimum of 7+ years of experience in supply chain management, preferably in the manufacturing industry with 3+ years' of analytics experience or working in an analyst role or similar to
Must be comfortable in a fast-paced environment with the demonstrated ability to effectively manage multiple priorities to completion
Ability to lead cross-functional teams in a matrixed, geographically dispersed environment and working across organizational boundaries to ensure successful project implementation.
Strong organizational, communication (oral and written) and time management skills
Strong computer skills and proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite and data visualization tools
Strong problem-solving skills
Strong analytical skills and experience with data analysis and modeling tools
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and suppliers
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, and other analytical tools
Knowledge of supply chain management software systems and enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems
Familiarity with regulatory requirements related to supply chain management
Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Travel
0 - 10%

Raymond James is seeking a Senior ServiceNow Technical Business Analyst for the ServiceNow Platform Team. The ServiceNow Platform Team provides technology solutions and support across the entire Raymond James Organization built on the ServiceNow platform.

As a Senior ServiceNow Technical Business Analyst, you will work closely with business owners across the Raymond James organization to maintain a solid knowledge of the functional capabilities of the various areas on the ServiceNow platform. You will use agile methods to analyze, define and document requirements. You will work with business owners, the development team(s), and leadership to drive consensus on scope, design, and implementation decisions. You will also conduct agile ceremonies to your assigned area of focus. This role will follow a hybrid workstyle in one of the following locations: Saint Petersburg, FL (33716), Memphis, TN (38120), or Southfield, MI (48075).

Manage stakeholders, collect requirements, and design solutions to meet business process and application requirements.
Establishes story acceptance criteria, necessary metrics, and overall intent/goal.
Translates technical complexities to business owners to drive solutions.
Communication and coordination between the relevant business owners and the agile development team.
Ensures the scrum team has a clear understanding of end-user stories to be developed in the system.
Create and maintain issue logs, schedule meetings, and take meeting minutes (when needed).
Communication and coordination between the relevant business owners and the agile development teams.
Participates in sprint reviews by representing business owner’s interests and coordinating with them to elicit feedback.
Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, Business or related degree and three (3) to five (5) years of relevant experience or a combination of education, training and experience.
Minimum of three (3) to five (5) years of experience as an IT Business, Data, or Systems Analyst.
Minimum of three (3) to five (5) years of experience documenting and analyzing business processes in the form of end-user agile stories.
Minimum three (3) years of experience supporting business analyst work within ServiceNow is desired.

We are currently seeing a driven professional with an existing analytical background in the Seaware platform to join the Windstar team! This new role works in conjunction with corporate and ship-based IT team members, Windstar (WSC) and Xanterra management teams, and the Seaware Operations team to provide overall support and technology product ownership for the Seaware reservations platform. You will work closely with all WSC departments to oversee the end to end use of the reservations platform to ensure that it meets the current and future needs and preferences of all business stakeholders. The position is also actively involved in the planning, design, training, and ongoing support of the reservations platform as well as other duties assigned by the Windstar Regional Director of IT.

Responsibilities (Text Only):

Develop a complete understanding of how Windstar uses the Seaware platform.
Collaborate and coordinate with users from Guest Services, Revenue, Inventory, Accounting, Sales, Marketing, Hotel Operations and IT departments to determine the overall vision and roadmap for the reservations platform.
Work with business users to understand and anticipate platform needs and translate them into actionable product requirements.
Serve as primary liaison between WSC and its software vendors to track prospective product enhancements and bug fixes, managing these backlog items, and their prioritization, to ensure the evolution of the product and its ability to meet and adjust to the company’s needs.
Oversee all stages of product evolution including long-term planning, budget, design, and delivery.
Meet regularly with the Seaware Operations team and other interested stakeholders to monitor and evaluate product progress at each stage in the application lifecycle. Regularly publish meeting notes and artifacts to keep all team members apprised of the product roadmap.
Serve as primary subject matter expert (SME) on the reservations platform to provide suggestions to end users on optimal use and configuration of the various application modules.
Monitor and enforce compliance with multiple industry and government data security and data privacy mandates including PCI-DSS, GDPR, CCPA, and others.
Serve as a technical business liaison and project management counterpart while working with application software vendors used by the organization and identified as core business partners and software providers. While working with the application software vendors, this individual is responsible for business requirements gathering, functional analysis, specification and software design and documentation on needs/requirements requested in future releases of the product.
Oversee vendor system documentation and the catalog of company internal system documentation and application knowledge to ensure that it conforms to the current state and use of the application.
Manage, design, and maintain application permissions, including user roles and permissions. Perform regular audits of system permissions to ensure the application conforms to principles of least privilege.
Review, audit logins for the internal Guest Service team, travel agents, and consumer web portals. Track the usage of all Seaware environments – including production, development, test and training – by both internal and external users. Work with the Infrastructure team to make sure that virtual environments are properly provisioned to meet performance and cost objectives.
Manage and maintain reporting requirements and the reporting change list, and work with WSC and corporate resources to monitor the backlog of reporting and analytics requests.
Assist with the implementation and service delivery change process of incremental vendor software releases and interfaces. (Scheduling, Communications, System & User documentation)
Track the usage of all Seaware environment(s).
Internal and External Usage
Current Dev, Test & Train environments
Assists in the patching of environments supported by Windstar and Xanterra IT to address updates as well as security vulnerabilities identified by the Infrastructure & Security team.
Work with other members of the IT team to proactively monitor the Seaware platform to identify and report issues and track their resolution.
Serve in an on-call capacity for after-hours/non-business hour support.
Monitor Revenue and Pricing, Sales and Marketing Chat(s), TEAMS, email and meetings for Seaware, My Windstar general reservation issues.

Strong existing knowledge of the Seaware reservations platform, including data dictionary, third-party interfaces and integrations.

WHAT IS THE V.I.E FRENCH INTERNATIONAL INTERNSHIP PROGRAM ?
Becoming an International Intern means having a secure job abroad for 6 to 24 months with a company or French administration. Whatever your background, if you are aged between 18 and 28, French or citizen of the European Economic Area (EEA), then V.I.E or V.I.A may be for you !
Please note, it is not voluntary work. Whether you are at the start of your career or doing a job with real responsibilities, you will be paid. V.I.E and V.I.A are a professional springboard.
If you dream of being trained abroad, just do it !

POSITION SUMMARY\:
To be fully engaged in supporting the Hospital Division to accomplish goals and initiatives by providing analytics for operations including but not limited to staffing, throughput, length of stay, and financial savings. The Operations Business Analyst proactively forecasts the throughput of patients using AI technology, serves as the primary liaison to IT, analyzes data, designs reports, investigates barriers and proposes solutions. The Operations Business Analyst collaborates with hospital leadership and front line staff to facilitate safe and efficient transport of patients and equipment.

PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES\:
1. Utilizes data from throughput applications to proactively identify opportunities to improve patient pull times and room turnaround for exceptional customer experience.
2. Trains clinical transport associates, volunteers, hospital leaders and others new to patient throughput software on daily use, metric collection, report creation and best practice understanding.
3. Serves as hospital division expert in throughput software providing technical support and acting as liaison to IT.
4. Tracks and trends inefficiencies in the patient throughput data initiating collaboration on action plans to correct and escalating any barriers to Director of Patient Throughput.
5. Conducts educational in-services and communicates timely information regarding software and/or throughput process updates in huddles and staff meetings.
6. Respects the patient’s rights, under state law, to strict confidentiality concerning condition, care and treatment.
7. Provides support for the collection, analysis, and interpretation of data for reports, proposals, and presentations.
8. Performs analysis to adjust for staffing volumes to enhance throughput and patient care; performs trend analysis to identify patterns in patient care, usage of facilities, equipment, or other areas of interest.
9. Assists with the design or implementation of new systems to store, manage, and retrieve data.
10. Collects and presents information into user friendly dashboards to enhance the management and throughput process.
11. Works on strategic projects as assigned by management, at times working on and/or overseeing more than one strategic project at a time.
12.Participates in providing gap analyses, highlighting current state, future state, operational needs, and best practices.

Qualifications:
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS\:

Education\: Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, IT, Finance, Health Care Administration, Statistics, or related field
Work Experience\: At least two years of experience in data, reporting and/or analysis including experience with trend analytics, observing workflows, identifying opportunities, and working with teams to enhance throughput
Work Experience in lieu of Degree\: Six (6) years’ experience in data, reporting and/or analysis including experience with trend analytics, observing workflows, identifying opportunities, and working with teams to enhance throughput
Licensure/Certification\: Lean Yellow Belt preferred
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities\:
o Demonstrated proficiency with spreadsheet and word processing applications
o Strong written and oral communication skills to produce clear, understandable data reports, dashboards, oral presentations and trainings
o Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities with calm and effective response
o Organizational and assessment skills to effectively prioritize and coordinate requests for data, reports and projects
o Interpersonal skills to promote collaboration across diverse work teams
o Ability to flex hours to support hospital operations
PHYSICAL DEMANDS\:

Majority of time involves sitting or standing; occasional walking, bending, stooping
Long periods of computer time or at workstation
Light work that may include lifting or moving objects up to 20 pounds with or without assistance.
May be exposed to inside environments with varied temperatures, air quality, lighting and/or low to moderate noise
Communicating with others to exchange information.
Visual acuity and hand-eye coordination to perform tasks
Workspace may vary from open to confined; on site or remote
May require travel to various facilities within and beyond county perimeter; may require use of personal vehicle

The Payroll & Business Analyst will lead the payroll process for Mowi USA business unit. Will be responsible for processing payroll, providing technical aid and supporting process improvement for Human Resources. The Payroll & Business Analyst will establish the developing of automated payroll processes: increasing payroll functionality, preparing monthly reports and managing payroll functions. Will also be in charge of preparing monthly payroll accrual, assisting with general accounting tasks and the monthly close process. The Payroll & Business Analyst will develop a robust understanding of all business unit regulatory standards, in order to ensure governance and compliance.

Responsibilities

Ensure payroll is processed timely and accurately.
Enter weekly payroll changes (not processed through self-service and HR processes). Audit the payroll register to ensure changes were captured and payroll is accurate.
Develop strong relationships with HR, through partnering with the team and assisting in process improvement related to HR functions and payroll systems. Provide excellent customer service to Mowi employees.
Support HR in the development of resources within Workforce Now, including: recruitment, employee goals and appraisals, reporting and analytical resources.
Provide support in the development of electronic employee files, including: assistance with self-audits and recommendations for improvements.
Support continued development of Workforce Now to provide improved self-service experience and increase self-service use.
Lead annual benefit and compliance reporting and audit processes, including: 401k audit, workers compensation audit, Self-Insured Medical Plan audit, 1095 review, EEO1 filing, etc.
Process weekly 401k contribution upload and reconcile payroll and 401k data.
Manage all garnishments, deductions, and Paid Time Off (PTO) balances in ADP Workforce Now.
Manage ACA compliance within Workforce Now.
Maintain knowledge of trends, best practices, regulatory changes, and new technologies in payroll.
Assist with the maintenance of fixed assets including processing additions, dispositions and running monthly depreciation.
Reconcile bank accounts including checking,

Qualifications and Skills

Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Outstanding interpersonal, negotiation, and conflict resolution skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.
Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
Experience using ADP Workforce Now preferred.
Must possess thorough knowledge of employment-related laws and regulations.
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite.
Ability to develop strong trusting relationships, in order to gain support and achieve results, within a diverse group of employees, ranging from a field environment to a corporate setting.
Flexibility and ability to interact with employees at all levels.

Education:

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Business Administration or related field preferred.
Minimum 5 years’ of experience in a corporate environment preferred.
Minimum 5 years’ of experience in Payroll preferred.

POSITION SUMMARY:

A Healthcare Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting healthcare data to support strategic and operational decisions within a Bradenton-based healthcare company. They develop data-driven insights, reports, and dashboards that enable healthcare providers, administrators, and executives to make informed choices that improve patient outcomes and optimize the use of resources. They will play a pivotal role by analyzing data to enhance patient care, operational efficiency, and decision-making. They will contribute to improving the overall quality and cost-effectiveness of all services.


REQUIREMENTS & PREFERENCES:

A bachelor's or master's degree in a related field (e.g., Healthcare Informatics, Data Science, Healthcare Management) preferred
Knowledge of healthcare processes and terminology preferred
Experience in healthcare data analysis is preferred
Certification in relevant analytics tools or methodologies is a plus


JOB ESSENTIAL DUTIES:

Gather and consolidate healthcare data from various sources, including electronic health records (EHRs), claims data, and external databases
Ensure data accuracy and completeness through data validation and cleansing processes.
Analyze healthcare data to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies
Create meaningful reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present data-driven insights
Generate regular reports for key performance indicators (KPIs) related to patient care, financial performance, and operational efficiency
Utilize statistical and machine learning techniques to predict patient outcomes, disease trends, and resource utilization
Monitor and track the performance of healthcare programs, services, and initiatives
Ensure data security, privacy, and compliance with healthcare regulations (e.g., HIPAA) in all data-related activities
Collaborate with healthcare professionals, administrators, and IT teams to understand data needs and requirements
Present findings and insights to non-technical stakeholders clearly and understandably
Supports the goals and mission of the company


SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE & ABILITIES:

Analytical thinking
Attention to detail
Communication skills
Problem-solving
Teamwork
Adaptability
Ethical and responsible data handling
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Total Compensation Estimator Tool

Thank you for your interest in career opportunities with the Florida Department of Health in Pinellas County. If you are looking to establish a successful career in Public Health, you have come to the right place. Many of our innovative and successful health programs are recognized throughout Florida. We hope you decide to join our team! Applicants will be contacted directly if selected for an interview.




The incumbent is part of a global public health organization and is expected to support the Florida Department of Health in Pinellas County in its mission to protect, promote and improve the health of all people in Florida through integrated state, county and community efforts and its efforts and its vision To be the Healthiest State in the Nation. Furthermore, the incumbent is expected to incorporate the agency values of Innovation, Collaboration, Accountability, Responsiveness and Excellence in all aspects of their work.




Your Specific Responsibilities:

This advertisement is for the Computer Programmer Analyst I (CPAI) with varying responsibilities with the Information Technology (IT) division. The position provides user support for the Health Management System (HMS) utilized by the health department for clinical services and develop reports using LOGI Analytics to extract and manipulate data in report format for the users. Other duties include support for the Dental oral health record Eaglesoft and the Environmental Health Database (EHD).

Provides technical support to HMS users.
Works with users to gather specifications and requirements of HMS reporting solutions.
Develops LOGI Analytics reports for HMS and publishes reports for users to access.
Provides user documentation, training and support for staff.
Serves as backup to other programming staff on daily responsibilities.



Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Knowledge of normalized database table relationships.
Skill with Microsoft 365 applications.
Skill in writing SQL statements to extract data from relational databases.
Skill in problem solving.
Skill in critical thinking and judgment.
Skill in providing quality customer service.
Ability to plan, organize and coordinate work activities.
Ability to review data for accuracy and completeness
Ability to communicate technical information effectively.
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with others.
Ability to interpret, detect, and respond to computer error messages and equipment malfunctions.



Minimum Qualifications:

A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university and one year of experience in computer systems analysis and/or computer programming; or
A bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with a major in one of the computer sciences or in management information systems; or
Two years of experience as described above and either (1) completion of a 720 classroom hour program of study from a vocational/technical school or accredited community college in an area of data processing (excluding data entry), or (2) 60 semester or 90 quarter hours of college course work from an accredited institution which includes four courses in computer science or management information systems.
Experience as described above can substitute on a year-for-year basis for the required college education.
Completion of a one-year program of study from a vocational/technical school in an area of data processing (excluding data entry) can substitute for one year of the required experience.



Other Desirable Qualifications:

Experience supporting an electronic health record (EHR)
Experience developing reports with advanced reporting tools
Experience providing business analysis services

Job Title: Senior Business Analyst - IT - Bayfront Health St. Petersburg
Job Description:
Position Summary:
The Senior Business Analyst, Business Relationship Management will lead the business/end users and IT systems development teams for business needs requiring IT based solutions including: identifying and analyzing business needs, creating functional and technical
specifications/requirements documentation, defining scope and objectives, making recommendations for solutions or improvements to business processes that can be accomplished through new technology or alternative uses of existing technology, researching business requirements and documenting the relationships between the components of the application system (i.e., end users, business processes, data, applications, and devices), and translating business requirements into application requirements to parallel overall business
strategies.
Responsibilities:
Serve as a trusted partner to the supported business functions, plan and coordinate IT operational or project-based initiatives that
automate processing or improve business systems.
 Manages relationships with customers, project managers, IT and business staff, and all levels of management.
 Facilitate meetings with customers to actively solicit, analyze, and document customer requirements, define the business problem
and the primary objectives.
 Develop and improve business processes, assisting with the development of informative “value based” metrics within IT and business
functions.
 Create process flow mapping; studying system capabilities, identifying the current and future state processes.
 Identifies, proposes and influences business solutions, negotiates deliverables and requirements that may impact multiple business
customers or functions.
 Act as liaison to assist in the identification of process improvements, solution design, testing and implementation of technically based
projects of various size, scope and complexity.
 Analyze business customer operations, to understand strengths and weaknesses, to determine opportunities to automate processes
and functions.
 Formulate solutions, processes and procedures with the goal of strengthening current state or determining future state business
strategies.
 Gather customer requirements with senior level management and ensuring agreement between customer and project team on
requirements for project deliverables.
 Determine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and
formats.
 Work with the Business Relationship Leadership in defining and documenting high level plans for IT engagement, including goals,
summary requirements and product/project roadmaps.
 Establish system specifications and objectives, based on business requirements and cost effectiveness, and provides
recommendations to management.
 Manage multiple business requirements, priorities and customers’ expectations.
 Construct workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications.
 Improve systems by studying current practices; designing modifications.
 Recommend controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures.
 Monitor project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions.
 Prepare technical reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing information and trends.
 Create informative, actionable and repeatable reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement.
 Conduct insightful, ad hoc analyses to investigate ongoing or one-time operational issues.
 Provides analytical leadership; defines and enforces standards/best practices and uses their advanced knowledge of Business Analysis
practices and techniques to guide team members.
 Acts as a coach and mentor to other less experienced Business Analyst team members.
 Maintains reasonably regular, punctual attendance consistent with Orlando Health policies, the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state
and local standards.
 Maintains compliance with all Orlando Health policies and procedures.
Qualifications:
Education/Training
 Bachelor’s degree required. Associate’s degree and two (2) years of directly related work experience may substitute for the
Bachelor’s degree (in addition to the requirements listed in the Experience section). High School Diploma or equivalent and four
(4) years of directly related work experience may also substitute for the Bachelor’s degree (in addition to the requirements
listed in the Experience section).
 Strong understanding of information systems, business processes, the key drivers and measures of
success for the relevant business.
 Demonstrated experience in critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

Experience
 Four (4) years of business analysis experience, ideally in healthcare, with the ability to communicate effectively at all
organizational levels.
 A minimum of four (4) years of IT experience in a multi-facility healthcare system.

As a member of our Operations team, the BUSINESS SYSTEMS ANALYST plays a key role in serving as a technological support liaison between internal stakeholders and customers.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Analyzes user requirements, procedures, and problems to automate or improve existing systems and review computer system capabilities, workflow and scheduling limitations.
Corresponds with clients and project leaders to identify and evaluate end-user and business requirements.
Creates and facilitates efficient and cost-effective solutions and analyzes system specifications to meet business requirements.
Ensures clean and accurate documentation that include detailed business requirements, client requirements and technical specifications; prepares reports which may be used in professional publications.
Documentation responsibilities encompass researching, organizing, writing, and editing documentation/reports, and processing use cases and design policies in documents and online mediums intended for internal departmental use and customers.
As primary point of contact, establishes ongoing communication with customers, various teams, and stakeholders; provides updates on the status of production to include timelines, issues, and resolutions.
Performs project scope and feasibility analysis; collaborates with the project management team to prioritize deliverables and negotiate product functionalities.
Obtains key input from enterprise architecture teams and identifies solution interdependencies.
Engages with knowledge workers to incorporate usability and user interface needs when designing systems.
Creates designs for technical solutions to resolve business problems and test components of new systems for efficiency.
Assesses the risks of various solutions and prioritizes competing business demands.
Coordinates project delivery by participating in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate systems designs and validate proposed solutions.
Partners with development and analytic teams to provide reporting on software solutions.
Routinely tests software patches; assists with new releases and user acceptance testing.
Researches use of existing software and hardware systems; recommends viable solutions for systems improvement and efficiency.

REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative, business, or other related field of study (e.g., Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science); will consider relevant years’ experience in lieu of degree.
Minimum of 5 years’ experience as a Functional, Data, or Business Systems Analyst; will consider relevant technical experience.
Excellent communication skills (written and verbal).
Demonstrate strong analytical skills.
Ability to troubleshoot and solve issues quickly and independently.
Ability to lead system level requirements and specification efforts.
Solid skills in working with relational databases.
Able to work within a team environment.
Ability to lead teams in Agile software development methodology and release processes.
Exhibit excellent knowledge of documentation and requirements management tools such as Confluence, Jira, and Microsoft Office.

CLOSING DATE: 10/31/23

Make a Difference in YOUR Career!

Our vision is both simple and ambitious: to put our drinks on every table.

We are the leading global independent beverage solutions provider. We serve a broad range of national and international retailers as well as Global, National and Emerging (GNE) brands. Our products are distributed worldwide from our production sites in Europe, North America, and Australia. Although our own branding may not appear on the labels of the beverages we produce, there is a good chance you are reading this while sipping one of our drinks.

Our ambition is to continually improve and it’s what keeps us at the top of our game. We are solutions-based. We are innovative. We seek out new challenges and conquer them. This is our company ethos, but it’s our people’s too: Refresco is at the cutting edge of a fast-moving industry because we have passionate people pushing the boundaries of what’s best.

Stop and think: how would YOU put our drinks on every table?

Position Description

The Senior Financial Analyst, Operations Finance will assist with the Refresco North America business unit reporting, budgeting/forecasting, financial support and training to internal customers, period-end close/accounting & controls, and management of analysis of manufacturing activities. This position will also provide basic support in financial closing process (month-end journal entries, account reconciliation, etc.). The Senior Financial Analyst will work closely with other functional departments and perform ad hoc analyses to drive plant efficiency and performance. This position reports to the Plant Controller.

Duties:

Support operations excellence through in-depth analysis and reporting of daily/weekly/monthly plant performance and cost drivers (ie labor)
Assist in the preparation and support of routine month-end closing entries and account reconciliations on a timely basis.
Partner with inventory control coordinators in investigating inventory discrepancies. Provide technical guidance and support to the inventory control coordinator in inventory transactions.
Develop a process for reviewing waste, identifying key drivers and push forward for process improvements that will help in reporting and cost reduction.
Assist in the review of customer claims and provide guidance as to plant responsibility.
Assist with the development of the monthly, weekly, quarterly, forecasting process for North America manufacturing consolidation, reporting, and analysis. Responsible for tracking financial forecast accuracy and bias and identifying root causes issues for solutions, as well as driving improvements.
Assist the Controller with the annual budget process for the North American manufacturing plants including plant level budgeting, regional/BU consolidation, and cause of change analysis.
Work with Operations to ensure processes are followed and enhanced for purchase orders, spare part counts, P-card compliance and invoice resolution.
Provide cycle count coverage for inventory control functions as needed.
The development of new and/or improved financial reporting and validation processes for plant manufacturing. This includes, but not limited to:
Automating/Optimizing reporting (ad-hoc and period end), accuracy and timeliness through tools such as BW and SAP.
Refining weekly/monthly waste reporting processes.
Developing Operational and Financial KPI’s for manufacturing cost trends.
Process Order Variance SME/support
Work with Operations and Engineering business partners to assist with monthly capital activity reporting, capital budget and capital cash flow forecasting activities.
Provide other ad hoc reporting, process optimization, development and other projects as required
Business Support & Training: Train & educate operational business partners and other internal customers on best practices and system enhancements. This could include, but not limited to:
Provide training & documentation on all plant accounting related items, including waste, process order review, AOP/Forecasting, inventory transactions, and purchase order transactions.
Develop and maintain financial SOPs and documentation.
Partner and assist in supporting the Supply Chain Finance and Operations teams on technical research and troubleshooting supply chain reporting related issues related to manufacturing. Act as subject matter expert on manufacturing financials and financial drivers.

Education and Experience:

Undergraduate degree in Accounting or closely related field required. CPA strongly preferred.
Three to five (3-5) years of financial business experience required.
Demonstrated data mining capabilities, with ability to develop analytical models, tools and reports
Experience in forecasting and analysis.

Skills/Qualifications:

Advanced knowledge of Excel is a must. Proficient in PowerPoint, Word, and eager to learn other software applications
SAP/BI experience preferred
Strong financial modeling and analytical skills, with demonstrated critical thinking, and problem solving skills
Ability to demonstrate continuous improvement in previous roles.
High level of accountability. A self-starter with strong initiative and the ability to work independently. Strong customer service orientation.
Ability to multi-task, and work in an organized, detailed manner under limited time frames & tight deadlines.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability explain results, document processes, and convey ideas.
Results oriented with a sense of urgency, able to work under deadline pressures.
Ability to balance multiple tasks with changing priorities.

Gather, identify and clarify business and functional requirements for clients and internal teams, using interviews and workshops with external/internal stakeholders

Join our dynamic team of innovators, creators, and problem solvers! At Frontline Insurance, we're on a mission to Make Things Better! We believe in fostering a collaborative, inclusive, and growth-oriented work environment where every team member can thrive and make a meaningful impact.


At Frontline Insurance we're more than just a workplace – we're a community of talented individuals dedicated to Integrity, Patriotism, Family and Creativity. Join us in shaping the future of Insurance and let's achieve remarkable things together. Your next career adventure starts here!


SUMMARY

Responsible for working with functional areas of the business to understand system change requests and then prepare design documents for the Frontline IT organization to develop from.




ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Work with major functional areas of the business to understand and document change requests submitted to the IT organization.
Review and analyze how changes to the business process and / or business needs will impact technical requirements throughout the system and organization.
Shepherd ideas through the System Development Life Cycle to ensure new business processes and system changes are documented, developed, tested, and promoted successfully.
Create Software Requirements Specifications, use cases, technical requirements, wireframes, system flow diagrams, and other documentation for Guidewire configurations and custom software development projects.
Clarify requirements prior to delivery of documentation to the Application Delivery team.
Become technically knowledgeable on our systems and their integrations with internal and external applications, research any dependencies and work on system design plan with solution architect and developers.
Work with the team to triage production issues prior to development involvement.
Be the liaison between functional leads, development teams, and support teams.
Support UAT (User Acceptance Testing) sessions as needed.
Work with the QA team to ensure test cases are current, correct, and cover alternative paths for existing and new system functionality.



SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

This position has no supervisory responsibilities.




EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE

Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, business, information systems, or a related field.
2 – 4 years of related work experience.
Experience working on a cross-functional agile team is preferred.
Property and casualty insurance experience is a plus but not required.



QUALIFICATIONS

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Self-starter with a can-do attitude.
Great interpersonal skills and a team player.
Ability to manage time effectively and work on tasks with competing priority.
Proficient computer skills, including Microsoft Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Excel, and Visio).
Use of an ALM tool (such as JIRA, Rally, etc.) to create user stories and defects for development teams to work.
Skilled at creating detailed Software Requirements Specification (SRS), use cases, diagrams, and wireframes.
Familiarity with HTML, XML.



Required:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Strong organizational and task management skills. Strong relationship management and proven experience delivering high level if internal and external customer service. Computer proficiency with strong skills in Microsoft Office applications. Must be proficient with the following: addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals.

Thank you for your interest in joining our team! Qurate Retail Group comprises six leading retail brands – QVC®, HSN®, Ballard Designs®, Frontgate®, Garnet Hill® and Grandin Road® – all dedicated to providing a more human way to shop. Qurate Retail Group is the largest player in video commerce ("vCommerce"), which includes video-driven shopping across linear TV, ecommerce sites, digital streaming and social platforms.
The Opportunity
The Sr eCommerce Business Analyst provides digital commerce with holistic, relevant business performance analyses, insights and recommendations. The Sr. Analyst will also support holistic digital demand planning and forecasting inputs and requirements.
Who We Are
HSN empowers shoppers with knowledge and shares insights in a lively and engaging way. We offer an ever-changing collection of familiar brands and fresh new products – from home and fashion to beauty, electronics and jewelry – and we connect shoppers to interesting personalities, engaging stories and award-winning customer service. QVC reaches more than 200 million homes worldwide via its 12 broadcast networks and reaches millions more via multiple streaming services, websites, mobile apps and social pages.
Your Impact
Maintain a interest in important digital needs/drivers and provide data support to measure trends and influences that are affecting demand planning and forecasting functions.
Work with A/B testing teams to test hypotheses, develop insights, and make recommendations.
Develop a strong partnership with the eCommerce category merchandising and marketing teams to understand and influence digital forecasting inputs.
Provide reliable ad hoc analysis, topical deep dives (concise, relevant retrospectives), custom and standard recaps to digital partners.
Build reporting to support digital needs inclusive of website and product traffic and conversion.
Demonstrate knowledge of team operations and drivers.
Develop standard input and reporting templates to ensure management reports and dashboards, including automated and manual KPI thresholds.

Bachelor’s degree in math/statistics/engineering or related field.
You have 5 years of progressively responsible positions within a business environment using important digital analytics tools.
You are comfortable coming into the office located in Saint Petersburg, Florida, 3-5 days per month.
Remote work is not permitted in NYC at this time.

Description:

Job Title: SAP Quality Business Analyst

Job ID: CHQ20232507-103912

Job Location: USA-FL-Melbourne; USA-TX-Rockwall; USA-NY-Rochester, USA-UT-Salt Lake

Job Description:

Support the design, development, deployment and enhancement of supply chain and manufacturing execution systems.
Gathering, managing, and documenting functional and technical requirements, communicating effectively with customers, developers, and management.
Analyze the current enterprise configuration management implementation and provide a status report before and after remediation actions are engineered
Interpret a customer’s description of a problem and determine possible solutions
Educate and train customers in the use of the system installed
Coordinate with hardware and software vendors to troubleshoot problems
Create and maintain detailed documentation on procedures for all systems

Qualifications:

Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Manufacturing Engineering, Supply Chain or related field

Preferred Skills:

Ability to communicate ideas in both technical and user-friendly language
Highly self-motivated and directed, with keen attention to detail
Proven analytical and creative problem-solving abilities
Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
Strong customer service orientation
Ability to work in a team oriented, collaborative environment
Knowledge of Manufacturing systems, manufacturing engineering, ERP, supply chain, business analyst, software development best practices

Required Education and ExperienceL: High School graduate and Associates or Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or related field preferred. Certification with the American Academy of Professional Coders - CPC certification required. Minimum 5 years experience in physician practice management. Current knowledge of State and Federal laws and regulations. Advanced knowledge of Microsoft office applications to include Access. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Excellent organizational skills. Ability to work independently and exercise appropriate judgment. Ability to create effective spreadsheets and graphs to analyze data and trends, and to make appropriate management decisions. Ability to prepare and present effective formal presentations. Professional appearance and manner.

Additional Eligibility Qualifications: Excellent written and oral communication skills. Excellent computer PC skills with knowledge of spreadsheets. Excellent CPC analytical skills preferred.

Essential Functions
Develop and maintain report summaries for key indicators, to include national standards (where available) and department standards and goals.

Collect, analyze, and interpret data related to A/R, reimbursement, and collections as directed.

Assist in operations review to facilitate long-term financial success while maintaining compliance.

Work in conjunction with PFS Management Team to develop training materials and programs on an ongoing basis to ensure compliance with Clinic policy and procedural changes and to ensure process efficiencies.

Expands job-related knowledge and skills to improve Department performance.

Serves as an effective communication liaison between the Department, Physicians, and Administration.

Provide training (computer, classroom, verbal, and/or written) to all levels of PFS staff, New employees and ongoing as necessary to improve skills and knowledge.

Keep PFS staff up-to-date on payer guidelines and policy changes to ensure proper claim reimbursement.

ABOUT US AND ABOUT YOU

Clinician Nexus enables health care organizations to build thriving clinician teams with industry-leading technology products, workforce and compensation analytics, and automated workflow solutions. Backed by extensive technical expertise and industry-leading data, we deliver innovative approaches to help clients to plan, educate, and engage their clinical workforce at every stage of the lifecycle. We are committed to providing our clients with outstanding guidance and support as they focus on shaping the future of health care.

The Business Systems Analyst sits within Clinician Nexus Customer Success. In this role, you will assist in analyzing client business requirements for the product, recommending automated system controls, and testing/validating product functionality.

PRIMARY ACCOUNTABILITIES


Helping to determine operational objectives, gather information, and evaluate output requirements.
Working closely with end-users (internal and external) to analyze, define, model, and document system requirements.
Assisting with identifying project milestones, phases and elements, while also keeping the team on time and within budget.
Constructing workflow charts and diagrams, studying system capabilities, and writing specifications.
Building client-specific rules within product, testing data, and validating results.
Assisting with creating end-user documentation (e.g., user guides, process flow charts, training materials, etc.) and delivering training.
Providing client support.
Participating in and leading product and report releases.
Position requires on-call and some weekend and after-hours commitment

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Bachelor's degree in data analytics, statistics, or related field.
Knowledge of the health care industry and/or finance is preferred.
A minimum of one year of experience with gathering systems' requirements and analyzing data is required.
Solid technical knowledge and experience working with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Excellent written and oral communication and interpersonal skills.

BEHAVIORAL ATTRIBUTES

Ability to present ideas in a business-friendly and user-friendly language and respond to client and/or survey respondent inquiries.
Self-starter with demonstrated ability to successfully assist with complex project deliverables in a very driven and dynamic organization.
Demonstrated ownership of assigned tasks and dedication and perseverance to get the job done.
Flexibility, adaptability, and the ability to work under tight deadlines or changing needs.
Confidence and ability to work independently.
Exceptional employee service orientation.
Strong attention to detail.
High level of self-motivation.

SALARY, BENEFITS AND PERKS

Reflected below is the base salary range offered for this position. Actual salaries may vary depending on factors including but not limited to academic achievements, skills, and experience. The range listed is just one component of the total rewards package offered to candidates.

$65,770 - $109,620
Competitive total rewards package
Medical and dental coverage at no premium cost for employees
401(k) and profit-sharing retirement plans
Flexible spending accounts
Generous paid time off (PTO)
Federal and company holidays
Gender-neutral parental leave
Bereavement and pet leave
Continuing education and professional accreditation sponsorship
Life and AD&D insurance
Short-and long-term disability
Employee assistance program
Mental health support program
