Job Title: Business Analyst, US Regulatory & Risk Squad - Assistant Vice President
Job Description:
Business Analyst, US Regulatory & Risk Squad - Assistant Vice President
Job ID: R0280875
Full/Part-Time: Full-time


Regular/Temporary: Regular
Listed: 2023-09-26


Location: Jacksonville


Position Overview

Job Title Business Analyst, US Regulatory & Risk Squad

Corporate Title Assistant Vice President

Location Jacksonville, FL

Overview

The Business Analyst (BA) – US Regulatory & Risk squad (AVP level) supports the US Reg & Risk Product Owner and the rest of the squad in preparing and delivering requirements, specifics, and other information or data. As the Business Analyst, you will be essential in delivering high-end products and in supporting the squad in having all documentation detailed and well prepared. You will work closely with Regulatory Affairs, Legal & Compliance for interpretation of regulations and assess impact on International Private Bank & define regulatory requirements. You will analyze /evaluate new local and multi-regional regulatory initiative/requirements, develop technical concepts /decision papers and innovative solution alternatives.

What We Offer You

A diverse and inclusive environment that embraces change, innovation, and collaboration

A hybrid working model, allowing for in-office / work from home flexibility, generous vacation, personal and volunteer days

Employee Resource Groups support an inclusive workplace for everyone and promote community engagement

Competitive compensation packages including health and wellbeing benefits, retirement savings plans, parental leave, and family building benefits

Educational resources, matching gift, and volunteer programs

What You’ll Do

Work closely together with the Product Owner and other squad members and key stakeholders (both control functions such as Legal, Compliance and Divisional Control Officer and business SMEs) to ensure right granularity of requirements specification on an epic/story level for regulatory requirements assigned to the BA

Define problems, conduct analyses (including workflow, feasibility, cost/benefit, trend, and cause-and-effect), create models, diagrams, presentations, and other documentations that support the target audience to understand the Business requirements and identify solutions

Facilitate communication and stakeholder management in order to create consensus on scope, agree implementation path, and proceed with implementation

Coordinate implementation of solution, in particular technological, procedural or control changes

Proactively identify and escalate risks and issues that might affect squad’s overall health

Document tasks and achievements through the appropriate tools (Jira, Confluence) and present updates to key stakeholders

Skills You’ll Need

University degree or equivalent, preferably with a degree in Business or Finance

Experience in Project Management, with knowledge of Agile methods (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban, etc.), tools (Jira or Confluence) preferred, and proficiency with MS Office (Word, Excel, Power Point)

Knowledge or experience in managing regulatory projects and understanding of risk management principles preferred

Experience in Financial Services and knowledge of Wealth Management products and services preferred

Experience in working in a challenging, fast-paced environment, with ability to deal with complex and ambiguous situations

Skills That Will Help You Excel

Self-motivated, proactive, and resourceful

Strong problem solving, organizational, and time management skills

Strong communication, interpersonal, presentation, and writing skills

Detail oriented and creative thinker with ability to generate ideas, develop concepts, and suggest innovative solutions

Ability to assess issues, evaluate risks, and suggest corrective actions

Expectations

It is the Bank’s expectation that employees hired into this role will work in the Jacksonville, FL office in accordance with the Bank’s hybrid working model.

Deutsche Bank provides reasonable accommodations to candidates and employees with a substantiated need based on disability and/or religion.

The salary range for this position in Jacksonville is $78,000 to $110,000. Actual salaries may be based on a number of factors including, but not limited to, a candidate’s skill set, experience, education, work location and other qualifications. Posted salary ranges do not include incentive compensation or any other type of renumeration.

Hiring Company:
Delicatessen Services Co., LLC
Overview:
Reporting to the Director of the Company Routes, the Company Route Sr Business Analyst is responsible for the oversight of several key functions that support the Company Route organization. Support will include but not be limited to analyzing financial statements and compliance metrics; overseeing approval processes of contracts, capital spending, and operations controls; and preparing pro forma materials for investments and divestiture opportunities. The ideal candidate must have an excellent work ethic, good time management skills, and a positive & and upbeat disposition. The position requires critical thinking and problem-solving skills. This individual must demonstrate the ability to work independently and draw their own conclusions to make recommendations to the Director of Company Routes and the Executive Team.
Job Description:
Essential Functions
Monthly & Quarterly Tasks
P&L review, tracking, and analysis. Review financial statements in total and individually to identify important trends and deficiencies.
Compliance tracking in adherence to the Sales Policy à Meetings, events, and number of deliveries and violations policy protocol.
Assist Director of Company Routes with quarterly presentations to the Executive Team.
Participate in monthly financial reviews with operations and finance to help facilitate operational and financial solutions.
Assist with quarterly bonus calculation.
Analysis & Pro Forma Financials
Create and maintain pro forma financial statements on future investment & divestiture opportunities.
Make recommendations to the Director of Company Routes on certain market and retail partnerships.
Create comprehensive presentations that capture recommendations and analysis of each opportunity and collective opportunities.
Assist with the annual budget process for new business models and new ventures.
Weekly Functions & Support
Track and maintain PO approvals and receipts for large capital purchases and contractual payments. Receive POs on invoices needing approval by the Director of Company Routes.
Submit, maintain, and track 1) capital expenditure authorization (CEAs) and 2) contract approval forms (CAFs)
Receive POs and submit appropriate capital invoices on behalf of the company route organization.
Assist in the lease and contract renewal process.
Organize, submit, and track the annual capital budget. Maintain communication with Company Route Operators and Director of Company Routes on status.
Assist with departmental coding and expense classification under the company route organization.
Assist with internal route setup controls with Legal, HR, and Finance teams. Coordinate bringing to a finish all system setups.
Submit W-9 paperwork for new company route vendors.
Ad Hoc & Other Support
Assist with ad hoc projects as needed to support the company route organization.
Prepare analysis schedules as requested by the Director of Company Routes.
Maintain a positive and approachable attitude between corporate partners and affiliated operations teams across the company route organization.
Develop relationships with partnering departments and close affiliates of the Brand.
Assist with major communications amongst company route teams as needed.
II.Education and Experience
Bachelor’s degree. With a concentration in Finance, Accounting, or Business Management desired.
5-7 years of analyst experience. Preferred experience in finance or accounting.
Demonstrate a high degree of literacy in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Proficient knowledge and experience with various ERP platforms or equivalent (Oracle, BI & EiS Technologies desired)
Strong communication, relationship, and analytical skills along with strong attention to detail.
Ability to break down and understand complex business problems, define a solution, and implement it using advanced quantitative methods.
Solid oral and written communication skills and strong presentation and follow-up skills.
Must be a team player with strong problem-solving skills and have experience working with cross-functional teams that support business on multiple levels.
Travel requirement – 10-15% of the time
Excellent follow-through skills and the ability to work collaboratively with various levels of business leadership, business owners, and business support personnel.
Location:
Sarasota, FL
Time Type:
Full time
Department:
Business Development

Pathways Health Partners

Pathways Health Partners is an Accountable Care Organization (ACO) on the forefront of helping independent providers make the transition to Value-Based Care. Pathways operates a Medicare REACH ACO, a Medicare Advantage MSO, and a Commercial MSO responsible for approximately 16,000 patients throughout North-West/Central Florida. Our service area is The Villages, down to St. Petersburg, across to Mount Dora, and areas in between. Pathways also operate a robust hospital medicine group, manages several of its affiliated medical practices, and an insurance agency.

Job Summary

The Business Process Analyst works with internal clients in the development and facilitation of process improvement initiatives using tools and techniques designed to achieve sustainable change and continuous improvement. The Business Process Analyst will drive process excellence through continuous improvement by working and partnering with team members.

Role and Responsibilities

Works with internal clients in the development and facilitation of process improvement initiatives using tools and techniques designed to achieve sustainable and continuous improvement.
Facilitates improvement work sessions with TVH members.
Conducts current state assessments including interviews with process users, process observation and process mapping.
Conducts periodic rapid improvement events to address areas of opportunity.
Works with relevant stakeholders to ensure the processes are understood and adhered to timelines and compliance.
Helps to promote a culture of process adherence through tracking and monitoring activities and acting on the results.
Drive decisions by analyzing data and providing insights.
Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications and Education Requirements

Education Requirements: Bachelor's degree in Business Management, Business Administration, Operation Management, Health Administration, Organizational Psychology, or Industrial Engineering preferred.
Certification Requirements (preferred): Lean, Six Sigma, project management, and/or change management
A minimum 3 year applicable experience in process improvement or similar healthcare administration and operations roles in which there were demonstrated results around improving workflow efficiency and/or user experience.
Proven project management skills, with an ability to prioritize multiple complex projects, deliverables, and timelines via project management tools.
Experience with project management tools (i.e., MS Project, etc.)
Knowledge of MS Office tools such as Excel, PowerPoint, etc.
Ability to clearly communicate complex information through a variety of written and verbal communication channels.
Excellent organizational skills
Strong collaboration and problem-solving skills, especially in an ambiguous problem-solving environment
Ability to facilitate improvement group sessions.

Preferred Skills

Works well independently and has strong operational skills
Excels at customer service and has strong interpersonal skills
Strong organizational and time management skills
Demonstrates a positive attitude and maintains a positive corporate culture
Communicates effectively and has strong verbal, non-verbal, and written communication skills
Develops strong relationships with coworkers and other stakeholders
Learns quickly and has strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills
Willingness to continually self-educate and grow professionally

Why Work for Pathways?

Pathways Health Partners is a growing company based in Leesburg, FL. We are proud of our professional yet family culture with the executive team working daily alongside our team members. We provide competitive salaries, bonuses for all team members, and a benefits package that is second to none.

Medical Insurance for Employee and Spouse/Significant Other paid 100% by Pathways!
Addition of family coverage for dependents at a fraction of the cost
25K life insurance for employees 100% paid by Pathways!
Increasing Employee coverage or adding spouse/dependents at a fraction of the cost
Vision and Dental Coverage available at a very low cost for employees, spouses, and family
401K retirement plan with 100% match up to 4% of annual pay
Paid holidays
Ample Paid Time Off (PTO) for vacation/sick/personal days

We look forward to speaking with you about this opportunity!

Job Title: Financial Operations and Revenue Management Analyst
Job Description:
Founded in 1965, Herc Rentals is one of the leading equipment rental suppliers in North America with trailing twelve month total revenues of nearly $2.7 billion as of June 30, 2023. Herc Rentals’ parent company, known as Herc Holdings Inc., listed on the New York Stock Exchange on July 1, 2016, under the symbol “HRI.” Herc Rentals serves customers through approximately 373 locations and has approximately 6,900 employees in North America.

The Financial Systems Analyst will work with various internal customers, including the finance, accounting and information technology teams to perform daily, monthly and quarterly tasks and complete development projects within our OneStream Consolidations and Planning/Analysis software as detailed below. The Financial Systems Analyst role is multi-faceted and can change significantly from day to day, from troubleshooting errors and working on break fixes, to working on months-long projects to implement new functionality. The position will develop in depth knowledge of accounting and consolidation, financial planning and analysis, software development, and project management processes.

Perform monthly data loads

Troubleshoot errors and inconsistent data
Develop dashboards

Design, build, test and implement new OneStream functionality
Setup data sources

Document development activities
Prepare training materials
Provide training to users
Write and edit calculation business rules in VB.net
Write and edit SQL data connectors
Work with internal and external audit to provide SOX control documentation

Bachelor’s Degree - Accounting, Finance or Economics

Travel may be required (5-10%)

With approximately 1,300 boutiques and outlets throughout the U.S., as well as an online presence for each of our brands, it takes sophisticated technology, resources and infrastructure to ensure the continued success of our businesses. From finance and accounting to technology and merchandising careers, we have diverse opportunities available for talented professionals to join our team of nearly 16,000 associates who share our commitment to excellence.

POSITION OBJECTIVE:
This positionis responsible for managing the lifecycle of Tableau analytics dashboards, including business requirements gathering, functional specification write-ups, prototyping, development, quality testing, user acceptance testing, roll-out and post-launch enhancements implementation.

FUNCTIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analyzes data to support project goals; evaluates project progress and results; reviews data results with team members to ensure accuracy; translates results into specific business actions.
Hands on with Tableau Desktop (dashboard creation, report authoring and troubleshooting, data source management).
Creates and edits SQL queries within Tableau to build calculated fields.
Creates interactive filters, parameters and calculations for preparing dashboards and worksheets in Tableau.
Builds and publishes interactive dashboards on Tableau Server. Collaborates with Master Data Architects to test, clean, and standardize data to meet the business requirements.
Has the confidence to work cross-functionally with various departments including business stakeholders and technical personnel to exchange ideas.
Other duties as assigned.

COMPETENCIES :
Culture
Living the Chico's FAS Values and Guiding Principles by demonstrating Customer focus, instilling trust, driving engagement, and driving results.

Decision Quality
Making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.

Action Oriented
Taking on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm.

Interpersonal Savvy
Relating openly and comfortably with diverse groups of people.

Situational Adaptability
Adapting approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations.

QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Business, Analytics, Computer Science, or Information Technology required
3+ years demonstrated application experience (internship, co-op, work experience) in an analytics, data or business intelligence field
3+ years experiencing designing and developing business intelligence dashboards using Tableau
Experience working with large and complex data sets, able to write complex SQL queries to create calculated fields
Empirical understanding of data systems (BI analytics, data blending, data warehousing, data ETL, etc.) on process automation and standardization
Must have excellent verbal communications skills and documentation skills to maintain workflows and dashboard functionality
Experience working directly with business analysts or business sponsors to gather and validate functional requirements and provide the design specifications
Ability to work on multiple projects and flexibility to change priorities when needed.
Experience with Syndicated data (Household Data, POS Data, Panel Data, customer analytics, web analytics)preferred

Headquartered in Dublin, Ohio, Cardinal Health, Inc. (NYSE: CAH) is a global, integrated healthcare services and products company connecting patients, providers, payers, pharmacists and manufacturers for integrated care coordination and better patient management.

Cardinal Health’s Information Security team is on a tremendous growth journey adding several new team members in our CyberOps, Resiliency, Security Architecture, and IT Risk and Compliance teams. We aim to be a world-class cybersecurity and risk management organization that enables Cardinal Health to be healthcare’s most trusted partner.

We currently have a career opening for an IT Business Analyst.

Responsibilities

Business Analysis is responsible for deeply understanding the business in multiple functional areas and across Business Units, as well as understanding the application landscape and capabilities. They maintain relationships with the business and leverage requirements engineering practices and methods to enable improved business processes to drive business success. They align business strategies and capability needs into business and technical requirements to ensure IT systems enable the desired value.

Leads sessions using variety of requirements gathering methods such as interviews, documentation analysis, surveys, site visits, business models with executives, managers, developers and subject matter experts.
Facilitates the team through the analysis of, and makes recommendations towards, complex business decisions.
Mediates across different IT teams utilizing knowledge of IT and roles and responsibilities within the organization.
Focuses on process analysis and re-engineering, with an understanding of technical problems and solutions as they relate to the current and future business environment.
Demonstrates excellent listening, communication, and facilitation skills.
Knows and executes best practices for business analysis processes and functions (from an industry and strategic standpoint.
Defines requirements in accordance with SDP/SDLC, management and project/product scope. Ensures problem statements and objectives are clearly defined. Ensures requirements are aligned to project scope, objectives and strategies.

Qualifications

Proven experience as an IT Business Analyst in a corporate environment.
Experience gathering end user requirements and coordinating solutions with a technical team.
Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent work experience preferred.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office products preferred.
Experience in creating application relevant reporting.

Accountabilities

Work closely with the business, IT and Security Teams.
Provide documentation for new Operational Technology Security applications, processes, and services.
Collaborate with the Security Architecture, OT Security, Network, and Enterprise Architecture teams.
Document Security Architecture standards and patterns into consumable playbooks to be leveraged by IT Solution Delivery teams.
Work to develop an Agile process or modified Waterfall for delivery of defects and enhancements.
Work with IT and Business teams to develop reporting on application performance, customer experience, issue trending, etc.…
Work from Home opportunity

Candidates who are back-to-work, people with disabilities, without a college degree, and Veterans are encouraged to apply.

Job Title: Adobe Customer Journey Analytics Business Analyst
Job Description:
We Are:

Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 506,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.

You Are:

An analytics consultant at heart, with broad knowledge of the digital analytics space and a deep understanding Adobe’s offerings and solutions. Bringing your experience implementing Adobe Customer Journey Analytics (CJA) and/or Adobe Analytics end-to-end solutions for clients, you know what it takes to transform cross-channel datasets into meaningful metrics and visualizations. Working closely with business stakeholders, you’re the go-to person for crafting insightful reports and dashboards that address critical business questions. On top of your technical expertise, you excel at leading project teams in fast paced environments and collaborating effectively with clients and team members at all levels.

The Work:

Lead teams to design, build, and maintain large-scale analytics solutions.

Strategize and implement Adobe Analytics and Customer Journey Analytics solutions together with client Business and Marketing teams, Architects, and Developers.

Work with client stakeholders to determine reporting requirements and KPIs for cross-organizational use cases.

Design and build cross-channel reports in Customer Journey Analytics to derive meaningful and actionable insights from large datasets.

Ensure that Data Governance policies and best practices are implemented and enforced across all systems.

Build and maintain Data Views and Connections in CJA, work closely with AEP Data Engineers to ingest additional data sources.

Provide and evangelize best-in-class documentation and enablement.

Articulate complex ideas in a clear and concise manner, both verbally and in writing.

Exemplify excellent consulting skills, diplomacy, effective messaging, and team mentorship abilities.

Travel may be required for this role. The amount of travel will vary from 0 to 100% depending on business need and client requirements.




What you Need:

A minimum of 3 years of experience implementing an Adobe Experience Cloud analytics product (Adobe Analytics or Customer Journey Analytics) along with Adobe Tags

A minimum of 1 year of hands-on experience working with Adobe Customer Journey Analytics.

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent (12 years) work experience (If an, Associate’s Degree with 6 years of work experience).

Bonus Points If:

Certified in at least 1 Adobe Experience Could product (Customer Journey Analytics, Analytics, Real-Time CDP, Journey Optimizer).

You are proficient in SQL, Python, or an equivalent coding language for data processing and analysis.

You have experience implementing Adobe Real-Time CDP or Adobe Target.

Chubb is the world’s largest publicly traded property and casualty insurer. With operations in 54 countries, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. The company is distinguished by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength, underwriting excellence, superior claims handling expertise and local operations globally.

As a member of the Global Center of Competence (“CoC”), Business Process Automation & Digital Analyst will partner with business/functional needs to identify pragmatic, yet innovative automation and digital solutions. They will coach business and functional unit leaders across the organization to drive and lead process automation (“PA”) and Digital initiatives across the enterprise. This position reports to: AVP, Intelligent Process Automation & Digital Optimization Leader.

Key accountabilities include:

Business Solutioning and Stakeholder Management

Partner with BPR expert to identify automation opportunities, discuss automation/digital approach and framework with designated business and functional product owners by outlining deliverables, timeline, roles/responsibilities to build automation pipeline.
Design business automation/digital solution in partnership with IT and Product Owners while ensuring alignment with the agreed process flow.
Collaborate with internal IT experts to design feasible IT solution, build user stories to support desired automation solution.
Establish and participate PI Planning, regular project update meetings.
Monitor pipeline, and inflight initiatives progress.
Support business/functional Automation/Digital owners to build out communication to ensure proper engagement such as Key milestones, in scope processes current and future state, timelines, technology dependencies, roles/responsibilities between business/functional owners, IT, Vendor and Global Automation team.
Act as an escalation point to secure engagement, resolve issues associated with business resources, IT and or SI Partner engagement.
Assists the line of business to escalate and resolve project blockers such as issues with business resources, IT and or SI Partner engagement.

Supporting Process Automation & Digital Implementation and Production

Collaborate with transformation leads, and product owners to drive the automation/digital business solution discovery, planning, identification of solutions and objectives, development and monitor supervised production for assigned workstream and/or initiatives.
Supports the deployment of agile and machine learning capabilities in the LOBs in line with Chubb standards.
Engage the appropriate internal and external (staff augmentation) resources to use process automation best practices to deliver successful solutions.
Assist the business to Integrate multiple projects across the line of business value chain.
Assist in the deployment of program and project management standards for effective delivery meeting Time, Quality, Budget, LOB requirements.
Guide and partner with change management resources (Change Manager & HR) to ensure effective communication and execution of the required organizational and role changes.
Provide guidance on the post implementation support.
Assist the LOB to Identify “in unit” roles and time requirements and work with business leaders to identify staff for the assignments.
Conduct lessons learnt post deployment on each initiative.

Participating in the Process Automation CoC and Utilizing its Practices

Participate as an active member of the Business Process Automation CoC in developing a set of best practice guidelines and training content for use across all PA initiatives.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of automation framework, technologies and knowledge by sharing information, building standards, developing intellectual property and capturing lessons learned.
Provide direction and guidance to all program staff for assigned units and programs.
Coach team members on areas of development to increase their knowledge and work performance.
|
Bachelor’s Degree, certification as a Green Belt Process Engineer or equivalent qualification.
Project Management certification and Agile experience.
4 – 6 years business process engineering/business analysis experience in financial services.
Solid experience in working in a multi-discipline, matrix structure team fostering collaboration and teamwork.
Business and System Analysis and Information System solution delivery experience.
Business Value Chain and Opportunity assessment techniques and experience.
Strong knowledge of machine learning, robotics and bpm.
Prior RTE experience in a global company and familiarity with WorkFusion platform is a plus.

The Opportunity:
The Department of Philanthropy and Alumni Data Services is currently recruiting for a Business Analyst to work with department leadership and staff to develop technology-driven solutions for Philanthropy and Alumni Engagement (PAE) that focus on two key themes: business process improvements and enabling the division’s staff success by providing seamless access to information and tools required for that success. The Business Analyst will lead the PAE division through process improvements and system changes, always reviewing to ensure we are leveraging best practices in data management and access. This position will understand the core business processes of the department and work with Information Technology (IT) to ensure the technology solutions enable efficient and effective use of the tools. The Business Analyst integrates business knowledge of the University with technical knowledge of the systems. This position is highly analytical by nature and can identify and implement efficiencies within the various process and systems used in PAE.

The Business Analyst will also provide ad hoc reporting for the division, which includes creating, updating queries and communication lists. They will be expected to gather the data requirements and understand how the data will be used to ensure we are providing all the data required to enable a process or decision. Works in conjunction with the Sr. Business Analyst and the AVP to support technology and reporting needs of the entire office and those of external constituents, as well as analyzing and improving processes across work areas.

The Business Analyst plays a crucial role as the department’s liaison to the University Information Technology, providing vital support for advancement systems and support the implementation of UC Innovation’s Ascend product (Salesforce CRM platform). In this capacity, the Business Analyst actively contributes to the development, configuration, testing, and implementation of new initiatives and system enhancements. This involves the gathering of requirements and close collaboration with the IT team to deliver innovative solutions. The role encompasses a range of responsibilities, including researching and applying best practices for philanthropic organizations, in-depth analysis of constituent data (including Alumni, Donors, and Prospects), evaluating CRM system data, and providing support for 3rd party philanthropic tools integrated within Salesforce such as iWave and Double the Donation. Additionally, the Business Analyst examines constituent history, creates reports utilizing Salesforce Report Builder for key stakeholders, modifies Salesforce List views for improved data accessibility, and designs tailored Salesforce dashboards to meet the specific needs of various business departments, and automation of Salesforce Documents using 3rd party generation tools. The Business Analyst plays a pivotal role in making recommendations regarding relationship strategies and constituent data based on industry best practices. The ideal candidate is characterized by their proactive, energetic, and tenacious approach, coupled with an attention to detail. They possess the ability to work collaboratively with University staff, furthering the University’s mission to fund-raise and friend-raise from its constituencies.
Qualifications
Bachelors degree in statistics, business, data analytics or a related field.
At least one year of experience working with CRM technology and data.
Experience using various data analytics and reporting tools including Salesforce Reports & Dashboards and Microsoft Excel. Create reports based on the findings, and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to identify successful initiatives.
Basic troubleshooting and root cause analysis skills
Ability to read and interpret data, draw conclusions from the data, and propose strategies or recommendations based on those conclusions
Ability to effectively communicate and influence key stakeholders to support proposed strategies, process improvements and operational decisions
Ability to effectively document solutions to support departmental continuity and sustainability
A broad understanding of fundraising and alumni engagement processes and data, preferably in higher education • Experience as a data analyst or business analyst.
Knowledge of, and proficiency in, Salesforce CRM based business systems and technology applications.
Familiarity with Ellucian Advance or similar fundraising applications/constituent relationship management systems.

It's an exciting time to be a member of the Fisher Investments Technology Department. We're investing in the future of our firm's technology and are building our team to achieve global growth. We are looking for a Business Analyst to support our Technology Business Services team. If you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference as we develop scalable and strategic solutions to support our global growth, we want to hear from you!

The Opportunity:

The Business Analyst (Portfolio Management Technology) will perform daily health checks on Fisher’s OMS platform – Charles River – to ensure the following: System is up and running, daily data feeds are processed, system workflows remain operational and connectivity from Charles River to Brokers and Custodians are working (FIX, SWIFT). The Business Analyst will also step in to support the various business stakeholders in different aspects of the Order Management and Execution Management System. You will report to an Application Development Team Leader.

The Day-to-Day:
Troubleshoot any outages identified during health checks
Engage vendors and our teams to resolve any issues identified
Communicate Issues Identified:
Alert our users and other technology partners of any issues
Daily interaction with users:
Field issues reported by users throughout the day and perform necessary troubleshooting
Field training requests from users
Formulate and articulate ideal solutions in partnership with the stakeholders to gain operational efficiencies over time
Track Production Issues
Log and diagnose production issues and track resolutions to follow
Periodically communicate status or project plans to all partners
Identify trends and take proactive steps to prevent incidents
Coordinate and plan for regular maintenance schedules
Your Qualifications:
3+ years of experience supporting Investment Management - Order Management systems including system configuration & parameter maintenance, user interface configurations & permissioning
18+ months of experience performing start of day health checks on order management systems including FIX heartbeats, data loads, batch completions
3+ years of experience performing business analysis and troubleshooting of issues reported by users on Order management platforms such as Charles River
18+ months of experience with user communications to effectively notify users of planned or ad hoc downtimes, maintenance schedules
Bachelor's degree (B.A.) in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or an equivalent field
Why Fisher Investments:

We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. We take great pride in our inclusive culture, our learning and development framework customized for every employee, and our Great Place to Work Certification. It's the people that make the Fisher purpose possible, and we invest in them by offering exceptional benefits like:
100% paid medical, dental and vision premiums for you and your qualifying dependents
A 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum
20 days of PTO*, plus 10 paid holidays (*17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time for California employees)
Family Support programs including 8 weeks Paid Primary Caregiver leave, adoption assistance and back-up child care
Opportunity to participate in our hybrid work from home test. This program is a pilot test and subject to change. Based on tenure and performance eligibility, you will have the opportunity to work from home up to 100 days per year

This position is supporting one of the largest state agencies in FL working to enhance applications and systems that support internal employees and agency customers. This business analyst will work within a full lifecycle development team, working as an intermediary between business stakeholders and technical teams. They will be providing oversight to development activities and have access to SMEs that have created and support internal systems and applications. This BA will be involved in, and work in concert with other team members, to analyze, design, implement, and test solutions.

· Research and understand business processes and their inter-relationships within the agencies central IT office
· Research and understand the Identity Administration and Governance Platform that the agency will be using and enhancing.
· Gather and document business and technical requirements.

Required and Preferred Experience:

· A minimum of 3 to 5 years of solid business/systems analysis experience and software development projects is required.
· Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel, Word, PowerPoint, required.
· Experience working with Microsoft DevOps is highly desired.
· Experience with Microsoft DevOps is highly desired.

· Experience with directing and managing project resources is highly desired.
· Experience with configuration and customization of Commercial-Off-The-Shelf products, is highly desired.
· Experience with data migration is highly desired.
· Knowledge of change and release management is highly desired.
· Experience working with Microsoft Power BI is highly desired.

Job Title: Operations Research Analyst (All Source) (ORA-AS) - Counter-Proliferation / Procurement - DOD TS/SCI
Job Description:
Peraton Overview
Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets. Every day, our employees do the can't be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers.
Responsibilities

Peraton is seeking an experienced and a highly organized Operations Research Analyst (All Source) (ORA-AS) - Counter-Proliferation / Procurement Specialist to work at MacDill AFB in Tampa, FL

In this role, you will:

Support a Combatant Command, Directorate of Operations, Inter-agency Coordination and Targeting Division (ICTD) and inter-agency (IA) mission partners to coordinate, synchronize, and integrate a wide range of DoD capabilities with IA mission partner authorities directly supporting time-sensitive, dynamic, and deliberate operations and activities that deliver comprehensive, multi-layered actions - sequenced to achieve maximum whole-of-government effects.
Be integrated into a DoD team focused on IW support through collaboration with USG partners.
Be the subject matter expert on fusing intelligence with other data sources, able to illuminate and exploit enemy vulnerabilities related to proliferation, procurement and weapons of mass destruction networks.
As a Subject Matter Expert, expertly handle requirements and deliver accurate, complete, tailored, finished products demonstrating deep-dive research skills utilizing industry leading analytical techniques and tools for crawling, scraping, aggregating, and triaging data that fills information gaps and augments non-traditional, inter-agency case, and serialized IC data.
Contribute, enhance and support the expansion of DoD capabilities to create effects against enemy networks and the entities used to support them by closing-off enemy exploited gaps and seams, and providing recommendations to action arms, policy makers, and regulatory bodies.
Be responsible to illuminate, enumerate, and characterize enemy network nodes, personalities, and their TTPs; perform research, structured analytics, data triage, and forensics on aggregated raw, unstructured, structured, serialized, and classified information from open source, commercially available sources, industry technical papers, academic research papers, trade, passenger, cargo and export records, law enforcement case information, intelligence community finished intelligence, and international partner provided data.
Based on the research and analysis of the data/information, produce complete, cohesive, cogent operations support packages, baseball cards, information papers, network presentations, evidentiary packages, charge presentations, enemy process/vulnerability products, target packages, and pattern of life studies used to coordinate combined DoD and IA deliberate and dynamic actions supporting effects on priority targets.

Qualifications

REQUIRED:

Bachelor's degree and minimum 8-10 years' experience OR military service-based training and additional years of experience will be considered in lieu of degree.
Expert knowledge of capabilities pertinent to the CCMD AOR and proven ability to develop and implement comprehensive network analysis products.
Experience in target development and approval process and applying a collection management strategy against designated targets.
Experience operating in a 4-star military headquarters or an Interagency Partner environment as a staff member with minimum guidance with background in the following:
Demonstrated experience in developing and supporting DOD strategic and operational Irregular Warfare objectives
Demonstrated experience in working collaboratively with USG Interagency partners
Demonstrated ability to perform all source operational intelligence analysis
Demonstrated ability to deliver unclassified/classified products and parallel reconstructed products tailored to maximize wide-ranging capabilities and authorities
Demonstrated understanding of law enforcement agency organizational structures, functions, data sources, data types, programs, records management requirements
Demonstrated expertise with financial investigative groups that target complex enemy global money laundering, and other criminal financial activities
Demonstrated oral and written communications skills, including an expert ability to communicate effectively with intelligence collection requirements at the operational and nation intelligence levels.
Expert Microsoft Office Skills.
Must be a U.S. Citizen with a current US Passport
Active DoD Top Secret clearance with SCI eligibility

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Master's Degree and minimum 15 years of experience working in the military All Source Intelligence field.
Graduate of a recognized Intelligence Collections Support Course at the Joint or Service Level and Information Operation planning experience
Experience working with distributed teams.



Target Salary Range

$112,000 - $179,000. This represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.

As the ACS/FBO ITBP, you will play a critical part in shaping the future of our Aircraft Management, Staffing (ACS), and FBO technology initiatives and driving innovation within the organization. You have the overall responsibility to serve as the strategic interface with our ACM, Staffing, and FBO LOBs for the purpose of business technology strategy development, solution discovery and delivery, consulting and relationship management. You will use your deep understanding of both information technology and the aviation industry to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to align technology strategies with LOB business goals. The baseline annual salary range is $125,000.00 - $145,000.00.




Main Responsibilities:




— Collaborate with ACM & FBO leaders and stakeholders to understand their objectives, challenges, and technological needs.

— Act as a bridge between the IT department and ACS/FBO teams, ensuring that IT strategies are aligned with the overall business strategy.

— Lead the development and maintenance of ACS & FBO technology roadmaps, incorporating short-term and long-term goals, industry advancements, and business priorities.

— Ensure all processes and systems are globally aligned avoiding regional disparate systems

— Identify emerging technologies with potential applications in the business, assessing their feasibility and impact on business outcomes.

— Build strong relationships with key ACS & FBO stakeholders and other relevant departments.

— Lead cross-functional teams to execute ACS & FBO technology initiatives, from concept to implementation, ensuring alignment with roadmap goals and project milestones.

— Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in aviation technology, IT, and related industries.

— Proactively identify opportunities for innovation and improvement within ACS & FBO technology systems and processes.

— Identify potential risks and challenges associated with aviation technology projects and initiatives and develop mitigation strategies and contingency plans to address them.

— Act as system owner for all technology systems used by the ACS and FBO LOBs.

— After a solution is delivered, responsible for ensuring that users receive adequate training and liaise with IT teams to resolve issues

— Represents Jet Aviation as one company internally and externally with industry groups, regulatory bodies and the General Dynamics network.




Minimum Requirements:




— Bachelor’s degree with a concentration in Project Management, Business Management, Computer Science or a related field.

— Proven experience in an IT business partner role or similar, with a focus on technology roadmap development.

— In-depth knowledge of aviation operations, regulations, and technology trends.

— Strong project management skills.

— Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively at all levels of the organization.

— Analytical mindset, capable of assessing complex technical and business challenges and proposing innovative solutions.

—7 years equivalent work experience related to business analysis, project management, application development/support.




Desired Characteristics:




— Excellent planning and time management skills

— Excellent communication & relationship building skills

— Ability to clearly communicate at all levels of the organization

— Business process minded with a broad experience across many areas of the business

— Technical aptitude & experience working with technology across multiple business functions

— Self-motivated, able to work independently or as a team

— Ability to deal with conflict

— Strong interpersonal skills and ability to lead through others including advocacy and assertiveness with a global mindset

— Strong personal values corresponding with Jet Aviation values (Trust, Honesty, Alignment, Transparency)

Jet Aviation provides equal employment and affirmative action opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.

The Department of Medical Education has an exciting opportunity for a full-time Sr. B usiness Systems Analyst to work in Miami, Fl. The Senior Business Systems Analyst collects data and provides analysis to assist in the development of technology plans and strategies that enhance overall performance, reduce costs, and increase efficiencies. The incumbent analyzes established operations, systems, methods, practices, and procedures to evaluate their effectiveness and ultimately make recommendations for improvements. Additionally, the Senior Business Systems Analyst integrates people, equipment, facilities, and other resources to improve work results, operating efficiency, effectiveness, and productivity. This employee also assists in the design, delivery, and improvement of in-house software applications, training programs, and related courseware.

Reviews, analyzes, and triages application issues and cases. Creates and maintains detailed support documentation of ongoing projects, tests internal application releases, and performs periodic system maintenance.

Provides training for internal users.

Recommends changes in development, maintenance, and system standards. Develops detailed action plan with goals and target dates and obtains necessary approvals.

Maintains ongoing communication and rapport with management team regarding project activity.

Flowcharts existing processes versus improved flow. Prepares time and cost estimates for projects and proposals. Conducts research for best practice models and benchmarking.

Applies industrial and management engineering techniques, such as process designs, optimization models, forecasting methodologies, and chain management principles, to improve overall systems.

Analyzes existing flow of people, activities, and materials, employee work methods and utilization, policies and procedures, staffing levels, supervisory structure, space utilization, supply and demand optimization methods, forms, equipment, and computerized systems to design improved work systems.

Designs systems for production and inventory control in buying, storing, handling, and processing of materials and supplies. Designs facilities, management systems, and standard operating procedures.

Develops management control systems to aid in financial planning and cost analysis.

Improves productivity through the application of technology and human factors. Designs supply chain management standards across the institution.

Conducts data collection to measure baseline versus improvement, before and after recommendations are implemented.

Creates formal presentations for projects and studies, including data collected, methodology used, results obtained, recommendations for improvement, and cost and savings involved.

Participates in continuing quality improvement activities.

Adheres to University and unit-level policies and procedures and safeguards University assets.

This list of duties and responsibilities is not intended to be all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties or responsibilities as necessary.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree in relevant field

Minimum 5 years of relevant experience

Skills in collecting, organizing, and analyzing data.

Ability to recognize, analyze, and solve a variety of problems.

Ability to exercise sound judgment in making critical decisions.

DEPARTMENT SPECIFIC FUNCTIONS

Develops an integrated approach to organizational performance management that results in delivery of value to stakeholders, contributing to ongoing organizational success Works with departments/leadership to develop business plans including market research, market assessments and projections, needs assessments, and financial projections.

Identifies and monitors trends and developments, creates reports and presents findings to leadership.

Provides training for internal users to ensure accuracy and efficiency of end work product.

Monitors system availability, working closely with system administrators and business systems analysts.

Collaborates in the development and organization of department and project budgets.

Acts as liaison to other departments, vendors, and other external parties to complete assignments.

Uses strategic planning tools and internal analytic tools with high proficiency.

Collaborates in the development and organization of department and project budgets.

Acts as liaison to other departments, vendors, and other external parties to complete assignments.

Any appropriate combination of relevant education, experience and/or certifications may be considered.

The IT Incident Manager is responsible for the monitoring and reporting of all incident and service requests to ensure SLA (Service Level Agreement) and OLA (Operating Level Agreement) compliance as well as responding to Executive level customer requests and escalated issues to ensure a timely resolution.


JOB DUTIES ESSENTIAL FUNTIONS:
Models ethical behavior and executes job responsibilities in accordance with Citizens core values, ethics, and information protection policies.

Overseeing the IT incident management process and coordinating with team members involved in resolving Incidents and problems reported by the enterprise. Act as the primary IT Point of contact for all service-related incidents and problems.
Responding to and prioritizing reported service incidents, coordinating with designated business coordinators. Provide communication and updates via web portal, and email. Work with impacted IT teams to ensure timely closure of incidents and ensure documentation of Root Cause and remediation.
Producing documents that outline incident protocols, develop ITSM best practices, and adjust Citizens Incident and Problem Management processes to meet best practices.
Monitor and produce weekly and monthly service quality reports to report on incidents, problems, and outages. Hold meetings with critical IT Staff to discuss and obtain details and information to document and resolve incidents/problems.
Responsible to analyze and support existing operations and make recommendations for the improvement of the management and resolution of Incidents and Problems.
Accountable to maintain regular written and in-person communications with department management, other department heads, and identified stakeholders regarding activities and services related to the ITSM process and activities.


REQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

High School Diploma or GED required
Bachelor’s Degree OR 3 years relevant experience, OR a combination of college education and relevant experience equivalent to 3 years.


PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:

5 or more years of IT in IT Incident and Problem Management including communications, documentation, and staff coordination.
3 or more years of progressively responsible reporting, report compilation, project management tracking, ITSM process improvement and documentation, and Incident Coordination.
ITSM Certification preferred, but not required.


KEY SKILLS & ABILITIES:

Solid knowledge of service delivery and service agreement (SLA / OLA ) practices
Solid knowledge ITSM process and delivery models.
Solid knowledge of project management methodologies and techniques
Solid knowledge of business process improvement and technical support methodologies and techniques
Solid knowledge of a variety of frameworks, practices, and procedures. (ITIL, COBIT, Six Sigma, etc.)
Solid knowledge of business analysis and business development practices
Solid knowledge of Microsoft Office suite applications : Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Access
Strong knowledge of change management methodologies and techniques
Proven conceptual, problem solving and situational analysis skills and the ability to prepare appropriate business decision documentation and communicate sound technical advice to clients, managers and technical staff
Demonstrated skill in establishing and maintaining business relationships with internal and external customers
Ability to identify issues that impede the successful completion of a project or service, escalate appropriately, and or successfully resolve
Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively present technical topics to individuals and groups with potentially varied levels of technical sophistication
Ability to perform technical and quality assurance reviews take appropriate steps or analysis to support resolution.
Excellent organizational and time management skills; detail oriented

Job Title: VP, Operations Strategy Lead Analyst – Hybrid
Job Description:
The Citi Global Wealth Business was created to combine our Private Bank business comprising of clients with a net worth of $25mm and join this with our Citi Gold and Citi Private Client business (net worth of ~$200k v. $1mm). This consisted of merging businesses across the Global Consumer Bank as well as the Institutional Clients Group. The goal of the creation of this business is to provide clients access to more products and digitize our offering to our clients. The Wealth Operations organization are looking to harmonize their processes to newly formed policies and create strategies and synergies across our people, product and our platform.

The candidate will be working on the Operations Change Management team, to govern and manage an ~$30mm Book of Work as well as drive strategy across the Wealth program for operations. Closely liaising with the Operational leads to drive synergies and implement process re-engineering changes, technology platform changes, and working on new and emerging technologies. In this role, on top of exposure to technology book of work and process reengineering, you will also have an opportunity to learn about Citi Wealth’s key businesses such as Banking, Lending, Trust and Investments and understand importance of KYC, Client Onboarding and Client Reporting.

As part of Change Management team, you will have a unique exposure to worlds of Technology, Business, Operations, PMO and Business Management through meaningful projects that have real impact on our business and clients Our seasoned professionals will provide you with a training and mentorship required to succeed in this role. You will experience a supportive and collaborative work environment and have exposure to our senior leaders. You will work on high impact and global projects to further develop your banking industry knowledge and soft skills such as communication, teamwork and leadership through, which are critical to success in today’s fast-paced, ever changing business landscape. After completing this program, you will also have solid real-world, hands-on experience in technology projects and banking industry.


Responsibilities:

Focus on the end-to-end operational processes to eliminate manual intervention, streamline the process creating efficiency and reducing cycle time

Partner with technology teams to deliver best in class solutions and enhancements to Operation teams
Understand, analyze and drive transformational decisions based on Data
Partner with the Ops product teams to update Operations process flows and lead process reengineering campaigns
Work closely with tech partners and work on emerging technologies such as NLP and AI to help create opportunities for the business
Track initiatives across partnered teams to ensure successful deliveries
Identify opportunities for Digitization and Automation including RPA and Workflow Management opportunities
Track initiatives across partnered teams to ensure successful deliveries
Drive design and implementation of new operating model for Operations, and associated processes and procedures
Develop and implement relevant operating model changes in order to pivot the Operations organization towards digitization and enhanced client experience
Promote a culture of continuous improvement and cultivating a robust service and control environment


Qualifications:

5-8 years of experience in the financial or consulting industry, change management, process re-engineering or client onboarding role specifically within Operations

Track record of implementing operational metrics and dashboards to support strategic decision making
Strong familiarity with Process Management, six sigma, process flow diagramming and governance, specifically within Operations
Experience program managing large scale global and complex initiatives and implementations
Ability to effectively partner with Ops leads, technology partners, senior management and business counterparts
Strategic thinker and visionary who can also roll up sleeves to ensure proper execution
Exceptional written & verbal communication skills
Very Strong Presentation, PowerPoint & Excel skills
Excellent leadership and negotiation skills
Demonstrated organization skills with the ability to multi task effectively in a high volume environment while maintaining adherence to deadlines and priorities
Self-motivated and directed, proactive and action-oriented, must demonstrate personal accountability

Key Required Competencies

Strong knowledge and experience working with large data sets, determining the key data points and being able to concisely summarize it for senior management.

Knowledgeable with creating dashboards/KPIs including using key industry tools such as SharePoint, QlikView, Tableau and others.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to synthesize and package data and present findings for senior mgmt.

Project Management experience in working in Waterfall / AGILE methodologies

Strong knowledge of process flow diagramming and knowledge of relevant tools (e.g. Visio, Signavio)

Strong expertise in both PowerPoint & Excel (Advanced)


Education:

Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience, potentially Masters degree

Overview

Shift4 (NYSE: FOUR) is boldly redefining commerce by simplifying complex payments ecosystems across the world. As the leader in commerce-enabling technology, Shift4 powers billions of transactions annually for hundreds of thousands of businesses in virtually every industry. For more information, visit www.shift4.com.

The Senior Business Analyst III is primarily responsible for assisting Shift4 Payments implement technology solutions in a cost-effective way by determining the requirements of a project or program, and communicating them clearly to stakeholders, facilitators and partners. In this role, you will serve as a liaison between the sales, operations, and technical development teams. You will be responsible for eliciting, analyzing, validating, specifying, and managing the business needs of the stakeholders; including customers, partners and end users. As the Senior Business Analyst, you will work closely with business units, subject matter experts and technical resources to identify business needs, define projects, develop requirements, report results and manage the effort to completion.

Responsibilities

Collaborates with customers, application developers, project management and team members to understand business requirements that drive the analysis and design of quality business solutions.
Interfaces with the business areas, customers, partners, vendors, technical staff, and project teams to drive value, return on investments and innovative solutions. This includes providing alternative solutions, including vendor solution acquisitions, with maximum benefits while reducing cost (e.g. cost benefit analysis, pros/cons of solutions).
Creates and maintains project lifecycle documents/deliverables (vision/scope document, supplemental specifications, mockups/designs, flow diagrams, testing plan, and training materials).
Translates business needs into clearly defined, detailed, and documented requirements, functional designs, and system supplemental specifications for new applications.
Analyzes change requests/enhancements in existing applications.
Manages job and project requirements so that projects are completed on time, in scope, within budget, with minimal defects.
Provides assistance on defining application development project deliverables.
Obtains appropriate level of signoff as needed throughout the project lifecycle.
Assures full compliance to required standards throughout the project lifecycle.
Assists with all aspects of requirements testing (testing plan, scenarios, documentation, defect management) to ensure minimal production UAT defects as well as performing analysis of the customer impact.
Assists with testing/QA/QC and provides root cause analysis and corrective action plans.
Assists in the resolution of risks, defects and issues.
Verifies that the delivered application requirements meet the customer needs based on the specifications, ensuring minimal defects in both UAT and production.
Assists with providing project status updates to the appropriate clients and stakeholders.
Provides required business and/or subject matter expertise for both project and production related activities.
Identifies, documents, and escalates risks, defects, and issues throughout the project lifecycle.
Analyzes data to determine business problem, trends, or opportunities for process improvements.
Participates as a subject matter expert for new strategic programs or initiatives impacting current and existing systems.

Qualifications

Must be flexible and demonstrate the ability to execute on deadlines in a high-pressure environment.
Demonstrate the ability to solve problems with a sense of ownership, enthusiasm, and innovation.
High level of written/oral communication.
Experience in project management-related activities.
Experience in group and/or management presentations.
Understanding and/or experience with software/web development.
Recommended: experience with Atlassian products (Jira, Confluence), GitHub / GitLab.

Education:

Bachelor of Science degree and/or relevant work experience.

Location:

This position is not remote, only available at any of the following Shift4 offices in a hybrid mode (4 days/week in the office, 1 day home office):

Center Calley, PA
Butler, PA
Silver Spring, MD
Tampa, FL

Carrier is the leading global provider of healthy, safe and sustainable building and cold chain solutions with a world-class, diverse workforce with business segments covering HVAC, refrigeration, and fire and security. We make modern life possible by delivering safer, smarter and more sustainable services that make a difference to people and our planet while revolutionizing industry trends. This is why we come to work every day. Join us and we can make a difference together.

About this role

We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented Business Case Analyst to join our Supply Chain team. In this role, you will be responsible for conducting in-depth analysis and evaluating the feasibility of buy versus make decisions in our supply chain network design. Your insights and recommendations will directly impact our strategic sourcing and manufacturing strategies. This is a crucial role that requires strong analytical skills, business acumen, and the ability to communicate effectively with cross-functional teams..

Key Responsibilities

Conduct Supply Chain Network Analysis: Evaluate the existing supply chain network, including distribution centers, warehouses, transportation routes, and inventory levels. Identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and opportunities for improvement.
Perform thorough analysis of the existing supply chain network, including supplier relationships, manufacturing capabilities, and cost structures.
Data Analysis and Modeling: Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to extract insights from supply chain data, such as demand patterns, transportation costs, inventory levels, and lead times. Develop mathematical models and simulations to optimize network design and evaluate various scenarios.
Evaluate the feasibility and potential benefits of buy versus make decisions for various products and components within the supply chain.
Conduct cost-benefit analysis to determine the financial impact of different sourcing and manufacturing strategies.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including procurement, production, finance, and engineering, to gather relevant data and insights.
Develop and maintain financial models and tools to support decision-making processes.
Identify and assess risks associated with different sourcing and manufacturing options.
Prepare comprehensive business cases with clear recommendations and present findings to key stakeholders.
Monitor and track the implementation of recommended strategies, measure their effectiveness, and make adjustments as necessary.
Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to supply chain network design.
Work closely with Commodity Sourcing Team to ensure partner selection is being optimized to support product requirements.
An entrepreneurial and creative approach to developing new, innovative ideas that will stretch the organization and push the boundaries within the industry.
The ability to effectively balance the desire/need for broad change with an understanding of how much change the organization is capable of handling, to create realistic goals and implementation plans that are achievable and successful.
The ability to persevere in the face of challenges and exhibit a steadfast resolve and relentless commitment to higher standards, which commands respect from followers.
Naturally connects and builds strong relationships with others, demonstrating strong emotional intelligence and an ability to communicate clearly and persuasively.
An ability to inspire trust and followership in others through compelling influence, powerful charisma, passion in their beliefs, and active drive.
Encourages others to share the spotlight and visibly celebrates and supports the success of the team.
Integrates economic, societal, and environmental factors into a purpose-driven strategy, turning sustainability into a competitive advantage.
Sets audacious business and sustainability goals, driving concerted action and investments, and stays the course in the face of setbacks or push-back from short-term oriented stakeholders

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree
5+ years of experience in Supply Chain Management

Preferred Qualifications

Strong analytical skills with expertise in financial analysis, cost modeling, and decision-making techniques.
Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis using tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, R, or similar software.
Strong analytical skills with expertise in data analysis and modeling techniques (e.g., linear programming, simulation, optimization algorithms).
Familiarity with supply chain management systems (e.g., ERP, WMS) and optimization software (e.g., Llamasoft, IBM ILOG CPLEX) is a plus.
Solid understanding of supply chain management principles, including procurement, production planning, and logistics.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex analyses in a clear and concise manner.
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and influence decision-making processes.
Detail-oriented mindset with a focus on accuracy and quality of work.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically to drive innovative solutions.
Knowledge of industry best practices and emerging trends in supply chain management.

Function Background/Context

Citigroup Internal Audit provides independent assessments of the company's governance, risk management and internal control environment for key stakeholders including the Board of Directors, senior management and Citi’s numerous regulators globally. IA is a change agent within Citi aimed to enhance the control culture of Citigroup worldwide and thereby support senior management decision making around the globe.

Job Description Summary

A key aspect of the IA Data and Operations group’s responsibilities is to provide the IA organization with strategic direction, oversight and coordination of Data and Technology capabilities firmwide. Reporting to IA’s Data Governance PMO & Capabilities Lead, the IA Data Capabilities Lead will collaborate with team members and the Enterprise Chief Data Office (ECDO) to drive IA towards a mature data governance program by enabling Citi’s core data governance capabilities to help IA organize, improve, and leverage its data as a strategic asset.

This highly visible role will assist in defining the strategy for IA’s data capabilities, including the interim and target state business and data architecture, processes, governance and sub-capabilities, in support of IA’s implementation of the Enterprise data strategy.

Key Responsibilities
Assist in defining the strategy for IA’s data capabilities, including the interim and target state business and data architecture, processes, governance, and sub-capabilities
Partner with Business/Function/Regions to receive buy-in to the business strategy, target state, and execution plan (includes authoritative sources such as System Of Record (SOR) and Authorized Redistributor (AR), lineage, logical models, etc.)
Support the implementation of strategic solutions identified via use cases
Help identify tooling needed for foundational data capabilities and evaluate any existing such tooling available in the environment today
Work with Enterprise Data Capabilities to track business/function/region plans against the enterprise master plan; ensure business/function/region budgets will be spend in alignment with the strategic capability goals
Understand specifications for the implementation – or enhancement – of all data governance tools and engage with foundational data capability initiatives and relevant users of all types; implement clear process flows for their use
Support the execution for business-critical data capabilities at Federated Chief Data Office (FCDO) level to address projects/value stream needs by leveraging world class data techniques; drive adoption of the Capabilities into the businesses, end users, and use cases
Partner with Technology to adopt and implement all necessary data governance tools at FCDO level including the discovery or automation of all required metadata to the greatest extent possible when new technology is created or when major modifications to existing technology are made
Partner with data governance tool operational users to ensure effective and sustainable data governance processes (e.g., documentation of data lineage; logging of data quality defects) for business/function/region
Collaborate with users of all types to ensure adoption of all data governance tool
Define critical success factors and monitor capability maturity assessment

Knowledge and Experience:
6-8 years of experience in business analysis or systems analysis. Data Governance experience preferred.
Requires analytical skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs
Proven ability to manage complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact by weighing various action plans and balancing potentially conflicting needs
Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills, with the ability to collaborate across different functions and time zones on any of the team’s outputs
High level of proficiency with the MS Office Suite is essential as well as knowledge of Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Cognos, Tableau, etc.). Experience with Power Query and SQL server are a plus
Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience, Masters degree preferred

Chubb is the world’s largest publicly traded property and casualty insurer. With operations in 54 countries, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. The company is distinguished by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength, underwriting excellence, superior claims handling expertise and local operations globally.

As a member of the Global Center of Competence (“CoC”), Business Process Automation & Digital Analyst will partner with business/functional needs to identify pragmatic, yet innovative automation and digital solutions. They will coach business and functional unit leaders across the organization to drive and lead process automation (“PA”) and Digital initiatives across the enterprise. This position reports to: AVP, Intelligent Process Automation & Digital Optimization Leader.

Key accountabilities include:

Business Solutioning and Stakeholder Management
