Job Title: AVP Technology Application Manager/Business Analyst – SaaS
Job Description:
Enterprise Services & Public Affairs Technology develops and manages applications used by the Global Public Affairs (GPA) and Global Marketing organizations that facilitate their business processes and communications needs, both internal and external to Citi. Technology and projects tend to be highly visible, integrated with multiple existing systems, and require a high level of technical expertise, knowledge, and creativity to maintain. This role will focus on some of our key SaaS vendor applications and technology solutions.

The Applications Development Senior Programmer Analyst is an intermediate level position responsible for participation in the establishment and implementation of new or revised application systems and programs in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to applications systems analysis, Software as a Service vendor management and development activities. Applications within the team’s portfolio include in house development, SaaS vendor applications and custom vendor developed applications specific to our unique requirements. The immediate focus of this position will be with our Software as a Service vendor technology.

Responsibilities:

Conduct tasks related to feasibility studies, time and cost estimates, IT planning, risk technology, applications development, model development, and establish and implement new or revised applications systems and programs to meet specific business needs or user areas.
Utilize in-depth specialty knowledge of applications development to analyze complex problems/issues, provide evaluation of business process, system process, and industry standards, and make evaluative judgement.
Recommend and develop security measures in post implementation analysis of business usage to ensure successful system design and functionality.
Consult with users/clients and other technology groups on issues, recommend advanced programming solutions, and install and assist customer exposure systems.
Ensure essential procedures are followed and help define operating standards and processes.
Serve as advisor or coach to new or lower level analysts.
Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision.
Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy.
Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Monitor the development process and analysis, design, construction, testing, and implementation as well as provide user and operational support on applications to business users.


Qualifications:

Passionate about technology and what it can enable when designed, deployed and managed properly.
5-8 years of relevant experience.
Experience working with Software as a Service (SaaS) products and/or vendor management.
Experience in systems analysis and programming of software applications
Experience in managing and implementing successful projects.
Working knowledge of consulting/project management techniques/methods
Ability to work under pressure and manage deadlines or unexpected changes in expectations or requirements.
Excellent communications skills a must; written and verbal.
Ability to adapt and learn constantly, coming up to speed quickly on proposed technologies.
Ability to understand the details while not losing sight of the bigger picture, and opportunities to leverage existing systems and data, integrations, etc.


Education:

Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent experience
Project Management and/or technical certifications a plus

Are you ready to make an impact at DTCC?

Do you want to work on innovative projects, collaborate with a dynamic and supportive team, and receive investment in your professional development? At DTCC, we are at the forefront of innovation in the financial markets. We're committed to helping our employees grow and succeed. We believe that you have the skills and drive to make a real impact. We champion a thriving internal community and are committed to creating a workplace that looks like the world that we serve.

Pay and Benefits:

Competitive compensation, including base pay and annual incentive
Comprehensive health and life insurance and well-being benefits, based on location
Pension / Retirement benefits
Paid Time Off and Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being.
DTCC offers a flexible/hybrid model of 3 days onsite and 2 days remote (onsite Tuesdays, Wednesdays and a third day unique to each team or employee).

The impact you will have in this role:

DTCC is embarking on an exciting multi-year journey to bring new digital capabilities to our clients. Our vision is to deliver groundbreaking solutions, such as self-service capabilities and workflow automation tools, that enable clients to personalize their experience with DTCC at scale with minimal effort and risk, while also reducing operational burden on internal teams. As a Business Analyst in our Process and Data Analysis Squad, you will drive the realization of this vision by bringing analytical rigor and intellectual curiosity to the analysis and reimagination of key client onboarding processes and data structures.

Foundational to our success is a thorough understanding of our current-state processes, data inputs, and information flows. The Process and Data Squad will lead the detailed analysis of complex processes and tools that span across various systems and teams while incorporating a data-centric view (for example, how does the data we collect in a certain step in the process flow downstream?). The squad will also drive key re-imagination and transformational efforts, bringing key collaborators together to drive consensus on how best to organize teams and deploy new processes and leading-edge tools that minimize manual processing risk, effectively manage data, and enhance the client experience

Being a member of the Process and Data Squad, the Business Analyst should have advanced organizational and analytical skills with a focus on close attention to detail. The ideal candidate will be key in bridging the gap between IT, the business, and shared services (for example, Compliance) and requires the incumbent to access, profile, and analyze data, understand and document business requirements, and communicate clearly and concisely with a broad range of technical and business partners custodians.

Your Primary Responsibilities:

Support the leadership team in establishing, maturing, and driving the implementation of industry-leading data management practices
Partner with business and operational collaborators to assess logical data element names, create clear and accurate data definitions, and identify valid values for the data
Build the connection between data elements and specific process steps and collection methods (for example, web forms, legal agreements, etc.)
Assist data modelers in producing conceptual and logical data models, including entity and attribute names and definitions
Draft high quality presentation material to share with partners and leadership that provides the appropriate level of detail for the intended audience
Be a self-starter with a solid ability to prioritize, assist with projects, and quickly learn new concepts and frameworks

**NOTE: The Primary Responsibilities of this role are not limited to the details above

Qualifications:

Minimum of 5 years of related experience
Bachelor's degree (preferred) or equivalent experience

Talents Needed for Success:

Knowledge of data management processes and standard methodologies preferred
Microsoft office applications: PowerPoint, Word, Excel, Visio
Technical Skills preferred, such as reading data using SQL queries
Basic understanding of Logical Data Modeling and Database design is a plus
Experience in Agile/scrum methodology
Knowledge of financial services operations, trends, and user demands

The salary range is indicative for roles at the same level within DTCC across all US locations. Actual salary is resolved based on the role, location, individual experience, skills, and other considerations. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

InnovaCare Partners, LLC
As part of Enterprise Analytics, the Business Analytics Manager leverages the tools and methods of analytics to generate business and clinical value for Innovacare Health through design, production, and interpretation of complex quantitative, often statistical, ad hoc analyses. The role of the Business Analytics Manager is to:
Provide analytics leadership in engagements with business and/or clinical departments within Innovacare Health in order to understand business and clinical issues and to recommend analysis plans,
Independently design, develop, and execute complex statistical/quantitative analyses that determine the underlying drivers of key performance outcomes and/or contribute to an understanding of the mechanisms by which drivers act independently or in concert (systems thinking),
Apply expert-level experience with tools that support complex statistical analysis leveraging multiple data sources,
Present recommendations to operational and executive leaders (Directors, VP/SVP/EVP, C-suite) in a consultative manner regarding the next analytical steps and/or paths to resolution of business/clinical operations issues, weighing the practical considerations and potential barriers that need to be overcome in order to successfully implement new programs and processes,
Oversee the work of others on a routine basis.
The result of the Business Analytics Manager’s work is a body of complex, ad-hoc business analyses that provide insight into drivers of business and clinical performance. In addition, the Business Analytics Manager acts as a trusted advisor to Innovacare senior leadership, proposing recommended solutions to business and operational issues supported by analytic findings. These findings and recommendations improve member health outcomes, increase the efficiency of care delivery operations, and help to contain healthcare costs through health improvement and risk mitigation.
EDUCATION
Master’s degree
EXPERIENCE
Prior Work Experience
Six to nine (6-9) years of prior advanced analytics-related work experience, including financial and/or clinical modeling and data analysis, is required.
Six to nine (6-9) years of experience applying analytics / statistical tools to very-large-scale, complex information sources are required.
Advanced Analytics Skill Set
Expert advanced analytics experience in the healthcare delivery or health insurance industries is required.
Ability to independently, or in a supervisory capacity, develop business problem statements and complex analysis plans.
Independently execute complex analysis plans, assess outcomes, formulate follow-up analyses, or provide expert assessment of the analytics plans and results of other staff.
Ability to independently apply data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI) as well as expert-level SQL is required.
Expert analytic problem-solving skills are required.
The ability to independently and effectively create and communicate complex, analytically-derived findings to senior executive leadership, both verbally and in writing, is required.
Understanding of HIPAA and other applicable statutes or regulations concerning patient privacy and the appropriate use and sharing of healthcare data is required.
Advanced Analytics Technology Skills
Demonstrated mastery of at least two advanced analytics tools is required (e.g., SAS, R, SPSS, Stata). Experience with similar tools will be considered.
Ability to independently and routinely apply data extraction and basic statistical analysis tools and methods is required.
MAJOR WORK ACTIVITIES
The successful Business Insights and Analytics Manager will:
Independently, or in teams, apply advanced analytics programs/tools to develop and execute complex, ad-hoc analyses of financial, clinical, socioeconomic, geospatial, and other data to surface insights regarding drivers of clinical risk and financial performance.
Independently, or in teams, interpret the results of complex, ad-hoc analyses and produce clear and concise explanations of complex results, generating recognized value (i.e., actionable outcomes) for a non-analytics customer base.
Routinely lead analytics engagements with senior leadership customers as a trusted consultant, providing recommendations for analysis plans and performance improvement recommendations based on analytically-derived information.
Apply organizational and time management skills to successfully and routinely manage multiple, complex assignments simultaneously while ensuring department credibility by discovering errors in department data or analyses, or determining the need for additional, follow-up analysis arising from original assignments.
Routinely provide leadership to, mentor, and supervise the work of other EA staff.
Travel Requirements
Up to 25% travel required

Location: MACDILL AFB, FL, US

Date Posted: 2023-11-02

Category: Cyber

Subcategory: Cybersecurity Ops

Schedule: Full-time

Shift: Day Job

Travel: Yes, 10 % of the Time

Minimum Clearance Required: TS/SCI

Clearance Level Must Be Able to Obtain: None

Potential for Remote Work: No


Description

SAIC is seeking an Operations and Planning Analyst to plan for, develop, integrate, synchronize and coordinate Command, Control, Computers, Communications, Cyberspace, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C5ISR) actions throughout the U.S. Central Command (USCENTCOM) Area of Responsibility (AOR) and Theater.


This individual should have experience and familiarity with the USCENTCOM Area of Responsibility and mission. Must be a team player, willing to work challenging assignments and tasks concerning Cyber security and Defensive Cyber Operations orders, policy, procedures and guidance; be willing to travel occasionally throughout the AOR (which includes Afghanistan, Iraq, Bahrain, Qatar, and other Southwest Asia nations).

Roles and responsibilities:

Interact and serve as direct interface with the military and government leadership within USCENTCOM and with Service Components.
Support J63 Plans and Exercises.
Conduct/participate theater-wide collaboration for Cyber Security orders, policies, procedures and guidance through multiple means including but not limited to meetings, Video Teleconferencing, email and collaboration session communications.
Distribute current Cyber Security orders, policies, procedures and guidance to the USCENTCOM Components.
Provide Cyber Security support to USCENTCOM AOR Network Operations (NETOPS) Centers, as required.
Review and update Cyber Security current orders, policies and procedures.
Interpret, analyze, produce and execute theater-wide Cyber Security orders, policies, procedures and tactics.
Coordinate and participate in theater Cybersecurity risk analysis, assessments or scoping missions, as required.
Review current intelligence for relevant threats and develop appropriate actions/response.
Assist with tracking of compliancy reporting for USCENTCOM orders.
Document Cybersecurity orders, policies, procedures and guidance.
Participate in command mission assurance working groups and conduct mission assurance analysis for J6 networks and missions.
Conduct defensive cyber operations planning and coordination for theater defensive cyber forces.
Analyze and recommend technology deployments at the headquarters and throughout the theater to maximize defensive cyber operations effectiveness. Develop a technology strategy to include evaluations and decisions points for J6 leadership.
Participate in command exercise program and develop cyber input for all exercises.
Participate in command operational planning teams and write cyber annexes to command orders.
Plan for and support integration of operational communications assets, systems, equipment and personnel in support of USCENTCOM Theater requirements.
Provide technical and subject matter expertise and recommendations for planning actions on all USCENTCOM numbered plans, contingency plans, operational orders, fragmentary orders, Communications Tasking Orders (CCTO) or other directives or procedures, as required. Support actions include traditional communications, cyberspace coordination and cybersecurity planning, as required.

Support and coordinate with Foreign Military Sales (FMS) technicians for planning and support of CENTCOM Partner Network (CPN) requirements, operations and expansion

Communications Operations, Planning and Intelligence experience
Ability to brief senior military and government leaders within the DoD and other organizations including Partner Nations.
Significant experience within USCENTCOM operations, AOR and staff work

Job Title: Business Analysis Manager


Job Summary:

The Business Analysis Manager is responsible for leading a team of IT business analysts to support the planning, development, and implementation of technology solutions within the government sector. This position plays a critical role in understanding business needs, assessing existing systems, and collaborating with stakeholders to ensure that IT projects align with government objectives and regulatory requirements.


Key Responsibilities:

Team Leadership:
Manage and lead a team of IT business analysts, providing guidance, mentorship, and performance management.
Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture that encourages professional development and knowledge sharing.
Business Analysis:
Identify, document, and analyze business processes, requirements, and objectives.
Develop and maintain a clear understanding of government policies, regulations, and procedures related to technology projects.
Collaborate with business units to define project scope and objectives.
Requirements Elicitation:
Engage with stakeholders to gather, validate, and prioritize requirements for IT projects.
Create detailed requirements documentation, including functional and technical specifications user stories and functional workflows
Solution Design and Planning:
Translate business requirements into technology solutions and systems.
Work with architects and technical teams to design efficient and cost-effective solutions.
Develop project plans, timelines, and resource allocation to ensure successful project implementation.
Quality Assurance:
Conduct thorough testing and validation of IT solutions to ensure they meet established requirements and government standards.
Implement quality control measures to identify and rectify defects in the systems.
Stakeholder Collaboration:
Facilitate communication and collaboration between IT teams, government departments, and other stakeholders to ensure alignment with government goals and objectives.
Compliance and Security:
Ensure that all IT solutions meet government security and compliance requirements.
Stay current with evolving regulations and implement necessary changes to maintain compliance.
Documentation and Reporting:
Maintain comprehensive records of project documentation, status reports, and project outcomes.
Prepare and present reports to senior management and government officials as required.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
At least 5 years of experience in IT business analysis, with 2 years in a managerial role.
Strong understanding of government operations, policies, and regulations.
Proven experience in leading and managing IT project teams.
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in business analysis tools and methodologies.
Knowledge of project management principles and methodologies (e.g., PMI, Agile, Scrum).
Familiarity with government-specific software and systems is a plus.
Professional certifications, such as CBAP (Certified Business Analysis Professional), PMP (Project Management Professional), or similar, are advantageous.

Multiple Positions (Junior level, Mid level, Senior level)

Strong Team Management

Builds and sustains relationship, persuasive communication and advocacy
Demonstrates organizational, Understands IS Practices and Approaches,
Strategic thinking and visioning, Identify relevant opportunities, New technologies and business impacts, Generating solution and standards
Turns IS strategy into action, Organization and management of IS function, Security and integrity management (SOX), Financial Management
Analytical thinking, Business requirements Analysis, Process design and evaluation
Change management, Planning, Execution, Monitoring, Delivering through others.

3 years SAP implementation experience
Minimum of 2 full life cycle implementations

Preferably ITIL Qualified – V3 Experience

Orchid Underwriters Agency (Orchid), a member of the Brown & Brown National Programs family, is seeking a Business Systems Analyst.
Our people make all the difference in our success.
We are meritocracy, where teammates are rewarded on their performance and achievement of goals. A proactive and entrepreneurial attitude thrives in our environment by having the freedom to pursue opportunities, while having the support of a national organization.

The Business Systems Analyst supports the technology needs for the organization. This role is to act as the liaison between the business and IT and provide business critical or complex technical solutions that meet user needs. Improve business performance by providing the technical analysis of business requirements (including translation into functional requirements), prioritizes of those requirements and user acceptance testing. Ensuring that clear, detailed and concise requirements have been captured.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND FUNCTIONS:
Understanding the business processes and the interdependencies of various systems in use.
Facilitating interactive discussions with the business unit and technology teams in order to achieve alignment on defining requirements.
Ability to elicit details system requirements and create workflows to solution business demand.
Gathering, analyzing, documenting, and translating business requirements into functional specifications that can be used to design and implement solutions to meet the business objectives.
Identifying and communicating risks, issues, and potential solution strategies along with providing status updates to senior leadership and impacted teammates.
Leading facilitated sessions with business users to identify system enhancements.
Documenting and gaining sign-off on business requirements.
Communicating project priorities to IT team.
Assisting with the creating of training material and training end users on system
enhancements and new programs.
Providing reports and data extracts to internal and external business partners.
Training, mentoring, and supporting other staff members.
Other duties as assigned.
This position requires routine or periodic travel which may require the teammate to drive their own vehicle or a rental vehicle. Acceptable results of a Motor Vehicle Record report at the time of hire and periodically thereafter, and maintenance of minimum acceptable insurance coverages are a requirement of this position.
COMPETENCIES:
Planning/organizing—the individual prioritizes and plans work activities and uses time efficiently. Makes good and timely decisions that propels our company forward.
Interpersonal skills—the individual maintains confidentiality, remains open to others' ideas and exhibits willingness to try new things. Creates an environment where teammates feel connected and energized.
Written and Oral communication—Communicate a concise message that resonates every time. The individual speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations and demonstrates group presentation skills.
Problem solving—Create innovative ways for our customers and our company to be successful. The individual identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner, gathers and analyzes information skillfully and maintains confidentiality.
Quality control—the individual demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness and monitors own work to ensure quality.
Adaptability—the individual adapts to changes in the work environment, manages competing demands and is able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events.
QUALIFICATIONS:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
REQUIRED:
A minimum 8 – 10 years of related experience
A minimum of a bachelor’s degree.
Expert level proficiency in Microsoft suite, Office365; focus on Excel and PowerPoint
Experience with new system implementations, workflows, requirements gathering and software life cycle.
Insurance industry experience (Personal Lines).
Experience working with offshore resource model.
Mentoring and giving direction to peers.
PREFERRED:
Insurance industry experience in MGU.
Experience with Unqork and Solartis systems.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS NECESSARY ON A REGULAR BASIS:
Manual dexterity, arm and upper body range of motion sufficient for use of a keyboard, mouse and telephone 7-8 hours per day
Vision sufficient for use of a computer monitor
Ability to sit at a desk 7-8 hours per day.
Who We Are:
Orchid, a member of the Brown & Brown, Inc. National Programs segment, is a premier leader in program underwriting services and distribution in personal and commercial catastrophe property insurance. For more than two decades we have been the market of choice for brokers and capacity providers alike. Established in 1998, Orchid has recognized a long-term and sustained growth trajectory, and currently places approximately $300 million of annual premium. Headquartered in Vero Beach, Florida with additional offices in Tampa, Orchid designs, markets, underwrites and administers insurance policies on behalf of third-party carriers through an independent network of more than 7,100 experienced agents and brokers.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We take pride in the diversity of our team and seek diversity in our applicants.

Position Description

The SAP PMO Leader is a director-level position that is responsible for the day-to-day management and ongoing strategy for all activities involved in portfolio, project, and change management inclusive of business analysis, project control.

Key Accountabilities:

Manages day-to-day activities in the Project Management Office (PMO) to ensure programs and projects meet organization goals, as aligned with strategy, and requirements.
Lead, implement and drive adoption of PMO tools and processes to effectively manage the delivery of projects for the organization.
Serve as reference point for PMO queries and provide guidance related to PMO processes, methodologies, and policies.
Portfolio management for in-flight and in-queue projects for all applications and technology projects.
Resource planning to ensure proper staffing of approved projects. Includes employed staff, contractors, and outsourced resources.
Facilitate prioritization discussions between IT and business teams’ leadership to ensure alignment on the company's IT project investments.
Manage the team to effectively capture functional and non-functional requirements for all projects. Ensure requirement traceability throughout the project lifecycle to ensure projects are delivered on scope.
Lead and manage the team to provide effective project management for all projects. Includes budget, schedule, risk, resource, and scope management. Includes appropriate application of change management practices inclusive of effective stakeholder communication.
Ensures the identification of risk, issues, risk response strategies and risk responses to ensure schedule compliance.
Ensure proper operational readiness stage gate criteria is defined and met of all projects prior to deployment to production.
Conduct post project assessment to capture learnings and ensure continuous improvement on tools and methodologies.
Provide organization and function wide reporting on project priorities, status, risks.
Seeks methods of improving/automating process and find ways to improve processes and profitability.
Develop and executes multi-year strategic roadmap across the organization with calibration exercises years; built upon interviews with business owners, prioritization, executive vision, and demand needs.
Collaborated with stakeholders to maintain ongoing partnership with continuous improvement mindset, working to apply knowledge and strategies to meet demands.
Manage and lead a team of reports within the PMO supporting project, change, and portfolio management and business analysis.
Lead requests for proposal/information initiatives to meet the organization and business demands from initialization to finalization.
Understand and maintains business acumen to support business partners to meet and exceed expectations. Drives to success technical tools and resources, business strategies and goals; functions as a leader with the ability to make decisions that impact the organization, provide direction, and set roadmaps.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's Degree plus fifteen (15) years of related business experience and five (5) years or analytical experience required.
Five (5) plus years of experience in leading organizational change and/or project deployment required.
PMP Certification
Exposure to the business functions of a manufacturing enterprise from an operations, finance, supply chain, or business analysis perspective preferred.

Skills/Qualifications:

Excellent attention to detail and accuracy; strong critical self-review skills.
Demonstrates ability to deliver communication which is clear, concise, and relevant to audience through appropriate methods and tools.
Appreciates what constitutes good customer service and displays consistent commitment to delivering.
Exhibits a high degree of professionalism.
Organized methodical application of established data governance standards.
Proactive approach to role and problem solving; solution rather than problem focused.
Self-motivated, flexible, with the ability to deal with high levels of complexity, change and evolving processes, often at short notice.
Strong leader/coach abilities and mentality.
Strong understanding of SDLC and project management methodologies.
Proficiency in Microsoft Visio and Project.
Demonstrated mid-level or above proficiency with MS Office Excel, analyzing and manipulating large datasets through formulas and macros preferred.
Strong analytical abilities with experience extracting data and developing reports in an ERP environment preferred.
Experience defining, writing and implementing business processes and data standards preferred.
CPA, Six Sigma, PMP, or similar preferred.

This is a highly technical and professional position involving business analysis, process mapping, requirements definition and application administration disciplines such as configuration, setup and user security. This position reports to the System Implementation Manager.

Examples of Duties

Interact with user groups and management to define and document requirements for business application software.

Coordinate the implementation, technical writing and user training activities associated with system changes and/or new system development efforts.

Assist in the evaluation and implementation of third-party software applications and development tools where applicable. Develop/maintain test scripts and conduct thorough testing of new and modified applications prior to implementation

Build and maintain strong working relationships with City departments to ensure accurate planning and coordinating of all information systems and subsystems and to in accordance with City of Ocala Ordinances.

Provide application and business expertise; to assist in the formulation, implementation and evaluation of system enhancements. Create and maintain complete documentation for data and business models.

Work with departments to analyze business information, existing procedures, processes and workflow to develop and implement productivity and service enhancements as well as assist in the exploration and recommendation of alternative solutions and methods of operation.

Provide support to end users on a variety of issues. Troubleshoot issues with existing or developed systems, and works with appropriate resources to resolve them.

Respond to telephone calls, email, and staff requests for application support. Track and monitor problems to insure timely resolution.

Create advanced queries and reports on various data sources to detect errors and missing information.

Administer application security, configuration, maintenance and setup.

Work with the Database Administrator and Senior Systems Analyst in applying upgrades and patches to the applications.

Provide supervisor with progress/status updates on a regular basis; escalating scheduling delays or other conflicts.

Minimum three (3) years of business application (such as CIS, FIS, GIS, AMR, or other City information system) or functional support experience.

Experience with network architectures, relational databases (Oracle or SQL Server and MS Access) and client/server environment desired. Working knowledge of MS Office, MS Project and Visio desired.

Graduation from an accredited four year college or university with major coursework in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or related field or related discipline is preferred. An equivalent combination of training and professionally responsible experience may substitute for educational requirements.

LICENSES/CERTIFICATES

Must possess and maintain a valid Florida Operators Driver's License with an acceptable driving record.

Supplemental Information

In-depth knowledge of business applications and functional operations with the ability to thoroughly analyze existing processes

Ability to conduct functional analysis, detail and document system requirements, evaluate third-party software applications, and implement new systems

Ability to analyze and interpret data and solve problems

Ability to effectively establish task and project priorities

Ability to read and comprehend technical and business material to stay abreast of technology trends and changes

Ability to learn new methods, procedures, and operations

Ability to utilize MS Office applications and integrate with other application systems

Knowledge of accounting principles and practices

Ability to plan and direct the work of others; must demonstrate teambuilding skills

Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, supervisors, other City Departments and the general public

Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing

Knowledgeable in the principles of leadership and training

Ability to remain calm in stressful situations, and maintain a flexible work schedule

Job Title: Treasury Transformation Lead Business Analyst – VP/ C13
Job Description:
The Treasury Transformation Team works closely with stakeholders to define, drive and execute end-to-end process design and implementation efforts for controls, infrastructure and operational toolsets required to support the day-to-day Liquidity Risk Management and reporting functions. These functions include but are not limited to liquidity regulatory reporting and metrics, management reporting and liquidity stress testing which span global Treasury groups, Finance functions, technology partners and business partners. The Treasury Transformation Controls Team is responsible for the delivery of Treasury’s transformation objectives related to liquidity risk and controls, and collaborates with stakeholders to identify priorities, coordinate efforts, track progress, define and implement best practices. The Treasury Transformation Controls Lead Business Analyst will be responsible to manage a set of supporting activities under the assigned book of work. The position will require coordination of activities across multiple liquidity functions, the ability to identify and recommend informed process improvements to the Project Manager and senior stakeholders. Additionally, this position will work closely with the Transformation Delivery Leads, Program Managers, Project Manager, PMO, QA/QC & IA.

Responsibilities:

Provides support and own a set of activities, working closely with the Treasury Transformation Controls Program and Project Manager.
Provides support on transformational efforts related to consent order and target state priorities, aligned with the firm-wide transformational goals.
Responsibilities can include but are not limited to: contributing to the creation and drafting of project plans and other project related artifacts, decks and stakeholder communications.
Provides support on project plan tracking, status reporting, creating and/or managing project governance forums, prioritizing workflow and resource management.
Supports transformation projects, organizational change initiatives, and the improvement, development and implementation of existing and new controls.
Applies in-depth knowledge of the business impact of process design and technical contributions.
Provides advice to internal and external clients on the implications of business trends, issues, operating environment changes and firm or business unit strategy.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Performs other duties and functions as assigned.
Qualifications:
6-10+ years of relevant experience, within the Financial Service.
Experience in a Project Manager and/ or Business Analyst Role, with exposure to Treasury, Liquidity Risk Management & controls strongly preferred.
Requires communication and diplomacy skills in order to guide and influence others.
Experience and demonstrated ability to manage competing priorities in a complex and dynamic environment.
Analytical mindset to resolve issues in a variety of complex situations and excellent quantitative and qualitative skills; being able to analyze data, draw conclusions, identify trends and issues, and diagnose root cause of issues.
Track record of success in delivering high quality work in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
Self-motivated with the ability to make decisions in the absence of detailed instructions.
Advanced Microsoft Office skills.
In depth knowledge of financial & regulatory reporting/ banking products / systems preferred.
Successful project management knowledge and experience preferred.
Excellent Verbal and Written Communication Skills required.
JIRA and/or Project Management System knowledge preferred or ability to quickly learn Citi’s Project Management Systems and Methodologies.
Education:
Bachelors degree required, Masters degree preferred

Salesforce Business Analyst

The Opportunity:

Are you looking for an opportunity to establish processes and drive technology innovation? You know that true progress is made at the intersection of business and tech, and as an IT business analyst, you’ll be highly skilled in both. Here, you’ll have the chance to work with an Agile team as they develop digital products to support your clients’ most pressing missions. We’re looking for someone like you to propel business analytics and processes forward, including delving into technology trends to deliver user-friendly client experiences.

As an IT Business Analyst, you’ll develop leading-edge Salesforce business solutions. Partnering with your team of architects, developers, testers, leading junior analysts, and other key stakeholders, you’ll identify clients’ business needs, gather user requirements, and develop user stories. You’ll understand the overall direction and nuanced user needs clearly, and you’ll lead your team as they fulfill these needs by creating deployable features. Together, you’ll deliver high business value products for our veterans. Ready to make an impact by transforming and modernizing federal healthcare? Work with us as we build systems to change for the better.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:

2+ years of experience as a Business Analyst

Knowledge of Agile methodology

Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical audiences

Ability to translate business needs into effective and detailed user stories, requirements, and acceptance criteria

Ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust or Suitability/Fitness determination based on client requirements

Bachelor’s degree

Nice If You Have:

Experience in facilitating strategic, consultative sessions with clients

Experience with Scaled Agile Framework, Scrum, or Kanban

Experience in government or Healthcare IT industries

Experience with the Salesforce platform

Knowledge of Visio or Lucid Chart

Salesforce Certification

Vetting:

Applicants selected will be subject to a government investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements of the U.S. government client.

Create Your Career:

Grow With Us

Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.

A Place Where You Belong

Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time.

Support Your Well-Being

Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.

Your Candidate Journey

At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $52,200.00 to $119,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees.

Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.

If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

JOB DESCRIPTION


You have 12 or more years of experience in Banking / Financial services, with strong Payments knowledge and / or prior experience in driving large scale strategic projects. You also possess leadership and project management skills with an ability to drive projects in close partnership with Operations, Product and Technology partners. This is the team for you.

As a Vice President - Business Analysis Manager in Graphite Payments Transformation team for JPMorgan Chase, you will drive initiatives under stringent timelines and in a fast-paced dynamic environment. You will be expected to have strong communication and influencing skills, strategic thinking, collaboration with multiple impacted teams, flexibility and result driven. You must have leadership and project management skills with an ability to drive projects in close partnership with Operations, Product and Technology partners.

Job Responsibilities

Define the business requirements for development and commercialization of new product capabilities (business analyst)
Articulate and document process flows including customer interactions and Operations intervention
Cover functional and non-functional requirements including but not limited to Product features, Operational requirements, Regulatory and Compliance requirements, User Interface, Client reporting, Sanctions, Resiliency and Scalability. The requirements must be able to cater to current expectations and allow scalability for future changes in business model
Perform impact analysis for business initiatives to determine key business groups that will consequently be required to undergo technical or operational process change
Partner closely with Product and Technology partners to help define globally consistent platform architecture
Conduct gaps analysis as required to determine degree of change emergent from business initiatives
Work with User Acceptance Testing team to determine the testing strategy and ensure thorough testing of all capabilities
Track the overall progress of an initiative and identify any possible red flag and collaborating with various stakeholders for resolution of the issues to ensure timely completion of the projects
Drive Operations readiness to support new product roll out by ensuring documentation of process flows, operational procedures, training, user entitlements, clearly defined roles and responsibilities and establishing escalation matrix
Anticipate internal and external factors impacting the global payment strategy and implementing plans to mitigate risks and capitalize on opportunities
Defect analysis, prioritization and exploring alternative solutions

Required Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills

Minimum of 12 years experience in Banking / Financial services
Well versed with Agile methodology and experience in driving projects under the said framework
Strong Project management skills and ability to work independently
Strong problem solving, collaboration, communication and interpersonal skills with proven ability to influence stakeholders without direct authority
Strategic thinker with ability to define future state business model and drive execution to that effect
Ability to multi-task and manage and deliver competing priorities
Attention to detail with logical thought process
Self-motivated, tenacious with excellent time management/prioritization skills
Experience in designing, delivering & presenting executive level content
Adept at working in matrix organization and dynamic high performance teams
Leverages the organization to deliver results quickly

Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, and Skills

Strong Payments knowledge and / or prior experience in driving large scale strategic projects preferred

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents and perspectives that they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. ABOUT THE TEAM

The Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across investment banking, wholesale payments, markets and securities services. The world’s most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. We provide strategic advice, raise capital, manage risk and extend liquidity in markets around the world.



Operations teams develop and manage innovative, secure service solutions to meet clients’ needs globally. Developing and using the latest technology, teams work to deliver industry-leading capabilities to our clients and customers, making it easy and convenient to do business with the firm. Teams also drive growth by refining technology-driven customer and client experiences that put users first, providing an unparalleled experience.

Overview
Analyzes, defines and prioritizes the business requirements, functional specifications and operational architecture for up to and including highly complex strategic, global programs. Provides consultation to IT and business management on applying technology to business opportunities and planning and implementing cross-functional applications or systems. May allocate/coordinate work within a team/project. Elicits, challenges, and prioritizes requirements using standard processes and templates, and translates into functional design and use case documents. Develops project scope, objectives, constraints and assumptions for a given large, strategic, multi-year project. Participates and provides guidance in development of the technical design, test plans, and user documentation. Consults internal business groups on requirements, functional architecture and implementation. Tracks scope and change throughout the remainder of the initiative utilizing formal requirements management principles, including change control and requirements traceability. Gathers and analyzes information to assist in development of recommendations to address strategic business objectives that span multiple, global business and technology areas. Participates in industry forums and keeps current on domain knowledge for their specific business and application areas of expertise. Applies experiences with existing software and/or systems development processes to develop better processes to be used in the future. Actively influences software development process improvement initiatives. Provides senior level consultation to internal business groups on process improvement projects designed to improve their business results. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives.
Bachelor's degree in business or technical-related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred, 6-8 years of experience in providing consulting advice to senior IT and business management required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

Job Title: Technical Project Lead -Vice President -(Hybrid) Tampa FL
Job Description:
The Finance, Treasury, Liquidity, Capital, and Risk functions at Citi are consumers of a vast amount of data that spans across the entirety of the firm, cutting across all lines of business, asset classes, and geographies. To meet the needs of these functions, a large, centralized data platform has been developed to enable the acquisition of data from all appropriate sources across the firm The scale of data that flows through this platform is significant, with thousands of inbound feeds being managed daily, dozens of consuming applications, and a 100+ terabyte data store in the middle. While there have been efforts made to automate integration and regression testing, we need to increase our investment in both automated testing tools and driving a test-first mindset in our requirement management and engineering practices.

The Technical Project :Lead Analyst will report directly to the Release and Process Governance Manager Lead, who is responsible for overall health of Risk, Finance, and Controls IT programs Release Management and SDLC governance . The candidate will define, design, implement (and manage ongoing production of) Program and Project tracking and reporting capabilities to support application delivery teams in their adherence to corporate program and project governance. This role will be involved in opportunities to build/improve End to End delivery processes, including development of a suite of proactive reporting, visualization, and communication, leveraging the data within multiple complex enterprise project management tools, to advise senior technology managers of the overall health of their initiatives and identify areas that require remediation.

This role will require strong Technology Project Management and Release Management knowledge with a Quality Engineering perspective. This technology leader should be someone who can drive innovation and implementation, while balance priorities, complexities, and risk as it relates to Data Quality Engineering.

Responsibilities:

Manage a portfolio of projects within a release, ensuring that all activities are planned and coordinated across multiple systems and applications to produce a quality release of code to
Execute status meetings with Project Managers, partner with Project Managers, Project stakeholders and drive releases to completion.
Prepare and produce project status, Issue/Risk log and RAG reports for senior management.
Preparation of weekly and monthly operational metrics reports including cost savings status and forecasts.
Participate in project governance and provide detailed metrics on project quality controls measures as related to Release Management.
Deploy appropriate methods and tools to drive implementation releases.
Leads reengineering efforts in business's methodology, strategy, and organizational goals.
Applies/demonstrates advanced understanding of processes, procedures, and policies for aligned business.
Influences strategic functional decisions through advice, counsel or provided services that have direct impact on the business.
Completes projects to acquire data, manage it, and present it for use in reporting and statistics.
Documents platform processes, procedures, and training materials.
Leads discussions and requirement gathering sessions, reaching consensus, and recommending solutions on system issues and projects.
Responsible for developing the agenda pipeline and facilitating meetings.
Interface and build strong rapport with all stakeholders.
Facilitate structured meetings and diligently capture and track action items to closure.
Translate strategy into actionable plan with defined ownership and roles/responsibilities and ensure delivery of activities.
Create a governance structure for managing complex activities that involve multiple businesses, technology, marketing, communications, training, and control partners.
Manage roadmap that can be used to drive priorities, identify dependencies, and ensure appropriate engagement with clients and participants.
Provide transparency and reporting to stakeholders and senior management.
Provide mechanisms to capture & monitor remediation of any potential risks. In addition, enable appropriate escalation of any item that may impact timely delivery or cause a change to the agreed scope of project.
Ensure accurate and consistent reporting of activities across all governance forums outside of direct control.
Lead iterative delivery of key strategic cross-functional program, through focus, transparency, communication, visibility, and accountability.
Own regular program communication, unblock teams, and build partnerships.
Develop standards, processes, and documentation to improve best practices & compliance
- including reviews, awareness, education, and process controls.
Provides expertise in projects managed and demonstrates an advanced level of understanding of the principles of IT project leadership.
Possesses an understanding of client core business functions.

Required Qualifications:

7+ years of Technology Project management experience, working within a technology delivery function with experience in organizing, analyzing, and visualizing enterprise data to enable data-driven decision making and actions, with emphasis in SDLC and Release Management across large and complex organizations.
Demonstrated work history in complex global environment as a project manager in technology with an emphasis on Banking. .
5+ years of financial industry experience in Finance, Risk / Trading.
5+ years technical experience in a development/engineering role.
Data warehouse and analytics experience -Understand Banking and Finance data model.
Experience with ITIL, Data Lineage, Inventory Management, CMDB, ServiceNow, APIs, CI/CD, DevOps
Knowledge of software development lifecycle (SDLC) methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, Safe, etc.).
3 to 5 years of Business Analysis experience in Finance, Risk /Trading would be a huge plus.
Strong skills in creating process documents, program management/planning, presentations, and communication.
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication.
Skilled in business process optimization, Lean Six Sigma
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office, SharePoint, JIRA ,Confluence
Ability to successfully coordinate and lead a meeting of senior and technical individuals.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Experience building Agile roadmaps, release plans, project plans with a thorough understanding of dependency management.
Consulting experience is preferred but not required.

Education

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience.
Scrum Master certification would be a plus.

Why it’s worth it:
Are you passionate about using data to help drive key business decisions? As a Revenue Operations Analyst, you will do just that by acting as the trusted data partner to the full Go-To-Market (GTM) team – Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success. Working closely with GTM leadership, you will help identify process improvements and drive attainment through analytics, reporting, data optimization, and KPI development. Additionally, your partnership in planning, forecasting, and management will play a critical role in helping ReliaQuest continue to make security possible for our customers and grow over 50% year over year.

The everyday hustle:

Own and execute timely, accurate, and insightful reports and analyses for the GTM team (Marketing, Business Development, Partnerships, Sales, and Customer Success).
Develop, analyze, and interpret key performance indicators (KPIs) to assist in GTM decision making.
Manage business review cadences for both internal and external stakeholders.
Support day-to-day inquiries, providing prompt and efficient resolution to a wide range of issues.
Integrate GTM data and tracking across different business units – including Finance, Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success – to ensure that our systems are generating accurate data.
Proactively identify, track, and execute opportunities to improve operational performance and achieve key goals and targets.
Act as a trusted business partner to Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success Leadership.
Assist with the on-going automation of reports and models in the SQL Server Database.

Do you have what it takes?

1-3 years of experience in Revenue Operations, Business Analytics, or a Financial Planning and Analytics role.
Experience using data to drive process improvements withing a SaaS organization.
Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem-solving abilities with a passion for numbers and analytics.
Excellent communication skills (written and oral) with the ability to build relationships and drive initiatives across a diverse set of stakeholders.
High proficiency in Excel.
Curious, independent, rigorous, and proactive personality.

Job Title: Business Systems Analyst I/II/III (Oracle HCM Fusion)
Job Description:
Overview

This position will support the Oracle HCM Fusion platform in Human Resources.

To coordinate and conduct complex system analyses feasibility studies and implementation studies of potential computer applications to determine the advisability and profitability of adapting complex electronic data processing techniques to Navy Federal functional areas under minimal supervision. To analyze business needs to develop and implement solutions that leverage systems and processes with a considerable degree if latitude. Works with the business to understand their needs, related to information technology and enhance business process by promoting new functionality. Using advanced knowledge of the organization's technology infrastructure and specific software applications assist the business to implement strategic vision through technology. Considered a stakeholder/contributor on complex systems projects and project teams. To lead full lifecycle project implementation. To exercise advanced technical knowledge of all phases of applications systems analysis.

Gathering requirements
Review Oracle Product documentation
Configure New and Existing functionality
Recommend solutions to address gaps
Planning Delivery of System Change
Testing changes and releases
Completing requirements and design documentation

Evaluate operational efficiency and effectiveness
Analyze information, requirements, data, work quality, work methods, processes, service specific practices, standards and metrics/statistics
Uses elicitation techniques to gather information at the right level of detail and scope to represent all of the stakeholder's needs

Supervise modeling efforts to ensure that specifications and constructs adhere to appropriate mathematical and statistical standards and answer particular analytic questions
Identifying business requirements (e.g., needs, objectives, functions, features, input and output)

Develop, recommend and document adjustments to workflow to streamline processes
Coordinate integration of solutions with existing applications; identify and resolve existing conflicts to ensures compatibility

Utilize performance measurements and indicators to identify areas for improvement; develop process improvement plans for each performance indicator or area identified

Implement new/enhanced products, services and/or operational changes
Identify and communicate key responsibilities and practices, evaluate results, and provide leadership and guidance to ensure successful implementation of business unit projects
Lead project teams; assure quality, consistent performance; meet schedules and/or resolve highly technical and complex problems
Interpret results of analysis; present recommendations, alternatives and implications
Serve as resource for the resolution of complex and/or unique problems
Lead, guide and mentor less experienced staff
Write requirements and define editorial workflow for business owner projects
Serves as change management lead for business unit; apply change management principles and knowledge to develop strategies including organizational assessments, stakeholder analysis and change roadmaps and plans
Develop and oversee project plans and roadmaps that outline preventative and corrective actions necessary to remediate control deficiencies, maximizing effectiveness and mitigating future exposure
Ensure preventative, detective, and corrective controls are properly identified and documented
Develop test plans, test criteria, scenarios and documentation; ensure acceptance of delivered solutions
Conduct and/or facilitate user acceptance testing to include developing and executing test cases, communication with project teams, validating and documenting results
Report testing activity including time spent, testing time lost and discrepancies found
Apply and communicate changes and new trends in systems/technology
Represent the business unit in identifying, analyzing and communicating system solutions
Conduct root cause analysis to identify development opportunities and recommend applicable business solutions
Research emerging technologies and recommend solutions that align with business goals
Monitor performance of systems to ensure continued systems efficiency
Collaborate with key partners in development and delivery of solutions
Perform other duties as assigned

Previous Oracle HCM Experience

Strong functional and technical requirements writing skills

Experience in leading large projects/initiatives which have business risk and impact
Significant experience in managing multiple priorities independently and/or in a team environment to achieve goals

Job Title: Internal Audit Data and Operations - Technology Lead Business Analyst (VP) (Hybrid)
Job Description:
Function Background/Context

Citigroup Internal Audit provides independent assessments of the company's governance, risk management and internal control environment for key stakeholders including the Board of Directors, senior management, and Citi’s numerous regulators globally. Internal Audit (IA) is a change agent within Citi aimed to enhance the control culture of Citigroup worldwide and thereby support senior management decision making around the globe.

Job Description Summary

This role will sit within the Global IA Data and Operations team and be responsible for supporting, overseeing, and providing strategic direction for the development and provision of data analysis and insight-driven reporting to the IA function and business stakeholders across Citi. The role holder will be required to develop expert knowledge about Citi IA and establish close working links within the audit function, to ensure strong contact points for the co-ordination of MIS activities, as well as building a knowledge base of the local environment to better drive insightful reporting of the Bank’s internal control environment. This role will focus on supporting the target management information (MI) data architecture for Citi IA’s MI needs; weekly and monthly data analysis and baseline MI production; as well as Business Intelligence solutions development.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain close links with supported Chief Auditors in managing their MI needs, insight-driven governance and stakeholder reporting commitments, operational MI reporting, and ad-hoc reporting needs.
Act as a strong advocate for data quality across all IA Management Information data, promoting accuracy, completeness and consistency among users who interact with IA data in source systems.
Interact with production-and internally developed applications/tools to verify information and data quality. Where a need is identified for enhanced data quality monitoring, design and build necessary tools to achieve this.
Continuous improvement of existing processes (including the collection, review, aggregation, and dissemination of information), to generate efficiencies and address relevant requirements.
Provision of ad-hoc information requests and analysis as deemed necessary - working closely with the broader Chief Operating Office team - for both internal (e.g., Citi/Product/Function Chief Auditors, Chief Operating Officer) and external stakeholders (e.g., examiners, regulators).
Work cross-functionally to establish the target data environment, and continue to maintain, develop, and enhance IA’s global Business Intelligence reporting solutions.

Knowledge and Experience:

BS/BA degree or an equivalent combination of education/experience in a related field (Computer Science, Management Information, etc.). Prior experience in the financial services industry/Internal Audit experience is a plus.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the confidence to lead meetings and discuss critical topics with senior management.
Experience in the translation of manual, qualitative data, into quantifiable analytics, and then proficient in re-qualifying such analytics into information and insight.
Strong understanding of and experience providing timely, high-quality, insightful data analytics and reporting under tight deadlines and among multiple competing deliverables, with flexibility to prioritize workload accordingly.
Excellent quantitative and qualitative analytical skills with a proven ability to operate in a manually intensive data environment, extracting large volumes of data from disparate sources, cleansing, and validating it, and transforming it into high quality, insightful reporting.
Intellectually curious, consistently evaluating “what is the data telling me?” and “why does it matter?"
A self-aware, self-confident individual who has well-developed interpersonal, organizational, and listening skills, and a strong ability to interact with IA’s stakeholders with regards to their performance metrics.
Effective negotiation skills, a proactive and 'no surprises' approach in communicating issues and strength in sustaining independent views. This individual must be an articulate and effective communicator, both orally and in writing, with an energetic, charismatic, and approachable style.
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills
Business Intelligence development experience is essential, preferably including Tableau and Cognos.
Experience working with senior management in the definition of and delivery of reporting.
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills
Demonstrable ability to take initiative and operate as a dynamic change agent, identifying opportunities to implement efficiencies in current processes.
Able to conceptualize the business need and deliver an innovative approach to solutions.
Strong coordination and project management skills; must be able to define business requirements and create robust technical and process documentation to support activities.

Company Overview
Fanatics is building a leading global digital sports platform. The company ignites the passions of global sports fans and maximizes the presence and reach for hundreds of sports partners globally by offering innovative products and services across Fanatics Commerce, Fanatics Collectibles, and Fanatics Betting & Gaming, allowing sports fans to Buy, Collect and Bet. Through the Fanatics platform, sports fans can buy licensed fan gear, jerseys, lifestyle and streetwear products, headwear, and hardgoods; collect physical and digital trading cards, sports memorabilia, and other digital assets; and bet as the company builds its Sportsbook and iGaming platform. Fanatics has an established database of over 100 million global sports fans, a global partner network with over 900 sports properties, including major national and international professional sports leagues, teams, players associations, athletes, celebrities, colleges, and college conferences, and over 2,000 retail locations, including its Lids retail business stores.
As a market leader with more than 18,000 employees, and hundreds of partners, suppliers, and vendors worldwide, we take responsibility for driving toward more ethical and sustainable practices. We are committed to building an inclusive Fanatics community, reflecting and representing society at every level of the business, including our employees, vendors, partners and fans. Fanatics is also dedicated to making a positive impact in the communities where we all live, work, and play through strategic philanthropic initiatives.

Fanatics Brands is looking for a Sr Inventory Analyst to support the Inventory Management team in monitoring inventory levels, traceability, and identifying, classifying, and finding the root causes of inventory inaccuracies. This position will work in conjunction with Accounting and Finance to develop, implement and monitor processes to insure the SOX (Sarbanes-Oxley Act) Compliance objectives are being met. The position also provides support on special projects directly or indirectly contributing to inventory control as needed for the US Operations team based in Tampa.

The successful candidate for the Sr Inventory Analyst role will conduct thorough analysis and recommendations related to inventory control accuracy to support Fanatics Brands internal and external networks. This position will partner closely with Accounting/Finance, Operations, Distribution and Tech teams to drive accurate and timely systematic on hand inventory levels.

This role will be a key contributor to ongoing transformational projects to improve Fanatics inventory control processes and related systems.
Responsibilities
Develop and manage team to implement and monitor processes and procedures to insure SOX Compliance
Identify business process breakdowns and negotiate process owners/business handoffs.
Develop and monitor KPIs and dashboards to drive business process improvements. Create and provide reports to management and cross-functional teams
Manage/Train/Educate new inventory team members and cross-functional teams in new inventory processes
Research and reconcile inventory issues to determine root causes and drive process and procedural changes to correct
Develop and Manage cycle counting and reconciliation activities for Key Third Party Contractors
Partner with Accounting, Operations, and Tech to ensure processes and systems are capturing inventory transactions accurately and under the correct classification for financial reporting.
Establish a framework for monitoring and controlling inventory including exception reporting, identifying key risk factors (e.g. aging, activity), and audits/cycle counting programs in both internal and external facilities.
Identify high-risk operational processes and develop/implement new process and tech recommendations to improve.
Develop expertise in core system processes to support root cause analysis and build out of new exception reporting and process improvements.
Strong data analysis capability required to manage the volume of SKU/Locations for which this position will be accountable. Need a strong foundation in analytical tools (e.g. Business Intelligence/ MicroStrategy, Excel, Access, etc.)
Demonstrated ability in using problem solving techniques to develop and implement business process improvements
Strong collaboration and problem-solving skills. Ability to think critically and work independently
Exhibit a sense of urgency, working in a fast-paced environment with constructive judgment during demanding situations
Some Travel (15 - 20%)
Requirements
Ability to analyze multiple data sources and processes to make strategic business decisions
2 – 4 years of Related Professional Experience required. Experience with end-to-end business processes in a manufacturing environment preferred.
Bachelor degree in Supply Chain, Business, Accounting, or Related Field preferred
Ability to work and think independently
Proficient in Microsoft Excel (Pivot tables, VLookups, SumIfs, etc.)
Experience with cycle counting programs, ERP systems and SOX compliance is a plus
Strong quantitative and analytical competency
Strong math aptitude and attention to detail
Willingness to travel to manage inventory audits, rollout of new processes/systems as needed
APICS Certification in Inventory Management or Supply Chain is a plus

Do you want to be part of a business that genuinely values entrepreneurialism, innovation and individual accountability?
