An opportunity has arisen for a talented finance professional to join the Virtual Test Division of HBK, a Platform company of Spectris plc (FTSE 250, SXS). The Business Finance Manager is a wide-ranging role, reporting to CFO of the Virtual Test Division, performing key reporting, planning and business analysis tasks for the principal businesses within the division and supporting the development and sharing of best practices.
The Business
The HBK Virtual Test Division is a leading supplier of simulation and real-time computing solutions for the Automotive and Aerospace & Defense industries. The division’s products assist customers in their development of technologically advanced components and products. The division was created when Spectris acquired VI-grade in August 2018. Since this time VI-grade completed two further acquisitions (RightHook - San Jose, Imtec - Berlin) as well as the purchase of two Intellectual Property portfolios. In July 2021 Spectris completed the acquisition of Concurrent Realtime – the combination of Concurrent Real-time and the VI-grade group of companies created the HBK Virtual Test Division.
The division currently has approximately 260 staff in 11 countries and is expected to deliver revenues on an annualised basis of in excess of €75m, growing at >10% per annum organically.
Job Purpose
To support Virtual Test Division CFO with Business Finance tasks for reporting and growth planning as well as developing best practice processes for analysing key business trends and performance.
The business has significant growth aspirations driven both organically and through further bolt-on acquisitions and we expect there will be significant opportunity for career progression within Virtual Test, broader HBK or the Spectris Group.
Key Responsibilities
Working within the finance department, reporting directly to CFO, Virtual Test Division, Business Finance Manager will perform the following:
Support monthly close process within Spectris consolidation system.
Perform monthly variance analysis to explain fluctuations in trading performance from Budget, Forecast or versus prior year.
Run the regular planning process for HBK Virtual Test Division working with the HBK central FP&A team: Budget, quarterly reforecasts and strategic planning process.
Manage quarterly R&D and Capex reporting as well as developing project and capex business cases where relevant.
Perform analysis of revenue resilience with specific focus on the development of the recurring revenue base.
Work with commercial team on product profitability and pricing strategy.
Candidate Specification
Relevant accounting/finance qualification (ACA, CIMA, CPA, CFA etc.)
Minimum of 3 years experience in reporting, forecasting and business analysis for a similar international business
Experience presenting business analysis to key stakeholders
Experience working with both an ERP system as well as a larger group consolidation system. Proficient Office 365 user with expertise in Excel.
High commercial awareness with effective influencing and communication skills as well as strong emotional intelligence. An awareness of cultural differences is essential.
Knowledge of IFRS accounting desirable but not required.
Experience of Business Intelligence tools desirable but not required.
Knowledge of engineering, technology or software industries desirable but not required.
Location
Hybrid working mode: the role will be based at CCRT’s offices in Pompano Beach, Florida, 2 days office/ 3 days work from home.
Compensation
100k USD basic gross annual salary + variable bonus.

Sunshine Act
Pfizer reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Pfizer to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Pfizer intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Pfizer that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government. If you have questions regarding this matter, please do not hesitate to contact your Talent Acquisition representative.

3. Problem Sensitivity - The ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It does not involve solving the problem, only recognizing there is a problem.
4. Information Ordering - The ability to arrange things or actions in a certain order or pattern according to a specific rule or set of rules (e.g., patterns of numbers, letters, words, pictures, mathematical operations).
5. Mathematical Reasoning - The ability to choose the right mathematical methods or formulas to solve a problem.

Job Title: Weekend Operations Analyst
Location: Miami, FL
Type: In Office
Schedule: Weekends
Type of Contract: Permanent
Pay Rate: 63.000 per year + Benefits

Description:
Are you ready for a challenging and dynamic role? We are seeking a dedicated Weekend Operations Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a vital part in ensuring timely information delivery regarding orders from Latin America to the United States. You'll be responsible for keeping client information updated, assisting in end-of-month updates, and making critical decisions on sales orders, billing processes, and overall logistics and inventory control.

Responsibilities and Duties:

Track product shipments from countries in Latin America to the United States, ensuring timely delivery and accurate information in our company systems.
Analyze order statuses, making batch changes if necessary to fulfill client requirements.
Inform teams and clients about the product's status, ensuring deliveries are on time.
Maintain accurate product information in the SAP system, including sales orders, delivery confirmations, and sales prices, within established monthly timelines.
Ensure correct product delivery, guaranteeing customer satisfaction and processing orders for collection.
Ensure all necessary information is available in systems and files required by management at the end of the weekend, leaving updated information for Monday.



Requirements:

Fluency in Spanish and English.
Mastery of Microsoft Excel.
Critical thinking and organizational skills.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in the logistics industry.
University degree in logistics, industrial engineering, or international relations (desirable).

Overview:

The Data & Services team is a key differentiator for Mastercard, providing the cutting-edge services that help our customers grow. Focused on thinking big and scaling fast around the globe, this agile team is responsible for end-to-end solutions for a diverse global customer base. Centered on data-driven technologies and innovation, these services include payments-focused consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, business Test & Learn experimentation, and data-driven information and risk management services.

This role will be asked to work across and with a matrixed organization of account and product leaders to drive impact for our clients and add value by driving sales and preventing revenue loss for the Mastercard Intelligence Center (MIC) and Acquirer Intelligence Center (AIC) BI products.

Role


Drive sales processes from initial introduction of solution through commercial negotiation
Manage the process to drive on-time license renewal of our BI platforms through clear value creation for our clients
Partner with the product team to develop business plans to drive long-term revenue growth
Partner with the account team to build awareness of the platform and identify near-term sales opportunities
Partner with the client services team to develop a Customer Success process to better serve customers and drive license renewals
Identify, coordinate, and convert opportunities to expansion client partnerships (up-sell, add-on, cross-sell, etc.)
Proactively identify customer risk and opportunity signals; develop comprehensive strategies to combat and/or limit erosion
Understand competitive products; can speak with authority to product differences that highlight Mastercard’s advantage
Generally, develop and deliver creative business solutions for complex business problems

All About You

Experience navigating and influencing senior leadership in a corporate environment
B2B enterprise sales experience preferred
Understanding of issuing bank and payments ecosystem
Experience in the financial Institution space; previous Mastercard experience strongly preferred
Proven history of dedicated, high-energy, patient, and customer-centric behavior
Strong organizational skills including the ability to prioritize and escalate customer issues as required
Strong presentation creation and delivery skills and ability to establish credibility with client stakeholders
Consensus builder and influencer capable of diving positive outcomes in challenging renewal situations
Detail-oriented with strengths in data analysis
A second language is desirable

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

Job Title: Technical Business Analyst - RJIM / Saint Petersburg, FL / Memphis, TN / Southfield, MI
Job Description:
Acts as a partner with the business to facilitate and implement technology solutions. Responsible for writing system requirements that will ensure the technology solution will meet the needs of the business. Leverages appropriate technical resources. Requires a high level understanding of systems, industry and end-user requirements. Demonstrates subject matter expertise and is able to integrate domain knowledge with an understanding of financial services standards and practices. Is the primary on the most complex or escalated issues and may provide direction and guidance team members. Applies specialized business knowledge and technical skills to significant deliverables and projects that involve multiple IT departments, business units and have enterprise impact. Is able to make judgements and recommendations based on the analysis and interpretation of data.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:



Creates detailed business requirements for functional (e.g., business processes, rules) and non-functional (e.g., data, security) capabilities.
Validates test cases to ensure that scripts will evaluate the business function being performed.
Gathers and interprets information from multiple sources (including databases, interviews, etc.) and makes recommendations.
Provides support for application development teams including documenting business processes.
Translates technical concepts to business audience and business information to a technical audience.
Participates in developing estimates and implementation plans for technical solutions.
Partners with team members to develop project schedules, reports and documentation. May be required to act as project lead on small to medium projects and/or provide direction to others on the team.
Works with User Experience / Design resources to help visualize requirements into prototype.
Understands and applies principles in risk management, issue tracking and change management.
Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


Qualifications

Experience and Skills:


Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS or related degree and five (5) years of relevant experience or combination of education, training and experience.
Financial Services experience required.
Advanced knowledge of risk management, issue tracking, change management and requirements gathering.
May work in a team environment or project room to facilitate collaboration.
May occasionally work a non-standard shift including nights and/or weekends and/or have on-call responsibilities.

Licenses/Certifications:


None required.

Competencies and Behaviors:


Analysis: Identify and understand issues, problems and opportunities; compare data from different sources to draw conclusions.
Communication: Clearly convey information and ideas through a variety of media to individuals or groups in a manner that engages the audience and helps them understand and retain the message.
Exercising Judgment and Decision Making: Use effective approaches for choosing a course of action or developing appropriate solutions; recommend or take action that is consistent with available facts, constraints and probable consequences.
Technical and Professional Knowledge: Demonstrate a satisfactory level of technical and professional skill or knowledge in position-related areas; remains current with developments and trends in areas of expertise.
Building Effective Relationships: Develop and use collaborative relationships to facilitate the accomplishment of work goals.
Client Focus: Make internal and external clients and their needs a primary focus of actions; develop and sustain productive client relationships.

Raymond James Guiding Behaviors
At Raymond James our associates use five guiding behaviors (Develop, Collaborate, Decide, Deliver, Improve) to deliver on the firm's core values of client-first, integrity, independence and a conservative, long-term view.

We expect our associates at all levels to:

Job Title: Treasury Transformation Lead Business Analyst – VP/ C13
Job Description:
The Treasury Transformation Team works closely with stakeholders to define, drive and execute end-to-end process design and implementation efforts for controls, infrastructure and operational toolsets required to support the day-to-day Liquidity Risk Management and reporting functions. These functions include but are not limited to liquidity regulatory reporting and metrics, management reporting and liquidity stress testing which span global Treasury groups, Finance functions, technology partners and business partners. The Treasury Transformation Controls Team is responsible for the delivery of Treasury’s transformation objectives related to liquidity risk and controls, and collaborates with stakeholders to identify priorities, coordinate efforts, track progress, define and implement best practices. The Treasury Transformation Controls Lead Business Analyst will be responsible to manage a set of supporting activities under the assigned book of work. The position will require coordination of activities across multiple liquidity functions, the ability to identify and recommend informed process improvements to the Project Manager and senior stakeholders. Additionally, this position will work closely with the Transformation Delivery Leads, Program Managers, Project Manager, PMO, QA/QC & IA.

Responsibilities:

Provides support and own a set of activities, working closely with the Treasury Transformation Controls Program and Project Manager.
Provides support on transformational efforts related to consent order and target state priorities, aligned with the firm-wide transformational goals.
Responsibilities can include but are not limited to: contributing to the creation and drafting of project plans and other project related artifacts, decks and stakeholder communications.
Provides support on project plan tracking, status reporting, creating and/or managing project governance forums, prioritizing workflow and resource management.
Supports transformation projects, organizational change initiatives, and the improvement, development and implementation of existing and new controls.
Applies in-depth knowledge of the business impact of process design and technical contributions.
Provides advice to internal and external clients on the implications of business trends, issues, operating environment changes and firm or business unit strategy.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Performs other duties and functions as assigned.
Qualifications:
6-10+ years of relevant experience, within the Financial Service.
Experience in a Project Manager and/ or Business Analyst Role, with exposure to Treasury, Liquidity Risk Management & controls strongly preferred.
Requires communication and diplomacy skills in order to guide and influence others.
Experience and demonstrated ability to manage competing priorities in a complex and dynamic environment.
Analytical mindset to resolve issues in a variety of complex situations and excellent quantitative and qualitative skills; being able to analyze data, draw conclusions, identify trends and issues, and diagnose root cause of issues.
Track record of success in delivering high quality work in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
Self-motivated with the ability to make decisions in the absence of detailed instructions.
Advanced Microsoft Office skills.
In depth knowledge of financial & regulatory reporting/ banking products / systems preferred.
Successful project management knowledge and experience preferred.
Excellent Verbal and Written Communication Skills required.
JIRA and/or Project Management System knowledge preferred or ability to quickly learn Citi’s Project Management Systems and Methodologies.
Education:
Bachelors degree required, Masters degree preferred

Benefits Operations Analyst I

The Benefits Billing Recon and Eligibility team is responsible for a number of operational tasks for ADP Totalsource. The department's responsibilities include client billing, carrier payments and the associated reconciliation and adjustment processes, equaling $3 billion per year. In addition to these tasks, the team serves as the first line of communication for Totalsource's carrier partners, the internal service teams, and the accounting department. Another main area of focus is the transferring of accurate and timely eligibility information between ADP systems and our carrier partner systems. Eligibility related responsibilities include the administration of the Electronic Data Interface process and the research/management of eligibility discrepancy reports. Members on the team are responsible for proactively identifying issues to internal processes and vetting out solutions to maximize efficiencies and minimize risks.

Carrier Reconciliation & Payment: Conduct monthly carrier reconciliations of assigned carriers. Average monthly carrier payments valued at $3 billion on an annualized basis. Monitor carrier activity to ensure that reconciliation files are received or sent on a timely basis. Perform eligibility data reconciliation. Create, maintain and modify queries needed to reconcile eligibility data. Create error files to send to regions and/or carriers. Research error files. If carrier system access is available, terminate all identified terminations that have appeared as a discrepancy. Maintain reconciliation files. When dealing with Paid as Billed carriers, incorporate and manage the Net Zero reconciliation process.
Client Billing: Ensure Client Benefit Billing processes are completed timely and accurately as well as prepare and deliver monthly ACH file. Average monthly client billing is valued at $250 million. Identify and communicate billing errors to carriers and internal partners. Ensure all recon and corrections have been made prior to the subsequent billing runs. Oversee the timely and correct auditing of benefit adjustments. Prepare monthly billing reconciliation files and journal entry worksheets. Prepare files and reports needed for reclassification of expenses.
WSE Eligibility: Manage eligibility communications between carriers and internal partners. Assist benefit service team with diagnosing and solving eligibility issues. Run the weekly EDI process and resolve any transmission failures. Actively work and manage the discrepancy report reconciliation process between processes. Monitor the workflow of electronic eligibility interfaces from creation to carrier receipt.
Field Support & Training: Acts as the liaison between Benefits Billing & Reconciliation and the service teams for billing and adjustment related questions. Train new associates and cross train team members to ensure the proper backups are in place for each department function.
Process Improvement: Leads technology projects to automate systems and improve processes. Troubleshoots and resolves problems, explores opportunities for enhancements and improvements to existing Client-related benefit billing reports, and financial reporting tools.



Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent in education and experience) Preferred
Microsoft Office proficiency with focus on Excel

1-2 years of directly related experience. Prior experience related to data analysis and information management of large sets of data are preferred. Also relevant are roles related to Accounting and Finance

Overview:

The primary mission of the Lead Data Analyst role is to help our business evolve into a data-driven organization in which data and analytics drive differentiation in Lennar’s products and customer experiences. The position sits in our Enterprise Data and Analytics team, which aims to drive improved business outcomes using insights gleaned from data and analytics and infuse them into Lennar’s corporate fabric. The Lead Data Analyst will wrangle, model, and analyze data, and will also understand the data flow from different applications to and from Enterprise Data Warehouse, to provide better quality data to drive improved decision making.

Responsibilities:
Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
Partner very closely with business analytics teams to understand core business processes and identify analytics opportunities
Develop a deep understanding of core business processes and how performance is measured, and work with business and business analytics teams to discern strategic and analytical data and analytics needs and gaps
Utilize diagnostic/predictive/prescriptive analysis to derive business insights and direct/drive action that increases revenue, decreases cost, and/or mitigates risk
Work with management to prioritize work according to business value
Develop appropriate visualizations, notifications and/or alerts to drive business action, and ensure results of actions can be measured and monitored
Drive data quality by validating data & metrics calculations, surfacing quality issues, documenting metadata, and remediating data quality issues
Participate in regular code reviews, promoting engineering best practices, including reuse and testing
Mentor junior analysts on standards, best practices, and advanced analytics techniques
Query and transform data from multiple data sets, and integrate potentially large volumes of data from a variety of sources
Test and validate ETL pipelines
Qualifications:
Education and Experience Requirements:
7-10+ years providing business analysis & querying data, analyze and understand data issues and help resolve them.
Undergraduate degree in data analytics, mathematics, statistics, engineering or equivalent field, or equivalent experience. Master’s degree is a plus
Creative self-starter who can analyze, interpret, and derive insights, and communicate those to drive change in business
Working knowledge of advanced probability and statistics - hypothesis testing, advanced regression, statistical process control
Expertise in SQL and RDBMS
Proficiency in the ‘modern data stack’ – Snowflake, dbt, Fivetran, Airbyte, Prefect, and similar tools
Proficiency with programming languages used in data science, such as Python
Ability and willingness to quickly learn new technologies
Expertise cleansing and integrating data from disparate data sources
Proficiency working with engineers on creating and testing ETL pipelines
Ability to learn business processes quickly and identify inefficiencies through analysis
Strong adherence to core software engineering principles (code modularization, versioning, git, testing etc.)
Familiarity with Agile development such as Scrum or Kanban
Understanding of fundamentals of cloud (Azure, AWS) technologies and databases
Experience with financial modeling
Experience working with NoSQL and graph database systems is a significant plus

Physical Requirements:
This is primarily a sedentary office position which requires the incumbent to have the ability to operate computer equipment. Finger dexterity is necessary.
Additional Requirements:
Team player
May be required to cross train for position(s) within the team organizational structure from time to time, as required by the Leadership

About the role

This position is responsible for analyzing information to prepare various reports related to the marketing and sale process of investment properties. Knowledgeable on fundamental concepts, practices and procedures associated with commercial real estate finance, including commercial appraising, market analysis and investment analysis.

What you’ll do

Generates, reviews and understands reports related to the marketing and sale process of investment properties; uses aggregate data from multiple sources to assist in creating a complete and complex analysis, improvement and/or recommendation. Types of analyses includes one or all of the following: general real estate industry, market/submarket trends, property cash flows (rent rolls/income statements/financial models), lease abstracting, government data (census, BLS) management reporting and strategic planning.
Prepares a variety of analyses, presentations and proposals for new business development, including preparation of financial models, graphics, illustrations and written content. Provides recommendations for management/Producer review.
Creates and produces electronic and/or direct marketing campaigns for sale of properties to include customized property information materials, comparable market analysis, market and industry research and targeted mailing lists. Reviews internal and external collateral materials, proofreads content, ensures appropriate branding, and approves materials for final distribution.
Creates and manages one or all of the following processes: marketing, strategic planning and management reporting, consolidated financial reporting, presentations and proposals from inception to completion; prepares presentations and proposals for new business development; provides recommendations with a focus that materials meet branding and messaging standards.
Assists in the coordination and implementation of strategic platform strategies; performs research and analysis to support those strategies.
May conduct ad hoc studies for management upon request.

What you’ll need

Bachelor's Degree in business, real estate or related field required.

0-2 years of related work experience is required. Real estate, investments, banking or sales support highly desired.

Real Estate Sales License preferred but not required.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Ability to provide efficient, timely, reliable and courteous service to customers. Ability to write reports and effectively present information.

Requires knowledge of financial terms and principles. Ability to calculate intermediate figures such as percentages, discounts, and/or commissions. Conducts basic financial analysis.

Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret documents. Ability to solve problems involving several options in situations. Requires intermediate analytical and quantitative skills.

Working knowledge of Microsoft Suite including: Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, etc. Knowledge of ARGUS preferred. Attention to detail, multi-tasking, and organizational skills required.

Decisions made with understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and timelines. Responsible for setting own project timelines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor.

Why CBRE?

A culture of respect, integrity, service and excellence crafts our approach to every opportunity!

We are guided by the needs of the cities we inhabit, the communities we build and the world we live in!

We have a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law. Job Title: HRIS Analyst Intermediate Robotic Process Automation
Job Description:
Description


All the benefits and perks you need for you and your family:

Benefits from Day One
Paid Days Off from Day One
Career Development
Whole Person Wellbeing Resources
Mental Health Resources and Support



Our promise to you:

Joining AdventHealth is about being part of something bigger. It’s about belonging to a community that believes in the wholeness of each person, and serves to uplift others in body, mind and spirit. AdventHealth is a place where you can thrive professionally, and grow spiritually, by Extending the Healing Ministry of Christ. Where you will be valued for who you are and the unique experiences you bring to our purpose-minded team. All while understanding that together we are even better.

Schedule: Full Time

Shift: Monday - Friday

Location: 893 Hope Way Altamonte Springs, FL 32714

The role you’ll contribute:

The HRIS Analyst Intermediate part of the HRIS team supporting multiple HR applications and technologies for Shared Services, HR Centers of Expertise, HR Business Partners and employees and managers at our Hospitals.

The Analyst works under the direction of the iSynergy HR Manager/Senior Manager and is responsible for completing HRIS related activities including but not limited to; system configuration, data conversion, functional specifications, program and system quality testing, go-live and post go-live implementation support.

The incumbent is responsible for supporting the integrity, effectiveness and efficiency of services related to the HRMS. The HRIS Analyst- Intermediate may be assigned cases needing resolution within the HR Help Desk (HRHD), as well as, perform testing in partnership with the Deployment, IT and Security teams.

The HRIS Analyst Intermediate is expected to take leadership on initiatives within the project and have the ability to prioritize, manage and execute work meeting all deadlines.




The value you’ll bring to the team:

Support all robotics processes and applications used by AdventHealth.
Responsible for timely management of HR Help Desk cases and project tracking.
Work as assigned with IT on break/fix issues and new development.
Ability to multitask, prioritize and meet deadlines while maintaining attention to detail and quality work.
Collaborate with other HR teams to stay updated on processes and identify new areas for robotics implementation.
Research new robotics process automation trends and provide recommendations to leadership.
Working knowledge of process improvement and process automation using RPA and intelligence tools.
Develop training and reference documentation surrounding Power Automate and other related tools.
Qualifications


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

Bachelor's Degree in related field required (or equivalent job related experience may be considered, if enrolled and on course to complete Bachelor’s degree).
2-4 years of experience related to HR/PR, preferably in Healthcare.
Business Analyst experience required
Minimum 3 years of experience in HR application support (HR Systems, Time and Attendance Systems, or Reporting and Analytics) or equivalent experience.
Basic system/application/data troubleshooting
Critical thinking and root cause analysis process
Advance Microsoft Office Skills, particularly in Excel
Specialized HRIS skills which includes application configuration and system support, troubleshooting, and report/query running.



KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS PREFERRED:

Previous project/process design or improvement analysis skills preferred.
Prefer knowledge/skills in any combination of the following:

§ Taleo (or other applicant tracking related application)

§ Oracle PeopleSoft (or other related ERP)

§ WorkForce Software (or other Time and Attendance/Labor related applications)

§ Experience with Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE)

§ SQL, Business Objects (BO) and/or Crystal Reports

§ System Testing/Data Modeling Applications

Primary Responsibilities: The function has as objective to provide support to and execute the demands from the clients, resolving all incidents (requests) received by the area, also support other areas of the Bank and Broker Dealer, manage and completion of maintenances on information related to new and existing customers and accounts. Includes the following but is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, performance standards or requirement efforts, skills, or working conditions associated with the job.

Process all maintenance for new/existing clients such as personal information, account title, types, adjustments among other maintenance requests for the bank and Pershing.
Open new CIF for clients as requested by different areas of the bank and Pershing.
Reviews and Update W-8 forms to certify accounts for avoid withholding.

Support and coordinate inquiries and investigations.
Open and close Certificate of Deposits for new and existing clients
Process manual interest input on CDs when needed.
Reconcile different G/Ls and Account concentrations that are used for internal processes.
Investigate and process unposted items to correct accounts.
Receives customers’ requests by 360 CRM and analyzes these requests to provides solution or additional information.

Signature Verification on all client’s requests
Complete Exception Item Processing (EIP) including NSF, Chargeback, and review of Checks, incoming and outgoing return items.
Scanning of client’s file and allocation of documents to the imaging system (Synergy)
Perform audits confirmation.
Support department employees on their daily work and projects
Support Audit and Regulators demands.

Flexible Schedule that may require to do overtime.

Language Skills: Speak, read, and write English and (Spanish for the LATAM market or Portuguese for the Brazil market).

You could be the one who changes everything for our 28 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.


*Applicants for this job have the flexibility to work remote from home anywhere in the Continental United States*

Position Purpose: The Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) team is responsible for all aspects of ERM and Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) coordination and reporting for Centene Corporate and all subsidiaries. The ERM Analyst position is responsible for identifying, assessing, monitoring, and reporting complex risks, applying knowledge of risk management techniques and is also responsible for supporting ESG and sustainability initiatives. This position partners with multiple business units and/or functional areas to assist with gathering, analyzing, and documenting ERM and ESG data.

Support strategies to improve the company’s ESG ratings and propose actionable plans with appropriate measures to track results and integrate them into company business processes.
Provide input and support Risk Program implementations, management, and oversight including ERM risk analysis, risk assessments, risk education, monitoring, remediation, and reporting.
Analyze ERM data to identify trends and material enterprise-wide risk issues. Identify key risks and mitigating factors and conduct statistical analyses to quantify and assess risk.
Research, benchmark, and evaluate ESG initiatives, guidance, regulations, and standards and identify potential emerging sustainability issues.
Work with multiple business units to gather risk and sustainability-related data from internal and external resources.
Maintain a repository of ERM and sustainability performance metrics and generate reports illustrating data, text, and graphics.
Education/Experience: Bachelor’s degree in Finance/Accounting, Health Administration, Business Administration, Statistics, or related analytical field. 3+ years of related experience with a focus on risk management, data analysis, data modeling, relational databases, and project management. Experience on large projects involving risk, business, or financial analysis with a large company preferred. Previous responsibility for cross-functional business analysis preferred.

License/Certification:
Preferred certifications include:

Certified Risk and Compliance Management Professional (CRCMP)
Certified Risk Management Professional (CRMP)
Governance, Risk and Compliance Professional (GRCP)
Certified Public Accountant (CPA)
Certified Internal Auditor (CIA)
Six Sigma


Our Comprehensive Benefits Package: Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.


Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Pricing Analyst

Southern Home Services is a leading provider of essential maintenance, repair, replacement, and new installation for residential and commercial heating, ventilation, and air conditioning (HVAC), Plumbing, and Electrical services. Southern Home Services is rapidly growing, doubling in size over the last 12 months. Currently the company employs 1200+ employees and serves over 600,000 homeowners in eight states across the South and Midwest US.

Job Description

The Pricing Analyst is a key resource to provide pricing solutions to Southern Home Services branches through directly impacting the company price books to ensure sales growth optimization and margin achievement. The pricing analyst uses information, resources regarding customer needs, historical data, market conditions, and internal margin/revenue targets to support the operating businesses with regular review and update of pricing.

Responsibilities

Support the improvement in gross margin dollars by identifying pricing actions that encourage higher sale values, conversion rates, margin rates, and customer satisfaction
Monitor input costing changes and develop sensitivity analysis thresholds to provide reporting on potential price changes to implement
Present pricing analysis to Operations and Financial executives, with insights, trends, and suggestions
Communicate and help implement pricing changes
Lead pricing-related projects including establishing timelines, defining deliverables, and drafting communications or presentations

Skills and Requirements

Bachelor’s degree in finance, operations, research, statistics, math, economics, or related analytical discipline preferred
Financial management experience with planning, forecasting, and business analysis
Experience within trades related industries – HVAC, Plumbing, Electrical, etc.
Work cross-functionally throughout the organization to drive analysis-driven change
Demonstrates complex problem resolution proficiency and the ability to identify/implement process and system enhancements
Proficiency with analytical and presentation tools
In-depth knowledge of BI tools and practical experience analyzing data, program metrics, and performance

Southern Home Services is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.

The policy applies to all employment practices within our organization.

Description:


SKUx is a leading fintech innovator giving brands and retailers the ability to deliver secure, serialized, intuitive digital offers anywhere, anytime, at the speed of today’s consumer. An offer Powered by SKUx™ also can provide first party consumer data throughout their offer journey, providing brands, retailers, and agencies the ability to develop personalized connections and retargeting with consumers. We make campaigns simple and customizable for the ultimate control over our customer’s direct spend, offering complete trust and transparency.

We’re planning for growth and continued innovation, and it’s an exciting time to join. If the below sounds like you and the kind of journey you’re seeking, we want to hear from you!

What You’ll Do

The Product Analyst is responsible for conducting product and user research as well as analyzing related data to support the product development process for the SKUx Instant Payment product line. The Product Analyst will support the product management team by conducting market research, gathering quantitative product data, and analyzing customer research to ensure SKUx products are reaching the right audiences and meeting both user and business needs.

The Day-to-Day:

Perform user research to understand specific audience needs
Develop metrics from research to track product goals during development
Interpret market research data to gauge market needs and compare competitor products
Monitor the market, competitor activities, as well as any price movements and make recommendations to support key decision making
Partner with Technology and Product Managers to dissect requirements and understand risks and dependencies
Monitor product performance (adoption, sales, etc.) and identify patterns and trends that indicate how well products perform
Gather and analyze customer feedback to understand customer perception of products, provide findings to product team to inform product decisions
Communicate findings and recommendations with product team and stakeholders
Requirements:

What Supports Success in the Role

Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, mathematics, or a similar field
One or more years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, or similar roles
Ability to conduct product analysis and user research
Familiarity with the digital payments and loyalty industries a plus
Experience with project management and product development life cycles
Expertise in data, market, and user analysis tools and techniques
Knowledge of customer survey tools and best practices
Knowledge and use of data visualization tools (Microsoft PowerPoint, Tableau)
Ability to lead multiple projects in various phases of conceptualization, execution, or delivery
Critical thinking and the ability to extract relevant information and prioritize
Highly refined interpersonal skills and professionalism
Self-motivated with critical attention to detail, deadlines, and reporting
Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships at all levels in the company and with customers
Working knowledge of Jira, Productboard, Miro, Figma, and Confluence preferred
Experience working in a startup, environment, highly preferred but not required


Why You'll Love Working Here

Full suite of benefits with eligibility on day 1 of employment
Paid Time Off – take time when you need it, it’s highly encouraged and supported, and we don’t track time
First week of employment is actually a week of paid time off courtesy of SKUx
Paid Holidays – up to 9 days
Free Parking when working at St. Petersburg Office
Hybrid work environment that blends schedule flexibility and valued colleague collaboration


Our SKUx Values

Teamwork: Unabashedly focused on a common goal, with high respect and engagement, empowered to deliver exceptional results. Dedicated to engaging with partners and empowering our teams to deliver exceptional results.
Transparency: To each other, our clients and in our products. We deliver transparency and live by the highest ethical standards.
Trust: We operate with integrity and are accountable to SKUx, to each other, and to our partners. We do what we say and say what we do.
Technology: Our technology democratizes digital incentives in service of the consumer. Entrepreneurship and education is in our DNA, thus we develop and optimize forward-thinking technologies to better fulfill customer needs.


More About Us

SKUx provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment. With diverse backgrounds, experiences, and knowledge, our employees make us who we are. We recognize the power of individuality and encourage respect and dignity within our SKUx team. When we come together and work collaboratively, we achieve outstanding results internally and externally for our customers.

Job Title: Business Systems Analyst- Student Success Platforms
Job Description:
Make a difference at one of Florida’s premier institutions for education in science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Florida Polytechnic University, ranked the No. 1 public college in the region by U.S. News and World Report, offers a unique working environment that encourages faculty and staff to be part of a culture that prizes collaboration, innovation, and the willingness to go above and beyond to ensure our students and University succeed. Florida Poly offers a small campus academic environment where students form connections with their faculty and peers as they pursue high-value degrees in engineering and applied sciences.
The University is equipped with cutting-edge facilities and equipment and two award-winning, architecturally distinct academic buildings. Its evolving curriculum, designed to meet the needs of industry and provide a life-long educational foundation for students, has helped the institution grow in prominence since its opening in 2014. Florida Poly’s deliberately small classes, affordability, and outstanding graduate outcomes have helped it earn
recognitions
such as being named a top value school, in the top 25 nationally for affordability, and in the top five best universities in the South for tech students. Accredited by ABET and SACSCOC, Florida Poly is educating some of the brightest minds in Florida and attracting standout talent from across the nation.

JOB TITLE


Business Systems Analyst- Student Success Platforms

JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY


The Business Systems Analyst is responsible for the Workday application business-system support, data security relating to role-based security administration and configuration support in the ERP environment. This position reports to the Director, Solutions Delivery. The Business Systems Analyst understands the customer’s business requirements and business process management, and interacts with staff in IT Services, human resources, procurement, payroll, grants, campus development, finance and accounting, auxiliary operations and some student support areas.

JOB DESCRIPTION

ABOUT FLORIDA POLY:
Make a difference at one of Florida’s premier institutions for education in science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Florida Polytechnic University, ranked the No. 1 public college in the region by U.S. News and World Report, offers a unique working environment that encourages faculty and staff to be part of a culture that prizes collaboration, innovation, and the willingness to go above and beyond to ensure our students and University succeed. Florida Poly offers a small campus academic environment where students form connections with their faculty and peers as they pursue high-value degrees in engineering and applied sciences. The University is equipped with cutting-edge facilities and equipment, and two award-winning, architecturally distinct academic buildings. Its evolving curriculum, designed to meet the needs of industry and provide a life-long educational foundation for students, has helped the institution grow in prominence since its opening in 2014. Florida Poly’s deliberately small classes, affordability, and outstanding graduate outcomes have helped it earn
recognitions
such as being named a top value school, in the top 25 nationally for affordability, and in the top five best universities in the South for tech students. Accredited by ABET and SACSCOC, Florida Poly is educating some of the brightest minds in Florida and attracting standout talent from across the nation.
ABOUT FLORIDA POLY INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY SERVICES:
The Information Technology Services (ITS) division at Florida Poly pursues the vision of enabling Florida Poly to be a leader among STEM institutions in the innovative use of information technology to transform teaching and learning, empower research, improve the student experience and student success, enable date-driven management and decision-making, and effectively conduct University operations and services. Our teams are staffed by energetic professionals who pursue service excellence, seek innovation and continuous improvement, and operate effectively in a highly collaborative environment. We are in the midst of a major transformation of IT infrastructures, architectures, and service delivery models at Florida Poly in support of the University’s new five-year strategic plan. Our strategic initiatives include business systems modernization, IT service management, business process management, next-generation network services, cybersecurity automation, data ware and business intelligence, and cloud migration.
Reporting to the Vice President and CIO, ITS is organized into seven teams including Academic Technology, IT Support Services, Networking, IT Security, Platforms and Systems Engineering, DevOps (including both data engineering and application engineering), and IT Solutions Delivery.
SUMMARY OF POSITION:
As highly collaborative members of the Solutions Delivery Team in Information Technology Services, Business Systems Analysts work with client departments in assigned business domains to design, refine, and continuously improve business processes that are automated using the University’s business information systems and other digital platforms. This work involves expert application of service design, process design, process management, change control, and maintenance of a comprehensive business process library. The Analysts further work with clients and – as needed – with solution architects, application engineers, and platform administrators to implement these new or revised processes in business systems. The Analysts help test and validate the results of implemented processes and workflows. The Analysts also use in-depth knowledge of the data models and business rules implemented in systems to help clients produce reports, analytics, and other business information displays. The Analysts also work with documentation and training specialists to design training and knowledge sharing programs to educate colleagues on key elements of, and changes to, systems and processes.
Business Systems Analyst – Student Success Systems
The Business Systems Analyst for Student Success Systems works with the University’s Ellucian Banner ERP platform and related academic advising systems, student client relationship management (CRM) platforms, and other student success systems. The Analyst assists a variety of Academic Affairs departments, including Registrar, Student Success, Student Affairs, Career Services, and specific academic disciplines, in making the best use of these platforms to improve student academic success and student services and engagement. The Analyst serves as a subject matter expert in the areas of Banner, DegreeWorks, and CRM Advise platforms functionality (as well as other related systems).
Additional preferred qualifications:
Experience with Ellucian Banner and related systems.
Experience in student advising and student success services.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Review, analysis, evaluation of processes, gathering of system requirements and end-user needs, and business requirements gathering for responsible systems. Document functional and technical requirements, process workflows, and any other results of business analysis and obtain sign-off from primary process owners.
Work as part of the ITS Solutions Delivery Team to deliver high-quality digital business solutions. Help maintain the business process library. Work with the Documentation & Training Specialist to meet client support needs for documentation and training.
Prepare and organize testing such as functional testing and user acceptance testing.
Foster inter-department relationships that emphasize collaboration, delivery, and process improvements. Work effectively with all areas of the University including other systems/business analysts and project managers on joint projects as necessary.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:
Ability to work with clients to solve problems, provide guidance, and enhance their ability to use functional modules in business system platforms such as Workday or Ellucian Banner ERP.
Proven ability to learn new technologies quickly and manage change efficiently, proactively and in a positive manner. Excellent communication and collaboration skills both verbal and written.
Ability to work both independently and in a highly collaborative environment.
Proven skill in completing assignments accurately and with attention to detail.
Ability to organize and prioritize work under pressure while meeting deadlines.
Commitment to consistently delivering excellent customer service and support.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field and two years of direct experience in business systems analysis or an equivalent combination of experience and education.
In lieu of a degree, any appropriate combination of relevant education, experience, and/or certifications may be considered.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Higher education experience.
Master’s degree in a relevant field.
REQUIRED LICENSES, CERTIFICATIONS, AND/OR OTHER SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS OF LAW:
Must possess a valid driver’s license.
This position requires a criminal background check, which may include a Level II screening as required by Florida Statute §435.04.
This position is subject to federal and state privacy regulations.
NORMAL WORK SCHEDULE: This position is salary exempt. The normal work schedule is Monday – Friday, 8:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m., however, occasional overtime (weekends and evenings) may be required. Travel between campus locations may be required.
TARGET HIRING SALARY: $80,000 - $85,000, commensurate with experience and subject domain/platform.
APPLICATION DEADLINE DATE: These positions are open until filled; however, the review of applications will commence immediately.
APPLICATION PROCESS: In addition to completing the online application, all Applicants are required to upload the following as an attachment to the application (preferably in PDF format):
Cover Letter
Resume
Contact information for three professional references
LinkedIn URL
ADDITIONAL INFORMATION TO APPLICANTS:
This role will be primarily based at the main Florida Polytechnic University campus in North Lakeland, but also has periodic duties on the Poly South campus, which is physically located on the Lakeland campus of Polk State College.
This role may include a hybrid schedule of 3 days in the office (Wednesday required), and 2 days remote.
DIVERSITY STATEMENT:
Florida Polytechnic University is an equal opportunity/equal access institution. It is the policy of the Board of Trustees to provide equal opportunity for employment and educational opportunities to all (including applicants for employment, employees, applicants for admission, students, and others affiliated with the University) without regard to race, color, national origin, ethnicity, sex, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status or genetic information.
Employment is contingent upon eligibility to work in the US. An appointment is not final until proof is provided.

health benefits

Required attachments are listed on each posting. Please be sure to attach all required documents in the Resume/CV field before continuing through the application. Once your application has been submitted, no changes may be made and additional attachments will not be considered.

An unofficial copy of the degree/transcript is acceptable during the application process. For positions requiring a degree, the official transcripts are required upon hire.

This position requires a background check, which may include a level II screening as required by the Florida Statute §435.04.

Position Location:

Orlando, FL - This is a hybrid position that requires at least two in person days a month.

Position Purpose

This position is fundamental to ensuring the accuracy and timeliness of their assigned retail affiliations’ reporting, stock balance, cycle time, flow through ratio and all customer resolution needs. The analyst will proactively work account health year-round while taking ownership of the audit process from cradle to grave and all relative SLA’s and defined metrics for an assigned set of affiliations. The execution of tasks will result in a reduction in costs, improved asset controls, NPS score improvements over the assigned account base, loss negotiations, and process improvements internally and externally. In addition, focus areas include asset controls, customer adherence to stock take date approvals and customer collaboration with stock take date project.

Major/Key Accountabilities

Proactive account health by taking the lead on identifying, correcting and resolving account health issues for assigned retail customers that include but not limited to: stock balance issues, inbound and outbound reporting/Portfolio issues, and providing timely feedback to customer.
Responsible for scheduling of audit dates, execution of entire audit process with guidance from Project Manager, reconciliation of physical count/stock balance variations, and tasked with assisting sales to finalize and close out the audit in a timely manner.
Resolves Customer issues that impact their audit result through utilization of independent research, customer assistance or working cross-functionally with field or in-house teams to ensure timely resolution.
Develop working strategy for each assigned affiliation based on needs and past history to drive process improvements internally and at the customer level.
Partner with Sales, Field Team, Stock Management and all relative teams to collaboratively improve work flow, customer engagement, and perform root cause analysis that will ultimately minimize the loss of assets, improve velocity and decrease damage.
Work proactive account health; maintain direct contact with assigned customer base to resolve outstanding account issues and account health maintenance from cradle to grave.
Facilitate and drive customer engagements on transactions during stock take date project.
Works to complete ad hoc assignments as directed by Manager.
Autonomous Account management issue resolution.

Measures

Issue resolution metrics
YoY loss/surplus reduction for assigned affiliations
NPS improvement with assigned affiliations
Improved asset productivity metrics for assigned affiliations

Authority/ Decision Making

Customer issue resolution
Transaction correction and reversals
Customer training needs
Bulk transfer review, creation and submission
Customer Interaction
Growth opportunity discovery, loss negotiations

Challenges

Frustrated customer issue resolutions
Multi-tasking and competing priorities
Working with dispersed field-based teams
Working across time zones and cultures
Cross functional communication in Orlando Operations Centre
Conflicting KPI’s with other work groups
Authority matrix approvals

Key contacts

Sales, Field team, Transaction Controls, Logistics, Customer Operations, Contracts, Stock Management.

All CHEP Customer Affiliations that have been assigned, WIS (Third Party Counters)

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in business or related field, or equivalent job experience
Desired Qualifications: MBA

Experience

3-5 years CHEP experience in Sales or Customer Operations
3-5 years account management or customer service experience
Analytical / Problem Solving / Trend analysis
Strong Negotiation and Excel skills
Working knowledge of CHEP Invoicing / Transaction Management
Bulk Transfers, Audit Adjustments, Declaration Processing

Skills and Knowledge

Technical User of Business Analytics, SAP, Siebel, MyCHEP, BlueView, Salesforce
Strong understanding of retail supply chains
Strong organizational, communication and problem-solving skills
Control / Risk Assessment Expertise
Complex problem-solving skills coupled with excellent interpersonal skills
Ability to multi-task and effectively prioritize in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Ability to work independently and as a self-starter

Essential Job Functions:
1. Consults with management to ensure agreement on system principles.
2. Consults with customers about software system design and maintenance.
3. Analyzes user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints.
4. Confers with systems analysts, engineers, programmers and others to design system and to obtain information on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements and interfaces.
5. Analyzes information to determine, recommend, and plan computer specifications and layouts, and peripheral equipment modifications.
6. Assesses the usefulness of pre-developed application packages and adapts them to a user environment.
7. Designs, develops and modifies software systems, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design.
8. Modifies existing software to correct errors, allow it to adapt to new hardware, or to improve its performance.
9. Stores, retrieves, and manipulates data for analysis of system capabilities and requirements.
10. Prepares detailed workflow charts and diagrams that describe input, output, and logical operation, and converts them into a series of instructions coded in a computer language.
11. Compiles and writes documentation of program development and subsequent revisions, inserting comments in the coded instructions so others can understand the program.
12. Conducts unit testing of programs and software applications to be sure they will produce the desired information and that the instructions are correct.
13. Corrects errors by making appropriate changes and rechecking the program to ensure that the desired results are produced.
14. Performs or directs revision, repair, or expansion of existing programs to increase operating efficiency or adapt to new requirements.
15. Writes or contributes to instructions or manuals to guide end users.
16. Develops software system testing and validation procedures, programming, and documentation.
17. Coordinates software system installation and monitors equipment functioning to ensure specifications are met.
18. Trains users to use new or modified software.
19. Reads manuals, periodicals, web content, and/or technical reports to learn how to develop programs that meet staff and user requirements.
20. Serves as trainer and mentor for junior employees.
21. Ensures compliance with University policies and procedures; county, state, federal, and international regulations; professional association guidelines; and accreditation requirements.
22. Completes special projects as assigned.
23. Performs other duties as assigned or required.


Marginal Job Functions:


Required Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:
Knowledge:
1. Computers and Electronics - General knowledge of electronic equipment, and computer hardware and software, including applications and programming.
2. Engineering and Technology - General knowledge of the practical application of engineering science and technology. This includes applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services.
3. English Language - Working knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition, and grammar.
4. Mathematics - General knowledge of arithmetic, algebra, geometry, calculus, and/or statistics, and their applications.
5. Design - General knowledge of design techniques, tools, and principles.
6. Customer and Personal Service - General knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of user satisfaction.

Skills:
1. Programming - Proficient skills in writing computer programs for various purposes.
2. Systems Analysis - Proficient skills in determining how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes.
3. Systems Evaluation - Proficient skills in identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the system.
4. Judgment and Decision Making - Proficient skills in considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the appropriate one.
5. Complex Problem Solving - Proficient skills in identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.
6. Critical Thinking - Proficient skills in using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems.
7. Operations Analysis - Proficient skills in analyzing needs and product requirements to create a design.
8. Quality Control Analysis - Proficient skills in conducting tests and inspections of products, services, or processes to evaluate quality or performance.

Abilities:
1. Deductive Reasoning - The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.
2. Inductive Reasoning - The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (including finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events).
3. Problem Sensitivity - The ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It does not involve solving the problem, only recognizing there is a problem.
4. Information Ordering - The ability to arrange things or actions in a certain order or pattern according to a specific rule or set of rules (e.g., patterns of numbers, letters, words, pictures, mathematical operations).
5. Mathematical Reasoning - The ability to choose the right mathematical methods or formulas to solve a problem.

Physical Requirements:
1. Speech Recognition - Must be able to identify and understand the speech of another person.
2. Speech Clarity - Must be able to speak clearly so others can understand you.
3. Must be available to work on call 24 hours per day, 7 days per week to handle emergencies.
4. Travel - Must be able to travel on a daily and/or overnight basis.
5. May be required to work nights or weekends.

Job Title: Cruise line Revenue Analyst Business Strategy
Job Description:
Cruise line Revenue Analyst Business Strategy

Job Description

We are seeking an Onboard Revenue Business Strategy Analyst who will be responsible for supporting the design, development, and implementation of analytics and reporting that assist the business in achieving strategic objectives and increasing productivity. Collaborates across business areas including Guest commerce, Guest operations, Decision Support, and IT to achieve desired results.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Performs qualitative and quantitative analysis to support key strategic objectives, including: (1) improving portfolio revenue, inventory, and promotions to maximize revenue.
Support Manager and Director with bandwidth allocation requirements for ships based on projected occupancy by developing an internet demand forecasting model
Identifies insights/opportunities/risks with supporting trends and/or cost-benefit analysis
Develops strategy for frontline incentives, target setting and crew compensation, including payout preparation, ship bonus segmentation, among others
Supports shore excursion allocation strategy in optimizing/automating the current process, and creating tools that will give visibility to the shoreside team, tour operators, and shipboard team
Develops methods, procedures, reports, and databases to track and maintain data for analytics
Develops appropriate tools to improve business management, decision making and add more visibility to trends and underlying root causes

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Economics, Mathematics, Statistics, Business Analytics, Finance preferred or related field.
2+ years of related analytical experience
Advanced proficiency in MS Office Suite applications with a focus in Excel.
Proficiency in analytical tools PowerBI and/or Tableau. Working knowledge of database structure.
Ability to focus on and take ownership for results (i.e., quality, deadlines, goal-setting, and process improvement
Must have strong critical thinking, problem resolution, organizational, and communication skills.
Ability to analyze results to help make informed decisions.
Self-starter with a strong sense of urgency in tackling challenges. High level of professionalism.
Ability to work calmly in difficult and high-pressure situations.
Excellent analytical, problem solving, administrative, multi-tasking, and prioritization skills.
Ability to work efficiently, independently and cohesively to consistently produce quality results.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Ability to work effectively in a team-based environment and provide support as needed. Statistical modelling experience/knowledge.
Bachelors Degree preferred
