Closing Date: Until Filled

Location: 4305 East 21st Ave., Tampa, FL 33605

Salary Range: $55,458.24 - 64,250.40

POSITION PURPOSE:

This position is responsible for the management of departmental report development and implementation. Collects and analyzes data, reports results, and presents in written and graphical formats. The Operations Analyst plays a vital role within the Operations Department, encompassing various areas such as bus operations, van operations, the operations control center, the customer service call center and the paratransit eligibility team. This position is responsible for overseeing and collecting data, with a primary focus on analyzing operations and call center data to generate meaningful insights. The Operations Analyst will leverage their analytical skills to create comprehensive dashboards that effectively display trends and performance indicators. Additionally, the Operations Analyst regularly meets with department managers and stakeholders to discuss data-driven findings, share insights, and collaborate on improvement initiatives. By providing valuable analyses and strategic guidance, the Operations Analyst contributes significantly to optimizing operations and facilitating informed decision-making within the Operations Department. Manages project oversight and coordination of ongoing goals and objectives throughout the operations department. Performs policy research and implementation using analytical, writing, and organizational skills. Writes, maintains, and supports a variety of reports of queries utilizing appropriate reporting tools. This position will have oversight of updating and maintaining department Standard Operating Procedures to be compliant with revision criterion.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Prepare statistical reports, graphs, spreadsheets, and forecasts identifying specific performance metrics and trend analysis.
Conduct data analysis to identify trends and potential problem areas or adverse trends and recommend opportunities for improvements.
Participate in industry related meetings, workshops, seminars, and conferences [as necessary] for the purpose of increasing self-education, gathering information, conveying information, networking, developing contacts, and representing the various divisions within Operations.
Meet with key personnel to define and understand reporting needs, providing recommendations based on statistical analysis.
Offer recommendations and assist in developing strategies to improve operations and efficiencies within the Operations department.
Perform statistical research and develop reports from various software used within the organization.
Track overall service key performance indicators (KPIs).
Develop and maintain departmental dashboards, including Customer Service Call Center, Bus Operations, Van Operations, and the Operations Control Center.
Ensure data integrity by running queries and analyzing data.
Develop internal process controls to remain in compliance with various reporting requirements.
Collect data from multiple software systems (such as Trapeze, Cisco Finesse, SeeClickFix) to generate trend and need analysis.
Test software for operations and determine effectiveness.
Develop departmental reporting for communication of transactional, statistical, and historical activities related to the Transportation Department's activities.
Study existing data to evaluate current effectiveness and develop new or modify existing applications and databases to streamline production and increase efficiency.
Assist with the preparation of annual budgets.
Act as an interdepartmental liaison.
Compile, monitor, and prepare various operational and statistical data related to performance tracking, benchmarking, and scorecard tracking for different divisions within Operations.
Audit daily database input to ensure accuracy and quality of information.
Monitor trends and forecast requirements based on data-driven forecast models.
Perform a variety of administrative tasks related to vacation bids, payroll, shift bids, etc., as required by collective bargaining agreements.
Maintain confidentiality and integrity while providing excellent internal and external.
Monitors and ensures all established operating procedures, work rules, and contractual provisions are properly followed.
Reviews attendance records, miss-out records, operator extra board records and operator pay claim inquiries ensuring compliance with work rules and contractual provisions.
Prepare and maintain a library of standard operating procedures, work instruction documents, workflow charts, process maps, and diagrams to specify in detail current business processes.
Fulfill daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting requirements by developing queries and reports from data systems using Trapeze, home-grown databases, SQL, MS Access, Crystal Reports, or other appropriate software.
Tracks overall service key performance indicators (KPIs) for transportation
Oversees the revision and update of Standard Operating Procedures

MARGINAL FUNCTIONS:

Performs other work-related duties, special projects, assignments, or tasks as assigned by the Director of Transportation.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:

This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

REQUIREMENTS:

Education and Experience:

Bachelor's Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics.
Minimum of three (3) years' experience performing business analysis, complex report building and data analysis; for example, as Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst. Strong experience graphing data in order to display statistical data and trends.
An equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered in lieu of the above requirements.
Experience utilizing – with high proficiency – Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Word, including V-Lookups, Pivot Tables, Math Functions, Linking, and Conditional Formatting.

Machines, Tools, & Equipment Used:

Ability to operate small office equipment, including copy machines or multi-line telephone systems, as well as a computer for both data entry, word processing, and/or accounting purposes.

Licenses/Certifications:

Valid Florida Driver's License or be able to obtain one within in 10 days of hire of moving to the State of Florida.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Knowledge of: Business operations analysis, trending and forecasting, math including fractions, percentages, and ratios. General office practices and administrative procedures. Excellent business writing skills including grammar, spelling, punctuation, and composition. Establishment and maintenance of record-keeping systems and procedures. Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques. Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (e.g. - Excel, SPSS, SAS etc.)
Intermediate to advanced use of MS Excel, Word, Outlook, Access, and PowerPoint. Statistical data analysis skills. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Interpersonal, customer service, and listening skills. Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.
Abilities: Create accurate and visually effective spreadsheets, reports, and graphs which represent complex information in a clear way. Conduct research, analyze findings, and prepare clear and concise reports and recommendations. Establish and maintain effective working relationships with all levels of employees; maintain confidential information; prioritize work based on the ongoing demands of the department; prepare clear, concise and complete reports and correspondence; exercise initiative and work independently; operate a variety of office equipment and machines. Follow written and oral instructions. Demonstrate integrity, ingenuity, and inventiveness in the performance of assigned tasks.
Strong analytical skills to perform statistical research, analyze data, and identify trends.
Proficiency in using software applications such as Trapeze, Cisco Finesse, relational databases, SQL, MS Access, Crystal Reports, etc.
Ability to develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs).
Knowledge of operations and processes within a public transit agency or similar industry.
Excellent problem-solving skills to identify operational issues and develop effective solutions.
Strong attention to detail to ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills to collaborate with key personnel, vendors, and departmental teams.
Proficiency in data analysis and interpretation using statistical techniques.
Familiarity with standard operating procedures and work rules in a transportation environment.
Knowledge of budgeting processes and ability to assist in the preparation of annual budgets.
Ability to work effectively as an interdepartmental liaison, coordinating with various teams and departments.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) for report writing, data analysis, and presentations.
Knowledge of database management and query development to extract, analyze, and share data.
Familiarity with CAD/AVL systems for importing and managing transportation data.
Ability to work with confidential information and maintain confidentiality and integrity.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills to work with different functional teams and stakeholders.
Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
Knowledge of industry best practices and willingness to stay updated with industry trends and developments.

Work is performed in a standard office environment.
Ability to hear, see, speak, and perceive color, depth and texture.

Job Title: Technical Business Analyst, Healthcare Eligibility Solutions
Job Description:
ABOUT PERFORMANT:
At Performant, we’re focused on helping our clients achieve their goals by providing technology-enabled services which identify improper payments and recoup or prevent losses due to errant billing practices. We are the premier independent healthcare payment integrity company in the US and a leader across several markets, including Medicare, Medicaid, and Commercial Healthcare. Through this important work we accomplish our mission: To offer innovative payment accuracy solutions that allow our clients to focus on what matter most – quality of care and healthier lives for all.
If you are seeking an employer who values People, Innovation, Integrity, Fun, and fostering an Ownership Culture – then Performant is the place for you!
ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY:
Hiring Range: $72,400-$102,000
We are seeking a Technical Business Analyst to work in our Healthcare Eligibility Team. This position requires a detail-oriented team player to capture user-stories, translate business requirements into functional and/or technical requirements, and create process flows and other similar diagrams. This position will actively support new client implementations and existing programs.
Key Responsibilities:
Capture the requirements from the discussion with business stakeholders and document them effectively for development team’s consumption.
Document existing processes and upcoming new processes which will be used as requirements and future training materials.
Create and design documentation including, current and future business processes flow diagrams, functional and non-functional requirements, use cases, business rules and other information or processes as required.
Develop SQL queries, analyze and test results to ensure positive outcomes.
Analyze business-specific questions and communicate them to developers in easy-to-understand written format.
Translate developer requests and communicate with business.
Conducts a variety of data analysis for intelligent insights using subject matter knowledge, independent judgement, and analytical expertise.
Follows and complies with company, departmental and client program policies, processes, and procedures.
Responsible for utilizing resources to ensure compliance with client requirements, HIPAA, as well as applicable federal or state regulations.
Successfully completes, retains, applies, and adheres to content in required training as assigned.
Completes required processes to obtain client required clearances as well as company regular background and/or drug screening; and successfully passes and/or obtains and maintains clearances statuses as a condition of employment. (Note: client/government clearance requirements are not determined or decisioned by Performant.)
Demonstrates Performant core values in performance of job duties and all interactions.
Correct areas of deficiency and oversight received from quality reviews and/or management.
Operates under minimal supervisor to deliver results aligned with business goals, given guidance in the form of high-level objectives.
Telework in adherence with Company policies and requirements.
Other duties and assignments as required to meet business needs.
Knowledge, Skill and Abilities Needed:
Strong experience on documenting process flows, data flows, functional requirements, user stories and knowledge repository.
Advanced skills in Excel, Word, Visio and/or any other requirements documentation tools.
Proficient SQL skills to query and test
General knowledge of requirements gathering, ETL processing and data matching
Strong system skills with ability to quickly develop expertise in new systems and applications.
Familiarity with JIRA and Confluence
Knowledge of Medicaid / Medicare / Other TPL business models and products a plus.
Knowledge of EDI Transactions, including, but not limited to 270/271, 834, 277, 837, 835 a plus.
Able to work independently and meet deadlines with minimal supervision.
Strong problem solving and communication (written and oral) skills.
Ability to produce results and maintain positive attitude in fast paced, dynamic environment.
Self-motivated and thrives in a fast-paced business operations department performing multiple tasks cohesively, with keen attention to detail.
Completion of Teleworker Agreement upon hire, and adherence to the Agreement (and related policies and procedures) including, but not limited to: Able to navigate computer and phone systems as a user to work remote independently using on-line resources, must have high-speed internet connectivity, appropriate workspace able to be compliant with HIPAA, safety & ergonomics, confidentiality, and dedicated work focus without distractions during work hours.
Required and Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor degree in relevant field or equivalent combination of education and experience.
3+ years of experience working as a Business Analyst documenting existing and new systems.
WHAT WE OFFER:
Performant offers a wide range of benefits to help support a healthy work/life balance. These benefits include medical, dental, vision, disability coverage options, life insurance coverage, 401(k) savings plans, paid family/parental leave, 11 paid holidays per year, as well as sick time and vacation time off annually. For more information about our benefits package, please refer to our benefits page on our website or ask your Talent Acquisition contact during an interview.
Physical Requirements & Additional Notices:
If working in a hybrid or fully remote setting, access to reliable, secure high-speed Internet at your home office location is required. Proof of such may be required prior to an offer being made. It is the Employee’s responsibility to maintain this Internet access at their home office location.
The following is a general summary of the physical demands and requirements of an Office/Clerical/Professional or similar job, whether completed remotely at a home office or in a typical on-site professional office environment. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of requirements, as physical demands of each individual job may vary.
Regularly sits at a desk during scheduled shift, uses office phone or headset provided by the Company for phone calls, making outbound calls and answering inbound return calls using an office phone system; views a computer monitor, types on a keyboard and uses a computer mouse.

Position Overview

Job Title Tech Analyst

Overview

As the Tech Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and delivering significant components of engineering solutions to accomplish business goals efficiently and reliably. Your key responsibilities in this role include being an active participation in the design of their solution components and investigating re-use, and ensure that solutions are fit for purpose, reliable, maintainable, and can be integrated successfully into the overall solution and environment with clear, robust, and well tested deployments. You should have experience in IT change projects and varying project / program environments (waterfall, scrum/agile, etc.), working with business requirements through to system level functional specifications, in business analysis, data analytics or UX (user experience), using Structured Query Language (SQL) tools (preferably Oracle) to perform data analysis and test data preparation, in a financial domain (capital markets, transaction banking, and wealth management) and/or related support functions, and owning a product backlog, sprint planning, prioritizing stories and driving iteration content. You should have the ability to influence and motivate other team members and stakeholders through strong dialogue, facilitation, and persuasiveness.

What We Offer You

A diverse and inclusive environment that embraces change, innovation, and collaboration

A hybrid working model, allowing for in-office / work from home flexibility, generous vacation, personal and volunteer days

Employee Resource Groups support an inclusive workplace for everyone and promote community engagement

Competitive compensation packages including health and wellbeing benefits, retirement savings plans, parental leave, and family building benefits

Educational resources, matching gift, and volunteer programs

What You’ll Do

Will work closely within the areas of Investments: including Custody, Trust, Discretionary Portfolio Management, and Investment Advisory to ensure scope, requirements and solution are properly captured and features/solutions delivered on a timely basis

Deep knowledge of MS Office products

Excellent documentation skills, experience in Business requirement documents (BRD), Requirements and process flows

How You'll Lead

Work with various vendors to coordinate the orderly transition of the Investments related activities and various upstream and down-stream related activities, as well as understand the necessary integration with satellite systems (Client On-boarding, Case Management, On-line Digital channels etc., Shadowing etc.)

Coordinate and participate in Testing

Skills You’ll Need

IT Tools: Strong experience in Oracle, Control-M, Informatica, Expertise in Programming Languages (PL)/SQL and Informatica extract, transform, load (ETL) to address computational, complexity, and efficiency challenges.

Extensive Development experience with strong experience in Data Mapping, Data Migration, and Data Warehouse changes related to re-platforming project, and system integration projects with knowledge of Wealth Management and related investment products. Would be a plus, with knowledge in any of the Wealth Management products like TCS BaNCS, Triple A, Temenos Wealth Suite, Avaloq or Expersoft,

Knowledge of Data Warehouses/Data flows/transaction flows (TA), Agile methods (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban, etc.) and tools (Jira, TeamCity, GitHub, Confluence), trade flows on various instrument types: equities, fixed income, derivatives, CIF’s, Mutual Funds and related

Experience with development of IT systems (primarily Dimensional Data warehouse systems), Data modelling (TA),

Skills That Will Help You Excel

Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken with documentation/presentation skills

High degree of accuracy and attention to detail while being highly organized with ability to commit and prioritize work duties and tasks

Data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams

Be an excellent team worker, while self-motivated with ability to work in virtual teams and matrix/global organizations including appreciation of different cultures during collaborating and sharing

Well-developed analytical and problem-solving experience and ability to grasp new concepts, provide insights and solutions, while maintaining pace with technical innovation

Expectations

It is the Bank’s expectation that employees hired into this role will work in the Jacksonville office in accordance with the Bank’s hybrid working model.

Overview
Who We Are

For over 235 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world’s leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. BNY Mellon has approximately $16.5 billion in revenues and a 23% return on tangible common equity.

BNY Mellon is a leader in the world of investment services and investment management, and our businesses support the full range of stakeholders of the financial system including:
Managing the custody of approximately $37 trillion financial assets of the world’s leading institutional investors, hedge funds, sovereign wealth funds, and corporates
Investing approximately $2 trillion as one of the largest global asset managers across a wide range of asset classes
Providing collateral, liquidity, and funding for the world’s largest banks through our markets franchise
Serving family offices and high net worth individuals through our wealth management franchise
Providing a full suite of solutions to advisors, broker-dealers, family offices, hedge and '40 Act fund managers, registered investment advisor firms and wealth managers
Advising large global corporations on a range of trust and other solutions
Providing integrated managed data services to asset managers

What We Do

Collateral Operations Group Overview
The Collateral Operations group is a global team within the Global Operations & Technology division of BNY Mellon responsible for supporting our clients’ collateral and portfolio reconciliations processes. Our clients include pension funds, endowments, mutual funds, hedge funds and other financial institutions using derivatives to manage their financial risks. We provide processing, inquiry and general support for our clients while working to improve and automate transaction processing systems. We are a center of excellence maximizing specific knowledge around the collateralization of complex derivative products, including swaps, options, forwards, and futures.

Collateral Operations Analyst Role Overview
As a Collateral Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for providing the collateral and portfolio reconciliation support as outlined above to clients on a daily basis. Apart from the daily collateral activities, you will also partner with senior colleagues to identify, develop and implement process changes, and be actively involved in contributing to broader strategic team objectives.

Role-Specific Responsibilities
Performs exchange traded, cleared and bilateral reconciliations for derivative products traded by our clients.
Monitoring collateral calls from counterparties.
Facilitating margin dispute resolution between parties.
Verifying delivery of collateral to clients and brokers.
Applies expertise and judgement in providing quality, and complex client service and support to internal and external clients on a daily basis, including phone interaction, problem resolution, transaction processing, reconciliations and accounting services, and updates to client accounts in a timely manner.
Performs complex operational tasks in a product or functional area. Conducts independent analysis and policy interpretation. Performs complex, manual processing of updates to client accounts or company records. Responsible for reconciliations, including reconciling cash breaks, position differences, and gathering and compiling data.
Serves as the primary point of contact for clients and executes all correspondent requisites in a timely and accurate manner with an understanding of the underlying business and specific client needs.
Provides product knowledge and technical assistance, determining when the more complex problems should be referred to a supervisor or senior professional.
Review and check work of other Client Processing Support staff and help resolve escalated issues.
Responsible for the quality and completion of own work.

Standard Job Responsibilities
Works with external clients to resolve day-to-day issues and direct them to appropriate resources at BNY Mellon.
Works effectively with peers across geographic regions.
Supports clients in addressing operational and technical questions or issues and ensuring requests are executed.
Applies problem solving skills based on precedence and experience.
Uses communication skills to deliver high quality service to a specialized client base.
Provides clients information related to BNY Mellon products and services representing a limited number of lines of business and geographies and directs them to the appropriate resources, as needed.
Leverages a general understanding of broader BNY Mellon services and offerings.
Monitors client inquiries and appropriately escalates non-routine or complex issues to the appropriate team member, as needed.
Tracks and follows up on open items and activities to accurate completion.
Participates in internal activities and initiatives designed to improve the client experience.
Supports a selected number of client accounts of limited complexity.
Involvement in technology projects and enhancements related to our collateral infrastructure.
Contributing to on-going projects, testing and continuous process improvement.
Participates in the onboarding of new clients and new business.
No direct reports.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
Up to three (0-3) years of total work experience is preferred.
Experience in an operational area and/or client services is preferred.
Experience and knowledge in derivatives, reconciliations, brokerage, trade, settlements and cash processing are all skills transferrable to this role but not a barrier to entry as on-the-job product training will be available.
Process-mindset and an interest in solving complex problems, performing reconciliations, and finding ways to make processes better.
Interest in advancing technical knowledge specific to derivative and collateral product knowledge.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in high-pressure environment.

Employer Description:
For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments and safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. Make your mark: bnymellon.com/careers.

SUMMARY/OBJECTIVES

SouthState Bank is a nationally chartered bank that provides consumer, commercial, mortgage and wealth management solutions to more than one million customers throughout Florida, Alabama, Georgia, the Carolina’s, and Virginia. With its Correspondent Banking Division, the Bank serves clients coast to coast.

The Check Fraud Team is responsible for protecting the Bank and its customers from check fraud, minimizing check fraud losses, and supporting branches and bank personnel when check fraud occurs.

The Deposit Operations Check Fraud Analyst’s primary responsibility will include, but not be limited to, the monitoring of real-time queues responding to high-risk alerts for checks drawn on our SouthState Bank accounts. Resolve queued transactions within service level agreements to reduce potential losses.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS


Analyze check fraud alerts and identify fraudulent items when compared to legitimate ones.
Ability to research/analyze data and recognize/evaluate patterns of customer activity.
Escalate cases to the Financial Investigations Unit when applicable.
Meet or exceed the accuracy, productivity and all other goals assigned by management.
Interact courteously and tactfully with managers, co-workers, customers and/or vendors.
Can be flexible to work weekends, holidays and/or extended hours as needed.
Accepts other duties as assigned by the manager.
COMPETENCIES


Strong analytical and account research skills are required.
Ability to work well under pressure, maintaining composure and meeting deadlines.
Work as a team with co-workers to ensure all functions are completed timely and correctly.

Qualifications, Education, and Certification Requirements


Education : High School Diploma.
Experience : A minimum of two years of banking and teller experience is required.
Very good knowledge of Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) and other state and federal regulations pertaining to check fraud and check processing.
Certifications/Specific Knowledge: F amiliarity Fiserv Premier core system preferred.
Demonstrated ability to problem solve, strong written and verbal communication skills.
Basic proficiency with Microsoft Office including Outlook, Word & Excel with strong analytical skills.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to prioritize multiple assignments and to meet required timelines.
Must demonstrate initiative, be self-motivated, flexible and adapt to changing priorities.
TRAINING REQUIREMENTS/CLASSES


New Employee Orientation
Annual compliance training
On-the-job training
Continuously update skills by participating in professional training
PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORK ENVIRONMENT

Must be able to stand and/or sit for long periods of time. Must be able to effectively access and interpret information on computer screens, documents, reports, and cash denominations, and identify customers.

This position is located in a cubicle environment that may be noisy throughout the day. It is also located inside a cooled and heated facility with ability to go to a break room or rest room during breaks.

Telecommuting roles, no matter if hybrid or 100% full time telecommuting, must have a secure home office environment that is free from background noise and distractions. This area also requires a reliable private internet connection that is not supplied by use of cellular data (hot spot). Cable or fiber connections are preferred. Requirements are subject to change, as new systems and technology is delivered.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

TRAVEL

Occasional travel may be required for outside meetings and/or training.

COMPANY:




Perry Ellis International is a leading global manufacturer and marketer of apparel, offering a diverse portfolio of over 30 lifestyle brands through multiple distribution channels. Our corporate headquarters is in sunny Miami, Florida. We have offices, stores, sites & distribution centers across the globe. Our network & footprint ecompases North, Central & South America, Europe, Africa and Asia. PEI is transforming how we influence today’s retail business environment through our innovation in product design, technology and marketing platforms. As a responsible corporate citizen empowering a creative and diverse team, our vision is to further embrace our entrepreneurial spirit and ability to adapt to change.




SUMMARY:




The Supply Chain Analyst is responsible for developing vendor cost improvement solutions which require constant use of ingenuity and innovation. This position supports end to end 3PL and Vendor cost optimization processes through assigned projects and analytics. You will work hand in hand with professionals that will ensure you succeed in your role. This position is based in our Corporate headquarters in Doral - Miami, Florida and will support our Vendors and 3PLs across Canada, Mexico and the USA.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:




Develop 3PL and Vendor cost improvement solutions across PEI’s network of partners

Perform 3PL and Vendor Cost Accounting/coding, Invoice Reconciliation, Rate/Data Validations & Verification, Cost research and communication/alignment of rates and invoices with our partners, including analysis of trends/historicals and expected rate increases

Work with 3PL and Vendors with their accounting teams and PEI’s internal Accounts Payable team to ensure coding accuracy and on-time payments are completed as well as engage in constant communication as per reconciliations/research/invoice inaccuracies

Approve 3PL and Supplies vendor invoices, post completing coding, validation, & verification processes

Gather and analyze data to develop insights used for the cost optimization of our 3PLs and Supplies Vendors

Identify underperforming areas from analyzing costs with our 3PLs and Supplies Vendors. Present proposed solutions and recommendations to improve, automating where possible

Drive 3PL and Vendor Cost performance through Cost KPIs, Prepare Cost reports or dashboards to provide reliable real time activity data to upper management

Monitor Vendors and Suppliers for contract compliance. May assist in the negotiation of contracts or service arrangements. Review and update vendor contracts

Analyze cost trends and evaluate/analyze data for our 3PLs and Supplies Vendors

Analyze financial reports, market research and operating procedures - Strategize ideas to improve overall business operations and meet with company executives and other stakeholders to provide suggestions in optimization and automation of financial/cost reports

Document company SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) related to costs across PEI network of partners (3PLs and Supplies Vendors) as well as implement continuous improvement strategies & automation

Conduct RCA (Root Cause Analysis) of all cost/price/rate issues. Learn and provides Lean Six Sigma Analysis on 3PL and Vendor cost accounting processes as well as rate/price discrepancies

Supports inventory management team by monitoring inventory in stock that has low turnover on the 3PLs warehouses. Also support our inventory management team with the 3PL cycle count programs

Conducts benchmarking analysis of other 3 PLs in the region by comparing best practices on cost management and efficiencies as well as evaluating and researching market rates

Perform/Support RFQ/RFI initiatives across the organization

Work/support with finance/accounting on the new vendor onboarding process

Work/support with our Logistics & Imports departments for inbound/outbound into/out-of our 3PLs from a costing perspective

Provides exceptional support to external and internal customers as well as team members




SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES:




Computer skills in Google Apps, Microsoft Office (Advanced Excel/Spreadsheet analytics)

Knowledge of commonly-used concepts, practices, and procedures within the supply chain field

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Superior presentation and negotiation skills

Strong organizational skills

Statistical and technical systems skills to be able to analyze complex data

Strong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills as related to technology and industry trends

Excellent people skills, to be used to achieve a full understanding of the business process being supported

A high level of self-motivation, strong multitasking skills

Work ethical, mature, responsible and have a great attitude

Willingness to learn and provide value to our Organization

Adaptable and capable of working in fast-paced environments

The ideal candidate exhibits the following key competencies,

Initiative

Teamwork

Innovation

Leadership

Value Creation




PHYSICAL DEMANDS:




This position requires the normal demands of any job, such as sitting, standing, reaching with arms and hands, walking, talking and hearing.




WORK ENVIRONMENT:




While performing the duties of this job, the noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. The work areas is a mix of distribution center type environment as well as office, conference rooms, computers, technology environment




MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:




2+ years experience in or combination of Business, Supply Chain, Operations type roles

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Engineering (Preferred), Operations Management, Supply Chain, Finance or related field. Industrial Engineering background a plus

3PL and Vendor Management/Supply Chain experience required

Business Intelligence and KPI performance experience a plus

Circle is a financial technology company at the epicenter of the emerging internet of money, where value can finally travel like other digital data — globally, nearly instantly and less expensively than legacy settlement systems. This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you'll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you'll be responsible for:

Circle is looking for a Senior Analyst to join the Investment Operations team who owns the investment of the reserves backing Circle's stablecoins, including USD Coin (USDC) and Euro Coin (EUROC). As thought leaders on investment and risk management, this team is responsible for ensuring that reserves are invested pursuant to approved investment policies, while also ensuring that Circle effectively manages its financial resources to account for ongoing changes in the size and composition of the reserve. As the Investment Operations Senior Analyst, you will be responsible for helping analyze market factors which will be used to articulate an ongoing and evolving strategy for investing the reserve.

What you'll work on:

Leading and supporting all operational functions relevant to the management of stablecoin reserves. This includes daily cash movements including investments and rebalancing, reconciliation of accounts, positions and contractual obligations, development of enhanced reporting capturing all relevant metrics, and development and maintenance of Policies, Standards and Procedures.
Optimizing fiat reserve positioning with respect to liquidity and return.
Developing a view of market factors, and ensuring an effective strategy for generating yield through a combination of banking partners and investment managers.
Investing the stablecoin reserve pursuant to the approved investment policy.
Helping to scale the stablecoin reserves function to support expected continued robust growth in stablecoin balances, geographies and currencies.
Building and maintaining relationships with new and existing financial partners.
Conducting due diligence of prospective financial partners.
Maintaining an effective risk management framework to ensure liquidity and capital sufficiency in regular and stressed environments.
Developing stablecoin reporting to demonstrate Circle's compliance with all applicable financial regulations and best practices.
Representing Investment Operations and Treasury in both internal cross-functional and external partnership meetings.
Leading evaluation and implementation of automation solutions for relevant processes to minimize manual reporting and process flows.
Partnering with internal stakeholders to develop a leading data strategy that allows timely and accurate reporting and decision making.

You will aspire to our four core values:

Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.
Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals.
High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you'll bring to Circle:

4+ years of related experience in Treasury, Finance or Operations.
Strong operational background with an understanding of current market innovations and trends.
Knowledge of markets' activities including investment portfolios, collateral management and liquidity pools.
Established ability to organize, analyze and interpret large data sets to explain irregularities or trends.
Ability to manage multiple competing priorities and use good judgment to establish order or priorities on the fly.
Established ability to build new processes and workflows as needed.
Self-motivated and creative problem-solver.
Strong technical skills including knowledge of coding language(s) (Python, R, etc.) are preferred.
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Computer Science or Business related field.
Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Additional Information:

This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle is on a mission to create an inclusive financial future, with transparency at our core. We consider a wide variety of elements when crafting our compensation ranges and total compensation packages.

The compensation range below is specific to Miami, FL. Actual starting pay is determined by various factors, including but not limited to: relevant experience, skill set, qualifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note that compensation ranges may differ for candidates in other locations.

Base Pay Range: $105,000 - $140,000

Annual Bonus Target: 12.50%

Also Included: Equity & Benefits (including medical, dental, vision and 401(k)). Circle has a discretionary vacation policy. We also provide 10 days of paid sick leave per year and 11 paid holidays per year in the U.S.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Circle. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Additionally, Circle participates in the E-Verify Program in certain locations, as required by law.

Company Overview

With $5 billion in revenue and 3,800+ employees in the U.S., Mexico and Canada, TBC Corporation is a leader in the mobility industry and one of North America’s largest marketers of automotive replacement tires through wholesale and franchise operations. TBC serves wholesale customers in the United States, Canada and Mexico through TBC Brands, NTW, TBC International, and TBC de Mexico. Additionally, TBC responds to the needs of consumers in search of total car care at more than 2,000 franchised tire and automotive service centers under the Big O Tires® and Midas®. TBC is headquartered in Palm Beach Gardens, Florida.




TBC markets on a wholesale basis to regional tire chains and distributors serving independent tire dealers throughout the US, Canada, and Mexico. TBC has 20 proprietary brands of tires specializing in passenger, commercial, farm and specialty tires. In 2005, TBC Corp. was purchased by Sumitomo Corporation of America (SCOA). SCOA is the largest subsidiary of Sumitomo Corporation (SC), one of Japan’s major integrated trading and investment business enterprises. In 2018 Michelin, the largest tire manufacturer in Europe, invested in the company which is now a 50:50, privately held joint venture between Sumitomo and Michelin.

About DWS:

Today, markets face a whole new set of pressures – but also a whole lot of opportunity too. Opportunity to innovate differently. Opportunity to invest responsibly. And opportunity to make change.

Join us at DWS, and you can be part of an industry-leading firm with a global presence. You can lead ambitious opportunities and shape the future of investing. You can support our clients, local communities, and the environment.

We’re looking for creative thinkers and innovators to join us as the world continues to transform. As whole markets change, one thing remains clear; our people always work together to capture the opportunities of tomorrow. That’s why we are ‘Investors for a new now’.

As investors on behalf of our clients, it is our role to find investment solutions. Ensuring the best possible foundation for our clients’ financial future. And in return, we’ll give you the support and platform to develop new skills, make an impact and work alongside some of the industry’s greatest thought leaders. This is your chance to achieve your goals and lead an extraordinary career.

This is your chance to invest in your future.

Read more about DWS and who we are here.

Role Details

As a Reconciliation Production Analyst for DWS Investment Operations, you’ll be a leader as part of the Global Reconciliation team and focus on efficiency and teamwork. To drive improvement, you’ll foster the sharing of knowledge between functional teams, while building and managing relationships at all levels and developing your knowledge of a wide range of banking products. Simply put, it’s a role that’s essential to getting business done in the best way possible and consistently delivering first-class client experiences.

As a Reconciliation Production Analyst , you will (be):

Act as escalation point for Front Office queries related to reconciliation issues. Manage expectations and ensure issues are addressed in timely manner by functional processing teams.

Gain hands on experience working with Front Office and partnering with other operational teams to remedy cash and position variances.

Subject matter expert for the reconciliations team and provide guidance on complex breaks

Ensure tasks are followed according to Key Operating Procedures. Escalate when procedures are not followed and provide necessary direction to remediate.

Work effectively with internal functions such as Trade Processing, Reference Data, Corporate actions, Bookings, Tax etc. and with external Custodians for resolution of breaks.

Review Daily Overdraft reporting to ensure timely delivery and escalation of overdraft including root cause assessment.

Review recon output and ensure timely identification and escalation of aging exceptions.

Research and resolution for total market value variance between Trading System and the Accounting Book of Record.

Responsible for key end of day reporting.

We are looking for:

3+ years in the buy side financial industry (asset management, private banking).

Must have experience with Reconciliations in the financial industry. Understanding of how both equity and fixed income products work.

Ability to analyze reoccurring issues and perform root cause analysis. Escalate issues in the event control gaps are identified.

Experience with portfolio, trading platforms (preferably Aladdin) as well as excellent understanding of life cycle of a trade.

Ability to quickly learn in a time sensitive and high pressure environment.

Good critical thinking skills.

Ability to make sound judgment and when to escalate with senior manager appropriately.

Ability to build and maintain strong internal and external working relationships.

Excellent organization and communication skills.

Thoroughness and attention to detail a must.

Ability to meet critical, time sensitive deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks.

Bachelor's degree required

What we’ll offer you:

At DWS we’re serious about diversity, equity and creating an inclusive culture where colleagues can be themselves sand it’s important to us that you enjoy coming to work - feeling healthy, happy and rewarded. At DWS, you’ll have access to a range of benefits which you can choose from to create a personalised plan unique to your lifestyle. Whether you’re interested in healthcare, company perks, or are thinking about your retirement plan, there’s something for everyone.

Some of our core benefits:

Competitive Salary and Matched 401K Savings Plan

Generous Paid Time Away plus Bank Holidays

Physical and Mental Health Well-Being benefits including (but not limited to) Health & Life Insurance Plans and the support of trained Mental Health First Aiders

Family friendly benefits including generous parental leave packages (supporting all variations of family set-ups), to healthcare plans and travel insurance

The opportunity to support our CSR strategy which is focused on combatting climate change & achieving greater social justice. You can make donations to our partnered organisations or take part in corporate volunteering opportunities in your local communities by providing on hand support.

DWS’ Hybrid Working model is designed to find the right balance between in-person collaboration and engagement in the office, which is core to our working culture, and working from home. Each business group varies on the split between time spent in the office and at home, but this will be discussed and made clear as part of your application and interview process. We will continue to review and evolve our working environments and methods to ensure that we are working in the best way possible for our people.

Examples of adjustments include providing a change to the format of the interview, or providing assistance when at the DWS office. Job Description:
Position Summary

Solution Analyst – Business Technology; Deloitte Consulting, US Delivery Center

Interested in creating mission critical solutions? Perform assessments of existing information systems, and identify gaps between business requirements and/or current process/system capabilities during workshop sessions with business users
Develop customized solutions and draft functional design documentation utilizing strong skills in logical thinking, decision making, problem solving, and attention to detail
Build new business processes around enterprise resource planning tools and other key functions

The team

Our US Delivery Center team is comprised of deeply passionate and experienced professionals who guide clients through their most complex challenges. Learn more about the US Delivery Center.

Required

Bachelor’s degree completed by August 2024 in these or related areas of study
Engineering/STEM, Information Management, Information Systems, Computer Science, Business (Accounting, Finance, Economics)
Strong academic track record (minimum GPA of 3.0)

Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future
If aligned to support Deloitte’s Government Public Services practice, you must be able to obtain and maintain a security clearance

Preferred

Confidence in technology-driven tasks, problem solving, awareness of cutting-edge solutions, operational/ process design awareness, executive presence, strong analytical and critical thinking skills with the ability to solve complex problems and easily communicate findings

Deloitte’s purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and in our communities. We are creating trust and confidence in a more equitable society. At Deloitte, purpose is synonymous with how we work every day. It defines who we are. We are focusing our collective efforts to advance sustainability, equity, and trust that come to life through our core commitments. Learn more about Deloitte's purpose, commitments, and impact.

From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. Job Title: Operations Research Analyst

This position performs scientific work that involves designing, developing, and adapting mathematical, statistical, econometric, and other scientific methods and techniques. The work also involves analyzing management problems and providing advice and insight about the probable effects of alternative solutions to these problems. The primary requirement of the work is competence in the rigorous methods of scientific inquiry and analysis.

Qualifications

Skill in coordinating extensive projects in assigned areas of responsibility. Projects are characterized by high visibility, unusual urgency or program criticality.
Expert knowledge of complex subjects under study so that conclusions reflect real world environments.
Ability to use advanced techniques and the modification and extension of theories, precepts and practices of operations research and related sciences and disciplines.
Ability to design and build very complex, sophisticated models.

Travel: This position may require minimal travel.

Organizational Profile:


Since its inception in 1953, Memorial Healthcare System has been a leader in providing high-quality healthcare services to South Florida residents. Today, it is one of the largest public healthcare systems in the nation with over 13,000 team members and highly regarded for its exceptional patient- and family-centered care. Memorial's patient, physician and employee satisfaction rates are some of the most admired in the country, and the system is recognized as a national leader in quality healthcare.


Memorial has a reputation as one of Florida's leading healthcare systems and is supported by a distinguished medical staff. In fact, the vast majority of physicians are board certified or board qualified in their specialties and have been trained at many of the nation's finest medical schools and hospitals. Because of its distinguished medical staff and services, Memorial draws patients from South Florida and beyond.


Many prestigious healthcare awards have been earned by Memorial Healthcare System and its facilities. The accolades include: Modern Healthcare magazine's Best Places to Work in Healthcare, Florida Trend magazine's Best Companies to Work for in Florida, 100 Top Hospitals, Consumer Choice Award, Best-Run Hospital, Best Nursing Staff, Best Pediatric Hospital and Best Maternity Hospital.



Disclaimer: This job description is not intended, nor should it be construed to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, efforts or working conditions associated with the job. It is intended to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification.

Join a team of professionals who are passionate about their work, love cross-training and the adoption of cutting-edge technologies. We care about our employees and foster an environment in which they can thrive by providing them the tools and training necessary to get the job done. Our team is a place where we encourage self-starters, and everyone’s ideas are heard and valued! We are looking for experienced Business Analysts with an Agile Mindset to join the ClearlyAgile team. Some are true BA's on the team and others may work closely with Product Owners.



What you'll be doing is using agile methods to analyze, define, and document business requirements in order to deliver valuable software applications that meet stakeholder needs.

Requirements gathering: identify and clarify business and functional requirements for clients and internal teams, using interviews and workshops with external/internal stakeholders
Collaborate with stakeholders and product teams to decompose large epic stories into features and user stories that can be understood and approved by members of the development team
Work with the agile team throughout the product development, testing, implementation phases to ensure requirements are clearly understood
Provide support to the Product Owner with backlog prioritization, feature sequencing and organization, user acceptance testing, etc.
Build trust and respect, establish relationships, and develop rapport with technical and non-technical team members

Requirements

What we’re looking for is someone who is willing to learn and open to new ideas. This position focuses on designing and developing solutions for our new and existing projects. This position requires a candidate with an enthusiastic and energetic personality who will be organized, inspirational and collaborative.

3+ years of Business Analysis experience, including gathering requirements for software development, creating user stories, and product backlog grooming
2+ years working as a Business Analyst in an agile environment, strong agile mindset, familiarity with Scrum process and role of Product Owner
Experience with Jira or similar tools
Scrum certification like CSM or CSPO preferred
Bachelor's degree preferred

LOCATION AND OTHER REQUIREMENTS

Must be located within commuting distance of Tampa, the role is remote but an occasional visit to the office may be required
Candidates must be authorized to work in the US without sponsorship (no subcontracts or visa sponsorship)

Benefits

ABOUT THE COMPANY

ClearlyAgile is one of the fastest growing Agile companies in the Tampa Bay area. We foster career growth and are focused on having fun while delivering quality products and services to our clients. With Unlimited Paid Time Off; 10 Paid Holidays; Medical, Vision, and Dental benefits; Employee Ownership; 401(k); paid training certifications; and very competitive compensation plans, ClearlyAgile strives to listen to and invest in its most important asset…its people.

Our Mission: Transform our customer’s businesses using Agile methodologies and principles to help them succeed in a flexible, collaborative, self-organizing and fast-paced environment.


Our Values: We hire and reward based on our core values.

Show Your Passion - Have passion for what you do. Be an active learner with a commitment to grow. Attend and participate in events!
Be a Champion of Agile - Spread the word. Back it up with examples, case studies, and data points. Lead by example.
Teamwork - Be cooperative and collaborative while maintaining a team-first mindset.
Customer-centric - Always focus on the client and their customers. See the world from their perspectives.
Quality - Maintain a sense of pride in the quality of your work and the collective work of the team.
Be a Leader - Empower yourself to make decisions and don’t be paralyzed by fear of failure.

We are an equal opportunity employer and committed to a diverse workforce.


To learn more about us visit our website at www.clearlyagile.com

Job Title: API Technical Implementation Manager - Payments - Senior Associate
Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Job Title: Risk Management Regulatory Intelligence – Framework and Business Analysis, Vice President
Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


Office of Regulatory Intelligence Management – Framework and Business Analysis, Vice President

Description

JPMorgan Chase & Co. is a leader in financial services, working in collaboration across the globe to deliver the best solutions and advice to meet our clients' needs, anywhere in the world. We operate in 150 countries, and hold leadership positions across our businesses. We have an exceptional team of employees who work hard to do the right thing for our clients and the firm, every day. This is why we are one of the most respected financial institutions in the world – and why we can offer you an outstanding career.

Office of Regulatory Intelligence Management (ORIM) is a firmwide function within the Risk Management & Compliance organization. Office of Regulatory Intelligence Management is responsible for transformation projects supporting firmwide strategy on matters regarding regulatory intelligence and change management. This function manages initiatives contributing to the design and operation of governance frameworks, technology innovations, and business processes and controls in order to help meet the ever changing needs of an evolving regulatory environment.

Office of Regulatory Intelligence Management is seeking a highly effective, analytical and innovative Vice President. The VP will contribute to thought leadership, strategic initiative development and execution, and promoting the team’s objectives globally across lines of business and corporate functions. The ideal candidate is a highly organized, collaborative, and communicative team member with demonstrated experience in Risk Management and Compliance, or program management for large-scale initiatives.

Job Responsibilities

Provide strategic vision and guidance for the governance and framework pillar of the function, providing strategic vision and driving agenda
Champion business analysis for program, working on a wide range of topics to support progress across department workstreams
Research and analyze current business processes and best practices to identify process improvements; craft strong analysis-backed business cases for proposals
Gather and critically analyze diverse collections of qualitative and quantitative data; relay succinct conclusions to inform team decisions and direct project efforts
Develop clear and compelling communication materials for audiences at all levels of seniority and familiarity with work at hand
Partner with the Lines of Business and Corporate Functions, manage relationships to deliver consistent and excellent stakeholder experience
Draft strong written content for policy and procedural documents, business requirements, technical specifications, project artefacts, internal and external communications

Required Qualifications, Skills and Capabilities

Minimum Bachelor’s degree; 12+ years work experience at a multinational financial services institution (Risk, Compliance, Legal preferred), consultancy, or relevant industry
Prior experience in governance and/or framework development roles, strategy, process improvement or project management advantageous
Exceptional writing and communication skills in concise management presentation formats as well as detailed narrative form
Strong logical and analytical skills with a creative passion for developing and expressing best-in-class ideas
Strong analytical skills, with ability to deliver insights and new features for senior management reviews;
Demonstrated skill in working with large, complex data sets to produce executive level reporting;
Advanced MS Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint); experience with data analytics/visualization tools a plus
High attention to detail and ability to work independently to produce executive-level materials, analyses, presentations

The Senior Operations Analyst will take a lead role in providing reporting, dashboards, analytics and strategic recommendations for the Customer Service Department, supporting Mechanical Claims and the Customer Contact Center for a multi-site contact center operation. The primary role is to manage and optimize the planning activities for a multi-site operation which includes preparation and presentation of monthly reporting, creating forecasts and staffing models, developing self-servicing dashboards, providing insight and analysis to assist in tactical and strategic decisions. Responsibilities also include developing, improving and automating existing reports and models, working with department heads to update data, documenting and analyzing data, presenting the results to management and handling ad hoc requests.
Job Responsibilities:
Provide reporting, self-servicing dashboards, forecasts, insights and analyses supporting tactical and strategic decision making
Data mining, cleansing, modeling, visualizing and analyzing, documenting existing and future business processes
Updating, refining and enhancing current reporting to improve the quality and speed of delivery of financial and operational reporting
Summarize data into presentations while telling a story to support business decisions and strategic direction. The target audience will primarily be internal customers and executive management.
Special Projects and ad hoc analyses as assigned
Idea generation, recommendations, etc.
Create and maintain relationships with stakeholders, gain thorough understanding of their desired business outcomes and how they translate into BI application features and visualizations
Development using a variety of BI tools including Excel, Power BI, Power Automate, Power Query, DAX and SQL in an Azure Cloud database environment
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Data Analytics or another related field. While a specific degree in data intelligence is a strong asset, equivalent work experience may be considered
Strong quantitative, analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience in financial analysis and reporting or related work. With demonstrated financial analysis and modeling expertise
Experience in presenting / discussing results of performance
Ability to prioritize tasks efficiently with a high level of attention to detail
Excellent project management, interpersonal and organizational skills
Ability to work under tight deadlines while being flexible and responsive to changing conditions
High degree of proficiency with the Microsoft Suite of products including Excel, Power BI, and Power Automate
Excellent command of the SQL language with the ability to write complex queries
Effective communications both verbally and written
Self-driven to learn new technologies, methodologies and approaches is a must

Job Title: Senior Technical Business Analyst - Business Intelligence
Job Description:
Overview

Shift4 (NYSE: FOUR) is boldly redefining commerce by simplifying complex payments ecosystems across the world. As the leader in commerce-enabling technology, Shift4 powers billions of transactions annually for hundreds of thousands of businesses in virtually every industry. For more information, visit www.shift4.com.

Job # 4071




Shift4 is seeking a key Senior Technical Business Analyst will act as a liaison between a business analyst and a business intelligence engineering team to understand business operations and gather, analyze and identify data from their sources to map to target databases and reports. You will ensure that data to fulfill any reporting and analytics needs is accurate, available, and easy to find to drive data-driven strategies that improves Shift4's processes.

This opportunity can be based at any of the following Shift4 locations and is Hybrid / Onsite 3 to 4 days a week: Tampa, FL / Center Valley, PA / Silver Spring, MD / Las Vegas, NV (if in Vegas, will need to work hours compatible with the 8-5 EST zone)

Responsible for the BI Data Mapping, which includes analyzing business requirements, identifying location of necessary data from technical systems, defining all necessary transformations and documentation of the mapping in source to target documents.
Conduct source data profiling for anomalies and informative summaries.
Interpret data from a business perspective to aid in the modeling of data targets such as an enterprise data warehouse.
Supports the strategy for how the data will be documented, handled, stored, and processed to support the requirements from across all business units.
Provides support for the ETL and BI developers for all data related analysis, questions, and issues.
Identify requirements that are needed by stakeholders to effectively manage performance, and work with department stakeholders on prioritization.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and implement technological solutions.
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to implement improvements.
Evaluate the effectiveness of implemented solutions.

Qualifications




Degree in Business, Finance, Information Technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field.
7+ years of business intelligence and analysis experience.
Ability to understand technical systems from both the application and data repository points of view.
Proficient in programming scripts using SQL, R, or other programming languages.
Demonstrated proficient skillset in database technologies and tools (SQL Server, Postgres, Oracle, AWS Redshift).
High degree of quantitative and qualitative analytical skills.
Experience extracting, transforming, and mining data.
Ability to use business perspective to identify and resolve business problems found from data.
Proven experience working with business users to understand requirements and translate them to systems data specifications.
Demonstrated highly effective communications, interpersonal, and team building skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

Nice to Have

Demonstrated ability to work directly with various levels personnel within the company.
Experience with dimensional data warehousing.
Experience with financial systems and processes.
Experience with credit card processing.
Experience with Analysis Services and MS SQL Reporting Services (SSRS).
Visualizing with modern visualization tools (Microsoft Power BI, Tableau or equivalent).
Continuing education certifications (IBM or Tableau certifications).
Master's degree in Business Intelligence, Business Administration, Business Analytics, or related field.

The role you’ll contribute:

Under general direction, monitors and supports systems in a 24/7 distributed enterprise client/server data center operations environment utilizing multiple technologies. Guides team in implementing approved changes and projects within the data center, enforcing data center operational standards and processes as well as maintaining daily operating records and required documentation. Identifies problem sources related to data center operations and effectively communicates with technical support staff to explain and assist with resolving incidents. Guides in initial, elevated, and critical level support for incident resolution and event management. Assists with capacity planning research & analysis. Backup on-call support for service impacting events.




Responsibilities:

Work Quality and Productivity (10%)
Complete tasks actively seeking ways to produce high quality, efficient work with minimal margin of error.
Look for extra work as work load permits.
Perform duties as assigned or directed in a proactive manner to ensure efficient operation of the department.
Demonstrate good organizational skills as well as prioritizing and managing time efficiently. Plans and anticipates as required by the situation presented.
Display a high level of effort and commitment to performing and completing work assignments
Demonstrate effective problem solving skills.
Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently prioritizing and managing time effectively.
Identify improvements in processes to reduce workload and minimize service impacts.
Maintain an organized and clean work area and Data Center.
Follow and enforce Data Center Standards and work guidelines.
This position may require you to be able to take a call during a disaster as defined in Policy CWHR190.



Infrastructure Activities (25%)
Maintain knowledge of operational activities within the Data Center and able to articulate them and their status.
Install & configure equipment racks, KVM switches & power.
Run & label ethernet & fiber cables from to connect equipment.
Rack and un-rack all equipment in the Data Center.
Perform hardware repairs/upgrades to equipment in the Data Center as needed.
Prepare for Asset Recovery & clean all data off of decommissioned equipment to ensure confidentiality. Inspect all equipment and ensure appropriate erasure.
Perform scheduled tasks following procedures and using knowledge and judgement.
Create/update documentation and procedures to maintain accuracy.
Document Data Center equipment and rack elevations.
Perform physical inspections of all equipment Data Center and Network Room. Take appropriate action to correct any identified issues.
Manage and maintain supplies for installing new equipment.




Incident & Event Management (30%)
Create incidents including appropriate information.
Follow incident management standards and processes including timely resolution and documentation.
Assign incidents to appropriate resources and ensure teams are engaged within the times required by the service and operating level agreements.
Escalate incidents as needed to ensure resolution.
Monitor environments for system failures or abnormal conditions and take appropriate action in a timely manner.
Diagnose alarms and take action to resolve them or escalate to appropriate teams.
Have knowledge of operational activities and processes within the Data Center and able to articulate them and their status.
Facilitate gathering of technical teams to support event resolution.
Maintain accurate information and data regarding events within appropriate tools.
Actively communicate event activities and status to appropriate personnel.
Take supporting role for major service impacting events including backup on-call.




Application & Environment Management (25%)
Work in Data Center Expert to monitor, manage and apply firmware update of IT environmental equipment such as PDU, UPS, AC and video devices.
Configure and add devices in Data Center Expert.
Configure and add devices in Visual Power Manager.
Work in DS View to discover new KVM switches and systems added to new and existing KVM switches.
Maintain authority for appropriate personnel to devices in DS View.
Add/update/remove all equipment configuration in SolarWinds.
Working knowledge of Service Desk, Generator, UPS, PDU & fire alarm systems.
Assist in downtime activities including activities.




Analysis (10%) – Assists with these activities
Review reports from monitoring tools to ensure systems are being monitored appropriately.
Evaluate configurations & settings in supported applications and set/correct them according to standards.
Review health & capacity reports to ensure system performance is within guidelines within the upcoming reporting period.
Predictive analysis of environment using available tools to reduce service impacting conditions.
Review Data Center Infrastructure Manager for capacity support and operational health and initiate corrective action for failures & risks.
Qualifications


The expertise and experiences you’ll need to succeed:

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:




Demonstrate a high level of knowledge and understanding of the Data Center Operations team and the Technical Services department, including the technology, processes, and business practices related to the area represented in order to perform job responsibilities and meet customer needs.
Actively communicate relevant information in a timely manner.
Ability to balance team and individual responsibilities along with person and professional demands.
Proficiency in written and oral communication skills.
Develop documentation for new processes and procedures.
Working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite.
Knowledge of Microsoft operating systems.




KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS PREFERRED:

Knowledge of Linux operating systems.
Analytical skills to determine incident & event root cause.



EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:




College degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or 5 years of relevant experience.
Minimum of 4-6 years of experience in Enterprise Data Center Operations, Enterprise Systems Administrations or equivalent is required.
Good understanding of Infrastructure Monitoring tools, concepts and processes.
Good understanding of operating systems and concepts.
Proven experience with troubleshooting initial, elevated and critical level support incidents.
Data center cabling and power concepts & technologies.




EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE PREFERRED:

Good understanding of networking concepts & technologies including LAN/WAN technologies, network equipment, protocols & other communication systems.
Experience leading problem analysis and resolution
Experience with SolarWinds monitoring tools.
Experience with APC StruxureWare Data Center Expert and Data Center Operation.
Experience with Eaton Visual Power Manager.




LICENSURE, CERTIFICATION OR REGISTRATION REQUIRED:




A+ certification. Extensive and proven experience may be substituted for certification where appropriate.
Server+ certification. Extensive and proven experience may be substituted for certification where appropriate.




LICENSURE, CERTIFICATION OR REGISTRATION PREFERRED:

Industry recognized certifications in IT Systems Administration such as Server, Network & ITIL are preferred.
