Job Title: Senior Data Analyst Marketing and Sales
Job Description:
The Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for CCI's efforts to develop and expand an analytically driven business performance evaluation framework. You will support the testing, analysis, and reporting function in projects across multiple functional areas of the business, including Marketing, Pricing, Sales, Operations and others. This role requires a creative individual who possesses skills in data handling, model development, analytics, and storytelling. Innovation is encouraged and a desire to collaborate well with our team, boundary partners, and leaders across the organization is a must.

Cox Communications is seeking a Senior Data Analyst who is experienced in:

Data mining, modeling, analysis, and visualization.
Analytical capabilities building and continuous improvement.
Using data analysis to assess the performance and identify insights of strategies and tests.




In this role you are part of a team responsible for CCI's efforts to develop and expand an analytically driven business performance evaluation framework. You will support the testing, analysis, and reporting function in projects across multiple functional areas of the business, including Marketing, Pricing, Sales, Operations and others. This role is a unique opportunity to help deliver on the vision to grow analytical capabilities, as well as support the development of key strategies critical to the business.

What You'll Do:


Serve as a subject matter expert supporting effectiveness analysis, including:

A/B testing and multivariate experiments.
Sales, Marketing, Pricing performance, including evaluation of strategy objectives.
Performance of offers, customer migration, churn, etc.
Designs and develops big data-based models and reporting tools using tools like SQL and Python in the Snowflake environment.
Identifies and mine new data resources to enable reporting and advanced analytics.
Translates data and trends into actionable insights via regular and ad-hoc reports that tell our competitive story.
Understands organizational objectives and helps improve reporting, analytics, and development projects to meet these goals.
Provides support to ad-hoc requests from senior leaders and boundary partners.
Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency by implementing data validation and quality assurance procedures .
Provides Data Analysis services across multiple products, business or organizational areas.
Interacts with business leaders to understand key objectives and concerns.
Develops database logic to extract required information for reporting.
Supports efforts to distill massive amounts of complicated data into meaningful and actionable insights.
Designs, develops and implements dashboards and reports to facilitate data review and analysis.
Manage and prioritize multiple projects, ensuring that they are delivered on time and within budget.
Drives successful projects by providing action-oriented analyses, optimization and a data-driven approach.




What's In It For You:

At Cox, we reward your hard work with meaningful benefits.

First, we offer a highly competitive compensation package, 401(k) with a generous company match, comprehensive healthcare, life, and disability benefits, plus numerous other benefits, including adoption assistance, pet insurance, and discounts on travel and cars!

We value people more than technology. That means you'll work within a culture and with a team that values your leadership, your experience, your contributions, and you - yes, you - as a person. We believe recognition is important, and Cox strives to celebrate those who help make us successful every day. We also encourage diversity and support inclusion; we want you to do you and feel comfortable doing so.

We also offer boundless opportunities for growth; you can sharpen your skills, learn a new talent, join a mentoring program, even earn an advanced degree. You'll find the potential for lateral or upward career growth within the Cox family businesses, including the innovative startups in transportation mobility, clean tech and more.

Who You Are:

Minimum



Bachelor's degree in a related discipline and 4 years of experience in a related field (Marketing, Data Analytics or related field). The right candidate could also have a different combination, such as a master's degree and 2 years of experience, a Ph.D. and 1 year of experience or 8 years of experience in a related field with no degree.
Analytical/financial analysis background.
Strong multitasking, analytical and creative skills.
Self-starter with strong organizational, detail and follow-up skills.
Excellent interpersonal, leadership, presentation, and collaborative skills to work effectively with teams throughout the organization.
Demonstrated business acumen, problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Develop framework to analyze effectiveness of offer recommendations, strategy rules and processes; provide insights to strategy teams for improvements.
Ability to translate and communicate complex analyses clearly and concisely.
Conducts business/strategy impact analyses, validations, and measurement through all stages from concept formulation, definition of metrics, determination of appropriate statistical methodology, research evaluation, and final presentation
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Deadline driven, ability to work with a sense of urgency.
Proficiency with quantitative tools including Excel and presentation tools such as PowerPoint and willingness to learn new tools that may be valuable to the team.
Continuous learner mindset.
Comfort setting direction and drawing insight from multiple (and often unclear) data sources.
Hands on experience with SQL.
Hands on experience with BI and dashboarding tools (MicroStrategy, Tableau, Power BI, or similar reporting tools.)




Preferred



Bachelor's degree in marketing, data analytics, engineering, computer science, economics, finance or similar analytical or technical field.
Telecommunications, cable industry, high tech, or consulting experience.
Familiarity with financial and data modeling techniques.
Interest in learning (or prior experience with) statistical analysis methods.
Strong knowledge of programming languages SQL, Python, R.
Experience working with Snowflake, AWS (Amazon Web Services) and/or ThoughtSpot.
Process management tools such as Airtable.




Join the Cox family of businesses and make your mark today!

USD 77,000.00 - 115,600.00 per year

About Cox Communications

Cox Communications is the largest private telecom company in America, serving six million homes and businesses. That's a lot, but we also proudly serve our employees. Our benefits and our award-winning culture are just two of the things that make Cox a coveted place to work. If you're interested in bringing people closer through broadband, smart home tech and more, join Cox Communications today!

About Cox

Cox empowers employees to build a better future and has been doing so for over 120 years. With exciting investments and innovations across transportation, communications, cleantech and healthcare, our family of businesses - which includes Cox Automotive and Cox Communications - is forging a better future for us all. Ready to make your mark? Join us today!

Job Title: Director of Business Intelligence & Sales Str
Job Description:
!!CREATE YOUR LEGACY WITH THE LEGACY COMPANIES!!

Position Overview:

The Director of Business Intelligence and Sales Strategy is a key leadership role responsible for driving data-driven decision-making, optimizing sales strategies, and establishing process rules of the road for sales operations and administration within our consumer and commercial appliance company. This position requires a strategic thinker with a strong background in business intelligence, analytics, and sales operations. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in enhancing our competitive advantage, identifying growth opportunities, and ensuring the effective alignment of sales initiatives with overall business objectives.

Job Responsibilities:

Business Intelligence Leadership:

Oversee the design and implementation of BI tools and reporting systems to enhance data visibility and accessibility across the organization.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define KPIs, track performance metrics, and establish benchmarks for business success.

Sales Strategy Development:

Support divisional business intelligence strategy through leveraging data analytics to provide actionable insights for key stakeholders.
Analyze sales performance data to optimize pricing strategies, product positioning and sales channels.

Sales Operations Management:

Design, implement, manage process governing customer implementation, contracts, pricing, and sales order processing.
Work closely with the sales team to ensure efficient and effective sales processes, including forecasting, pipeline management, and territory planning.
Collaborate with IT and other relevant departments to integrate BI solutions into the sales operations workflow.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Collaborate with finance, marketing, and product development teams to align business intelligence and sales strategies with broader organizational goals.
Act as a liaison between sales and other departments to facilitate communication and coordination of initiatives.

Team Leadership and Development:

Lead and develop a high-performing team of business intelligence analysts and sales strategists.
Provide mentorship, coaching, and professional development opportunities to enhance team capabilities.

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Analytics, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree is a plus.
Proven experience (10+ years) in business intelligence, analytics, and sales strategy within the commercial appliance or related industry.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to translate data into actionable business insights.
Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively across functions.
Familiarity with BI tools and other relevant technologies.
Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal.

Summary:


The Automation Business Analyst is a critical role in any Automation Team, responsible for working with the Senior BAs to identify the best opportunities for automations.

The Junior BA will be responsible for helping in gathering requirements from the Subject Matter Expert and working alongside the programmers in delivering the solution under the guidance of the Senior Business Analyst.


Essential Duties Include:

Evaluate business processes, anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement.
Stay up-to-date on the latest process and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems.
Perform requirements analysis by conducting SME (client) interviews.
Effectively communicate your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management.
Gather critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing Process Definition Document/Business Requirements Document.
Create High Level and Modular Maps/Keystroke Document.
Conduct meetings and presentations to review and validate findings.
Work closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff.
Ensure solutions meet business needs and requirements.
Create user acceptance test cases and perform user acceptance testing.
Serve as a liaison between stakeholders and users.
Manage competing priorities.
Monitor deliverables and ensure timely completion of projects.


Minimum Degree Requirement:

Bachelor or Master’s degree in Finance/Industrial/Process Engineering or Management Information Systems


Requirements:

Minimum 6 months of related Business Analysis experience (1 yr. preferred)
Proven attention to detail and an ability to work independently
Certification in one or multiple RPA and/or other emerging automation/ cognitive technologies a plus.
Ability to identify opportunities for innovation and offer new ideas (‘thinks outside the box’)
Ability to multi-task and manage shifting priorities and deadlines, with attention to detail and an ability to work both independently and in a team environment
Should have excellent communication skills in both written and verbal English


Benefits
Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage
Retirement 401(k)
Paid time off and holidays
Paid parental leave plans for all new parents
Leave benefits including disability, paid family medical leave, and paid military leave

Note: These benefits are only applicable to full time, permanent associates at Accelirate located in the United States.


Accelirate is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, veteran status, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.


Accelirate does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Accelirate and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.

Job Description
Fragomen’s Business Immigration Analyst, formerly known as the Assistant Paralegal, position will provide you with the opportunity to make an immediate impact to our business, as well as offer training, development, and long-term growth opportunities. Fragomen’s exclusive focus on immigration means you will work in an exciting, ever-changing and challenging atmosphere with people who are passionate about immigration. Providing world class client service and industry leading technology solutions, Fragomen helps our clients to navigate the complex world of global immigration to better achieve their goals.
As a Business Immigration Analyst, you will:
Perform a range of case related duties, including drafting email correspondence, letters and documentation to clients, government agencies, and colleagues
Assist with drafting and filing applications and petitions with government agencies
Compile and summarize large quantities of data for clients, managers and reporting needs
Learn about the various types of immigration matters
Gather and maintain confidential client contact information in our proprietary case management system
Provide status updates to clients and senior level team members
Request, collect, and file documents in proper order
Be responsible for accurately updating our case management system with client data
Build knowledge of firm, immigration case types and client processes
Depend on others for instruction, guidance and direction
Meet assigned deadlines and communicate case progress/status/issues to supervisor
Demonstrate flexibility and initiative regarding assignments for self and team
Let’s talk if you have the following:
Bachelor’s degree, associate’s degree or Paralegal Certification
A client service mindset, attention to detail and desire to achieve a high level of productivity
Experience using various computer systems, including Microsoft Excel
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment with competing demands
The ability to prioritize, meet deadlines and escalate case issues to supervisor
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Desire to contribute to positive work environment, effectively collaborate and promote teamwork

Job Title: Operations Software Analyst Senior (Scheduling Team: Autosys)
Job Description:
Position Type :

Full time

Type Of Hire :

Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)

Education Desired :

Bachelor of Computer Science

Travel Percentage :

0%

Job Description

As the world works and lives faster, FIS is leading the way. Our fintech solutions touch nearly every market, company, and person on the planet. Our teams are inclusive and diverse. Our colleagues work together and celebrate together. If you want to advance the world of fintech, we’d like to ask you: Are you FIS?

About the role:

We are reinforcing our platform operations team to support growth in the Capital Markets Software as a Service (SaaS) environments. We are looking for experienced technical operations to supplement the existing support team who manages the environments for Transfer Agency Solutions, providing shareholder services to our customers.

About the team:

The team provides day-to-day hands-on support for the applications in which our customer operates their business. The team is made up of senior technologists covering a broad array of software and infrastructure. The support model is follow-the-sun and provides support coverage around the clock with team members located globally.

What you will be doing:
Day-to-day support of production environments is mission one. The goals of the team are to provide any downtime for our customers and mitigate any unplanned issues. In addition, the team provides technical support to do projects, releases, conversions, and business continuity.

What you will need:

Hands on experience in managing enterprise level batch processing using CA Workload Automation AE (Autosys) scheduling software
Strong unix shell scripting skills
Hands on experience in supporting day to day operations tasks in an enterprise environment
Knowledge of DevOps tools as part of the deployment pipeline e.g. Git, Jenkins, Docker, Ansible, Elastic, Jira

Technical Skills:

The following technical skills are highly desirable- candidates should be able to minimally be familiar with the concepts and plan to build these skills as part of their developmental growth at FIS

Working knowledge of networking, routing, Loadbalacers, VPNs
Understanding of various communication protocols - FTP, SFTP, SSL, HTTPS
General working knowledge of DBMS suites (Oracle, SQL)

Devops skill set:

Hands on one or many scripting languages: BASH, BAT, Cron, KORN, python, powershell
Logging and monitoring tools such as Splunk, Greylog
Experience with IDE software (e.g. Visual Studio Code, Atom)
Experience with Git source control systems (e.g. Bitbucket, GitHub, GitLab)
Experience with CI/CD orchestration systems (e.g. Jenkins, Harness, Octupus)
Experience with infrastructure as code tools (e.g. Terraform, Ansible)

Security admin:

SSH, TLS, general working knowledge
Certificate management

Working knowledge of ITIL practices:

Change Management
Incident Management
Problem Management
Business Continuity, Disaster Recovery
Typical organizational skills

Responsibilities:

Monitor, Track and Report on all job abends/errors
Maintain and monitor all application schedules, investigating and repairing errors
Design, update and maintain monitoring tools
Create, update and maintain run and recovery procedures
Maintenance of the batch schedules for the distributed environment using the CA Workload Automation AE (Autosys) scheduling software

Daily monitoring of the run schedules. Attendance at daily standup status meetings to discuss any reported scheduling issues

Design and maintenance of all scheduling flows, calendars and associated resources
On request changes to job flows
On request project enhancements/additions to job flows
Troubleshoot and rectify any scheduler-related issues affecting correct and timely job flows
Assist in application recoveries by providing necessary scheduling expertise when required
Verify scheduling changes introduced by other Technical Analysts

Application Maintenance

Monitor scheduling software performance
Interface with scheduling software vendors to get resolution to questions or issues regarding the scheduling software, or to request enhancements to scheduling software functionality
Work with Systems Engineering to ensure that scheduling software platforms are successfully supporting the operation of the software

Efficiency and Productivity

Review run schedules on a standard and constant basis for accuracy and efficiency
Develop or otherwise undertake projects designed to improve productivity of the scheduling software, usually via scheduling efficiency enhancements

Change Management

Attend regularly-scheduled change management meetings on an as-needed basis to discuss any scheduling requirements.

Projects & Other Assigned Tasks

Work on assigned projects/tasks
Appropriately escalate any error/issue that progresses beyond first-level support
Own and drive high severity incidents by coordinating with technical, client services and professional services team
Participate in disaster recovery and maintenance activities
Take automation improvement initiatives to reduce manual tasks improving efficiencies using DevOps tools



What we offer you:

A voice in the future of fintech
Always-on learning and development
Collaborative work environment
Opportunities to give back
Competitive salary and benefits

.

Company Name: West Florida Medical Center Clinic PA
Job Description:
Description:

JOB SUMMARY

Provide financial analyst support for members of the Practice Management team, in order to increase and enhance their productivity at the executive level.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform advanced statistical analyses including opportunity assessments, clinical and financial risk tracking, trend identification and predictive modeling exercises.
Assess data quality using advanced statistical testing and validation techniques.
Interpret and analyze outcomes data to accurately assess, evaluate and demonstrate program performance.
Written and verbal presentation and interpretation of findings in multiple settings.
Explore existing processes and data warehouses, generating ideas for analysis projects.
Work with complex database programs to generate original data reports and revise existing reports.
Maintain a detailed knowledge of physician compensation structures, billing and collection processes, operational methods and policies, and corporate policies and procedures which could impact analytical outcomes.
Maintain a detailed knowledge of financial operations (function of the general ledger and relation to the income distribution plan).
Interact with MMS management team routinely to understand project goals, deadlines and develop satisfactory working relationships.
Other duties as assigned.

CORPORATE CULTURE RESPONSIBILITIES

Follow established corporate and department-specific policies and procedures
Attend all corporate and department-specific required training.
Uphold MCC’s Purpose, Values, and Vision.
Abide by MCC’s Corporate Culture Responsibilities.
Perform other duties as may be assigned cheerfully and willingly.
Requirements:

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's degree in finance or related field required.
Minimum of 3 to 5 years of financial planning and analysis experience in a hospital/healthcare environment REQUIRED.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES

Ability to work with staff members at all levels of the organization in a cooperative, team-oriented manner.
Exceptionally strong analytical, organizational, communication, presentation and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrated experience constructing and maintaining complex financial models.
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft applications to include Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access.
Ability to identify and resolve problematic situations.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, high volume environment.
Strong work ethic and desire to progress and ability to learn new skills on a largely independent basis. Demonstrated customer-service skills.
Be a person of integrity and character, willing to embrace change and make a positive impact in the lives of patients and co-workers.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS OF THE ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

Strength (Lift/Carry/Push/Pull): Sedentary (exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally)
Standing/Walking: Occasionally; activity exists up to 1/3 of the time
Keyboarding/Dexterity: Frequently; activity exists from ¾ of the time
Ability to look at a computer screen for extended periods.
Ability to perform constant repetitive hands and finger motions.
Ability to work in various positions (standing, sitting, bending, and walking) for extended periods of time.
Talking (Must be able to effectively communicate verbally): Yes
Seeing: Yes
Hearing: Yes

EMOTIONAL REQUIREMENTS OF THE ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

Must exhibit stable work behaviors daily.
Must possess adequate individual coping skills.
Ability to remain calm and professional regardless of workload or time constraints.
Must be able to work under stress and remain calm and professional.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

Exposed to frequent and constant interruptions in daily functions/schedule.
Must be available to customers and staff throughout the day.
Required to work extended hours to meet deadlines and to participate in various assigned committees.

Specific Operational Responsibilities

Identify report and request maintenance assistance for work orders. Follow-up as required. - As Needed
Assist in development of job descriptions for clinical departments. - Annually
Assist in establishing work schedules and assignments for staff and new physicians. (i.e., call schedules, managing physician and staff time-off, other coverage areas, etc.) - As Needed
Maintain departmental charge slips as directed by Senior CPM/VP of Operations. - Annually
Attend quarterly professional training sessions (i.e., skill specific). - Quarterly
Perform tasks and duties of absent staff members. - As Needed
Attend events and other MCC functions as appropriate. - When Required
Other duties, special projects or reassignments as directed by Senior CPM/VP of Operations - As Needed
Review and authorize payroll data. Meet prescribed deadlines for submission. - Bi-Weekly
Assist Senior CPM/VP of Operations in administering physician specialty practices, both operationally and fiscally. - Daily
Assist in planning, implementing and administering personnel training, and coordination of medical and clerical duties. - Daily
Work with Senior CPM/VP of Operations to develop and foster professional relationships within MCC in accordance with MCC internal customer service standards. - Daily
Monitor and ensure compliance between departments, physicians, staff and regulatory guidelines. - Daily
Maintain communication with physicians, staff and departments. - Daily
Assist in monitoring and enforcing MCC policies and procedures. (OSHA, Dress Code, and HIPAA, for example). - Daily
Under the direction of the Senior CPM/VP of Operations code and process invoices. - Daily, Monthly, Quarterly
Under the direction of Senior CPM/VP of Operations assist in the development of educational materials and conduct staff in-service training (Coding, insurance and/or reimbursement changes, including other training, updates and changes, for example). - Monthly
Develop and maintain knowledge of each physician pay sources, referring physicians and market resources. - Monthly
Identify, order, pick-up and deliver medical and non-medical related supplies and materials, as needed. - Monthly

Hiring Company:
Delicatessen Services Co., LLC
Overview:
A Boar’s Head Business Systems & Process Analyst is a key analytical resource group that is a part of Enterprise Applications team driven to identify, define, develop and deliver innovative solutions that are in alignment with the organization goals.

The Systems Analyst role is tasked with improving process capabilities, functional & technical requirements, design, and deliverables, while maintaining and improving quality standards. As such the Systems Analyst role is solely responsible for the analysis, design and development of the necessary requirements, functional specifications, and process artifacts to support development efforts for a specific business unit(s). The Systems Analyst leads and coordinates these activities from beginning to end through the use of best practices focused on problem solving, requirements gathering, analytical assessment and deliverables management.

For this particular role focus will be centered on Marketing and Web development technologies. Potential areas of focus and responsibilities include:

Acting as Analyst/Product Owner/Scrum Master for an agile Java/web development team based on Kanban/Scrum hybrid model
CMS administration support, configuration, and process management
Salesforce/CRM administration support, entity and process configuration, security management
E-Learning administration, support and process management
Marketing content management and analytics support
Job Description:
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
General Analytical & Design Duties
Understands how to use technology to competitive advantage and to solve business issues – focusing on web applications’ concepts and business level functionality.
Develops and maintains a thorough understanding of business operations, identifying opportunities for operational efficiency through automation and effective utilization of reporting & analytics tools critical for all business areas (e.g., Marketing, Sales, Distribution, Manufacturing, Finance, Human Resources).
Assists in technical delivery management and relationship management to identifying options for potential solutions and assessing them for both technical and business suitability.
Works collaboratively with IT and the Business resources, assesses people, process, and technology current states, working to evaluate tradeoffs between usability and performance needs, and then utilize outcomes to develop requirements, use cases and user stories according to standard templates, using natural language.
Provides thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs; elicits requirements using interviews/requirements workshops, conducts document analysis, surveys, site visits, plus task and workflow analysis.
Establishes partnerships to conduct/perform decision analysis (options vetting with pros/cons assessed and outlined).
Critically evaluates information gathered from multiple sources, reconciles conflicts in information gathered, decomposes high-level information into details, abstracts up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguishes user requests from the underlying true needs and then transfers the same knowledge to development team.
Partners with knowledge management leads within Boar’s Head to ensure and maintain consistency on Standard Operating Procedures and formal Work Instructions that outline use of web applications and other implemented enterprise-wide applications (Ex. Oracle ERP, Oracle Business Intelligence, Oracle CRM, QMS, LIMS, MES, etc.) utilized in a business process.
Brokers signoff on functional requirements, process documentation and use cases from the appropriate business process/product owners and all key impacted stakeholders.
Assists with writing and reviewing requirements, functional specifications, and detailed design documentation to derive test objectives, develop test strategies, and write test plans/steps.
Assists in creation and maintenance of test plans/scripts and test scripts enabling execution resulting in thorough analysis and accurate documentation of test results.
Supports roll-outs of new and expanding applications/processes/projects.
Process Analysis Specific Duties
Adept at outlining current state and designing conceptual/future state visual process level diagramming and documentation (in Visio and other more advanced visual modeling tools) that help articulate options to reduce costs, improve efficiencies, effectiveness, and streamline execution while keeping quality norms in alignment.
Identifies, documents, and communicates current state of business process, partnering with Technical Delivery Managers, Systems Analysts, and Developers to recommend future state options.
Provides process documentation (to include interaction points with other systems and/or applications).
Business & Systems Analysis Specific duties
Business Systems Analyst is responsible for needs analysis, creating user stories & requirements, managing product backlogs, signing off as Product Owner, and go-live business testing and support.
Identify and develop process improvements and data validation rules to enforce company data policies, procedures, and efficiencies
Fosters understanding of software functions and limitations, usage scenarios, outlines error handling (system/human interaction points) and expected /necessary quantitative measures for success (e.g., expected performance targets, specific percentages for quality improvements)
The Business Analyst assists with defining the methodology, standards and practices for implementing solutions and develops appropriate documentation on projects, as well as ensuring that business requirements are adequately understood and documented. Translates analysis outcomes into application and operational requirements, functional specifications (to include user interface requirements).
Plan, review, and revise configurations and customizations of business systems, as needed to meet evolving needs of the business
Develop, test, and deploy customizations, custom objects, new functionality based on evolving business needs
Develops use cases/user stories that include quantifiable measures for successful outcomes in the designed scenarios.
Partners with QA teams in end-to-end systems testing and coordination of user acceptance testing strategy development and validation.
Provide ongoing training materials to ensure adoption, and deliver training in conjunction with departmental stakeholders
Possesses an understanding and possess some capabilities in development within an OBIEE Technology Stack.
Project Management Support
Assists Technical Delivery Manager(s) in business strategy analysis and enhancement demand management and assists Project Manager’s (PM) in refining project plans/objectives for items responsible for delivering and executes according to best practice methodologies and IT process standards.
Assesses project requirements and works with PMs, resource managers and others delegated as PMs to assess level of effort estimates.
Ensures project success through team alignment towards project objectives and expected results.
Develops and maintains necessary project documentation in accordance with best practices and within the agreed upon project timelines.
Works independently with users to define concepts yet remains collaborative with project managers in order to work in accordance with project strategy and project priorities that the project manager has defined.
Drives and challenges business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plans.
Partners with the project manager to define change requests for missed requirements and scope change, helping maintain the right focus on defined project constraints (schedule, resources, and scope/quality).
Analyst/Product Owner/Scrum Master for an agile Java/web development team based on Scrum
Experience with Atlassian project management tools (JIRA, Confluence) is a significant plus
Communication
Demonstrates strong oral communication skills, including the ability to effectively interact with business partners and internal team members.
Demonstrates strong written communications skills, including the ability to produce clear and concise recommendations, business requirements and/or functional specifications, use cases and user stories.
Facilitates large scale meetings with all levels of the company, clearly articulating objectives and identified next steps.
Communicates technical concepts and issues to non-technical people.
Interacts with all levels of the company with patience, courtesy, diplomacy and professionalism
Education and Experience
A Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, MIS, or related field or equivalent experience.
A minimum of 3 years of experience in a Business and/or Process Analyst role to be considered; to include experience with documenting requirements, functional specifications, use cases, and user stories.
Ability to articulate business and technology needs/constraints to IT members and end users alike.
A minimum of 3 years’ experience in a Business Analyst role within an Agile centric construct is mandatory (Agile Certifications such as Kanban or Scrum Master are a plus).
Self starter/motivator and having a proactive and strategic mindset are a must
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Strong collaboration and coalition building skills
Other projects and responsibilities may be added at the manager’s discretion.
Hands on experience and proficiency with the full Microsoft Office Suite, Microsoft Project, Microsoft Visio, SmartDraw.
Technology and software comprehension –
Experience with Java based CMS systems
Experience with Salesforce/CRM systems
Experience in UI/UX Design or Graphic Design is a plus.
Experience with web application quality assurance testing
Experience with application performance testing
Awareness/knowledge of with Web development technologies is a plus.
Examples:
HTML; CSS; JavaScript (React), CSS
Docker and Kubernetes
Apache Kafka
iSpring
RESTful web services
Language Skills
Well-developed communication skills - oral, written, listening. Must have excellent interpersonal skills.
Physical Demands & Work Environment
This position requires working in an office environment.
Occasional travel may be required.
This is primarily a first shift position but adjustments to shift start/end times may be required depending on future production support schedules.
Availability for on-call during non-business hours is required.
After-hours and weekend work is intermittently required for system troubleshooting, maintenance, and upgrades.
Location:
Sarasota, FL
Time Type:
Full time
Department:
Management Information Systems

Availity delivers revenue cycle and related business solutions for health care professionals who want to build healthy, thriving organizations. Availity has the powerful tools, actionable insights and expansive network reach that medical businesses need to get an edge in an industry constantly redefined by change.
At Availity, we're not just another Healthcare Technology company; we're pioneers reshaping the future of healthcare! With our headquarters in vibrant Jacksonville, FL, and an exciting office in Bangalore, India, along with an exceptional remote workforce across the United States, we're a global team united by a powerful mission.
We're on a mission to bring the focus back to what truly matters – patient care. As the leading healthcare engagement platform, we're the heartbeat of an industry that impacts millions. With over 2 million providers connected to health plans, and processing over 12 billion transactions annually, our influence is continually expanding.
Join our energetic, dynamic, and forward-thinking team where your ideas are celebrated, innovation is encouraged, and every contribution counts. We're transforming the healthcare landscape, solving communication challenges, and creating connections that empower the nation's premier healthcare ecosystem.

Reporting into the Senior Director, Product Management, the Payment Accuracy Product Director will be responsible for leading and executing Availity’s product strategy for Payment Accuracy including driving product innovation, managing the strategic roadmap, assuring customer value, and driving commercial results. The successful candidate will work across the business to promote and identify new opportunities to add value to our payment accuracy product portfolio, determine investment priorities, guide development of new capabilities with client/stakeholder input, and ensure that the value is communicated and recognized throughout the organization and market. Additionally, the Payment Accuracy Product Director will develop workforce strategies to support successful team execution.
Sponsorship, in any form, is not available for this position.

Location: Remote, US

Why you want to work on this team:
Work on a team that is passionate about solving the complexities within the healthcare space
Have a deep passion for solving challenging problems in a creative way
Be part of a team that works hard, but likes to have fun along the way
To be qualified for this position you:
10 years of experience in healthcare technology space managing products with at least 5 years in leadership role
Proven success in managing healthcare products from inception to launch
Experience innovating within the Payment Integrity process for health plans and healthcare providers to reduce costs, streamline processes and remove waste for administrative transactions
Develop a business strategy for claim validation capabilities to support payment integrity solutions based on situational awareness of various business scenarios (i.e., benefit and/or provider configuration, COB, claims payment logic, etc.)
Define measures of success and develop ROI tools to demonstrate the success of payment accuracy solutions to enable the adoption of payment accuracy tools earlier in claims processing (i.e., pre-adjudication)
Knowledge of Product Development Lifecycle and experience in developing business cases, market/product requirements, positions, product strategy and roadmaps, pricing and launch materials
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Healthcare, or related discipline
Proven ability to engage effectively at all levels of the organization and to facilitate remote multi-stakeholder teams in decision making
Builds trust, respect and durable agreements with internal and external team members, business partners and customers
Comfort with being a change agent
Willingness to explore and champion innovative approaches to meet customer needs and gain market success
Possesses excellent marketing skills, business analysis skills and strong strategic thinking capabilities
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Self-motivated, detail-oriented and a team player
You will set yourself apart with:
Expertise with Payment Integrity and Payment Accuracy Products in the health plan and healthcare provider space
Pragmatic Marketing Certified (PMC)
Master’s Degree and / or an advanced degree in healthcare or technology related field
You will be:
Leading the Payment Accuracy product portfolio – developing and executing the product strategy, managing the strategic roadmap, and ensuring cross-functional alignment to deliver and monetize products
Delivering a commercially viable product ensuring all factors of a go to market strategy are enacted
Driving cross-team innovation and enterprise thinking to actively seek opportunities for growth through product line extensions, partnerships, channel expansion, and operational/cost improvements to existing products
Developing market insights by maintaining close relationships with the market for awareness of market needs. Working with Marketing, Sales, and others as they identify appropriate markets and develops effective strategies and tactics for reaching them
Owning the Go-To-Market strategy and Assisting sales in their interactions with prospects and users
Collaborating with Market Research to strategize, plan, and prioritize market, product, and subject matter research that identify and define opportunities to support and grow business. Specifying market requirements for current and future products supported not only by research, but also through ongoing visits to customers and non-customers
Monitoring costs and resource commitments and creating reporting to ensure internal stakeholders and Senior Leaders are informed on the financial status as well as delivery of the product(s)
Actively evaluating potential partners that could aid in delivery of applicable product(s). Actively assisting in managing such partners to ensure success of product(s)
Owning product metrics, progress, user experience and operational outcomes and regularly communicating outcomes against product goals to drive iterative improvements
Collaborating and influencing across the Availity matrix organization to align the activities of product, marketing, IT, sales, and service teams and their leaders to deliver the product(s)
Ensuring technical feasibility, architectural alignment, scale, and performance of solutions by engaging and soliciting feedback from the right technical, operational or enterprise team members
Attending industry or client facing events where you will represent Availity and be responsible for speaking to the audience on the value of our Payment Accuracy Products
Availity culture and benefits:
Availity is a certified “Great Place to Work”! Culture is important to us and there are many ways for you to make your mark here!
We have several Diversity & Inclusion teams, a Young Professionals Group, a She Can Code IT group for women in tech, and various ways to engage with fellow Availity associates.
Availity is a culture of continuous learning. We have many resources and experts in our tech stack and in our industry that can help get you there too!
Don’t feel like wearing business attire? Cool, you can wear jeans – we are a casual place.
We offer a competitive salary, bonus structure, generous HSA company contribution, healthcare, vision, dental benefits and a 401k match program that you can take advantage of on day one!
We offer unlimited PTO for salaried associates + 9 paid holidays. Hourly associates start at 19 days of PTO and go up from there with all the same holiday benefits.
Interested in wellness? We allow our associates to reimburse up to $250/year for gym memberships, participation in racing events, weight management programs, etc.
Interested in furthering your education? We offer education reimbursement!
Availity offers Paid Parental Leave for both moms and dads, both birth parents and adoptive parents.
Want to work for an organization that gives back to the community? You’re at the right place! Availity partners with various organizations, both locally and nationally, to raise awareness, funds and morale as our staff members volunteer their time and funds to engage the organizations campaign.

After you apply, you will receive text/email messages thanking you for applying and then you will continue to receive more text/email messages alerting you as to where you are in the recruitment process.

The Business Analyst, Information Technology will be the discipline of enterprise analysis and planning strategic methods to meet the business goals of our organization. You will strive to meet the company needs by understanding business models and our business operations and integrating them with technology. You will be tasked with analyzing our organization’s efficiency by studying its needs, its business model, its workflows, and its technological systems. Making recommendations to the CIO. This employee will be asked to research possible software solutions to increase work efficiency, estimating costs and time requirements of projects and ensuring deliverables.

MAJOR RESPONSIBLITIES:

Serves as the project level liaison, between the IT organization and business partners, is business oriented with good technical understanding.
Experience with business and technical requirements gathering, analysis, vetting, prioritization and documentation, business process modeling/mapping, testing and implementation.
The key responsibility is to help derive and manage the requirements, work with inhouse and external developers to build solutions or integrate, or customize cloud/SAAS/custom type solutions etc. to ensure requirements are met in technology deliverables.
Captures business requirements and translates them actionable technical specifications, functional specifications, and system and data mappings, and works seamlessly with Information Technology engineers to translate, construct and deliver the technical solution. This includes researching and analyzing user’s business requirements, technical specifications, writing test plans in support of business functions, process knowledge and system requirements.
Serves as the SPOC to varied business functions across the IT portfolio of work. Will possess and continuously develop process expertise in the business units supported, as well as functional expertise in the suite of applications supporting those processes. These suite of applications include and are not limited to – custom inhouse developed franchise solution, Greatplains, SSRS and Power BI dashboards, SharePoint, MS Office, MS Project Online etc.
Experience in project management. Has had some exposure managing projects, scope, milestones to deliver on time, within budget and scope. Set and manage meetings and deadlines cross functionally. Direct and oversee project teams manage issue resolutions and communicate progress of projects to all stakeholders, etc.
Vendor management experience for technical escalations a plus. Experience creating SOW’s and RFP’s to vendors when needed and reviewing proposals and statements of work in response a plus.
Some weekend, off hour work required for maintenance and production releases

Qualifications:

8+ years in a technical BA role
8+ years enterprise IT experience
8+ years managing enterprise projects ie ERP implementations, Inventory and supply chain etc.
Bachelor’s degree required in MIS/CIS, computer science, or related role 3-5 years quality assurance or business analyst experience in a software development environment
Understanding of Agile programming; working with shorter release cycle/continuous delivery environment
Strong knowledge of Business Analyst techniques and tools
Please provide portfolio of business / functional requirements, technical specifications, test cases, UAT feedback, deployment plans, process analysis, timelines, RFP’s and other relevant documents
Relevant certifications– CBAP, PMP
ITIL exposure
Experience in franchise industry is highly desirable.
On Site work is a must

Job Description

At AI Cyber Solutions, we are looking for a candidate who could help us develop and implement our existing business intelligence systems. As a BI Implementation Consultant, you would analyze the data gathered, evaluate the current system, implement, and test new ones. In short, transform data into knowledge with the help of analytics tools.

Skills Required

3 – 5 years of business analyst experience or equivalent educational qualifications.


Extensive experience of data mining.


Good understanding of machine learning.


Strong mathematics and statistics knowledge with reporting skills.


Good experience using business intelligence tools and data processing tools like Tableau, Hadoop, etc.


Excellent communication skills.

Tasks to be Performed

Test, implement, and record BI systems.


Evaluate existing data-gathering process and analytics systems.


Build machine learning algorithms and predictive models.


Analyze big data to figure out trends and patterns.


Translate business requirements into technical specifications.


Use data visualization techniques and tools to present the information obtained.

Job Description

How will you make a difference as a Senior Business Immigration Analyst at Fragomen:
Perform a range of case related duties, including drafting email correspondence, letters and documentation to clients, government agencies, and colleagues

Compile and summarizing data for clients, managers, and reporting needs
Learn about the various types of immigration matters

Provide status updates to clients and senior level team members
Request, collect, and file documents in proper order
Update case management system
Build knowledge of firm and client processes
Depend on others for instruction, guidance, and direction
Meet assigned deadlines and communicate case progress/status/issues to supervisor

Let’s talk if you have the following qualifications and experience:
Bachelor’s degree, associate degree, or Paralegal Certification

A client service mindset, attention to detail and desire to achieve a high level of productivity

The ability to prioritize, meet deadlines and escalate case issues to supervisor
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to contribute to positive work environment, effectively collaborate and promote teamwork

Overview:
It's an exciting time to be a member of the Fisher Investments Technology Department. We're investing in the future of our firm's technology and are building our team to achieve global growth. We are looking for a Business Analyst to support our Technology Business Services team. If you are looking for an opportunity to make a difference as we develop scalable and strategic solutions to support our global growth, we want to hear from you!

The Opportunity:

The Business Analyst (Portfolio Management Technology) will perform daily health checks on Fisher’s OMS platform – Charles River – to ensure the following: System is up and running, daily data feeds are processed, system workflows remain operational and connectivity from Charles River to Brokers and Custodians are working (FIX, SWIFT). The Business Analyst will also step in to support the various business stakeholders in different aspects of the Order Management and Execution Management System. You will report to an Application Development Team Leader.

The Day-to-Day:
Troubleshoot any outages identified during health checks
Engage vendors and our teams to resolve any issues identified
Communicate Issues Identified:
Alert our users and other technology partners of any issues
Daily interaction with users:
Field issues reported by users throughout the day and perform necessary troubleshooting
Field training requests from users
Formulate and articulate ideal solutions in partnership with the stakeholders to gain operational efficiencies over time
Track Production Issues
Log and diagnose production issues and track resolutions to follow
Periodically communicate status or project plans to all partners
Identify trends and take proactive steps to prevent incidents
Coordinate and plan for regular maintenance schedules
Your Qualifications:
3+ years of experience supporting Investment Management - Order Management systems including system configuration & parameter maintenance, user interface configurations & permissioning
18+ months of experience performing start of day health checks on order management systems including FIX heartbeats, data loads, batch completions
3+ years of experience performing business analysis and troubleshooting of issues reported by users on Order management platforms such as Charles River
18+ months of experience with user communications to effectively notify users of planned or ad hoc downtimes, maintenance schedules
Bachelor's degree (B.A.) in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or an equivalent field
Why Fisher Investments:

We work for a bigger purpose: bettering the investment universe. We take great pride in our inclusive culture, our learning and development framework customized for every employee, and our Great Place to Work Certification. It's the people that make the Fisher purpose possible, and we invest in them by offering exceptional benefits like:
100% paid medical, dental and vision premiums for you and your qualifying dependents
A 50% 401(k) match, up to the IRS maximum
20 days of PTO*, plus 10 paid holidays (*17 days of PTO and 3 days of sick time for California employees)
Family Support programs including 8 weeks Paid Primary Caregiver leave, adoption assistance and back-up child care
Opportunity to participate in our hybrid work from home test. This program is a pilot test and subject to change. Based on tenure and performance eligibility, you will have the opportunity to work from home up to 100 days per year
FISHER INVESTMENTS IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

Overview:
The Security Operations Center (SOC) Analyst provides dedicated monitoring and analysis of cyber security events. The Analyst will perform analysis of security events to include: validation, escalation & reporting of indicators or attacks, compromise, threats interest. They are responsible for ensuring the SOC analyze, triage, and suggest remediations to reduce threats in the environment. Deliver excellent customer service.
Responsibilities:
Ability to confidently and simply explain technical security issues.
Familiar with MITRE ATT&CK Framework and TTPs.
Review threats and incidents related to vulnerability scanning and determine root casue analysis, conduct validation and recommend remediation.
Provide the various business units with incident response and threat and vulnerability management services as required by the business.
Conduct hands-on analysis of high volumes logs, network data, and other attack artifacts in support of incident investigations utilizing SIEM platforms.

Provide suggestions, solutions and integrations to improve SOC Operations.

Provide Knowledge of TCP/IP communications and how common protocols and applications work at the network level to include DNS, HTTP, and SMB
Ensure security appliances, data sources and configurations up to date, and
Working knowledge of PowerShell or Python to automate daily tasks.
Works well in a cohesive team environment to include being able to work alone with minimun guidance.

Bachelors of Science or Bachelors of Arts degree, preferred

Carrier is the leading global provider of healthy, safe and sustainable building and cold chain solutions with a world-class, diverse workforce with business segments covering HVAC, refrigeration, and fire and security. We make modern life possible by delivering safer, smarter and more sustainable services that make a difference to people and our planet while revolutionizing industry trends. This is why we come to work every day. Join us and we can make a difference together.

About this role

Manager, SIOP Business Intelligence at Carrier Corporation plays a crucial role in leveraging data to optimize the Sales, Inventory, and Operations Planning (SIOP) process. This role involves collaborating with the Digital team to understand data availability in the AWS data lake and Snowflake data warehouse and using this data to develop informative dashboards in Power BI. The Manager - SIOP Analytics and Data Steward ensures data quality, accuracy, and accessibility, facilitating data-driven decision-making in the SIOP function.

Key Responsibilities

Collaborate with the Digital team to understand the data available in the AWS Datalake and Snowflake data warehouse.
Ensure the necessary data is accessible and appropriately structured for SIOP analytics.
Identify and rectify data quality issues, discrepancies, and gaps that may impact SIOP performance.
Assessment of available data in the AWS data lake and Snowflake data warehouse, highlighting gaps and potential data sources.
Documentation of data quality standards and data governance practices to maintain data accuracy and consistency.
A streamlined and well-organized set of integrated data from various sources for SIOP analysis.
Utilize PowerBI to create interactive and informative dashboards that provide real-time insights into the SIOP process.
Interactive Power BI dashboards that provide a visual representation of SIOP KPIs, facilitating data-driven decision-making.
Understand the SIOP workflow, key performance indicators, and data requirements to design dashboards that enable informed decision-making.
Analyze SIOP data to identify trends, anomalies, and areas for improvement.
Prepare reports and visualizations to communicate SIOP performance and key metrics to stakeholders.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, including Sales, Operations, and Digital, to align data and analytics initiatives with SIOP goals.
Foster a collaborative environment to drive data-driven decision-making.
Suggest process improvements based on data insights and analytics, with the aim of optimizing the SIOP process.
Implement best practices to enhance data-driven SIOP performance.
Develop and maintain data governance policies and procedures to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and compliance.
Establish data ownership and access controls.

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's degree
3+ years of experience in data stewardship, data governance, or data management.
3+ years of experience in SQL, PowerBI or other data visualization tools.

Preferred Qualifications

Strong data analysis and data modeling skills.
Master’s degree in data science, Business Analytics, Information Technology, or a related field.
Experience with AWS data architecture and Snowflake data warehouse.
Experience with Data Cataloguing tools like Atlan.
Certification in data management, data governance, or related fields.
Experience in the field of operations, or SIOP.
Experience with data integration and ETL processes.
Understanding of industry-specific data compliance and privacy regulations.
Project management skills for leading data-related initiatives.
Familiarity with machine learning and predictive analytics.
Ability to design and implement data governance policies and procedures.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Knowledge of the SIOP process and its data requirements.

The Field Service Business Analyst is responsible for preparing metric reports in PowerBI and supporting the processing of Final Field Reports from FS outages. They will also contribute to a variety of process improvement functions for the Field Service and TGR Groups, including but not limited to shipments and returns to site, technology and other inventory management, and document control.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Support and develop Power BI Dashboards and reports for reporting to PGS Leadership on the status of FS and TGR business groups
Support and develop Power BI Dashboards and reports for reporting to FS Leadership on the status of individual FS & TGR work groups
Support FS & TGR Management in understanding the results of the data analysis to aid business decisions
Interprets business requirements and determines optimum BI solution to meet consumers’ needs
Support efforts to ensure data quality, such as following up with data owners when questionable data and outliers are found with specific feedback on how to bring data into compliance (such as CRM and/or SAP information related to outages)
Update and maintain knowledge of Power BI best practices and data skills as the system changes
Process Final Field Reports and perform reviews to ensure all requirements are met, and route based on the completeness of the document.
Actively track the queue of Final Field Reports and work to reduce turn around time by activities such as following up with individuals and escalating where necessary.
Actively support the continuous improvement of processes and procedures.
Participate and facilitate in department and project initiatives.
Provide department support including but not limited to; Communication with office and site operation personnel, timeline tracking, scanning, filing, and document analysis.
Coordinate communications regarding documentation controls and assist users with any questions related to document controls software, creation, and practices.
Facilitate document controls training and awareness.
Participate in training courses and programs as they relate to overall business and personal development, as well as product related developments.
Overnight travel (less than 10%) by land and/or air.
Perform other such duties as may be required
OTHER DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Comply with all safety policies, practices and procedures reporting all unsafe activities to Management and/or Human Resources.
Participate in proactive team efforts to achieve departmental and company goals.
Contribute to building a positive team spirit.
Communicate effectively with subordinates and management at all levels.
Protect confidential information by not communicating, disclosing to, or using for benefit of third parties.
Comply with all company policies and procedures.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EDUCATION
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
Education and/or Experience: Minimum Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution or at least five (5) years of related experience and/ or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Language Skills: Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business metrics and procedural documentation. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, suppliers and the general public. Ability to proof-read documents to ensure they follow grammatical and spelling standards.
Mathematical Skills: Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs. A basic understanding of graphical representations of data such as box-and-whisker, histograms, pie charts, etc.
Reasoning Ability: Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram or schedule form.
Computer Skills: Knowledge of database, project management, spreadsheet, word processing software, and electronic mail. Proficiency in Microsoft PowerBI and other Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Visio, Power Point, One Note, Outlook) Software, and Document Management Software.
