Job Description

We are FIS. Our technology powers the world’s economy and our teams bring innovation to life. We champion diversity to deliver the best products and solutions for our colleagues, clients and communities. If you’re ready to start learning, growing and making an impact with a career in fintech, we’d like to know: Are you FIS?

About the team:

The Product Management team plays a pivotal role in the Worldpay Product Management organization, focusing on end-to-end user journeys for our partner software companies, via our APIs. This team’s priority is to drive the strategy that enables Worldpay to deliver world-class user experiences for the card present merchants. Because this team unifies capabilities across the Worldpay product portfolio, this is a highly collaborative team that works closely stakeholders across the enterprise as well as internal teams such as other Product leaders, UX, engineering, operations and marketing.


What you will be doing:

As a Product Owner for triPOS, you will be responsible for deep and thorough requirements collection and analysis for our partner Line of Business. You will collaborate with a team of Product Managers and owners on product vision and liaison with the technical teams to turn that vision into granular features and user stories.

Understand product strategy, market, industry and client goals·
Work with d stakeholders to understand business problem statements and convert them into user stories.
Articulate product vision and user stories in a manner clearly understandable to development teams
Manage backlog of user stories for one or more products
Establish user story acceptance criteria, accept user stories and refine user stories with Scrum teams.
Review and provide feedback on test plans to ensure application changes meet acceptance criteria.
Create Sprint release plans with input from development teams.
Monitor the development progress and provide updates to stakeholders as requested.
Apply SAFe Agile methods and processes that encourages frequent inspection and adaption.
Planning and review meetings to communicate feedback on development achievements.


What you bring:

We are looking for a dynamic, creative, hands-on Product innovator with the following attributes:
Typically requires a minimum of 5+ years of Product Owner or Product Analyst experience
Experience working within an Agile environment
Strong understanding of business analysis, planning, development and management
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to technical and non-technical audiences of various levels in the organization, e.g., executive, management, individual contributors
Proficiency in problem solving and time management skills managing multiple deadlines
Proficiency to operate independently and within a multi-disciplinary team


Added advantage if you have:

Experience of working for a Payment Service provider, Fintech company, bank or other financial institution
Experience of delivering International Expansion projects for a large organization
MBA degree


What we offer you:

A competitive salary and attractive benefits package
A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
A modern, international work environment and a dedicated and motivated team
The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services & technology
A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities – Worldpay is your final career step!

Work alongside a team of employees to support common company budgetary goals.

Job Title: Analyst – Mobility, Parking, Operations, and Technology Planner
Job Description:
Analyst – Mobility, Parking, Operations, and Technology Planner
Work Location: Tampa, FL
Employment Type: Full-time regular
Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding environment where you will work alongside the industry’s best and most talented, with the opportunity to have a front row seat in planning analyses and decisions for the public and private sector? If so, you have found the perfect opportunity! Walker Consultants is seeking a seasoned individual to assist our planning, operations, and technology practice as we serve our clients throughout our southeast US market share. Our services apply decades of best practices that enhance the users’ experiences and advance the owners’ goals.
Our primary objectives always focus on achieving the following:
Make it easier for people to reach their destinations
Support and encourage transportation mode of choice
Optimize parking and transportation customer service and bottom lines
Improve quality of lives through economic growth and built environments that work for people
Perform due diligence services helping gauge market risk and upside potential
Responsibilities
At this continuing developmental level, this role performs:
Conduct extensive research and analyze data in specific or general parking, mobility, and transit areas using a variety of methods.
Define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Write and present formal and technical reports, working papers, and correspondence.
Identify common problems, issues, and opportunities based on observation, research, and data analysis.
Develop strategies, actions, and projects to address identified issues consistent with community goals, best practices/standards, and applicable regulations.
Develop recommendations and implementation strategies.
Prepare information (i.e. project fact sheets, display boards, slides, online platforms, etc.) to explain projects to and gather input from stakeholders and the public.
Work with and communicate effectively with a broad range of team members, clients, review agencies, and others as appropriate for a range of project types.
Participate in a range of challenging parking, mobility, and transit projects including strategic urban plans, corridor and curb management studies, feasibility studies, and alternative analyses.
Support development of planning, operations, and technology documents with a primary focus on research, data collection, field assessment, data analysis, mapping, writing, and editing reports.
Prepare information to explain projects clearly and succinctly to stakeholders and public, as well as gather feedback and input from community members and stakeholders.
Assist with coordinating projects among team members, clients, and external consultants.
Communicate and interact with team members, clients, and review agencies.
10% travel required - overnight and air travel to client sites.
Qualifications
Two years demonstrated proficiency as an entry-level analyst or planner, or
Master’s degree in business, marketing, planning, architecture, engineering, or other degree appropriate to the area of concentration (mobility and parking planning, parking operations, parking technology, etc.), or
Five years transferable experience in parking, mobility and transportation industry, and
Appropriate verbal, writing, analytical and/or software skills for the specialty area.

Benefits of Joining Walker
As a skilled member of the Walker family, you will be given the opportunity to grow and develop your skills surrounded by committed, talented and enthusiastic co-workers. In addition to competitive compensation, as a full-time employee, Walker offers vacation retreats, tuition and professional certification reimbursement, professional organization membership reimbursement, 401(k) match and HSA employer contribution, commuter benefit accounts, medical, dental, vision insurance, flexible work schedules, and more!
Who We Are
Walker is a 100% employee-owned company of many capabilities offering professional services to clients in the private and public market sectors. Walker maintains a strong foundation as an industry leader in all aspects of parking planning, design, engineering, restoration, and consulting that encompass operations, technology, and mobility solutions engaging a wide spectrum of specialists and renowned experts who have been advancing standards in the industry for several decades.
Walker works collaboratively as a national team to provide sustainable planning and transportation solutions. From small towns to large urban metros and transit agencies, we help our clients build communities that are places people want to live, work, and have fun. For every project, we develop creative strategies that both put people first and are rooted in data and in line with overall goals for transportation, economic development, climate, and land use. We are focused on the future, and our plans and policies are shaped by technology, data, and infrastructure that optimize current and future investments.
You’ll join a dedicated team working with a variety of clients (cities, transit agencies, metropolitan planning organizations, hospitals, airports, universities, developers, and others) on cutting edge projects to plan for the future of transit, manage curb space, and provide more sustainable mobility options for people. This includes planning transit around a system of solar microgrids to power electric bus fleets and local resiliency/mobility hubs.
You’ll have an opportunity to directly test ideas, shape policy, and see your plans implemented. At Walker we go beyond planning, we guide implementation.
Walker Consultants is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE). We invite all qualified applicants to apply and do not discriminate against individuals because of their race, color, religion, national origin, gender, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or age.

Job Summary
The Business Planning Analyst serves as representative to ensure customer requirements are met from receipt of order to delivery. Throughout the order process continual liaison between Sales, Engineering and Operations, for all aspects of order management, customer interface, inspection and delivery coordination. Responsible for quoting and coordinating the shipment of product, preparing shipping documentation and other records to ensure compliance with necessary procedures.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Sales Order Management
Serve as the point of contact between the sales force and other functional departments on customer orders
Review and verify that documents are accurate, consistent with current revisions, and that deviations are properly authorized in advance; ensure follow-up with Sales or customer on any incorrect or missing information
Review price list/specs to resolve issues with Sales and Engineering before submitting for final Bill of Material (BOM) preparation
Ensure that the Terms & Conditions (T&C’s), delivery, and payment terms have been reviewed and approved
Verify that specifications and customer delivery are acceptable with current manufacturing schedule and ensure that the build schedule is executed consistent with customer requirements
Review special requests with applicable departments (i.e. extra manuals and language, letters of credit, inspections, training, extended warranty, painting)
Assist customers with questions about special options, delivery dates, paint, paperwork, etc.
Follow up from customer inspection visits to ensure proper action for open items
Responsible for keeping sales current on progress and all changes
Prepare customer/country specific documents as needed
Coordinate customer supplied product
Perform background checks on customer through MK Denial
Coordinate spare parts requirements included with unit sales
Perform all data entry and maintain files for sales orders both physical and electronically
Prepares and updates the inbound and backlog for management
Provides Metrics to Management including but not limited to: Pricing, Discounts, On time deliveries and sales history
Other projects and responsibilities may be added at the company’s discretion
Traffic / Logistics
Serve as interface between internal and external traffic quote management
Utilize build schedule as planning document and ensure that all transportation is effectively scheduled in advance with service providers
Monitor all transportation activities through tracking and reporting with service providers
Interact with customers and Sales on providing timely shipment updates, tracking status, and ETA of products
Ensure that all documentation required for shipments (BOL, Export Doc’s, Decelerations, LCs etc.) is completed accurately
Coordinate inbound shipments to the US
Approve freight invoices for accuracy before payment to vendors
Finance Support
Draft and issue both Proformas and Invoices to customers as needed
Track payments received
Other Duties
Review Bid and Tender documents as necessary, initiate Risk Memo review
Demo units – Tracking and Reporting
Coordinates and maintains the Sales Agent and Distributor agreements and files
Attend weekly production meetings which include: Build schedule and RTB to monitor production progress and all other assigned meetings by your supervisor.
Provide timely order status updates to Supervisor, Sales, Manufacturing and customer as necessary
Facilitate customer requests as necessary, i.e. issue CE and COO certificates
Ensures that communication externally and internally is answered timely and effectively
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business / Engineering preferred, or Associates Degree with relevant experience
Minimum 5 years of relevant industry experience
Understanding of engineering / manufacturing environment, technical support system, order entry process and business systems is helpful
Ability to work productively and cohesively in a diverse and multicultural environment
Specialized Knowledge, Equipment, and Applications:
Results-oriented; effectively assertive to ensure company and customer requirements are met
Familiarity with contracts, T&Cs, and Incoterm 2000 is helpful; International import and export knowledge is a plus
Strong interpersonal skills; ability to communicate to all levels both internally and externally; ability to establish effective working relationships with customers at all levels ranging from manufacturing mechanics to senior management
Detail-orientated and ability to handle multiple tasks
Self-directed and assertive in a team environment
Ability to prioritize and adapt to changing priorities and unplanned events
Strong problem-solving skills required
Project Management abilities
Effective oral and written communication skills in English; multiple language skills a plus
Advanced computer skills with Microsoft Office, knowledge of SharePoint, MSE, Syteline a plus
Analytical skills – strong knowledge of Excel a plus

At Travel + Leisure Co., our mission is simple: to put the world on vacation. The Sr. Engineer, Financial Systems spearheads all of the application development and support activities across the full Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Applications portfolio. Provides design oversight and serves as technical escalation point for the development, implementation and support of business applications and IT solutions within Information Technology. Provides SME knowledge, technical planning expertise in the areas of application architecture, application design, software development, performance, testing, implementation, and infrastructure. Ensures that the delivered solution meets the technical specifications and design requirements, and all development practices complies with the enterprise standards, best practices policies and procedures. This role will drive technical implementation of in-house application development as well as integration of vendor purchased products and operates across technology boundaries by collaborating with others to fill in gaps in knowledge.

How You'll Shine:

Lead the solution design efforts for the system, ensuring that documented designs meet architectural, industry, and T+L IT standards. Responsible for design specifications of one or more large or critical applications or systems.
Analyze complex business and systems requirements, and designs solutions for applications, data, processes, interfaces, controls, outputs, environment, infrastructure tools/utilities and/or testing that fit within the recommended time frame, architecture, standards and budget.
Lead design and development of formalized solution methodologies using structured software design patterns and best practices.
Provide expertise to identify and translate system requirements into high level design (HLD), low level design (LLD), interface design document (IDD), using structured software design patterns and best practices.
Ensure solution design is in alignment with Enterprise guidelines, meets business expectations, performance SLAs, architectural standards, and meets or surpasses quality benchmarks.
Reviews the Solution Architecture document and creates the necessary design artifacts and contributes to project plans and cost estimates.
Work with developers to develop answers to ad-hoc technical problems and ensures the low-level design adheres to the application design as well as Development Standards, Best Practices, Security Guidelines and Architecture direction.

What You'll Bring:

Bachelor’s degree in information technology / software engineering / computer science / business.

Master’s degree is a plus.

Hands-on, proven expertise and experience with implementations and application support of off the shelf and SaaS based Oracle ERP applications.

Primary career focus on Oracle eBusiness Suite or PeopleSoft Financials as well as expertise with NetSuite / Oracle Cloud Financials and other related technologies in a Financial Systems Shared Services environment.

System Development Life Cycle - Methodology knowledge and practical experience.

Project Management Life Cycle – understanding of PMLC.

Understanding of Data Privacy including PII and PCI Compliance.

At-least five (5) full implementations or upgrade Software Development Life Cycle experiences with Oracle’s Enterprise Resource Planning suite of products, specifically, PeopleSoft, Oracle eBS, and NetSuite, Cloud Financials with regard to the design, development, testing, implementation, and support.

At-least five (5) years’ experience with and acting as subject matter expert on Oracle ERP products within the Record to Report, Procure to Pay, Acquire to Retire, Project Initiate to Close processes.

For eBusiness Suite: excellent working knowledge in designing, developing, and implementing customizations, extensions, interfaces, queries, and reports using Oracle Forms, Reports, SQL, PL/SQL, API, OAF (Oracle Application Framework), SOA, Workflows, Rest API, BI Publisher, and OIC (Oracle Integration Cloud) on Release 12 through Cloud Financials.

For PeopleSoft Financials and PeopleTools: excellent working knowledge in designing, developing, and implementing customizations, extensions, interfaces, queries, and reports using App designer, People Code, App Engine, Integration Broker, Component Interface, XML Publisher, PS Query and SQR reporting on Release 9.2 through Cloud Financials.

Experience in Data Migration and Integration of Oracle modules with third-party applications.

Oracle certifications preferred.

At-least five (5) years of experience with Oracle and Microsoft Database products.

Demonstrated knowledge across infrastructure disciplines and technologies and has a broad understanding of IT standards and methodologies.

Strong functional, analytical, troubleshooting, debugging and problem-solving skills with the ability to establish effective working relationships and contribute in a team environment.

Ability to learn rapidly and to apply formal training to new software environments.

10 years professional experience in software application engineering

5+ years of experience as a software architect, systems analyst, software engineer of which 2+ years must be in a technical lead role capacity

Experience in business process improvement and systems convergence initiatives.

Experience working with offshore development teams

Ability to compose technical specifications, including requirements specification, API specifications, Functional specifications.

Ability to organize, prioritize and direct work activities.

Ability to work and effectively communicate with IT management personnel, peers and outside vendors.

Strong functional, analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills.

Experience in working with offshore consultants within a 24/7 support model.

Experience with XML and enterprise integration technologies including Web Services (SOAP/WSDL).

Experience with both cloud and on-premises technologies preferred.

Possession of outstanding verbal and written communication skills as well as excellent customer service and business relationship-building skills.

Strong business analysis background.

Demonstrated ability to work under pressure.

Proficient in Microsoft Office products

Unless there is a legal requirement, experience will be accepted for the education requirement.

Company Name: The Bank of New York Mellon Corporation
Job Description:
Who We Are


For over 235 years, Bank of New York Mellon (BNY Mellon) has been at the center of the global financial markets, providing the world’s leading institutions the tools, capabilities, and services to be distinctive investors. BNY Mellon has approximately $16.5 billion in revenues and a 23% return on tangible common equity.


BNY Mellon is a leader in the world of investment services and investment management, and our businesses support the full range of stakeholders of the financial system including:

Managing the custody of approximately $37 trillion financial assets of the world’s leading institutional investors, hedge funds, sovereign wealth funds, and corporates
Investing approximately $2 trillion as one of the largest global asset managers across a wide range of asset classes
Providing collateral, liquidity, and funding for the world’s largest banks through our markets franchise
Serving family offices and high net worth individuals through our wealth management franchise
Providing a full suite of solutions to advisors, broker-dealers, family offices, hedge and '40 Act fund managers, registered investment advisor firms and wealth managers
Advising large global corporations on a range of trust and other solutions
Providing integrated managed data services to asset managers


What We Do


Collateral Operations Group Overview

The Collateral Operations group is a global team within the Global Operations & Technology division of BNY Mellon responsible for supporting our clients’ collateral and portfolio reconciliations processes. Our clients include pension funds, endowments, mutual funds, hedge funds and other financial institutions using derivatives to manage their financial risks. We provide processing, inquiry and general support for our clients while working to improve and automate transaction processing systems. We are a center of excellence maximizing specific knowledge around the collateralization of complex derivative products, including swaps, options, forwards, and futures.


Collateral Operations Analyst Role Overview

As a Collateral Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for providing the collateral and portfolio reconciliation support as outlined above to clients on a daily basis. Apart from the daily collateral activities, you will also partner with senior colleagues to identify, develop and implement process changes, and be actively involved in contributing to broader strategic team objectives.


Role-Specific Responsibilities

Performs exchange traded, cleared and bilateral reconciliations for derivative products traded by our clients.
Monitoring collateral calls from counterparties.
Facilitating margin dispute resolution between parties.
Verifying delivery of collateral to clients and brokers.
Applies expertise and judgement in providing quality, and complex client service and support to internal and external clients on a daily basis, including phone interaction, problem resolution, transaction processing, reconciliations and accounting services, and updates to client accounts in a timely manner.
Performs complex operational tasks in a product or functional area. Conducts independent analysis and policy interpretation. Performs complex, manual processing of updates to client accounts or company records. Responsible for reconciliations, including reconciling cash breaks, position differences, and gathering and compiling data.
Serves as the primary point of contact for clients and executes all correspondent requisites in a timely and accurate manner with an understanding of the underlying business and specific client needs.
Provides product knowledge and technical assistance, determining when the more complex problems should be referred to a supervisor or senior professional.
Review and check work of other Client Processing Support staff and help resolve escalated issues.
Responsible for the quality and completion of own work.


Standard Job Responsibilities

Works with external clients to resolve day-to-day issues and direct them to appropriate resources at BNY Mellon.
Works effectively with peers across geographic regions.
Supports clients in addressing operational and technical questions or issues and ensuring requests are executed.
Applies problem solving skills based on precedence and experience.
Uses communication skills to deliver high quality service to a specialized client base.
Provides clients information related to BNY Mellon products and services representing a limited number of lines of business and geographies and directs them to the appropriate resources, as needed.
Leverages a general understanding of broader BNY Mellon services and offerings.
Monitors client inquiries and appropriately escalates non-routine or complex issues to the appropriate team member, as needed.
Tracks and follows up on open items and activities to accurate completion.
Participates in internal activities and initiatives designed to improve the client experience.
Supports a selected number of client accounts of limited complexity.
Involvement in technology projects and enhancements related to our collateral infrastructure.
Contributing to on-going projects, testing and continuous process improvement.
Participates in the onboarding of new clients and new business.
No direct reports.


Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required.
Up to three (0-3) years of total work experience is preferred.
Experience in an operational area and/or client services is preferred.
Experience and knowledge in derivatives, reconciliations, brokerage, trade, settlements and cash processing are all skills transferrable to this role but not a barrier to entry as on-the-job product training will be available.
Process-mindset and an interest in solving complex problems, performing reconciliations, and finding ways to make processes better.
Interest in advancing technical knowledge specific to derivative and collateral product knowledge.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in high-pressure environment.



BNY Mellon is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Minorities/Females/Individuals With Disabilities/Protected Veterans.

Our ambition is to build the best global team – one that is representative and inclusive of the diverse talent, clients and communities we work with and serve – and to empower our team to do their best work. We support wellbeing and a balanced life, and offer a range of family-friendly, inclusive employment policies and employee forums.

Provides consultation to IT and business management on applying technology to business opportunities and planning and implementing cross-functional applications or systems. May allocate/coordinate work within a team/project. Elicits, challenges, and prioritizes requirements using standard processes and templates, and translates into functional design and use case documents. Gathers and analyzes information to assist in development of recommendations to address strategic business objectives that span multiple, global business and technology areas. Participates in industry forums and keeps current on domain knowledge for their specific business and application areas of expertise. Applies experiences with existing software and/or systems development processes to develop better processes to be used in the future. Actively influences software development process improvement initiatives. Provides senior level consultation to internal business groups on process improvement projects designed to improve their business results. Contributes to the achievement of related teams' objectives.

Bachelor's degree in business or technical-related discipline, or equivalent work experience required, advanced degree preferred, 6-8 years of experience in providing consulting advice to senior IT and business management required, experience in the securities or financial services industry is a plus.

BriteCore is seeking a Business Configuration Analyst to help drive its rapid growth. The BCA is a critical pillar of the client implementation team and is responsible for configuring the property and casualty insurance administration system to deliver value to clients. A successful BCA must be able to review and understand clients’ insurance manuals translate the contents into requirements and configure them into our platform. This position requires heavy problem solving and debugging and puts into practice business knowledge of the insurance industry and many technical skills, including light programming such as Python or other scripting languages. Frequent client interactions are necessary and possibly light travel.


The ideal candidate enjoys configuring and building out powerful software applications, has strong logical and problem-solving skills, is self-driven, and has excellent technical and communication abilities. A computer science, engineering, or management information systems background is strongly preferred. P&C insurance industry experience is recommended.


Responsibilities



Fully comprehend insurance materials, including policy and rating manuals, underwriting guidelines, and other information pertinent to insurance activities.
Analyze client materials uncovering risks for potential problems/issues (such as missing, unclear, or contradictory information)
Configure an insurance business framework within our software using client data, internal tools, and basic programming.
Research, troubleshoot and problem solve.
Train internal and external clients on our software administration tool.
Must be comfortable teaming with project managers and interacting directly with clients.



Skills and Requirements

Bachelor's degree in engineering, computer science, MIS, or business with a technical or information systems specialization.
2+ years of experience in P&C insurance is preferred
Proficiency in configuring and managing software as a service (SaaS) applications
Ability to interpret insurance manuals and operational information, or demonstrated ability to learn new domains.
Light programming skills in Python or another scripting language
Strong attention to detail
Critical thinking skills



Benefits

Comprehensive health insurance coverage including medical, dental, and vision
Short and long-term disability coverage
Critical illness coverage and life insurance
401(K) with a company match
Unlimited vacation time
Fully paid parental leave
Fully remote work in a remote-first company

BriteCore is a fully managed administration platform for insurance companies. We focus on building gorgeous, scalable, and usable cloud-based solutions. Our team of top performers enjoys working together and takes tremendous pride and ownership in our platform. The environment is progressive, deploying through AWS using continuous integration principles. We love great technology and it shows in every aspect of our product. Our team enjoys a very flexible, balanced, and stimulating environment. Bring creativity, focus, productivity to your job, flexible paid time off, and remote work.

The Senior Information Technology (IT) Business Analyst will have expertise in Treasury and/or Finance. In this role, you will collaborate with business partners in finance, banking, treasury, and cash management functions, as well as with other IT professionals. This role will identify, analyze, and implement solutions to support key finance and treasury systems and processes. You will define and design, dashboards, interfaces, and reports, and provide functional and technical support to cover these business areas.
YOUR IMPACT:
These duties are not meant to be all-inclusive and other duties may be assigned.
Document and track current and future state business processes and requirements within one or more functional business areas.
Create functional specifications based on business requirements. Regulate and assess changes to requirements and their impacts.
Tracks requirements from business case to implemented solution. Maintains requirements for reuse.
Integrate testing for project and provide support for user acceptance testing.
Assist in defining test scenarios, test plans, test strategies, and the creation of test scripts to ensure requirements from business case implemented into solution.
Provide artifacts (data model, DTIL’s, data maps, knowledge base articles, etc.) and educate the support team. Provide input to production support when necessary.
Identify and gather appropriate business requirements that lead to the necessary solution that satisfy the business need.
Facilitate requirements gathering within one or more business functional areas to develop a comprehensive business requirements document.
Work in conjunction with project manager, and systems analysts to build test plan, business test scripts. Trace test plans/scripts to requirements from business case to implementation solution to ensure accurate results.
Define and create project related policies and procedures, create functional specifications, DITL’s, decisions documentations as well as following Project Management Office (PMO) methodology.

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Finance/Accounting, or equivalent.
Five (5) or more years of experience in Business Analysis, Information Technology, or in a related area.
Analytical, written, and verbal communication skills.
Experience in business analytics and system design analysis.
Experience and proficiency with various web-based software applications including Microsoft Office Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.
Ability to travel up to 20%.
STANDOUT QUALIFICATIONS:
Background supporting IT systems for Accounting, Finance, Treasury/Banking, or Cash Management.
Previous knowledge or experience with any of the following: JD Edwards, Syteline, SysPro, Great Plains, OneStream, Blackline, Concur, WorkDay, Vertex, AP Advantage, Sage, Radley, Avalara, Kronos, Dell Boomi, DevOps

Technical experience to include Python, SQL and OLAP, various Azure services, Databricks, Database Architecture and design for OLAP/Data Warehouse (star and snowflake design). Reporting tools – SSRS, PowerBI
Knowledge of github and its features, including fork, pull request and merge.
Experience working with end users, managers, customer and other stakeholders to analyze user requirements, sourcing data, and building front-end BI Applications for end users.
Ability to articulate complex technical topics in business terms to non-technical audiences
Troubleshoot and use of performance-tuning BI tools, systems, software. Able to resolve data quality/integrity problems.
Experience designing and delivering end-use training, materials, and technical support.

Preferred Skills, Experience and Certifications:

Experience with MS SQL Server, Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services, or Google Cloud Platform a plus (data pipelines, database/data warehouse, etc.)
Experience working using AGILE project management methodology
Background in Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) with ability to manage or perform development duties
Project Management/Business Analysis, Salesforce and healthcare industry experience
Certified Business Intelligence Professional and Azure Fundamentals

Job Title: Business System Analyst - IT Division - Police Services
Job Description:
Performs professional and technical work in supporting enterprise business applications including planning, design, analysis, implementation, integration, and management of various computer systems for the City departments. This position reports to the IT Manager with varying responsibilities dependent upon area of assignment.

Serves as the liaison between IT and the assigned department.
Attends assigned department staff meetings, manages multiple projects, and provides status reports of progress.
Works closely with the assigned department to create electronic forms and business workflow solutions for improved efficiencies.
Identifies and troubleshoots issues and provides resolution.
Monitors system activities and takes appropriate action to minimize down time.
Implements and maintains interfaces to and from other computer systems.
Develops and documents business requirements and project plans.
Develops integrations between systems.
Manages software upgrades with third party vendors and assists in testing and verification of the upgrades.
Contributes to and maintains compliance with IT system standards.
Provides assessment of future departmental and enterprise needs.
Works with network team to maintain and upgrade servers that support the assigned department.
Works with Microsoft SQL server, OBIEE, or similar reporting tools supporting systems and producing reports.
Participate in disaster recovery tests and planning.
Trains the users to be able to successfully use the system, minimize errors, and have knowledge to troubleshoot.
Stays abreast of new tools and techniques available to enhance business processes.
Works with vendor for software support and other technical issues.
Provides assessment of future departmental and enterprise needs.

Depending upon area of assignment, may be required to support:

Development Services:

Software support includes but not limited to: software for building permits, planning & zoning, land management, cash receipts and code enforcement.
Avolve Projectdox electronic plan review software.
LobbyCentral visitor check-in software.

Financial Services:

Software support includes all purchasing, cash management, accounts payable, account receivable, utility billing, payroll, auditing, and general accounting.
Assists and leads departmental efforts in the conversion of the City's legacy financial system.
General knowledge of financial systems including online payment portals and PCI compliance.
Knowledge of Oracle or comparable financial system.
Leads technical integration of all city systems into the financial system.

Fire Rescue Services:

Serves as the system administrator for the Fire NFIRS and ePCR systems.
Manages the databases to support Fire's inventory, station management, and work order system.
Manages and serves as software system administrator of Telestaff scheduling system.

Information Technology:

Software support includes, but not limited to: Laserfiche, Compliance Suite, Halogen, Oracle Cloud Suite, and MCCI JustFOIA.
General knowledge of computer equipment as it relates to computer systems used including but not limited to: desktop and wide-format scanners, as well as servers.

Police Services:

Serves as the application system administrator for the public safety CAD – 911 and Records Management Systems software.
Creates reports and dashboards utilizing Crystal Reports and other BI software.
Integrates or coordinates integrations between internal business applications utilizing programming skills.
Knowledge of SQL and other databases in order to develop scripts for querying data.
Develops forms and builds workflows using programming languages and scripts to enhance City department efficiencies. Preferable experience with SharePoint, Laserfiche or other document management systems.
Manage projects as assigned for software and hardware integrations.
Manage projects for interagency data sharing initiatives.

Recreation Services:

Software support includes, but not limited to: Vermont Systems' Rectrac Activity (web) registration, Golf software, Pontem Cemetery, Motorola irrigation systems, Hiperweb inspection management software, social media, and website content management.
Maintains the activity management software, Vermont Systems, Rectrac, as the software system administrator.
General knowledge of computer equipment as it relates to computer systems used including but not limited to: point of sale equipment, cash drawers, tablets for park inspections, irrigation management, and library distribution systems.
Chairs Recreation Department technology team.
Works closely with the City's Marketing and Communications Division and serves as the website and social media auditor of marketing and public communication in coordination with Recreation Administration.

Utility Services:

Serves as the system administrator for the Maximo system.
Creates reports and dashboards utilizing Crystal Reports and other software.
Integrates ESRI GIS with department software systems and assists with maintenance.
Develops scripts for querying databases.
Develops forms and processes using programming languages and scripts to enhance City department workflow.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

Must have experience and knowledge of the principles and techniques used to support ERP systems including purchasing, cash management, accounts payable, account receivable, payroll, benefits, and auditing.
General knowledge of the principles and techniques used in document capture, processing, and storage utilizing document management systems.
Knowledge of Microsoft Desktop systems, data processing, hardware platforms, enterprise software applications, Microsoft Server systems, Microsoft Structured Query Language (SQL) databases and server, municipal ERP systems, document management system administration and the Microsoft Office suite of products.
Extensive experience in project management for an organization supporting 1500 employees.
Extensive experience in system administration.
Excellent communication skills both oral and written, especially as related to the communication of technical concepts to non-technical individuals.
Ability to organize data, to think logically, and to analyze issues.
Ability to prioritize requests and problems.
Ability to prepare complex reports for assigned department.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and meet scheduled in a self-directed fashion.
Ability to work flexible schedules, on-call support and occasional after-hours projects and upgrades.

Minimum and Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in information technology or closely related field plus a minimum of three (3) years’ experience in system administration of business applications and a minimum of two (2) years’ experience in business process management utilizing Sharepoint, Laserfiche or similar systems; OR
Seven (7) years’ experience in system administration of business applications and a minimum of six (6) years’ experience in business process management utilizing Sharepoint, Laserfiche or similar systems.
Project Management PMP Certification preferred.
Experience with SQL, OBIEE, or similar reporting tools preferred.
Possession of a valid State of Florida Class "E" driver's license required.

Physical Demands and Conditions:

The environmental conditions and physical demands described herein are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.

Stoop and bend.
Reach and grasp objects.
Use manual dexterity or fine motor skills.
Have the ability to identify and distinguish colors.
Communicate orally.
Hear.
Use a keyboard to enter and transform words or data.
Use a video display terminal; and/or
Work in a normal office environment with few physical discomforts.
Lift or carry objects up to 50 pounds.
Stand up for up to one hour at a time.
Climb up and/or downstairs.
Push or pull carts or other such objects.
Working in an area that is somewhat uncomfortable due to drafts, noise, temperature variation of the like.
Working in an area that is very uncomfortable due to extreme temperature, noise levels, or other environmental conditions.
Work with equipment or performing procedures where carelessness would probably result in minor cuts, bruises or muscle pulls.

The Learning Platforms team (LPT), housed within Academic Systems, Innovation, and Experience at the University of Miami Information Technologies, is dedicated to managing academic systems that facilitate communication, collaboration, innovative course design, and flexible educational experiences. This team provides comprehensive support through its help desk and handles system administration and development tasks to develop and maintain academic applications and platforms. The Systems Administrator will work closely with the Office of the Executive Vice President for Academic Affairs and Provost. The System Administrator will work primarily remote (80% or more).

As part of the Learning Platforms team the Systems Administrator is responsible for the following technical and professional duties to support the university (instructors, staff, and students):

1. Provides Tier 3 support services for the University’s micro-credentialing system (Suitable).

2. Performs the setup, development, and maintenance of the micro-credentialing system.

3. Determines and performs necessary system maintenance, including upgrades and updates, configuration, integrations, troubleshooting, quality assurance, debugging, and user testing.

4. Monitors and improves existing processes related to user provisioning, role permissions, and data integration with the student information system and other identity management systems.

5. Defines and configures specifications and processes executed for competencies, activities, workflows, and other operational needs in the system.

6. Identifies, evaluates, and recommends new or updated integrations or processes, including preparing resource plans and budget estimates per existing IT governance procedures.

7. Analyzes and effectively communicates system and business requirements to vendors.

8. Determines requirements and installs the necessary processes to deploy frequent reports on the system to monitor usage, and according to business needs.

9. Creates and maintains a project and operational calendar for updates and communicates the impact of frequent releases on supported populations.

10. Provides guidance, technical documentation, and training resources to IT units, and supported population.

11. Trains other members of the Learning Platforms team on the support and maintenance of the micro-credentialing system.

12. Provides backup support to other systems within Learning Platforms such as the learning management system, test administration system, video content management system, and advising system.

13. Within assigned projects, adheres to university-level policies on data integrity, confidentiality, development, and installation processes across the supported systems.

Department Specific Qualifications

Education:

Bachelor’s Degree in relevant field or any appropriate combination of relevant work experience or education.

Experience:

At least three years’ experience in information technology or any appropriate combination of relevant education.

Experience may include a combination of the following: system configuration, technical support, process improvement, business analysis, or application development.

Experience with system administration of enterprise systems.

Experience with systems integration.

Experience working with faculty, staff, and students to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to micro credentialing. (Preferred).

Knowledge, Skills, and Attitudes:

Skill in completing assignments accurately and with attention to detail.

Ability to analyze, organize and prioritize work under pressure while meeting deadlines.

Ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues with a responsive attitude.

Ability to work independently and collaborate with others at all levels of the organization as well as vendors.

Ability to gain new technical skills quickly.

Strong oral and written communication skills; ability to communicate complex technical concepts in easy-to-understand terms.

Ability to process and handle confidential information with discretion.

Ability to work evenings, nights, and weekends as necessary.

Commitment to the University's core values.

We welcome individuals with an interest in our organization to submit their applications. Any appropriate combination of relevant education, experience and/or certifications may be considered.

SUMMARY: As part of a leading global aerospace distributor, this position is part of a Supply Chain and Planning team responsible for supplier long term agreements, contract negotiations, and overall relationships, as well as analyzing inventory and sales together to develop key metrics and strategies that will maximize profitability and inventory health while meeting customer needs and supplier contractual requirements. It will require a detail-oriented self-starter with exceptional Business Intelligence, supplier management, and analytical skills.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Negotiation and business development of long-term agreements with multiple suppliers and/or manufacturers.
Relationship establishment and ongoing management of multiple suppliers and/or manufacturers, providing data, business reviews, audits, etc as requested or needed.
Analysis will show associated metrics, KPIs, trending, cost control, comparison, what-if queries, etc.
Decision making authority to meet/exceed internal goals, i.e., constantly looking for margin improvement opportunities.
Development and execution of inventory strategy in accordance with company policy to maintain/increase inventory health.
Modeling and analysis of potential new product lines and inventory investments.
Identify, assess, and develop new revenue and profit growth opportunities.
Lead cross-functional reviews and communicate to internal/external stakeholders at business review meetings or as needed.

Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Supply Chain Management, or related field of study.
6-7 years of relevant/technical work experience OR
Proficient in MS Office suite, strong Excel skills and experience with Microsoft PowerBI or another BI tool
Statistical Analysis and Modeling experience / coursework
Team oriented, resourceful and fast learner.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with managing multiple priorities.
Proficient critical thinking and analytical skills
Professional / interpersonal verbal & written communication skills
Polished, professional presence with exemplary communication skills
Advanced negotiation skills
Effective time management, able to identify and prioritize tasks necessary to meet long and short-term objectives.
Fluent in English

Master’s degree
8-9 years of purchasing and/or business analysis work experience.
Expert knowledge of PowerBI or another related Business Intelligence tool
Knowledge of Component Control Quantum

Job Title: Investment Banking Technical Analyst - Assistant Vice President
Job Description:
Investment Banking Technical Analyst - Assistant Vice President
Job ID: R0249805
Full/Part-Time: Full-time


Regular/Temporary: Regular
Listed: 2023-09-15


Location: Jacksonville


Position Overview

Job Title Investment Banking Technical Analyst

Corporate Title Assistant Vice President

Location Jacksonville, FL

Overview

As the Tech Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and delivering significant components of engineering solutions to accomplish business goals efficiently and reliably. Your key responsibilities in this role include active participation in the design of their solution components, investigating re-use, ensuring that solutions are fit for purpose, reliable, maintainable, and can be integrated successfully into the overall solution and environment with clear, robust, and well tested deployments. You should have experience in IT change projects and varying project / program environments (waterfall, scrum/agile, etc.), working with business requirements through to system level functional specifications, in business analysis, data analytics or user experience (UX), using Structured Query Language (SQL) tools (preferably Oracle) to perform data analysis and test data preparation, in a financial domain (capital markets, transaction banking, and wealth management) and/or related support functions, and owning a product backlog, sprint planning, prioritizing stories and driving iteration content. You should be self-motivated with ability to work in virtual teams and matrix/global organizations including appreciation of different cultures during collaborating and sharing.

What We Offer You

A diverse and inclusive environment that embraces change, innovation, and collaboration

A hybrid working model, allowing for in-office / work from home flexibility, generous vacation, personal and volunteer days

Employee Resource Groups support an inclusive workplace for everyone and promote community engagement

Competitive compensation packages including health and wellbeing benefits, retirement savings plans, parental leave, and family building benefits

Educational resources, matching gift, and volunteer programs

What You’ll Do

Will work closely within the areas of Investments: including Custody, Trust, Discretionary Portfolio Management, and Investment Advisory to ensure scope, requirements and solution are properly captured and features/solutions delivered on a timely basis

Work with various vendors to coordinate the orderly transition of the Investments related activities and various upstream and down-stream related activities, as well as understand the necessary integration with satellite systems (Client On-boarding, Case Management, On-line Digital channels etc., Shadowing etc.)

Coordinate and participate in Testing

Deep knowledge of MS Office products

Excellent documentation skills, experience in Business requirement documents (BRD), Requirements and process flows

Skills You’ll Need

Extensive Development experience and Experience with development of IT systems (primarily Dimensional Data warehouse systems), Data modelling (TA), and Data Mapping, Data Migration, and system integration projects with knowledge of Wealth Management and related investment products. Would be a plus, with knowledge in any of the Wealth Management products like TCS BaNCS, Triple A, Temenos Wealth Suite, Avaloq or Expersoft

Knowledge of Data Warehouses/Data flows/transaction flows (TA), trade flows on various instrument types: equities, fixed income, derivatives, CIF’s, Mutual Funds, and related, Agile methods (SAFe, Scrum, Kanban, etc.) and tools (Jira, TeamCity, GitHub, Confluence)

IT tools: Strong experience in Oracle, Control-M, Informatica, Unix shell scripting, (Power Designer would be a plus), Expertise in Programming Languages (PL)/SQL, Java, Qlik, and Informatica ETL (extract, transform, load) to address computational, complexity, and efficiency challenges

Domain Knowledge: Prior experience with Banking / Investment Platforms, Experienced in Wealth Management and Front Office interaction on Pre-Trade and Trade Lifecycle Systems and Booking Systems/Custodial Platforms; Understanding of Tax Lot Accounting, Fees, Corp Actions, and related Custodial/Trust/Investments services

Worked on Supporting Transaction Monitoring process and Data Warehouse changes related to re-platforming project

Skills That Will Help You Excel

Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, and documentation/presentation skills

High degree of accuracy and attention to detail, while being highly organized with ability to commit and prioritize work duties and tasks

Data presentation skills, including an ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams

Be an excellent team worker with the ability to influence and motivate other team members and stakeholders through strong dialogue, facilitation, and persuasiveness

Well-developed analytical and problem-solving experience and ability to grasp new concepts, provide insights and solutions, while maintaining pace with technical innovation

Expectations

It is the Bank’s expectation that employees hired into this role will work in the Jacksonville office in accordance with the Bank’s hybrid working model.

Deutsche Bank provides reasonable accommodations to candidates and employees with a substantiated need based on disability and/or religion.

The salary range for this position in Jacksonville is $78,000 to $110,000. Actual salaries may be based on a number of factors including, but not limited to, a candidate’s skill set, experience, education, work location and other qualifications. Posted salary ranges do not include incentive compensation or any other type of remuneration.

Job Title: Rare Disease Account Manager – Oncology (Miami or Ft. Lauderdale, FL)
Job Description:
Description:

Recordati Rare Diseases, Inc. (RRD) develops high-impact therapies for devastating rare diseases. At RRD, we focus on the few - those affected by rare diseases. They are our top priority and at the core of everything we do.

RRD is a biopharmaceutical company committed to providing often overlooked orphan therapies to the underserved rare disease communities of the United States. RRD's mission is to reduce the impact of extremely rare and devastating diseases by providing urgently needed therapies. We work side-by-side with rare disease communities to increase awareness, improve diagnosis and enhance availability of treatments for people with rare diseases. Recordati Rare Diseases operates three business units including our endocrinology, metabolic and oncology franchises. RRD is committed to attracting, developing and retaining the top talent in the pharmaceutical industry. We provide our employees with a dynamic work environment and the opportunity to grow professionally while making a difference in our patients’ lives.

Reporting Structure

Reports To: Regional Business Director

Direct Reports: None

Areas Managed: Regional Sales

Location: Miami or Ft. Lauderdale, FL

Requirements:

Overview

The Rare Disease Account Manager’s role is to promote the portfolio, to identify key accounts, and establish partnerships with key Health Care Professionals (HCPs), prescribing physicians, hospital pharmacists, oncology nurses and any other key stakeholder at a local level (hospitals and community oncology centers).

The Rare Disease Account Manager will build sustainable relationships with key stakeholders and leverage customer insights in order to develop strategies and solutions which will facilitate access to the portfolio in the hospitals. Collaboration with local HCPs will be key to ensuring appropriate prescribing of our RRD medications.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Day to Day Activities
Ensure daily customer contact through one to one meetings, group meetings, speaker meetings and symposia.
Support marketing and medical to ensure KOL and Ad boards are effective and well attended.
Develop business intelligence reports with tracking and analysis of the above.
Complete company administrative requirements within agreed timelines.

Territory (Account) Planning and Analysis

Prepare the territory for new product launches.
Understand brand priorities and needs relative to each account. Identify prescribers, and influencers relevant to the RRD Pharma portfolio at a local level.
Understand and describe the decision-making process to allow HCPs to access the portfolio.
Understand and describe the patient flow in each hospital, highlighting the key drivers and barriers to achieve RRD Pharma goals.
Define the timelines to access each hospital. Identify members of the Pharmacy commissions, frequency of meetings and estimate when the drugs will be included in the hospital formulary.

Business (Account) Planning

Develop and maintain account plan templates. To include key metrics to identify brand and / or partnership opportunities.
Provide up to date local intelligence via the CRM as agreed with local Sales Director.
Make recommendations for local initiatives or strategies based upon local market access conditions.
Participate in medical/pharmaceutical events (congresses, symposia, seminars).
Obtain and provide information on the properties of promoted products.
Implementation of Local Plans
Deliver agreed launch KPI’s and sales targets, effectively and efficiently.
Assist with development of a business plan with short, medium and long-term objectives in line with the regional and corporate business objectives to drive future business opportunities for product portfolio.
Along with marketing and medical departments, help develop and implement KOL engagement strategy.
Support the Medical team in any need regarding Regional access.
Provide the Medical team with the formularies so they complete them and present them to the champion (physician defending drug before the hospital pharmacy committee).
Engage with Hospital pharmacists and other access local stakeholders implementing relevant projects
To be flexible and accountable in amending the local plan based on local market access conditions.
Administration
Prepare expenses on time.
Track implementation of plans and achievement of objectives using company systems and own processes. Use these methods to identify gaps in performance and plan remedial actions.
Ensure effective coverage and frequency of calls on decision makers and prescribers within the territory.
Record full details of all interactions and discussions with stakeholders on the CRM tool.
Regularly update the CRM database with calls/activities.
Follow all Ethical Code and Compliant policies in any interaction and project with all stakeholders.
Act in full compliance with all laws, regulations, and policies including adverse events / pharmacovigilance responsibilities.

Education and Experience

Minimum of 3 years’ pharmaceutical experience
Oncology/niche/rare disease/specialty product experience.
Experience/involvement in a successful recent product launch.
Knowledge of local market access/payor experience (hospital pharmacists and access process in the hospital setting) is essential.

Knowledge and Skills

Life science degree or higher qualification is preferred and/or Relevant experience in oncology
Written and spoken English language is preferred.
Excellent Planning & Organizational Skills.
Excellent communication combined with good commercial acumen.
Strong presentation skills and business analysis skills.
Teamwork, proactive collaboration and interaction with other teams. Continuous information interchange with the members of other departments from the same accounts.

Work Environment

This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines. Based upon job requirements, employee may be required at times to attend meetings including travel out of state over weekends and nights. Employee must be able to freely operate and travel by car and train/plane modes of transportation. Employee is required to have a valid driver’s license and means of transportation.

Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. The employee must be able to fly via commercial air carrier.

This is largely a sedentary role; however, the employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. Occasionally is required to lift and/or move light to moderate weight up to 25 lbs.

Location

This position will be located in designated territory in the US with proximity to a major airport
Significant domestic travel (approximately 50%) required; occasional international travel

FLSA Classification

This position is considered Exempt

Aroma360 is a boutique Scent Marketing and Branding company that specializes in providing the highest-quality essential oil-based scenting solutions to businesses and individuals all around the world. As the only full-service scent company, Aroma360 guides clients from concept and development to strategic implementation while priding themselves on exceptional customer service every step of the way. Aroma360 is continuously raising the bar for healthy scenting solutions in the industry!

We are looking for a Sales Support Analyst to join our rapidly growing team. As a Sales Support Analyst, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation of our sales processes by assisting sales agents with post-sale activities, managing sales data cleanup, and utilizing your knowledge of Salesforce and Shopify. Your responsibilities will also include running reports to provide insights that contribute to strategic decision-making.

Responsibilities:

Assist in handling refund processes post-sale, ensuring accuracy and customer satisfaction.
Collaborate with the sales team to resolve refund-related issues.
Conduct regular reviews and cleanups of sales data to maintain data accuracy and integrity.
Identify and rectify discrepancies in sales records.
Work closely with the sales and finance teams to ensure accurate financial reporting.
Manage sales data and processes in Salesforce and Shopify.
Generate, analyze, and provide insights from sales reports.
Perform other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Finance, or a related field.
1-2 years of experience in sales support or a similar role.
Knowledge of Salesforce and Shopify platforms.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Excellent attention to detail.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and other relevant data analysis tools.
Effective communication skills.






Joining our team comes with a range of exciting benefits to support your health, well-being, and professional growth, including:

Comprehensive health coverage, including dental and vision insurance, to ensure you and your family are taken care of.
Life insurance provides peace of mind for you and your loved ones.
Paid time off, allowing you to recharge and enjoy life outside of work.
Access to a 401(k) plan to help you plan for a secure financial future.
Employee discount to take advantage of great deals on our products and services.
Opportunities for paid training to develop your skills and advance your career.
Fun and exciting company events.



Our organization is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any candidate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status, or any other legally protected characteristics. We are committed to promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion in our workplace and welcome candidates from all backgrounds to apply for any open positions.

Main Purpose of the Role:

(Information Technology)

Pay Range: $74,297.60 - $81,727.36 Annual Rate

Shift: Monday - Friday, 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM (40 Hours/Week)

Location: 330 West Church Street Bartow, FL 33830

Health Benefits Package, Including Paid Holidays

Must have the physical, developmental and mental ability to perform job tasks, work efforts, responsibilities and duties of the job illustrated below:

MAJOR FUNCTION

Provides technical expertise in Geographical Information Systems (GIS) development, operations, analysis, design, implementation, documentation, and ongoing support for ESRI ArcGIS system and databases for the Polk County Board of County Commissioners (BOCC).

ILLUSTRATIVE DUTIES System Analysis and Design:

Performs system analysis, maintenance, upgrades, implementation, and optimization of complex Windows/ESRI GIS systems leveraging industry standards and best practices.
Translates system requirements into program specifications.
Identifies data capture control methods, database elements, map elements, and symbology.
Responsible for creating,maintaining, storage, and recovery of geographic, text, and imagery data within predefined RTO and RPO.
Ensures the GIS system is operational, supported, secure, and governed based on industry standards and best practices.
Prepares system documentation for internal and client use.
Performs technical work maintaining legacy code and develops new code, as needed.
Maintains and enhances a working knowledge of the required GIS programming languages, coding methods, data access methods, and operational requirements.
Creates test data and scenarios. Evaluates and reports on test result data.

Project Management:

Coordinates with a diverse group of users, divisions and agencies when developing and deploying GIS projects.
Completes accurate program development estimates.
Develops time/cost estimates, cost benefit studies and fit/gap analysis.
Responsible for tracking and reporting the progress of projects to ensure timely completion.
Works with customers to identify project requirements, business processes, and business rules.

Customer Knowledge:

Maintains an in-depth knowledge of the county divisional GIS use cases, applications, and integrations.
Works with customers to resolve issues and effectively manages in-house and vendor support tickets.

Training:

Trains employees in the usage of GIS systems including new user, refresher, and advanced training scenarios.
Assists in the training of junior IT staff members.
Provides advanced technical guidance to other staff members.
Assists other staff with GIS tasks, projects, and integrations as directed.

Written and Oral Communications:

Leads meetings with customers, vendors, and colleagues.
Provides written and oral reportsto management of the Information Technology Division.
Manages vendor interactions effectively.

Disaster Recovery:

Responsible for the design, implementation, testing, and annual review of disaster recovery processes and scenarios for the enterprise GIS system.

Emergency Operations:

In cooperation with the county Emergency Management staff, coordinates coverage and staffing of the Emergency Operations Center GIS section during declared emergencies and training scenarios.

Additional Duties:

Performs additional related duties as required.
Completion of additional educational courses as required.
Position may require travel as needed.

KNOWLEDGE, ABILITIES AND SKILLS

Skilled at working as part of a team or independently as required.
Extensive knowledge of GIS, business analysis, and project management concepts.
Extensive knowledge of system development and analysis methodologies and the ability to apply this knowledge to the analysis and development of geographic information systems.
Extensive knowledge of ESRI ArcGIS Server and ArcSDE software.
Knowledge of MS Windows Server operating systems and virtualization.
Knowledge of relational database management, administration, and optimization.
Ability to translate system requirements into program specifications.
Ability to write, test, and debug GIS scripts and code.
Ability to stay focused on completing tasks and meeting goals.
Ability to follow oral and written instructions, to use independent judgment, and make logical decisions.
Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.
Ability to maintain a positive working relationship with employees, management, and other divisions.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Graduate of an accredited four (4) year college with a bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in Information Systems, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Geography or a related field.
Minimum of four (4) years related experience, including three (3) years in GIS system administration or analysis.
Must have a valid driver’s license and be able to secure a valid Florida driver’s license at the time of employment within this classification.
A comparable amount of related training, experience and education may be substituted for the minimum qualifications.

ArcGIS Server

HTML5

CSS

JavaScript REST API

Join a leading company in the Maritime Industry in a critical role on our IT team! Moran Towing Corporation (www.morantug.com) has an exciting opportunity available as a Product Owner in our Jacksonville, FL office. This full-time, Exempt position reports to the Director, Product and Program Management.




Moran Towing Corporation is one of the oldest companies in America and has prospered by continuously reinventing itself for over 160 years. Starting in 1860 as a tugboat company, we have grown from those roots to become a dominant provider of commercial ship docking services, marine transportation, LNG support operations, environmental recovery, and commercial diving services. While economies, cultures, markets, and technology will always continue to evolve, our steadfast commitment to partnering with our employees and customers to solve our customers’ marine requirements has enabled us to stay the course year after year.




Position Summary

The Product Owner is responsible for driving the execution and value recognition of the product lifecycle to ensure that it meets the user/customer needs. The incumbent is a key member of the agile team in the Scaled Agile framework, acting as the voice of the user/customer. As a member of the (digital) product team, the Product Owner serves as the liaison between the business and the product development (i.e., software engineering and/or configuration) team. This role manages the product backlog and contributes to the overall product vision and roadmap for the company.




Specific Responsibilities include, but are not limited, to:




Primary Responsibilities

Maximizes the value delivered by the product team.
Manages and prioritizes the team backlog, ensuring it is aligned with the customer and stakeholder needs.
Works with product management to define the product vision and roadmap.
Guides the development team in the user story creation efforts, providing clarity from a customer point-of-view and ensuring testability of the story.
Conducts design thinking workshops and interviews to gather user feedback and research.
Gathers and applies feedback across stakeholders, customers, and teams.
Facilitates backlog grooming sessions with the Scrum Master and System Architect.
Collaborates with the product team and business leaders to make implementation decisions producing the best outcomes.
Identifies and resolves product dependencies and blockers with other product teams.
Participates in team events during Program Increment (“PI”) planning, contributing to activities such as retrospectives and break-out sessions.
Participates in Product Owner synchronization sessions with the Release Train Engineer (RTE) or Product Manager, contributing the status reporting of the PI Objectives, addressing any opportunities or issues related to feature development, and assessing any scope changes.
Utilizes the Weighted Shortest Job First (“WSJF”) or equivalent prioritization methodology to provide the most economic value for product development.
Participates in system demos, providing feature-level validation and feedback around the demo.
Develops performance metrics and KPIs needed to manage efficient product delivery.
Manages feedback mechanisms with the customer/user community to drive continuous improvement.



Secondary Responsibilities

Participates in cross-team program, backlog grooming sessions with the product management team, system architects, and RTE.
Manages risks and dependencies across the company product portfolio.
Maintains product-related documentation.
May be required to travel to our remote offices on occasion throughout the year.
Other related responsibilities as assigned.



Required Qualifications

BS degree in Computer Science or related field.
10+ years of experience in the software development industry, particularly data, mobile or web.
7+ years of experience working as a Business Analyst.
3+ years of experience in a Product Owner Role.
Prior product or project management experience.
In-depth working knowledge of modern software development using Agile Scrum and/or Scaled Agile methodology.
Experience gathering customer and market input and translating into actionable insights.
Experience planning and facilitating workshops and other client-facing meetings.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Comfortable working with senior management and stakeholders.
Strong organizational skills and is detail oriented.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to work well both independently, within a team, and effectively communicates with all levels of management.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.



Preferred Qualifications

Experience working with cross-functional teams beyond IT, such as Finance/Accounting, Marketing, Sales, Human Resources, and Operations.
Experience in assessing and implementing process improvement.
Knowledge of the maritime industry.



Physical demands of this position include being able to:

Bend, kneel, reach overhead, and occasionally lift up to 55 pounds.
Ability and willingness to travel as necessary (<15%).



This position description does not cover or contain a complete list of responsibilities or activities. Responsibilities and activities may change, or other responsibilities and activities may be assigned, at any time with or without notice.

Competitive compensation
Career development opportunities
Team-oriented work environment

Health Care Flexible Spending Account (FSA)
Company paid Life, AD&D, and Long-Term Disability Insurance Plans

Generous 401(k) Plan with employer non-elective, matching, and discretionary contributions
