Job Description:

Jacobs is actively searching for an Operations Research Systems Analyst (ORSA) based in Tampa, FL. This role is integral in supporting our strategic decision-making process by employing mathematical modeling and advanced analytical techniques.

Program Mission:

In partnership with Jacobs, the USSOCOM J51 and J52 divisions collaboratively work to fortify the nation's defense against irregular warfare and asymmetric challenges. Leveraging Jacobs' specialized services and expertise, J51 crafts global approaches for SOF applications aligned with DoD's Global Campaigns, while J52 formulates USSOCOM's strategy, policy, and posture. Together, with Jacobs' support, these divisions ensure the precise, informed, and dynamic allocation of Special Operations Forces to uphold and advance the objectives of the National Defense Strategy. In partnership with Jacobs, the USSOCOM J51 and J52 divisions collaboratively work to fortify the nation's defense against irregular warfare and asymmetric challenges. Leveraging Jacobs' specialized services and expertise, J51 crafts global approaches for SOF applications aligned with DoD's Global Campaigns, while J52 formulates USSOCOM's strategy, policy, and posture. Together, with Jacobs' support, these divisions ensure the precise, informed, and dynamic allocation of Special Operations Forces to uphold and advance the objectives of the National Defense Strategy.

Primary Responsibilities:

Formulate and implement mathematical models and other optimization methods to interpret data aiding managerial decisions.
Provide in-depth analysis during strategic planning, command strategy, risk assessments, and evaluation of operational ROI.
Collaborate with Operational Planning Teams (OPTs), Crisis Action Teams (CATs), and other relevant groups as necessary.
Support Jacobs' strategic documentation with ORSA expertise, from preparation to coordination, data collection, and analysis.
Employ ORSA methods and tools to aid joint planning and contingency operations, ensuring that projects are executed efficiently and are of national importance.

This position is CONTINGENT upon contract award, the expected award date is in January 2024. Our recruiting team will follow up with you on your application and will be starting the interview evaluation process immediately.




Here’s What You’ll Need:


Basic Qualifications:

Civilian Education: MA/MS in relevant fields like Social Sciences, Public Policy, Applied Statistics, Operations Research, Systems Analysis; OR Military Education: CGSC Equivalent or higher.
A minimum of 10-15 years of operations research systems analyst (ORSA) experience, with an MS degree in Operations Research.
Active TOP SECRET clearance and eligibility for SCI.

Preferred Qualifications:

Candidates with experience in one or more specialized areas such as SOF, PSYOP, MILDEC, CWMD, CYBER, AT/FP, SNA, Special Programs, Interagency Experience, Intelligence, and CCMD will be given priority.
Previous collaborated with or have experience with USSOCOM.
Experience in data-driven analyses, strategic level studies, and wargames.

Description

Coordinates the Supply-Demand balancing process and efforts to ensure the highest level of customer satisfaction by having the right product, at the right time and the right quantity globally. Influences and enables the company to execute the detailed planning and execution and Business Unit strategies.

Key Responsibilities


Utilize Supply Chain tools and systems to regularly monitor demand and supply exceptions and imbalances; takes necessary steps to prevent and/or correct anticipated supply/demand problems considering all alternatives and consequences of decisions.
Prepare analysis based on agreed priorities for Business Unit sales and builds.
Organize and lead the IBP weekly cadence meetings and ensure proper documentation of identified gaps and actions plans.
Lead weekly discussions with Purchasing to review planned purchases/receipts, trade priorities with suppliers to meet customer needs and identify any purchasing gaps that would need to be resolved to ensure best possible purchased supply.
Participate in weekly manufacturing discussions and administer the weekly supply meetings to establish key actions to ensure optimal manufactured supply.
Identify supply issues associated with established production plans and resolve by collaborating with supply planning, manufacturing, quality and packaging teams.
Coordinate the weekly Demand-Supply balance meetings: provide supply overview and work with Sales, Product Marketing, Customer Order Manager and Demand Planning to manage demand, include new customer opportunities, execute build reviews and make allocation decisions (as needed).
Communicate details of any ongoing inequalities to appropriate groups to facilitate best management of existing inventories until issues are completely resolved.
Work with other BU Demand-Supply balancer to prioritize the right products in case of any conflicts
Participate in monthly IBP (S&OP) meetings by preparing Executive Summary including key challenges, key wins, top priorities and future risk mitigation.
Build internal relationships though excellent problem solving, initiative, collaboration and demonstrating accountability for follow up actions.
Participate in strategy decisions to develop and maintain system item planning parameters, rules and training
Identify areas for Supply Chain process improvements and participate in implementations as needed.
Know and apply the Quality System and any appropriate Federal and International standards.


Skills Knowledge and Expertise

Education:
Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited institution required; Master’s Degree preferred
Experience:
3 years experience in Business Analysis, Forecasting/Demand Planning or Supply Planning
Functional/Technical Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:
Knowledge of and working proficiency with various software packages including Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Must possess and demonstrate strong leadership, team building, and problem-solving abilities
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Self-starter, proactive, well organized and able to make sound decisions from proper analysis of data
Develop product and customer knowledge


About Exactech
About Exactech
Exactech is a global medical device company that develops and markets orthopaedic implant devices, related surgical instruments and the Active Intelligence® platform of smart technologies to hospitals and physicians. Headquartered in Gainesville, Fla., Exactech markets its products in the United States, in addition to more than 30 markets in Europe, Latin America, Asia and the Pacific. Visit www.exac.com for more information and connect with us on LinkedIn, VuMedi, YouTube, Twitter and Instagram.

As the Senior Business Intelligence Manager at Quirch Foods, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing, and managing our Azure-based Business Intelligence solutions. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to leverage data for strategic decision-making and business growth. If you are a seasoned BI professional with a passion for data, analytics, and cloud technologies, we encourage you to apply.

Duties:

Develop and implement business intelligence strategies and solutions to drive data-driven decision making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Design and maintain data models, dashboards, and reports to provide timely and accurate information to stakeholders.
Conduct data analysis using advanced analytics tools and techniques to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement.
Lead the development and implementation of data governance policies and procedures to ensure data integrity and security.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in business intelligence and analytics.

Requirements:

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or a related field.
Strong proficiency with Azure services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Data Warehouse, and Azure Analysis Services.
Expertise in data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing.
Proven experience in business intelligence, data analysis, or a similar role.
Proficiency in analytics tools such as Visio, Tableau, or Power BI.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively convey insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Knowledge of predictive modeling techniques and statistical analysis.
Familiarity with database management systems and SQL queries.
Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively in a team environment.

If you are a highly analytical individual with a passion for driving data-driven decision making, we invite you to apply for the position of Business Intelligence Manager. Join our dynamic team and contribute to our organization's success through the power of analytics.

Job Title: Full Stack / Back-end Engineer - Java / Python / Golang
Job Description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.

At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way.

When you join Team Amex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we champion your meaningful career journey with programs, benefits, and flexibility to back you personally and professionally. Every colleague shares in the company’s success.

Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to our customers, communities, and each other every day. And, we’ll do it with integrity and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they truly belong.

Join #TeamAmex and let’s lead the way together.

As part of our diverse tech team, you can architect, code and ship software that makes us an essential part of our customers’ digital lives. Here, you can work alongside talented engineers in an open, supportive, inclusive environment where your voice is valued, and you make your own decisions on what tech to use to solve challenging problems. Amex offers a range of opportunities to work with the latest technologies and encourages you to back the broader engineering community through open source. And because we understand the importance of keeping your skills fresh and relevant, we give you dedicated time to invest in your professional development. Find your place in technology on #TeamAmex.

From building next-generation apps and microservices in Kotlin to using AI to help protect our customers from fraud, you could be doing transformational work that brings our iconic, global brand into the future. As a part of our tech team, we could work together to bring groundbreaking and diverse ideas to life that power the digital systems, services, products and platforms that millions of customers around the world depend on. If you love to work with APIs, contribute to open source, or use the latest technologies, we’ll support you with an open environment and learning culture to grow your career.




Our Software Engineers not only understand how technology works, but how that technology intersects with the people who count on it every day. Today, innovative ideas, insight and new perspectives are at the core of how we create a more powerful, personal and fulfilling experience for all our customers. So if you’re interested in a career creating breakthrough software and making an impact on an audience of millions, look no further.




You won’t just keep up, you’ll break new ground.

There are hundreds of opportunities to make your mark on technology and life at American Express. Here’s just some of what you’ll be doing:

Taking your place as a core member of an agile team driving the latest development practices
Writing code and unit tests, working with API specs and automation
Identifying opportunities for adopting new technologies
Join a team of engineers that delivers knowledge management solutions to businesses worldwide



At the core of Software Engineering

Every member of our team must be able to demonstrate the following technical, functional, leadership and business core competencies, including:

Agile Practices
Porting/Software Configuration
Programming Languages and Frameworks
Business Analysis
Analytical Thinking
Business Product Knowledge



How will you make an impact in this role?

Function as member of an agile team by contributing to software builds through consistent development practices (tools, common components, and documentation)
Demonstrate increased self-reliance to achieve team goals
Participate in code reviews and automated testing
Debug basic software components and identify code defects for remediation
Enable the deployment, support, and monitoring of software across test, integration, and production environments
Automate deployments in test or production environments
Automatically scale applications based on demand projections



Qualifications

Strong programming knowledge in Java/Python/Go.
Experience in developing REST APIs.
Experience in building Micro services.
Experience working in JavaScript and able to demonstrate good JavaScript knowledge.
Able to demonstrate good web fundamentals & knowledge of DOM
Experience writing adaptive and responsive UI applications
Knowledge of HTML5, React, Redux, Angular, Node
Hands on experience in building REST APIs
Experience in RDBMS and NoSQL databases.
Experience with TDD, BDD and unit testing.
Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) environment and their frameworks
Working in an Agile or SAFe development environment is a plus
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills

BBM




Salary Range: $70,000.00 to $135,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits

The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.

We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:

Competitive base salaries
Bonus incentives
6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
Flexible work arrangements and schedules with hybrid and virtual options with Amex Flex
20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
Career development and training opportunities

For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.

At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.

American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.

We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

Make Things Happen, Humble Professionalism, Franchisee Focus

Overview

The Supply Chain Analyst maintains key financial, performance and process data, and analyses in support of distribution to 25,000 Subway restaurants in North America. This includes financial analysis execution of financial audit, contractual fee adjustments and analyses for the department. The Supply Chain Analyst identifies both real and potential issues with supply chain partners and ensures that corrective action takes place to the benefit of Subway® franchisees.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

The essential duties and responsibilities, knowledge, skills and abilities listed below are required to be successful in this position. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties and responsibilities.

Deep knowledge of Distributor and IPC pricing methodology.
Analysis and management of Key Performance Indicators, including monthly processing of distributor submissions.
Timely and accurate execution of Inventory Revaluation process, including monthly analysis and communication of valuation data. Communicates with supply chain partners for their review, biannual adjustment of base distribution fees per case and coordination with Contracts Administrator for corresponding contract addenda.
Timely and accurate execution of Monthly Distributor Invoice Audits, including preliminary analysis of findings, distribution of those findings to distribution partners for their review and response, documenting the mutually agreed upon final results.
Timely and accurate execution of Drop Size adjustments, Base Fee Tracking and Net Fee Forecasting, monthly Distributor Accounts Receivable Aging and ongoing OTIF analysis, tracking and reporting.
Interacts with IT to ensure data accuracy, provide feedback on process improvement related to existing and future visualization platforms.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities the ability to perform these essential duties and responsibilities.
Other duties as reasonably assigned.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

A strong background in audit and analysis of financial/KPI data is required. The ideal candidate will possess knowledge of foodservice distribution generally and pricing specifically. Experience with Arrowstream, Power BI, Tableau and Smartsheet, along with extensive capabilities with Excel are required.

Ability to stay on track with key timelines and milestones
Ability to effectively communicate verbally and in writing with multi-level personnel as well as trading partners and their representatives.
Must be able to support other Supply Chain Analysts as needed.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to quickly grasp and understand technical concepts and apply them to business needs.
Should be self-motivated, goal oriented, quality driven, and capable of working independently with little supervision.
Must be flexible and able to adapt to changing business needs and priorities
Familiarity with distribution and supply chain processes

Competencies

Action Oriented: Takes on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm while maintaining humble professionalism
Tech Savvy: Must possess or develop a working knowledge of the end-to-end supply chain. Must learn and demonstrate a very deep knowledge of last mile distribution.
Ensures Accountability: Holds self and others accountable to meet commitments, acts with a clear sense of ownership, takes personal responsibility for decisions, actions and failures
Communicates Effectively: Develops and delivers a clear message in a variety of communication settings, attentively listens to others and adjusts their own style
Plans and Aligns: Plans and prioritizes work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals
Customer Focus: Building strong franchisee experience through customer and vendor relationships that delivers franchisee-centric solutions
Collaborates: Builds partnerships and works collaboratively with Logistics, Integrated Planning, Strategic Sourcing and IT to meet shared objectives while gaining trust and support of others
Decision Quality: Makes good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward
Resourceful: Secures and deploys resources effectively and efficiently
Self-Development: Actively seeking new ways to grow and be challenged using both formal and informal development channels

Qualifications and Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Business preferred.
Minimum of 3 years Business Analysis or Audit Management experience required.
An existing general knowledge of the food supply chain is a plus
Existing knowledge and ability to use Business Intelligence & Visualization Tools such as Tableau, Smartsheet, Enterworks, Arrowstream and Microsoft Dynamics.
Advanced knowledge and ability to use Microsoft Office software including Excel, Word and PowerPoint

Leadership Responsibility

No

Travel

This job does not require international travel. Occasionally, local travel within driving distance, and overnight domestic travel may be required.

Work Conditions

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly sitting for long periods of time. Compliant with the ADA, reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.

Hours of Operation

This is a full-time position. Standard office hours of Monday through Friday, 8:30 AM to 5:00 PM EST. This position may require additional work hours outside these work hours, including weekends to complete job requirements.

Job Title: Computer Programmer Analyst II or III (Tyler Community Development and Utilities Software)
Job Description:
This is professional, technical, and analytical work in the research, analysis, and design of complex management information systems especially Tyler Technologies Community Development and Utilities software, the City’s CRM and civic services platform. Work involves development of specifications for complex software programming applications; customized and standardized modification and maintenance of existing software; participation in design and coding activities; active support providing guidance, maintenance, and development services to end users; testing and debugging programs. Work includes considerable consultation with users concerning new or existing business requirements and information processing needs.




Salary: $61,484 - $117,479 ** DOQ

Close Date: Open Until Filled

**The starting salary and selection into a Computer Programmer Analyst position, at level II or III, will depend upon qualifications and experience.


To Qualify


Minimum Qualifications. Applicants must:

Have a valid Bachelor’s degree.
Have two (2) to five (5) years of experience with computer programming and business analysis, requirements gathering, and process flow documentation.
Have experience with programming and development of Tyler Technologies suite of community development applications and utility billing, configuration and setup of Tyler as required, and common interfaces with financial, work and asset management, and other systems.
Have working knowledge of Rapid Application Development (RAD) or Object-Oriented Development methodologies.
Be proficient in the use of multiple programming languages such Javascript, Python, HTML, CSS, .NET, C# or PHP.
Be proficient in SQL for Microsoft SQL Server, Oracle, or db2 query and working with large datasets and complex data models for data mining, analysis, reporting and extracts.
Be proficient in the use of the full Microsoft Office 365 Suite and windows operating system.
Have knowledge of API, ETL, and interface concepts.
Be able to communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.
At the Computer Programmer Analyst III level, possess at least four years of experience in programming or systems analysis with at least six months supervisory experience within a large computer data processing facility.



Desirable Qualifications. Preferred applicants:

Have three (3) to five (5) years of professional work experience serving a technical subject matter expert of the Tyler Community Development and Utilities environment.
Have related work experience in a government business setting.
Are able to plan, schedule and perform work to meet deadlines and organization goals.
Are able to work under stressful conditions and persevere on long work projects of a technical and complex nature.
Are able to work efficiently and effectively in a work team.


Selection Process


IMPORTANT APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS

For purposes of employment, re-employment, promotion, transfer or demotion, the most qualified applicant will be selected to continue in the hiring process. At this point, any prior criminal records will be verified. A prior criminal record will not necessarily disqualify a selected applicant from employment.

The City of St. Petersburg is committed to a Drug Free Workplace and compliance with the Department of Transportation (DOT) drug testing rules. Applicants may be required to successfully complete pre-employment drug testing and/or medical exams.


How To Apply


Apply online at www.stpete.org/jobs - Select Apply for Jobs/Register/View Job Postings. City employees must use the Current City Employee link or use a City computer to access iRecruitment Employee Candidate. The City of St. Petersburg is committed to affirmative action and equal opportunity employment, and encourages individuals with disabilities and veterans to apply for posted positions. In accordance with Chapter 295 of the Florida Statutes, qualified servicemembers/veterans and the spouses/family members of certain servicemembers/veterans receive preference/priority in employment. Eligible applicants are responsible to apply for Veterans’ Preference at the time of submission of any job application. Reasonable accommodations may be made for qualified individuals with disabilities to apply, to interview for positions and to perform the essential job functions.

AtkinsRéalis seeks an energetic and highly motivated self-starter to join AtkinsRéalis in Orlando, Florida as Senior Tolls Business / Data Analyst supporting the Florida’s Turnpike Enterprise (FTE) General Engineering Consultant (GEC) Program, working as an “extension of staff” in the client’s office in Ocoee, FL (metro Orlando area). This position will provide career growth opportunities through development of FTE toll revenue collection business operations and systems projects. Relocation assistance is available.

The ideal candidate will have a background in business operations for toll revenue collection and a broad base of skills, capability and experience in information technology, systems engineering, application development, testing and support, business intelligence, systems business and technical analysis, data analysis, and the supporting tools including SQL and Power BI. Willingness to be a team player and an open communicator is a must.

About us

AtkinsRéalis is one of the world’s most respected design, engineering and project management consultancies. AtkinsRéalis has been providing infrastructure planning, engineering, construction, environmental consulting, urban planning, architecture, and program management services to public and private clients across the United States for more than 50 years. AtkinsRéalis has the depth and breadth of expertise to respond to the most technically challenging and time-critical infrastructure projects and the urgent transition to a low-carbon economy.

Major functions:

Under supervision, applies technical professional competency in Business Financial and Operational Analysis and Reporting, Financial Auditing, Toll Operations, and associated Toll Revenue Systems technology to the investigation of toll business operational needs and problems, the coordination of Toll project activities, and the use and development of computer applications / tools for the preparation of data analyses, studies, reports, audits and other documents.
Carries out job functions within small, project-oriented, multidisciplinary teams of toll professionals and supports direct interaction with clients within the context of project meetings, financial reviews, operations-related activities, and project production and delivery.
Major results expected include high-quality written, verbal, and graphical deliverables in the form of spreadsheets, databases, studies, reports, charts, exhibits, etc.
Projects typically involve high levels of agency involvement or complex technical requirements. Typical projects may include planning and budgeting; alternative analysis; development; issue resolution management; operational analytics and reporting; system testing; and support of maintenance and operations.

How will you contribute to the team?

Assignments require the investigation of a large number of variables and the development of novel solutions to Toll projects. Duties usually include the following:
Uses a variety of tools to perform analysis of toll system transaction data, including investigating anomalies and issues as identified.
Performs regular monitoring and trend analysis of toll system performance.
Analyzes the information generated from the roadside (toll equipment) to troubleshoot issues.
Analyzes business rules and procedures (roadside and back office) to optimize revenue collection and/or minimize negative customer impacts.
Supports the development of various monitoring tools and in-depth analysis of toll systems.
May recommend changes or improvements to systems or operations.
May research feasibility of alternative approaches, technology capabilities, previous experience with Toll system deployments, cost benefits, and client/regulatory agency specifications, and prepares analysis.
May manage Toll efforts in one or various concurrent projects.
Performs other such duties as the supervisor may from time to time deem necessary.

What will you contribute?

B.S. degree in Business, Information Technology or another subject related to Toll Revenue Collection Business Operations / Systems (incl. Back Office and/or Customer Service Center), such as Accounting, Finance, Computer Science, or Engineering. Toll-related Master's degree/MBA can substitute for one year of experience.
This level may be achieved by candidates with four (4) years’ experience since Bachelor's or three (3) years since Master's/MBA.
Without a degree, a minimum of ten (10) years of relevant experience is required.
Relevant work experience would provide exposure to information and communication technologies, toll operations, and/or intelligent transportation systems (ITS), including toll collection systems, toll infrastructure, electronic payment, call centers, or traffic management.
Experience with toll facility/limited access projects is a plus.
Toll agency consulting experience desirable but not mandatory.
Professionalism / Interpersonal Skills – Ability to deal effectively and harmoniously with people at all levels of the organization and to represent the firm professionally.
Client Service – Ability to listen to, understand and anticipate client needs. Ability to track deliverables to meet those needs.
Leadership - Proven collaborative leadership with effective negotiation, interpersonal and partnering and persuasive skills; Proven ability to lead analyst teams successfully.
Communication - Strong, effective technical writing, oral and listening communication skills in English including ability to present concepts verbally; good public speaking ability to groups of people.
Analytical & Critical Thinking - Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skill; Ability to develop and review policies, methods, practices, and procedures.
Management - Strong team and time management skills.
Adaptability – Ability to adapt to changing needs, requirements, and priorities; lead and communicate to ensure staff are working in a coordinated manner.
Technology / Process Transfer & Application – Drawing technology and processes from other industries to successfully improve operations and performance of the tolling system.
Detailed understanding of the practical design and deployment of a wide range of information, communication, and toll operations technologies, including video / violations-processing systems, toll collection systems, electronic payment, toll infrastructure, customer service centers or traffic management.
Ability to travel to project sites and company/client offices throughout the country, if necessary.
Ability to work under pressure of multiple projects.
Knowledge of production support systems and personal computer proficiency. Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Office products, including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Outlook is required. Proficiency in the use of Microsoft Project, Visio and SharePoint is desired.
Proficiency in the use of SQL, Power BI, Python is preferred.
PMP certification is a plus.

Opportunity to work on various projects of various sizes.

Company Name: DoubleTree by Hilton Miami Arpt Convention Ctr
Job Description:
Mission of the Role

Implement revenue management strategies and processes in our client hotels, to optimize and maximize its revenues

Scope of the Role

Implement revenue management operations, procedures, and best practices.
Identify new revenue opportunities.
Provide daily, weekly, and monthly reporting.
Optimize and expand distribution partnerships.
Act as overall business development consultant for the hotel manager/owner.
Challenge and influence hotels to improve service level and operational standards.
Build and maintain strong working relationships with levels of staff at the client hotel.
Travel regularly to each hotel.
Embed a revenue management culture.


Core Job Responsibilities & Duties

Oversee revenue management and distribution strategy of the hotel and manage day to day yield operations.
Daily pick-up analysis, strategy adjustments and reporting.
Perform competitive benchmark studies and follow market trends.
Create and maintain a 13-month rolling demand calendar.
Create and develop pricing strategies in conjunction with the individuality of each hotel.
Provide weekly dynamic forecast of expected results, variances, and budget comparisons.
Manage and oversee strategy for all 3rd party distribution
Responsible for assessing, analyzing, and pricing group business strategies
Analyze overall monthly hotel performance and provide summary report with recommendations to improve long term strategies.
Ensure all related systems are configured correctly, validated, and working to full capacity
Oversee and audit the standards and operations of the reservations department.
Ensure the web site booking process is maintained up-to-date and functional.
Ensure hotel personnel is fully competent in the use of all systems
Work in liaison with hotel sales and reservations departments as a team.
Regularly check the input and the quality of data (segmentation, denials tracking, etc.…) points.
Conduct quarterly property performance review and develop strategic and tactical action
Responsible for best practice standards to include competitor analysis; environmental scanning; market modeling; distribution yield management; business mix yield management; length of stay yield management; inventory availability by channel; pricing control and new pricing concepts
Evaluate performance of distribution partners and contracted rates (OTA, FIT, tour operator, corporate, consortia, crew, groups, etc....).
Reduce the cost of distribution by finding new less expensive means of delivering business
Prepare outline for and support the annual revenue budget process.
Inspire Hotel’s HODs to further embed a revenue management culture.
Advice and coach the client in other operational areas.
Visit the hotels to get first-hand knowledge of all revenue management issues and other key areas

Manage sell-out opportunities; review arrivals report checks on rooms inventory, control guest relation according to AFP Management SOP’s

Block special requests as needed; VIPs, special needs rooms, connecting, etc.
Be aware of all rates, packages, and promotions currently underway
Follow and enforce all AFP Management’s hotel credit policy.
Perform other duties as required from management
Any other reasonable requests made by management.

Personality

Business Development DNA and commercial minded.
Strong sense of need for achievement of goals and success.
Sound ability and knowledge to develop standards of operations and strategic processes
Good analytical and numeric skills for fast data crunching.
Ability to work under own initiative in a highly pressured environment.
Good listening skills and the ability to anticipate business needs.
Able to develop relationships with 3rd parties and hotel teams.
Capacity to read situation, understand environments and respond accordingly
Capable of prioritizing between revenue generating actions and time-consuming tasks with low yield impact.
Ability to work across all levels and functions of Doubletree Miami’s client portfolio under own initiative in a highly pressured environment.
Well-developed interpersonal, adaptive influencing and supervisory management skills
Willingness to travel and ability to interact professionally with other cultures
Mentality of client service and taking responsibility beyond direct duties.
High level of motivation, determination, and commitment.

Experience & Qualifications

2 – 4 years of hands-on Hotel Revenue Management experience.
A strong command of both written and spoken English is required, additional languages an asset.
Bachelors or master’s degree in Hotel Management, Tourism or Economic Studies
Highly computer literate with a high-level command of Excel.
Knowledgeable of hotel technology: PMS, Channel Manager, GDS, CRS, Extranets

I HAVE READ AND UNDERSTAND THE JOB DESCRIPTION AS STATED ABOVE AND ACCEPT THAT ANY OF THE TASKS MAY BE MODIFIED OR CHANGED. I ACCEPT RESPONSIBILITY FOR KNOWING THE MODIFICATIONS AND I OR CHANGES IN THIS JOB DESCRIPTION. I CAN PERFORM THE ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS OF THIS JOB AS LISTED ABOVE, WITH OR WITHOUT REASONABLE ACCOMMODATION.

Vice President, Head of Finance

About OppZo

OppZo is a mission driven FinTech company whose goal is to democratize access to affordable working capital. OppZo's team consists of former government contractors, experienced capital allocators, and entrepreneurs who are passionate about designing innovative and mission-aligned financing solutions to help small and medium businesses grow. We believe that every business owner deserves access to affordable and fair financing when they need it.

OppZo is reinventing how small businesses get access to capital. We are venture-backed and led by veterans in the FinTech space.

About the VP, Head of Finance Role

OppZo's Head of Finance role is an integral part of our growing team and will bring leadership, strategic and analytical expertise to lead OppZo's Finance and Accounting department. Responsibilities include creating forecasting models, cash management across several different funding mechanisms, assessing risk and ensuring all accounting activities comply with regulations. To be successful in this role, you should have experience crafting financial strategies and managing accounting teams, and exposure to private funds. This role reports directly to the Chief Financial Officer. If you are seeking a growth opportunity, want experience in a startup environment and enjoy the challenge of scaling a company through accelerated growth, this role is for you!

Duties and Responsibilities:

Work closely with the CFO to formulate short to long-term financial and strategic plans
You will provide financial direction and oversight to all corporate functions and operations on matters of accounting, financial reporting, internal controls, auditing, tax & treasury
Responsible for managing accounts payable, accounts receivable and relationships with external vendors
Plans, controls, and coordinates staff to ensure that corporate requirements, local requirements, fiscal regulations, and regulatory requirements are identified and complied with timely and in a cost-effective manner
Analyze financial and operational results to better understand the company's overall financial health & performance
Produce models to project long-term growth, accounting for factors that will impact performance
Communicate results and recommendations to senior management that will lead to revenue generation, cost reduction and more efficient operations.
Ownership of relationship with external auditors. Ensure timely and accurate preparation of key schedules for external auditors
Work cross-functionally within the organization to support various stakeholders on technical accounting matters
Assess the impact of new and proposed accounting pronouncements and standards to ensure compliance with SEC and GAAP reporting requirements

Experience

Proven work experience as a Head of Finance/Accounting Director of Finance/Accounting or similar role
In-depth understanding of cash flow management, bank reconciliation and financial forecasting
Hands-on experience with budgeting and risk management
Experience working within fintech, private credit markets, structured finance, and unrated/rated asset-backed lending
BS/BA in Accounting, Finance or relevant field
Actively licensed as a Certified Public Accountant
MS/MBA or relevant certification (e.g. CFA) is a plus
At least 7 years of relevant work experience
Thrives in a fast-paced and diverse environment and able to manage multiple work streams
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills with keen attention to detail, ability to synthesize large amounts of information, analyze risk and identify mitigating factors
Ability to function as part of a flat organization, work effectively as an individual and as part of multiple teams
Embraces speed as a habit with an appetite to lead, learn and problem solve
Demonstrated financial acumen (P&L responsibility, M&A experience, financial analysis, business analysis)
Strong leadership with a demonstrable ability to act as a brand ambassador and culture carrier
Experience working within fintech, private credit markets, structured finance, and unrated/rated asset-backed lending
Government contracting experience a plus

OppZo, Inc. and its affiliates are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Job Title: IT Security - Contractor - L2

6- Utilize statistical data and track incidents for continuous improvement.

9- Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook

2- Cyber Leadership

· Leads Analyst performing cyber and cyber-related and/or cyber operations work.

3- Harris Business Excellence / Quality

a. Provide excellent customer service skills when addressing security related operational impacts.

b. Comprehensively troubleshoot Remedy tickets and Arbor alarms in an expedient manner.

c. Seek out training opportunities for analysts and self.

d. Thorough documentation in Trouble Tickets requests of all related activities.

e. With the anticipation of passing; take at least one Cisco, CompTIA, ITIL, Microsoft, Mange Engine or F5 certification test.

f. Support business continuity by participating on a disaster recovery team and by facilitating on call all HTEN programs.

g. Weekly Case reviews with the Security Analyst and management.

h. SIEM Content Creation Management

i. HTEN program WIKI Reviews

j. A background with RMF experience.

4- Talent / Engagement / Teamwork / Diversity

a. Communicate professionally with internal and external stakeholders.

b. Connect with leadership in a timely manner on job assignments, problems identified, and improvement suggestions (Monthly Case review Management).

d. Ensure new hires are trained effectively.

e. Conducts training of personnel within pertinent subject domain. Develops, plans, coordinates, delivers and/or evaluates training courses, methods, and techniques as appropriate.

5- Cyber Investigations and Analysis

a. Applies tactics, techniques, and procedures for a full range of investigative tools and processes to include, but not limited to, interview and interrogation techniques, surveillance, counter surveillance, and surveillance detection, and appropriately balances the benefits of prosecution versus intelligence gathering.

b. Identifies and assesses the capabilities and activities of cybersecurity criminals or foreign intelligence entities; produces findings to help initialize or support law enforcement and counterintelligence investigations or activities.

c. Analyzes threat information from multiple sources, disciplines, and agencies across the Intelligence Community. Synthesizes and places intelligence information in context; draws insights about the possible implications.

6- Values, Ethics & Compliance

a. Comply with Harris values, code of conduct, policies, government laws / regulations, mandatory training, and safety procedures.

b. 100% completion of all Harris mandatory training in the same month in which the training was assigned 100% of the time.

c. Complete non-Harris directed soft-skills or other values-based training.

7- Education

a. Bachelor’s with 2-3 years of hard experience.

b. Certifications a plus.

3 years

Schedule:

8 hour shift

Security operations center: 3 years (Preferred)
Information security: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Kforce has a client that is seeking a Nuclear IT Business Analyst in Jupiter, FL.

Summary:
The Nuclear IT Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing business processes, identifying requirements, and proposing software solutions to optimize business processes in nuclear energy management. The analyst will be experienced in nuclear energy management software systems and will work closely with the nuclear IT team to ensure that business processes are optimized for improved efficiency and effectiveness.

Responsibilities:

Analyzes business process and practices to focus the design and implementation of information technology solutions that meet customer needs and business initiatives
Collaborates on an on-going basis with the Programmer/Analysts
Applies advanced analytical skills within functional area
As a Nuclear IT Business Analyst, you will gather, analyze, and document business requirements from stakeholders
Identify and implement software solutions that support business processes
Develop detailed functional and technical specifications for software solutions
Act as a subject matter expert for nuclear energy management software systems
Nuclear IT Business Analyst will conduct system testing and facilitate user acceptance testing
Identify risks and issues related to software systems and coordinate resolution
Provide training and support to end-users
Collaborate with other IT departments to ensure integration and alignment of business systems
REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in a business analyst role
Experience developing functional and technical specifications
Strong knowledge and experience with nuclear energy management software systems
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities in a deadline-driven environment
Ability to work as part of a team and build strong relationships with stakeholders

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

SUMMARY/OBJECTIVES

SouthState Bank is a nationally chartered bank that provides consumer, commercial, mortgage and wealth management solutions to more than one million customers throughout Florida, Alabama, Georgia, the Carolina’s, and Virginia. With its Correspondent Banking Division, the Bank serves clients coast to coast.

The Check Fraud Team is responsible for protecting the Bank and its customers from check fraud, minimizing check fraud losses, and supporting branches and bank personnel when check fraud occurs.

The Deposit Operations Check Fraud Analyst’s primary responsibility will include, but not be limited to, the monitoring of real-time queues responding to high-risk alerts for checks drawn on our SouthState Bank accounts. Resolve queued transactions within service level agreements to reduce potential losses.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS


Analyze check fraud alerts and identify fraudulent items when compared to legitimate ones.
Ability to research/analyze data and recognize/evaluate patterns of customer activity.
Escalate cases to the Financial Investigations Unit when applicable.
Meet or exceed the accuracy, productivity and all other goals assigned by management.
Interact courteously and tactfully with managers, co-workers, customers and/or vendors.
Can be flexible to work weekends, holidays and/or extended hours as needed.
Accepts other duties as assigned by the manager.
COMPETENCIES


Strong analytical and account research skills are required.
Ability to work well under pressure, maintaining composure and meeting deadlines.
Work as a team with co-workers to ensure all functions are completed timely and correctly.

Qualifications, Education, and Certification Requirements


Education : High School Diploma.
Experience : A minimum of two years of banking and teller experience is required.
Very good knowledge of Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) and other state and federal regulations pertaining to check fraud and check processing.
Certifications/Specific Knowledge: F amiliarity Fiserv Premier core system preferred.
Demonstrated ability to problem solve, strong written and verbal communication skills.
Basic proficiency with Microsoft Office including Outlook, Word & Excel with strong analytical skills.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to prioritize multiple assignments and to meet required timelines.
Must demonstrate initiative, be self-motivated, flexible and adapt to changing priorities.
TRAINING REQUIREMENTS/CLASSES


New Employee Orientation
Annual compliance training
On-the-job training
Continuously update skills by participating in professional training
PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORK ENVIRONMENT

Must be able to stand and/or sit for long periods of time. Must be able to effectively access and interpret information on computer screens, documents, reports, and cash denominations, and identify customers.

This position is located in a cubicle environment that may be noisy throughout the day. It is also located inside a cooled and heated facility with ability to go to a break room or rest room during breaks.

Telecommuting roles, no matter if hybrid or 100% full time telecommuting, must have a secure home office environment that is free from background noise and distractions. This area also requires a reliable private internet connection that is not supplied by use of cellular data (hot spot). Cable or fiber connections are preferred. Requirements are subject to change, as new systems and technology is delivered.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

TRAVEL

Occasional travel may be required for outside meetings and/or training.

Occasional travel may be required for outside meetings and/or training.

JOB DESCRIPTION


You’re ready to gain the skills and experience needed to grow within your role and advance your career — and we have the perfect software engineering opportunity for you.

As a Software Engineer II at JPMorgan Chase within the Corporate & Investment Bank, you are part of an agile team that works to enhance, design, and deliver the software components of the firm’s state-of-the-art technology products in a secure, stable, and scalable way. As an emerging member of a software engineering team, you execute software solutions through the design, development, and technical troubleshooting of multiple components within a technical product, application, or system, while gaining the skills and experience needed to grow within your role.

Job responsibilities

Executes standard software solutions, design, development, and technical troubleshooting
Writes secure and high-quality code using the syntax of at least one programming language with limited guidance
Designs, develops, codes, and troubleshoots with consideration of upstream and downstream systems and technical implications
Applies knowledge of tools within the Software Development Life Cycle toolchain to improve the value realized by automation
Applies technical troubleshooting to break down solutions and solve technical problems of basic complexity
Gathers, analyzes, and draws conclusions from large, diverse data sets to identify problems and contribute to decision-making in service of secure, stable application development
Learns and applies system processes, methodologies, and skills for the development of secure, stable code and systems
Adds to team culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and respect

Required qualifications, capabilities, and skills

Formal training or certification on software engineering concepts and 2+ years applied experience
Demonstrates understanding of overall software skills including business analysis, development, testing, deployment, maintenance and improvement of Software
Experience in developing, debugging, and maintaining code in a large corporate environment with one or more modern programming languages and database querying languages
Experience across the whole Software Development Life Cycle
Good understanding of techniques such as Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery, Test Driven Development, Cloud Development, application resiliency and security
Emerging knowledge of software applications and technical processes within a technical discipline (e.g., cloud, artificial intelligence, machine learning, mobile, etc.)
Proficient in Pega development as well as multiple design techniques
Working proficiency in Pega toolset to design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software
Good understanding of PL/SQL

Preferred qualifications, capabilities, and skills

Familiarity with modern front-end technologies
Exposure to cloud technologies

Position Summary:

Performs professional internal auditing work. Work involves monitoring activities; conducting operational, financial, and compliance audit projects; providing consulting services to the organization’s management and staff; and providing input to development of the audit plan. Maintains all organizational and professional ethical standards. Works under limited supervision with moderate latitude for initiative and independent judgment.
Responsibilities:
Essential Functions
Assists in identifying and evaluating the organization’s risk areas.
Performs audit procedures, including identifying and defining issues, developing criteria, reviewing and analyzing evidence, and documenting client processes and procedures.
Performs data analysis procedures using analytical tools, such as Microsoft Excel or others.
Conducts interviews, reviews documents, develops and administers surveys, composes summary memos, and prepares and organizes working papers.
Identifies, develops, and documents audit issues and recommendations using independent judgment concerning areas being reviewed.
Communicates or assists in communicating the results of audit and consulting projects via written reports and oral presentations.
Develops and maintains productive client and staff relationships through individual contacts and group meetings.
Pursues professional development opportunities and shares information gained with co-workers.
Represents Internal Audit on organizational project teams and at management meetings.
Maintains reasonably regular, punctual attendance consistent with Orlando Health policies, the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state, and local standards.
Maintains compliance with all Orlando Health policies and procedures.
Other Related Functions
Performs related work as assigned by management.
Maintains all organizational and professional ethical standards.
Works independently under general supervision with latitude for initiative and independent judgment.
Keeps abreast of Orlando Health policies and procedures, current developments in hospital compliance and auditing, and changes in local, state, and federal laws, as applicable.
About Orlando Health:
Orlando Health, headquartered in Orlando, Florida, is a not-for-profit healthcare organization with $9.2 billion of assets under management that serves the southeastern United States and Puerto Rico. Founded more than 100 years ago, the healthcare system is recognized around the world for Central Florida’s only pediatric and adult Level I Trauma program as well as the only state-accredited Level II Adult Trauma Center in Pinellas County. It is the home of the nation’s largest neonatal intensive care unit under one roof, the only system in the southeast to offer open fetal surgery to repair the most severe forms of spina bifida, the site of an Olympic athlete training facility and operator of one of the largest and highest performing clinically integrated networks in the region. Orlando Health has pioneered life-changing medical research and its Graduate Medical Education program hosts more than 350 residents and fellows. The 3,888-bed system includes 29 hospitals and emergency departments – 24 of which are currently operational with five coming soon.
Orlando Health is committed to providing you with benefits that go beyond the expected, with career-growing FREE education programs and well-being services to support you and your family through every stage of life. We begin your benefits on day one and offer flexibility wherever possible so that you can be present for your passions. “Orlando Health Is Your Best Place to Work” is not just something we say, it’s our promise to you.
Qualifications:
Education/Training
Bachelor’s degree in business, healthcare administration, or other relevant field from an accredited college or university.
Licensure/Certification
None.
Experience
Three (3) years of full-time experience in auditing, business analysis, or in a discipline requiring clinical and/or analytical skills. A graduate
degree in a relevant field or relevant certification (CIA, CPA, CISA, CRMA, CFE, or RN) may substitute for one year of required experience.
A combination of a graduate degree and a certification may substitute for two years of required experience.

Job Summary:

The Moffitt Cancer Analytics Platform (MCAP) Product Owner (PO) is a member of the Health Informatics department in Health Data Services. The MCAP PO will bridge gaps between clinical, research, and operational stakeholders and technical teams across the Center for Digital Health. The primary responsibilities of the PO are to ensure MCAP stakeholders' data-related needs are met in a timely manner, and the platform continues to take advantage of the most innovative architecture, technologies, and services to accelerate discovery and facilitate the evolution of Moffitt's suite of downstream analytic products and services.




Responsibilities:

Ensure successful delivery of MCAP services and products.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure successful implementation of data-related enhancements and delivery of associated services and products.
Gathers requirements from stakeholders, articulating value to leadership, driving prioritization efforts, establishing consensus, and developing RACIs and timelines.
Utilize productization principles to develop and maintain roadmaps with milestones that define planned features, enhancements, and releases for MCAP products.
Collaborate with clinical, research, and operational stakeholders to document requests for MCAP work, align requests to strategic goals, define user stories, and assign tasks to technical teams for completion and value delivery.
Continuously explore new technologies, services, and tools and assess their applications to MCAP and associated products.

Credentials and Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Informatics, Information Systems, Computer Science, Data Science, Analytics required; Master’s Degree preferred.
Minimum five (5) years of experience as a Technical Product Owner, Manager, or consultant; preferred 7 years of experience.
Minimum three (3) years of experience as a Business Analyst, Systems Analyst, Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or BI Developer working on large-scale data processing and analytics platforms in development and support roles; preferred 5 years of experience.
Preferred PMI Certified Agile Certified Practitioner (PMI-ACP), Scrum Master Certified (SMC), Certified Scrum Master (CSM), Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO).
Experience working with databases, data warehouses, data lakes, data marts, and analytic tools required.
Ability to work with large datasets and perform data analyses required.
Solid understanding of relational databases, data modeling, self-service data enablement, and complex queries required.
Intermediate SQL knowledge and skills required; advanced SQL knowledge and skills preferred.
Experience with product management and productization principles required.
Knowledge and experience employing agile methodologies in product management required.
Excellent problem solving and communication skills (written and verbal) required.
Flexible work style and comfort working in a flat organizational structure.
Proficiency working in cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure,
Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and Snowflake experience preferred.
Knowledge of data integration techniques, ETL/ELT processes, and data warehousing concepts preferred.
Experience working with healthcare data (structured, unstructured, and semi-structured) preferred.

Location: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center & Research Institute · Health Informatics
Schedule: Full Time, Day Shift, Monday - Friday; 8 AM - 5 PM

Title: Oracle NetSuite Business Analyst

Kaseya is looking for a strong NetSuite business analyst to join our growing Oracle NetSuite team, working in partnership with business owners and development to deliver best user experiences. As a business analyst, you will focus work with the Finance operations, customer experience, other product owners, development team in an agile environment to represent the business throughout product development. This individual will play a critical role in analyzing processes and functional implementation to improve operational experience.

Responsibilities

Financial Expertise: Have a deep understanding of accounting principles, accounts payable (AP), accounts receivable (AR) / Billing processes.
NetSuite Implementation and Customization: Own and lead NetSuite implementations, customizations, and enhancements to meet business needs.

Proactively monitor system health and performance, troubleshoot issues, and ensure data integrity.

Continuous Improvement: Stay updated on NetSuite's latest features, industry best practices, and trends.

Bachelor's degree in information technology or related field (Required)

5-7+ years of experience as a NetSuite Administrator or similar role with AR functional knowledge.
Strong understanding of accounting principles and financial processes including revenue (ARC 606) management.
Strong understanding of supply-chain / order fulfillment functions in NetSuite.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team.
Proactive and self-motivated with a focus on continuous improvement
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities, with attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality solutions.

Job Title: Head of Product Management, Prime Video LATCANZ

Prime Video aspires to be the first-choice entertainment destination for every customer, worldwide. Delivering on the full scope and scale of this vision is contingent on accelerating Prime Video's international growth, helping every customer WW experience the unparalleled selection only Prime Video can offer through its complete suite of marketplace offerings. Head of Product, LATCANZ serves as the General Manager of the LATCANZ regional product. We seek a seasoned product leader, eager to invent new ways to drive customer acquisition and deepening engagement and retention of existing regional customers through ideation, design, development, and ongoing management of products and programs. They will work closely with country and regional operating teams and core Prime Video Product and Tech teams to address growth opportunities and challenges. This includes identifying, building and surfacing the best way to drive benefit discovery and usage when a customer first joins Prime Video and ongoing member retention. They will develop mechanisms to understand and evangelize the unique opportunities and challenges of the regional market, needs of the regional customers, and regulatory nuances that may create headwinds for the business. They will directly lead a team of product managers focused on making CX improvements that make the regional product CX frustration-free and delightful, and features that reduce churn, across all business lines (SVOD, TVOD, Chanels, AVOD, Live Events, Freevee).

Key job responsibilities

Create mechanisms to gather and synthesize customer and market needs, understand current acquisition, engagement and churn trends, understand regulatory headwinds, and customer pain points, and derive insights to power 3YP and yearly operational priorities.
Partner closely with the regional business teams and functional PMs to define long-term vision for PV in Region, including identifying big bets, region-specific table stakes and regulatory features that are necessary for PV to do business in the market, product features that will improve engagement and reduce churn, including product gaps that prevent PV from meeting its selection goals.
Drive alignment of product strategy with senior PV leaders.
Build mechanisms to partner closely with the Core Product and Technology teams to influence their roadmaps to deliver regional needs, and/or co-own initiatives that have a sizeable impact on increasing the depth of engagement of international customers.
Build mechanisms to advocate for global thinking while building hyper-localized CXs, making a step change to the current regional CX.

The International Commerce and Expansion team within Prime Video focuses on making it easy for international customers to experience Prime Video, in their preferred language, on their preferred device.

· Strong communication skills across media types and to all levels

InspereX unites the more than two decades of success in fixed income and market-linked products origination, underwriting, distribution, and education of Incapital with the innovation of Silicon Valley’s 280 CapMarkets and its revolutionary fixed income tech platform, BondNav®. Introduction, Job Description, and Functional Responsibilities:

Candidate will provide cost analyses, cost estimating, advice, guidance and expertise to EGS technical managers in development, implementation, and tracking of all program budget requirements.

Provide cost analyses, cost estimating, advice, guidance and expertise to EGS technical managers in development, implementation, and tracking of all program budget requirements.

Develop charts and presentations for technical managers to analyze variances for Monthly Program Reviews (MPR).

Assist with the NASA EVM implementation and Integrated Product Team (IPT) business processes.
Formulate budget requirements in accordance with budget execution and formulation requirements, technical requirements, and analysis of program milestones.
Create complex Excel templates containing formulas, charts, and links to other resource data in order to develop required product.
Design, build and integrate templates, charts, and presentations used for formulating budget, schedule, and technical execution plans, and special studies/reports.
Develop presentations communicating requirements to all levels of program management and across all engineering and administrative disciplines, ensuring resource requirements are consistent with program needs.

A minimum of 5 years of business analysis experience performing analytical business functions such as financial and business analysis and project management as well as elevating and making recommendations to PMs or management.

Effective and clear communicator with excellent presentation skills
Self-starter with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work in a team environment, be flexible, multi-task, operate with little direct supervision, and meet customer deadlines.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word) and commercial business applications
Experience in working in teams composed of other business analysis personnel.

At Oshkosh, we build, serve and protect people and communities around the world by designing and manufacturing some of the toughest specialty trucks and access equipment. We employ over 15,000 team members all united by a common purpose. Our engineering and product innovation help keep soldiers and firefighters safe, is critical in building and keeping communities clean and helps people do their jobs every day.
The Oshkosh Corporation Vocational segment leverages the power of our people, brands, and strength in technology to improve the safety, cleanliness, and productivity of our communities. The Vocational segment includes market leading brands McNeilus, Oshkosh, IMT, Pierce, AeroTech, MAXIMETAL, Oshkosh Airport Products, and Frontline Communications. Our purpose-built products serve our communities with carefully designed and engineered refuse trucks, front-discharge mixer trucks, fire apparatus, Airport Rescue and Fire Fighting trucks, service vehicles, and command trucks. Our products are designed to perform under the toughest conditions.
Oshkosh Vocational is a segment of Oshkosh Corporation, which is a Fortune 350, multi-billion dollar company. At Oshkosh Corporation we are dedicated to designing and building the world's toughest specialty trucks, truck bodies, and access equipment by working shoulder-to-shoulder with the people who use them.
THE ROLE
As the Principal Business Analyst - Syteline, you will enhance the Syteline business capability through information systems while providing information system support for day-to-day business activities. You will partner with the business leads to provide new functionality that is identified, communicate status and risk in current work and act as a liaison between the business and the technical teams. You will provide the business with a vision of the solution and work with the technical teams to get it accomplished.
YOUR IMPACT
Lead the process for identifying and gathering appropriate business requirements to create the necessary solution to satisfy business needs
Serve as an IT Business Analyst expert in Syteline and understanding business requirements, system documentation and implementation of quality software solutions
Manage changes to requirements, assess impacts of changes, and track requirements from business case to implemented solution
Provide tier 2 functional and technical support for the day-to-day IT support tickets using the service desk ticket tracking system
Execute and define test scenarios, plans, strategies, and the creation of test scripts
Supervise the integration of testing for cross-functional projects and provide support for user acceptance testing
Lead the cross functional test plan creation and partner with business unit subject matter experts (SME) to develop test scripts
Define applications changes required because of support and log development requests in the application development tracking system
Develop and present business relevant presentations with regard to information systems to co-workers, business areas supported and occasionally executives
Partner with the IT infrastructure team with regard to technical framework needs or troubleshooting support issues
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in the IT/computer-related field
8+ years of IT experience supporting ERP and related business applications
STANDOUT QUALIFICATIONS
Recent experience with one of the following ERP solutions: Syteline 7.x, JD Edwards Enterprise One 9.x, Great Plains, Syspro and related add-on solutions
Experience working in a world-wide and complex manufacturing environment
Strong understanding of business processes and technology
Experience and knowledge of multi-tier and cross-platform architectures
Technical expertise using SQL

What you will do

You will work with multiple Plant Materials results within one or multiple PBUs / Region. Supervise and drive implementation for supply planning, supplier delivery, and material control processes to be performed to support required customer service levels and optimize inventory levels for group of plants within this network.

How you will do it
Aligns on the top priorities of the PBU value stream, Supply Chain and rest of the PBU functional leaders and with the global functional leaders to ensure the corresponding Materials actions are implemented to achieve the team’s goals.
Supports Plant Materials Managers and staff; provides technical leadership input, supports performance review delivery, and development plans.
Coordinates standard methodology sharing and basic standardization pertaining to Materials across the assigned plants and represents the corresponding PBU in the Best Practices Sharing Committees from the Materials standpoint.
Directs the progress of the assigned plants in JCMS Material Control principle by acting as a JCMS MC SME which includes coaching, 2nd party assessments, kaizens, acceleration events and other roles and responsibilities as defined. Achieves and maintains Material Control SME certification to achieve these responsibilities.
Leads Materials team in developing and maintaining collaborative working relationships with internal or external customers, driving improved customer service and problem solving in coordination with the corresponding PBU Operations leadership team as well as with the Global Manufacturing Materials and PBU Business Customer Service and Procurement leaders (and the rest of the manufacturing Operations Leadership Team as applicable).
Supports the selection and training of Materials Managers and Staff and required for specific businesses (e.g. Scheduling, Cycle Counts, PFEP, Supplier scheduling, Forecasting, etc.); Identifies Training needs, plans and carries out Trainings
Commits to Materials plans and goals for the assigned plants; leads preparation of all Materials monthly reports, actions plans and analysis; manages specific research and provides analysis as requested. Reports Key Process Figures to Operations and Global Operations and Delivers Materials updates for/ at Management Review meetings
Drives improvement of Inventory, Delivery and Supplier Delivery within PBU to meet KPI goals.
Advises completion of Materials responsibilities in new product launches and introduction of new supply chain entities within PBU.
Advises Supplier Delivery Improvements and Procurement Critical issue activities for assigned plants globally to insure alignment with Customer Delivery expectations, and provide common guidelines for improvement among all plants.
Approves, along with Ops Leader and IBP and Material Control Director, all Inventory Plans for applicable PBU CAR's to ensure appropriate methodology is used and Excess and Obsolete inventory is minimized. Supports Inventory Planning process and approves Quarterly Forecast reviews consistency among all plants.
Takes part in most critical customer audits to assure communication of customer requests and common answer and guidelines for improvements among all plants.
Supports application, maintenance and continuous improvement of the Johnson Controls Manufacturing System (JCMS).
Promotes safe working conditions & practices during plant visits, initiates corrective actions or process improvements as needed.

What we look for
Required
Bachelor’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Logistics, or Business Administration with minimum of ten (10) years experience in a warehouse, manufacturing or production area including at least three (3) years of material management experience.
Bachelor Degree requirement can be setup as an exception with commitment to complete within three (4) years of hiring date only if there are at least four (4) years of Materials Management experience.
Proficiency using ERP & MRP systems.
Leadership experience to maintain effective working relationship and communication with all plants and departments.
Understanding of manufacturing operations, supply chain, and business processes and the ability to effectively communicate and motivate change in a manufacturing environment, across levels in the organization and extending to internal and external partners.
Ability to understand and clarify business needs and develop processes that achieve business objectives is a must.
Extended knowledge of ERP business systems and experience as business analyst helping to design and document processes, including implementing supporting IT tools, or ERP’s like AS/400, SAP, Oracle, or similar ERP systems
Knowledge of MES (Manufacturing Shop Floor systems) to optimize transactional activity in Receiving, Line delivery and Shipping.
Knowledge of and experience working with multiple types of manufacturing operations strongly preferred.
Ability to travel 50%

MBA
APICS CPIM Certification preferred or expected to be obtained from individuals taking this role within 2 years.
