Description


Job Summary

Under general supervision of the Manager, Transplant Business Operations in Transplant Service Line and following established policies, procedures, and guidelines, assumes the responsibility for providing data analytics to drive business operations decision making. Develops and performs analytical and planning functions in support of transplant business operations decision making while proactively identifying areas of opportunity for risk mitigation and revenue maximization. Assists with time capture processes for inclusion within the Medicare Cost Report. Supports or assumes leadership of assigned projects throughout the department as assigned by transplant management. This role is responsible for data analytics and additional support of performance measures, ongoing measurement, data collection, reporting, data visualizations and information dissemination. Responsible for understanding the organ allocation process and working with procurement teams to identify opportunities for improvement to organ acceptance and cost savings. Support Transplant Business Operations Manager and Transplant Administrator in developing annual budget by identifying trends based on actual and future changes to organ acquisition policies. These duties are accomplished in conjunction with the appropriate stakeholders to include representation from appropriate hospital departments, medical staff, Information Systems, Finance, and vendors as needed. Responsible for performing job duties in accordance with the mission, vision, and values of Tampa General Hospital

Who You Are:

You love connecting the dots and can never stop digging. You see a system, technology, widget, doodad, or contraption and you must know everything about it. You must know how it works, how effective it is, how it interacts with other gizmos. Heck, if it is good enough, you want to know how many you can buy. You want to know how it is used and how it can ever be used. This thing may not even exist yet and you want to fully understand it in every possible future.




And you know how to apply your knowledge of numbers to analytical challenges and come up with answers that make sense. You are also patient enough to explain to non-technical people what your numbers mean; this requires charts and graphs and other well thought out graphics that help make sense of your algorithms and equations. Your analysis will matter, and you will need to communicate it to your peers, customers, and history itself.




The bottom line: You are a no-nonsense analyst that looks past the “cool” factor of new systems to see the utility or cost-effectiveness of the newest toys. You use statistical analysis, simulations, predictive modeling, or other methods to analyze information and help decision-makers chose the right course of action.




Who We Are

Infinity Labs is an innovation-focused company with expertise in modeling, simulation, and analysis (MS&A), research and development (R&D), cyber operational technology, and training. Our project portfolio is exceptionally broad and encompasses a wide spectrum of physical scale and applications (e.g., materials, components, subsystems, platforms, and system of systems). We integrate science and systems as part of our overall solutioning approach, and we investigate advanced concepts and technologies with disruptive application potential. The sophistication of our work directly reflects the ingenuity and proficiency of our team. Our workforce shapes the future, and our employees are our greatest asset.




What You’ll Do:

All sorts of analysis. You will use sophisticated computer software to analyze and solve problems, this may include the use of statistical software to simulate current and future events and evaluate alternative courses of action. You will work with experts across fields to understand how each of your pieces fits into the bigger picture. Simply put, you will break down problems into their various parts and analyze the effect that different changes and circumstances would have on each of the parts.




Qualifications/What You‘ll Bring:

BA or BS undergraduate degree in math, physics, or engineering

A minimum of 4+ years’ verifiable experience supporting government (military) programs.
Experience using a high-level language such as MATLAB, Mathematica, Python, or R
US Citizenship is required for consideration, as this job requires a US government security clearance.
Nice to have – Secret level clearance
Acceptable – No current clearance but eligibility to obtain

Nice to Haves:

Experience in specialized simulation software such as AFSIM is highly desirable.
Advanced degree in math, physics, or engineering



Physical Demands:

Must be able to remain in a stationary position and work on a computer for prolonged periods

As a three-time recipient of the Business of the Year award and a recognized 'Best Places to Work' organization, we prioritize employee well-being and foster a culture that values individuals. Our competitive total rewards package for eligible employees, which includes:

Job Title: J35 Special Operations Joint Fires Targeting Analyst
Job Description:
This position requires an active TS/Sensitive Compartmental Information (SCI) clearance.


A J35 Special Operations Joint Fires Targeting Analyst is responsible for gathering and analyzing intelligence data to identify and target critical assets and objectives in support of special operations missions. This role involves precise planning and coordination of fires, ensuring successful execution of military operations.


Compensation & Benefits:

Pay commensurate with experience.

Full time benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, and other possible benefits as provided. Benefits are subject to change with or without notice.


J35 Special Operations Joint Fires Targeting Analyst Responsibilities Include:

Serves as the senior Joint Fires specialist for SOCCENT.
Subject matter expert in the development, planning, prioritizing targets and execution of full spectrum Special Operations targeting as defined in Joint Publication 3-60 and the Joint Fires Targeting Handbook.
Coordinate and synchronize the targeting process with all CENTCOM Components and inter-agency in all aspects of theater and operational targeting.
Enable strategic and operational level joint fires and targeting execution through subordinate commands by coordinating for the required approval authorities, with SOCCENT/Combined Forces Special Operations Component Command (CFSOCC).
Demonstrate expert knowledge of Joint fires and targeting doctrine, policies, processes, and procedures along with demonstrated experience with the Joint Targeting Cycle (JTC). Understand and apply Joint planning, execution, and assessment concepts and doctrine to refine and assess new policies and procedures.
Train and educate command staff on command theater strategic targeting process which includes intelligence support to targeting, Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff (CJCS) Collateral Damage Estimation Methodology, CJCS Sensitive Target approval Process, and related procedures.
Prepare briefs, information papers, and presentations as required utilizing Microsoft Office family of products (i.e., Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, Excel, and Access).
Develop and maintain an electronic resource, to include key points of contact, to be used for mission continuity that may be accessed by all stakeholders.
Performs other job-related duties as assigned.


J35 Special Operations Joint Fires Targeting Analyst Experience, Education, Skills, Abilities requested:

Bachelor’s Degree (BS/BA).
Nominees shall be a former O-4/O-5/WO3-WO5/E7-E8 or mid-grade GS-13 (Step 5 or higher) equivalent with 5+ years of Special Operations experience.
3+ years operational level planning experience including IW/UW planning.
CENTCOM AOR operational experience in the past 5 years.
Knowledge of the Joint Targeting Cycle.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills and experience preparing and presenting senior leadership briefings.
Demonstrated complex problem-solving knowledge and experience using relevant methodologies.
Qualifications and training obtained at Command and General Staff College or service equivalent.
Must pass pre-employment qualifications of Cherokee Federal.


Company Information:

Cherokee Nation Strategic Programs (CNSP) provides support, services, and solutions to federal and commercial customers. The company takes a personalized approach to solving our clients' toughest challenges, helping you make the most of your skills. CNSP is part of Cherokee Federal – a team of tribally owned federal contracting companies. For more information, visit cherokee-federal.com.

Title: IT Financial Business Analyst
Location: TAMPA, FL 33610
Duration: 6 months+

Job Description:

We are seeking an IT Financial Business Analyst to support the Compliance Technology Services (CTS) leadership team.
This role will be responsible for supporting activities with respect to direct financials including reporting, metrics, and analysis of the allocations and overall business office activities.
The resource will also be responsible for ensuring that all regular reporting and ad hoc tasks are delivered in a timely and consistent manner across all areas of the organization.
The benefit of this role to the organization is the oversight of the delivery of business office services ensuring a focus on accuracy, timeliness, consistency, efficiency, and elimination of duplication.

Responsibilities

Provide support leadership to the Sr. Technology Managers on the financial activities related to Software and Fixed Price contract execution.
Assist with the management of all Fixed-priced and Software contract end-to-end activities with Internal teams and Sourcing.
Support forensic analysis and investigation of all FPC and SW financial impacts and proactively address any potential negative impacts
Facilitate payments through the AP workflow and audit invoices on a monthly basis for reporting purposes.
Track all Financial Transfer Requests across groups in GFT for both Fixed-price and Software projects.
Provide information on financial re-forecasting cycles and manage the entries in the financial tools.
Work with Financial Controllers on the monthly accrual process and ensure all finances are reported accurately.
Track cross-sector financials and analyze the monthly trend/forecast across CTS
Analyze financial reports on a monthly basis to find saving opportunities validate the charges and reverse as necessary
Collaborate across GFT on refining systems and global processes. Providing feedback, insight, and guidance on efficiency improvements regarding Fixed Price and software financial processes along with system enhancements to the financial systems (Renault & PTS 2.0).

Job Title: Senior Associate, Senior Security Operations Analyst
Job Description:
Known for being a great place to work and build a career, KPMG provides audit, tax and advisory services for organizations in today’s most important industries. Our growth is driven by delivering real results for our clients. It’s also enabled by our culture, which encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence and supports our communities. With qualities like those, it’s no wonder we’re consistently ranked among the best companies to work for by Fortune Magazine, Consulting Magazine, Working Mother Magazine, Diversity Inc. and others. If you’re as passionate about your future as we are, join our team.

KPMG is currently seeking a Senior Associate, Senior Security Operations Analyst to join our Global Information Technology Group which is part of KPMG International.

Responsibilities:

Be accountable for managing daily security operations which focus on key business platforms ensuring integrity of changes which impact information security and control management
Collaborate with various Information Technology Services (ITS) Global teams on different security operations related tasks, analyze cloud compliance/vulnerability reports, technical review of exception request; help and guide junior team members to manage the service request queue (ServiceNow)
Work together with Automation, Cloud Security Posture Management and ITS Global Operations teams on the implementation, automation, and maintenance of new Cloud security monitoring policies within our cloud environment
Build a deep understanding of current environments, researching, and advising on IT infrastructure
Assist the Security Operations Group (SOG) Manager with daily management of core security operations process
Coordinate with platform Information System Security Officer with the daily management of information security related queries and requests

Qualifications:

Minimum five years of recent security and IT experience is required
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, computer networking, computer security or a related field, or equivalent work experience
Experience with Microsoft Azure is preferable: Microsoft Defender for Cloud, Azure Policies, Azure Application Gateways, Web Application Firewalls, Network Security Groups, among others
Network infrastructure knowledge on TCP/IP and Internet protocols
Experience with Palo Alto Prisma is preferable
CISSP, CISM, CCSP (Certified Cloud Security Professional) or CCSK (Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge) certifications or equivalent experience is preferred

Job Description:
About Enhance Health

Enhance Health is an organization of health insurance experts that leverages digital technologies and a concierge experience to streamline the health insurance enrollment process. Analyze sales data to assess performance metrics, including conversion rates, sales funnel efficiency, and revenue generation.

Fun, Engaging Work Environment
Holiday Pay

The Principal Information Technology Business Analyst has expertise in Payroll and Timekeeping functions. These duties are not meant to be all-inclusive and other duties may be assigned.

Eight (8) or more years of experience in Business Analysis, Information Technology, or in a related area.
Experience in business analytics and system design analysis.
Experience and proficiency with various web-based software applications including Microsoft Office Word, Excel, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.
Ability to travel up to 20%.

Background supporting IT systems for HRIS, Payroll, or Timekeeping Systems

Recent experience with ERP systems, interfaces, and data mapping.
Basic or Advanced understanding of SQL.

Facility Profile
TGH is the area’s only level I trauma center and one of just two ABA-verified adult & pediatric burn centers in Florida. With five medical helicopters*, we transport critically injured or ill patients from 23 surrounding counties to receive the advanced care they need. The hospital is home to one of the busiest solid organ transplant centers in the country. TGH is a nationally designated comprehensive stroke center, and has a 32-bed Neuroscience Intensive Care Unit. Other outstanding centers include cardiovascular, orthopedics, high-risk and normal obstetrics, urology, ENT, endocrinology, and the Children’s Medical Center, which features a nine-bed pediatric intensive care unit and pediatric kidney transplant services. As the region’s leading safety net hospital, Tampa General is committed to providing area residents with world-class and compassionate health care ranging from the simplest to the most complex medical services.

Tampa General Hospital was named the #1 hospital in Tampa Bay by U.S. News & World Report, 2020-2021, and recognized as one of America's Best Hospital's in five medical specialties: Cardiology & Heart Surgery, Diabetes & Endocrinology, Gastroenterology & GI Surgery, Nephrology, and Orthopedics. Tampa General Hospital has been designated a Magnet Hospital by the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC), the highest recognition for nursing excellence, for the fourth consecutive time – an accomplishment that fewer than one percent of hospitals nationwide have earned. Job Title: Operations Research Analyst/ Data Scientist (OR/SA) Journeyman
Job Description:
Job Description:


Prescient Edge is seeking an Operations Research/ Data Analyst Journeyman to support a Federal government client.

As a Operations Research/ Data Analyst Journeyman, you will:

Provide on-site technical expertise and capability for assessing operations and analyzing plans, including support to contingency operations
Plan, develop, implement, and facilitate efforts to assess operations in the USCENTCOM AOR and analyze plans, such as the TCP, OPLANS, CONPLANS, OPORDS, FRAGOS, commander’s estimates, and other plans or operations
Provide OR and/or DS/A in support of Operations, Campaign, and Strategic Assessments
Support OPTs, Crisis Action Teams (CATs), and other assigned B2C2WG as needed. Planning support includes: participating in mission analysis activities to ensure measurable and achievable end states, objectives, desired effects, and tasks are developed; leading USCENTCOM planning teams in developing assessment frameworks and methodologies; managing planning teams in assessment activities; and integrating assessment activities and findings across the staff
Educate, train, assist and guide staff members during the assessment processes
Support the planning and execution of exercises to reinforce staff training and proficiency in assessments activities
Integrate assessment findings with USCENTCOM’s Quarterly Readiness Reviews
Integrate assessment findings with the annual Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff (CJCS) CJA/AJA and other Joint Strategic Planning System (JSPS) activities
Provide technical expertise to assist in implementing USCENTCOM sponsored initiatives which improve DoD-wide Joint and Service doctrine for Operations and Campaign Assessments
Assist the CCJ8 in its role as the secretariat for the Campaign Assessment Board (CAB), Campaign Assessment Working Group (CAWG), and the USCENTCOM Assessment Cell (CAC) and shall support all other B2C2WG as necessary
Execute analysis in support of assessments with high visibility, unusual urgency, or program criticality, requiring a variety of OR techniques and tools
Apply conventional OR methods and techniques to support assessments, exercising sound military and analytic judgment in applying standard professional OR practices
Exercise creativity and innovation in selecting and applying OR techniques and tools to support assessments, methods, processes, enhance assessment performance, or increase efficiency and effectiveness
Use statistical analysis, trend analysis and forecasting, data visualization and modeling, risk analysis, or other methods to analyze information and develop practical solutions to fit specific situations
Work on a wide variety of ambiguous, complex, compounding problems given only a skeletal framework or foundation for departure, characterized by either their expansive breadth or depth where analytic precedents and guidelines often do not exist, which may require unconventional approaches or the application and adaptation of sophisticated analytical techniques producing original results
Perform work with a marked degree of technical authority, assuming responsibility for each step of the analytic process, the thoroughness of the analysis, significance of the findings and effectiveness of the presentation
Initiate, oversee, and/or develop requirements from a project’s inception to conclusion for extremely complex programs
Develop project requirements, plans, and schedules to support assessment activities
Determine the nature of ill-structured or broadly stated problems, identify problem ramifications, and provide technical expertise concerning the validity of assumptions and the assessment criteria
Define problems, conduct research, develop analysis design, perform data collection and reduction, display data for analysis, examine the underlying relationships, select appropriate methods or techniques, formulate mathematical expressions, construct analytical models for understanding data, draw conclusions and operational insights from assessments, and prepare reports describing and justifying the results
Work independently or as part of a team to complete projects, potentially as a part of a larger project or a phase of analysis
Perform assignments arising from previous assessments that exposed problems or were highlighted in other applications
Develop and support new analytic capabilities as requirements evolve within the command for assessments (e.g., data mining and analysis, systems analysis, social analysis, data visualization and modeling)
Integrate analytical applications (e.g., R programming language) and Microsoft applications (e.g., Excel, SharePoint, Access, and Word) to support assessments
Create data management tools to support statistical/predictive analysis
Develop tools and reports that assist users with access and data analysis
Develop and manage DCMP, developing tools, methods, and processes for data collection
Use, modify, and tailor Client assessment tools (e.g., C2IE)
Provide support regarding inbound and outbound tasks utilizing the USCENTCOM Task Management Tool
Verify and validate data for accuracy to ensure precise analysis results and apply a wide range of analytical data-mining techniques to produce accurate data sets
Provide input and consolidate feedback of past, current, and future activities for the CCJ5, to include, but not limited to, weekly and quarterly updates and executive summaries for the leadership
Coordinate with operational technical experts
Coordinate assessment support and interface regularly with the HQ staff and DOD partners, Joint, Interagency, Coalition, and NATO, and shall support assessments conducted by those partners
Document working groups’ results, conferences, in-progress reviews, and other milestone activities
Document working groups’ results, conferences, IPRs, and other milestone activities
Brief senior leaders, potentially on controversial and/or sensitive results and findings that may involve differences of opinion or varying interpretations among experienced and respected professionals
Routinely communicate with, prepare correspondence and presentations for, and advise senior leaders
Generate finished products for presentation and final reporting



Benefits

At Prescient Edge, we believe that acting with integrity and serving our employees is the key to everyone's success. To that end, we provide employees with a best in class benefits package that includes:

A competitive salary with performance bonus opportunities
Comprehensive healthcare benefits, including medical, vision, dental, and orthodontia coverage
A substantial retirement plan with no vesting schedule
Career development opportunities, including on-the-job training, tuition reimbursement, and networking
A positive work environment where employees are respected, supported, and engaged



Job Requirements:

Active TS/SCI security clearance
The position shall be staffed by individuals with OR and/or DS experience and hold a bachelor’s degree in a technical field, such as OR, data science, math, engineering, science, computer science, or related field, master’s preferred

3 years of OR and/or DS experience, with a minimum of 1 year of experience of OR and/or DS experience at a Combatant Command staff, Joint or Combined Command Headquarters, or Defense Department equivalent. Minimum of 1 year of operation assessment experience preferred.

Ability to work independently or as part of a small team in conducting analysis in support of assessments with high visibility, unusual urgency or program criticality; requiring a variety of OR and DS techniques and tools.

Ability to communicate, prepare correspondence and presentations at the 4-Star General Officer level.

Ability to develop and support new analytic capabilities as requirements evolve within the command for assessments

Ability to integrate analytical applications/software programs and Microsoft applications to support assessments
Ability to create data management tools to support statistical/predictive analysis, DCMP, developing tools, methods, and processes for data collection

JOB

Department:
Public Utilities

About Our Job

To provide the Public Utilities department with information technology, project management, end-user application support, and analytical expertise as it relates to system software and user applications for department-wide business applications. To provide guidance, assistance, and implementation direction for new or existing departmental applications or systems established for use within the County. Reviews and assists with the implementation of process improvements as they relate to the department’s business applications. Provides program/project management function in conjunction with users and EIT. Coordinates staff training for all business applications and provides analytical expertise to the department with the goal of developing customer service-focused and fiscally responsible outcomes.

Job Description:
Manages projects and implementations of various software applications (primary vendor-based cloud-hosted) within the department which include but are not limited to primary business applications such as utility billing, work and asset management, business intelligence, and mobile workforce management. The projects and implementations include developing and managing requirements, project charters, scope, budgets, and schedules utilizing both County and external resources. Serves as the department representative for primary business applications for software vendors, consultants, and integrators. Interfaces with vendors to support the cloud-based applications. Works with end-users to identify their needs and assist them with problem determination and improving their use of the applications.

Research and maintain a system topology that ensures the software products work with each other to provide the end-users with functionality to perform their tasks in the best manner possible. Coordinates with department managers and acts as department liaison with Enterprise Information Technology (EIT) to develop strategic plans for business applications and enhancements to include business process development, new application, and user interface development, performance metrics development, staff training, and application version management.

Maintains continuity of business operations that includes disaster recovering planning and backup procedures. Initiates, coordinates and enforces systems, policies, and procedures. Verifies application results by conducting system audits of technology implemented. Maintains quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards.

Performs supervisory duties as needed (recruitment, training, performance reviews, coaching, discipline).

Work Hours: Monday – Friday, 8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m.

About You

Minimum Qualifications: A Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university in Information Technology, Business Administration or a related field and four (4) years of related experience in process improvement, business analysis, change management, end-user application support, and information technology project management. Associate Degree from an accredited college or university and six (6) years of job-related experience. Year-for-year experience may substitute for a college degree. Two or more years of supervisory experience. Advanced professional certification highly preferred.

Preferred Qualifications: PMP (Project Management Professional) Certified. Experience with utility billing and work & asset management software applications. Experience working within ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library) framework for software development and maintenance.

Job Competencies: Ability to multi-task and prioritize workload and work under demanding situations and tight deadlines. Ability to establish and maintain collaborative working relationships and possess strong customer service skills. Ability to assimilate user requirements and business processes to optimize the use of the department’s business applications.

Subject to Passing Substance Screening: This position is subject to passing a pre-employment substance screening. An applicant who fails to pass a required drug screening test shall be disqualified from employment in any class for a period of five (5) years.

About Everything Else

Pay: $63,003.20 - $87,006.40

Job Title: Business Insights Analyst, Value Creation Office (US Remote)
Job Description:
Purpose

PerkinElmer is seeking a Business Analyst for the Value Creation Office (VCO) - AES Division established underneath the Chief Executive Officer - AES Division to drive operational improvements. This role will report directly to the Chief of Staff to CEO / Head of Value Creation Office within the AES division and be responsible for supporting major operational improvement initiatives in close partnership with business leaders and senior members of the VCO team.

Responsibilities:

Business Analyst, Value Creation Office - AES Division will support multiple workstreams in the VCO that encompass major operational improvement initiatives in a specific business or functional area* that enhance efficiency, increase revenue, and reduce costs. They will have a strong grasp of business fundamentals, a mindset of curiosity, and both desire and ability to play a versatile athlete role to support value creation activities across the full spectrum of business priorities. The role will require a high-performing, resilient and collaborative professional who is excited to roll up their sleeves, quickly get up to speed on new topics, and engage in solving the highest priority challenges for the business. It is expected that this role will provide a successful candidate with the option to fast-track into a business leadership role within several years. As a Business Analyst, this person will:

Work with the VCO team to identify, collect, and refine data required to understand root causes of business challenges; perform analyses, develop recommendations, summarize conclusions and takeaways into quality outputs and present them to the team to drive problem-solving
Further contribute to decision-making on key issues by framing next level questions arising from the analysis, formulating and validating hypotheses, and developing options and scenarios
Own a portfolio of initiatives from start to finish, working under supervision of senior VCO leaders and in partnership with business leaders to successfully implement the improvements
Support tracking and reporting mechanisms within VCO governance structure to monitor initiative value delivery and take corrective actions if required
Support identification, planning, and execution of new value creation opportunities across the business that may fit in the Value Creation Office framework
Support management of Transition Services Agreements (TSAs), including driving governance processes, tracking costing and invoicing, partnering with the business in TSA exit activities, and preparing and executing TSA roll-offs
Contribute to M&A strategy by supporting deal team and company leadership in due diligence, deal execution and post-merger integration of acquired companies
Partner with and provide direction to external advisors, including consulting firms, individual consultants, law firms and others

Examples of focus areas include pricing, salesforce effectiveness, manufacturing and service operations, R&D, supply chain and logistics, sourcing and procurement, real estate, corporate business functions, and other.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Economics or Finance (or a related field)
3+ years of work experience in a relevant business environment in an analytical role
Must be able to not only compile the data but also be able to make specific recommendations and present them to senior leadership.
Mastery of Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint applications, command of common financial modeling and data analysis approaches and techniques

Preferred Characteristics:

1+ years of work experience at top-tier consulting firm strongly preferred, ideally with experience in enterprise-wide transformations or functional operational improvement programs
Strong growth mindset and commitment to learning, development and continuous improvement
Demonstrated aptitude for analytical and conceptual problem-solving; facility for quantitative analysis and summarizing complex concepts in easy-to-digest outputs
Experience in understanding issues, analyzing data, deriving conclusions, developing practical solutions and supporting their implementation
Experience with analytical and data visualization tools (PowerBI, Tableau, Alteryx, etc.) preferred
Strong work ethic and motivation, extremely high ownership, low ego (getting things right vs. being right), no-nonsense attitude and “work hard, play hard” mentality
Ability to balance multiple competing priorities and projects with different stakeholders; Excellent prioritization skills and “nose for value” that focuses efforts on the highest ROI work

COMPANY DESCRIPTION:

Are you ready to help improve the lives of millions of people and create a healthier world? When you work at PerkinElmer, that’s exactly what you’ll do. From our dedicated scientists and world-class operations employees to our innovative R&D professionals and committed sales and service groups, we’re a unique team of global colleagues who come to work every day knowing we’re making a difference. Through innovation, collaboration, and belief in our mission, we strive to create an inspiring and inclusive culture for our employees, so they can be their best and, together, create a better tomorrow.

PerkinElmer is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, or veteran status or any other characteristics protected by applicable law. PerkinElmer is committed to a culturally diverse workforce.

The annual compensation range for this full-time position is $64,000 to $96,000. The final base pay offered to the successful candidate will be determined by factors including internal equity, work location, as well as individual qualifications, such as job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

Job Title: Informatics Analyst - Business Professional II - R13632
Job Description:
JOB

Department:
Human Resources

About Our Job

Join our team in this exciting new position! Interpret and analyze data and provide strategies related to the overall benefit plan results for the County. Results may include things such as medical cost, pharmacy cost, clinical programs, population health and disability.

The primary responsibility within this position is to interpret and analyze data and provide strategies related to the overall benefit plan results for the County. Results may include things such as medical cost, pharmacy cost, clinical programs, population health and disability. This role will require creating reports or presentations as necessary and the analyst will need to be able to articulate results to a wide range of audiences including the Manager of Employee Health and Benefits and other County leadership and must be able to present complex information in a compelling format and manner. Flexibility and good communication skills are imperative. Responsible for commitments to quality and on-time deliverables. Motivated and willing to understand and probe into technical details and data irregularities. Manages resources efficiently to complete assigned projects accurately. Participates in the development of project plans and timelines.

****PLEASE NOTE: Pending approval of FY22 budget, position will not start employment before October 11, 2021

Note: Responsibility/Level of Position will be determined based on qualifications/competencies of selected candidate.

Job Description:
Performs population health analysis using varied data and tools to evaluate and measure performance of benefit and wellness programs using medical claims, pharmacy claims, dental claims, wellness, utilization, financial, performance guarantee, audits, and other data as pertinent to the project assigned.

Designs and implements data information efficiently using carrier platforms and other business intelligence platforms, including but not limited to Tableau, Microsoft BI, and Gartner as appropriate.

Extracts data from multiple sources and creates integrated analytic datasets and reports. Utilizes healthcare industry standards and studies to develop information in an understandable and concise format. Researches all questions from internal and external sources.

Conducts periodic updates of analytical information. Works with Senior Benefits Analyst to investigate and evaluate alternative solutions to meet the County Benefit and Wellness goals.

Works with Benefits staff to benchmark data as compared to budget and be prepared to discuss rationale within findings, impacts, or data variances.

Document’s methods and specifications for findings clearly; contributes to writing of and presenting of results, findings and conclusions.

Creates and evaluates the data needs of assigned projects and assures the integrity of the data.

Provides ad-hoc reporting as needed or requested.

Work Hours: Monday – Friday, 8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m.

About You

TIER II: A Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university in Public Administration, Business, Finance, Planning, Industrial/ Engineering Technology or job-related field and two (2) years of professional job-related experience in informatic sciences - including population health OR Six (6) years professional job-related experience in management of technical projects/programs and strategic planning may substitute for the required education OR Related professional program/project management may substitute for the required education at management discretion.

TIER III: A Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited college or university in Public Administration, Business, Finance, Planning, Industrial/ Engineering Technology or job-related field; three (3) years of professional job-related experience in informatic sciences - including population health. A Master’s Degree preferred and can count for one year of experience; OR Seven (7) years professional job-related experience in management of technical projects/programs and strategic planning may substitute for the required education.

Job Competencies: Demonstrated written and verbal communication skills. Able to present information to various audiences; experience in working in a data warehouse environment as well as the ability to work with large data sets from multiple data sources; solid understanding of complex databases and analytic environments; strong programming skills in analytic tools such as Tableau, Microsoft BI, and other business intelligence platforms; demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills; computer literacy and demonstrated proficiency is required in order to navigate through internal/external computer systems, and MS Office Suite applications, including Word and Excel. Strong understanding of the Healthcare and employee benefits market.

About Everything Else

Pay: $71,000.00 - $80,000.00

This Posting is currently Open Until Filled

What Is MyBambu?

MyBambu is a financial institution delivering the first all in one mobile digital banking solution targeting the Hispanic unbanked and underbanked population. The mission of MyBambu is to promote financial inclusion to the unbanked and underbanked by providing an array of financial solutions delivered via mobile devices. We give an overlooked audience a convenient, safe, and cost-effective way of managing their finances. MyBambu’s objective is to promote financial literacy and access to unbanked/underbanked individuals, who have previously been left behind. In 2020, we were honored to be recognized as FIS’s Impact Award winner for innovation in the next frontier of the Modern Banking Platform. We’ve fostered a company culture that empowers people to do the most defining work in their career offering an environment that’s made up of a passionate and goal-oriented team.


MyBambu participates in E-verify and will provide the Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new hire’s Form I-9 to confirm work authorization. Find out more information: E-Verify Participation Poster or Right to Work Poster.


Your Opportunity:

The impact that you can have at MyBambu is powerful. We’re looking for someone who’s eager to take on a meaningful role in the success of MyBambu on a massive scale. Someone who takes works seriously, but also isn’t afraid to have some fun either. Someone who’s ready to take MyBambu—and their career—to the next level.

Job Title: Operations Analyst 2
Department: Operations
Effective Date: 9/16/2023
Location: Alachua, FL

While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the current job, it is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, skills, duties, requirements, or working conditions associated with the job. RTI Surgical, Inc., reserves the right to revise the job or require that other or different tasks are performed when circumstances warrant (i.e., emergencies, changes in personnel or staffing, workload, or technical developments).

SUMMARY:
RTI Surgical is a global, industry-leading private-label OEM with expertise in allograft, xenograft and synthetic-based implants. RTI began operations in 1998 when it spun off from the University of Florida Tissue Bank in 1998 with the goal of expanding the gift of tissue donation by pioneering tissue-based innovations that promote natural healing. Today, through integrated partnerships with customers, RTI develops and delivers restorative solutions to physicians and their patients.

As a Private Label Original Equipment Manufacturer (PLOEM) partner, RTI provides comprehensive turn-key services for development and product life cycle management in support of patients and leading medical technology companies. RTI’s implants are used in multiple surgical applications including dental, spine, sports medicine, plastic and reconstructive surgery, urology/urogynecology and trauma.

RTI is rooted in a steadfast commitment to quality, integrity, and patient safety with a focus on four key values:
We are accountable to each other by trusting each other’s judgment and holding each other responsible for results.
We find joy by striving to create a working environment that people enjoy.
We fully engage by focusing our hearts and minds on our customers, patients, and each other.
We adapt to change by working collaboratively to be flexible to the changing needs of our business.
RTI’s headquarters is located near Gainesville, Fla. in North Central Florida’s growing life sciences region, and has additional state-of-the-art facilities in Greenville, NC and Germany.

Montagu Private Equity (“Montagu”), a leading European private equity firm, acquired RTI in 2020 and has supported the transformation of the company to its next level of potential.

POSITION SUMMARY:
The Operations Analyst 2 has strong expertise in planning and related processes. They are capable of evaluating data and recommending and implementing solutions, supporting and developing value stream systems, and conducting production and financial analyses. They may manage or carry out responsibilities in some or all of the areas outlined below.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Develops queries, reports, and analysis of product-based inventory flow in order to ensure on-time delivery of products to both internal and external customers
Proactively analyzes product-based delivery dates and current status against those required delivery dates
Monitors product-based inventory activity to ensure that product supply is being held for its intended use
Works closely with S&OP to identify, resolve, and elevate potential shortfalls in advance of occurrence
Monitors overall product-based inventory levels and their relation to anticipated future demand
Performs analysis on non-forecast requests to determine fulfillment plan
Monitors and assists with fulfillment once the plan has been established
Performs production and capacity planning analysis, develops operations metrics, and provides support for continuous improvement
Supports global production and tissue utilization initiatives
Coordinates standard cost updates and performs cost estimates and analyses for new products and operations improvement projects
Conducts financial analyses and project payback and ROI
Supports operations quality systems development including statistical modeling and design of experiments
Builds effective relationships with the highest level of customer service for all RTI departments and all levels

CORE COMPETENCIES:
Critical Thinking and Problem Solving
Results Oriented
Data Analysis
Business Acumen
Quality Focus

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
Bachelors degree in Industrial Engineering, Management, Supply Chain, or other applicable business field
3-5 years work experience in field; tissue industry strongly preferred
Experience with SAP and Microsoft Office Suite, with an emphasis on Excel, required

Physical Requirements:
Light work: Physically handle objects up to 20 lbs. occasionally.

Work Environment:
Office Setting - Open layout with assigned work station or office

Job Title: Director - Business Intelligence Operations/Cost Accounting: CORP - Strategic Fin Supp Svcs
Job Description:
Summary:
Responsible for managing and reviewing all cost and other financial data which is maintained and reported by the Strategic Financial Support Services (SFSS) Business Intelligence (BI) department.

Detailed responsibilities:

Oversees the cost accounting system to ensure that monthly processes are performed timely and provide accurate information. Reviews monthly costing processes to ensure that appropriate allocations and RVU methodologies are being implemented. Ensures that month-end analysis is correct for distribution to finance managers and executives on a timely basis.
Responsible for vetting of all financial data which is produced in the BI department. This includes ensuring that the EPSi system, along with the data warehouse, has accurate data.
Provides a supporting role to the finance department and other managers within the healthcare system with regard to various types of reporting, as requested.
Manages the BI request portal to ensure that staff are fulfilling information requests in an efficient and timely manner.
Anticipates business changes or needs based on the goals of the corporate environment, and proposes BI solutions to address them. Reviews and recommends methods or processes to ensure customers utilize information in the most efficient manner.
Maintains relationships with managers and other leaders around the healthcare system to ensure their projects and issues are adequately addressed. Communicates with BI customers to ensure that their information and reporting needs are accurate and timely.
Proactively identifies issues as they pertain to the BI department, and implements solutions or makes suggestions to address them accordingly.
Ensures that third party data registries such as Premier, HealthGrades and AJRR receive data from BI in a timely and accurate manner.
Provides coaching, motivating, and training of staff on a timely basis so that they can perform at their highest level of capability. Educates staff on any reporting methods which might better serve the BI customers.
Creates presentations and educates finance and other organizational leaders with regard to the benefits of cost accounting, patient level reporting, and how the process works.

Job Title: ERP Business Analyst On Site - Boca Raton
Job Description:
MAJOR RESPONSIBLITIES:

Serves as the project level liaison, between the IT organization and business partners, is business oriented with good technical understanding.
Experience with business and technical requirements gathering, analysis, vetting, prioritization and documentation, business process modeling/mapping, testing and implementation.
The key responsibility is to help derive and manage the requirements, work with inhouse and external developers to build solutions or integrate, or customize cloud/SAAS/custom type solutions etc. to ensure requirements are met in technology deliverables.
Captures business requirements and translates them actionable technical specifications, functional specifications, and system and data mappings, and works seamlessly with Information Technology engineers to translate, construct and deliver the technical solution. This includes researching and analyzing user’s business requirements, technical specifications, writing test plans in support of business functions, process knowledge and system requirements.
Serves as the SPOC to varied business functions across the IT portfolio of work. Will possess and continuously develop process expertise in the business units supported, as well as functional expertise in the suite of applications supporting those processes. These suite of applications include and are not limited to – custom inhouse developed franchise solution, Greatplains, SSRS and Power BI dashboards, SharePoint, MS Office, MS Project Online etc.
Experience in project management. Has had some exposure managing projects, scope, milestones to deliver on time, within budget and scope. Set and manage meetings and deadlines cross functionally. Direct and oversee project teams manage issue resolutions and communicate progress of projects to all stakeholders, etc.
Vendor management experience for technical escalations a plus. Experience creating SOW’s and RFP’s to vendors when needed and reviewing proposals and statements of work in response a plus.
Some weekend, off hour work required for maintenance and production releases



Qualifications:

8+ years in a technical BA role
8+ years enterprise IT experience
8+ years managing enterprise projects ie ERP implementations, Inventory and supply chain etc.
Bachelor’s degree required in MIS/CIS, computer science, or related role 3-5 years quality assurance or business analyst experience in a software development environment
Understanding of Agile programming; working with shorter release cycle/continuous delivery environment
Strong knowledge of Business Analyst techniques and tools
Please provide portfolio of business / functional requirements, technical specifications, test cases, UAT feedback, deployment plans, process analysis, timelines, RFP’s and other relevant documents
Relevant certifications– CBAP, PMP
ITIL exposure
Experience in franchise industry, health med spa type franchises is highly desirable.
On Site work is a must



HairClub is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating an inclusive work environment for everyone. We embrace and celebrate the unique experiences, perspectives and cultural backgrounds that each employee brings to our workplace. HairClub strives to foster an environment where our employees feel respected, valued and empowered, and our team members are at the forefront in helping us promote and sustain an inclusive workplace.

Location: Must have ability to commute to Tallahassee, FL

Years' Experience: 8+

Type: W2 with year-to-year renewal

Education: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field. Or equivalent work experience.

Key Skills:

Experience as a business analyst on software development projects.
Experience serving in a senior business analyst capacity directing the efforts of other business analysts.
Experience implementing messaging according to HL7 standards including ADT and C-CDA.
Experience implementing messaging according to EDI standards.
Summary

The Business Analyst serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs. Possesses expertise in the business unit(s) they support, as well as, an understanding of the IT organization's systems and capabilities. Analyzes business partner's operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions. Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology. Translates high level business requirements into functional specifications for the IT organization and manages changes to such specifications. Educates the IT organization on the direction of the business. Negotiates agreements and commitments by facilitating communication between business unit(s) and IT from initial requirements to final implementation. Possesses an understanding of technological trends and uses this knowledge to bring solutions to business units supported to enhance the enterprise's competitive edge. May make recommendations for buy vs. build decision.

Responsibilities


Define and document functional specifications and software test plans as assigned by the Department. Specifications and test plans should be documented utilizing Microsoft Office tools and the Department's change and configuration management system and templates provided.
Perform validation of documented business requirements against business processes as assigned by the Department to ensure that business requirements accurately represent the needs of business stakeholders. Business stakeholders include but not limited to, end-users of the Health Management System, Department staff involved in the processes automated by the software, Department staff who are consumers of the data collected within the software, and any external partners exchanging Health Management System related data with the Department.
Perform verification of developed software against business requirements and technical specifications as assigned by the Department.
Provide subject matter expertise (SME) to Business Analysts and development team as directed by the Department. Performing in the role of SME includes providing accurate answers to questions regarding intended software functionality. These answers are based on specific knowledge within a functional area or gathered through written and oral consultation with additional SMEs. SMEs may be end-users of the Health Management System, Department staff involved in the processes automated by the software or other Department staff who are consumers of the data collected within the software.
Facilitate business requirement gathering sessions with SMEs as assigned by the Department. SMEs may be end-users, IT technical staff, HMS practice management team members and HMS clinical team members. Ensure a defined agenda is communicated to participants, ensure a common understanding of terms and definitions, synthesize ideas, track discussions, and provide clear summaries of the discussion and decisions in oral and written form using Microsoft Office tools.
Identify and document opportunities for improving the efficiency of workflows represented within the software as assigned by the Department. Identification is a result of evaluating current system design through testing and end user feedback. Identified opportunities must be documented using Microsoft Office and the Department's change and configuration management system.
Prepare documentation of application change requests utilizing Microsoft Office tools and the Department's change and configuration management system as assigned by the Department.
Complete job required training as assigned by the Department. Completion verification may include certificates, sign-in sheets and verification via the Department's Learning Management System.
Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field. Or equivalent work experience.
Eight years of documented experience as a business analyst on software development projects.
Four years documented experience serving in a senior business analyst capacity directing the efforts of other business analysts.
Four years documented experience implementing messaging according to HL7 standards including ADT and C-CDA.
Two years documented experience implementing messaging according to EDI standards.

Business Analyst with a focus on application, process, and data integration; to play a key role in data-driven integration initiatives. In this position, you will be responsible for evaluating, quantifying, and facilitating the integration of various data pipelines from internal systems into a portal platform. Responsible for facilitating and enhancing the transparency, traceability, and the potential for data replication and integration processes.

Roles and Responsibilities:
Conduct interviews with business stakeholders to assess and quantify the business value of data integration. (integrate data pipelines from internal systems into a portal platform)

Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data requirements and objectives.
Work closely with IT resources to set up APIs and other data access mechanisms.
Collaborate with teams to ensure seamless ingestion of data into portal platform.
Prioritize testing and quality assurance activities to ensure a quality solution.
Coordinate with senior business and technical resources to gather requirements, assure data quality and accuracy.
Create comprehensive and transparent documentation of the setup and integration process, serving both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

Required Professional and Technical Expertise:

Over 7 years of IT experience in data analysis and integration.
Proven experience as a Business Analyst in data integration projects.
Proven experience as a project manager and/or scrum master experience
Knowledge of data access mechanisms, APIs, and integration tools.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to prioritize and coordinate complex projects.
Proficiency in creating documentation for technical and non-technical audiences.
Implemented data integration strategies to collect, process, and centralize data from various sources.
Developed data quality assurance processes to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data.
Created data visualizations and reports to communicate to internal and external stakeholders.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to drive initiatives and promote responsible business practices.

Preferred Professional and Technical Expertise:

Certifications in Product and Project management such as CSPO, CSM.

Title: Business Analyst
Location: Boca Raton
Duration: 7 Months
Interview Type: In Person

Job Description:

Serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization in order to provide technical solutions to meet user needs.

Possesses expertise in the business unit(s) they support, as well as, an understanding of the IT organization's systems and capabilities.

Analyzes business partner's operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions.

Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology.

Translates high level business requirements into functional specifications for the IT organization and manages changes to such specifications.

Educates the IT organization on the direction of the business.

Negotiates agreements and commitments by facilitating communication between business unit(s) and IT from initial requirements to final implementation.

Possesses an understanding of technological trends and uses this knowledge to bring solutions to business units supported to enhance the enterprise's competitive edge.

May make recommendations for buy vs. build decision.



Education:

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or other related field. Or equivalent work experience

Bachelor's degree in finance is also acceptable.



Experience:

Typically has 3 to 5 years of relevant technical or business work experience. Five years preferred.

Complexity:

Intermediate professional level role. Works with business partners within one business function to align technology solutions with business strategies.

Demonstrates an informed knowledge of a business area to resolve problems on an ongoing business.

Supports several moderately complex business processes.

Works on multiple projects as a project team member, occasionally as a project leader.

May coach more junior staff.



Other Requirements & Qualifications:

The business analyst will be responsible for identifying specific business opportunities and collecting and analyzing the data; simplifying requirements with the help of flow diagrams and use cases; influencing stakeholders to support business projects; leading projects and coordinating with other teams to produce better business results; testing business processes and recommending improvements; preparing, reviewing, revising and maintaining technical documents, including software and systems engineering, system operations, testing and user documentation; gathering and analyzing technical and product information from various sources to document new or changing product functionality; and assisting in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology.

The ideal candidate should have high-level written and verbal communication skills, with an emphasis on technical writing.

There is a need for a candidate with analytical, critical thinking and problem-solving abilities, with high-level presentation and negotiation skills.

A strong ability to adapt and work in a fast-paced environment is critical, as is the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, with an eye for prioritization.

The candidate should possess an in-depth understanding of organizational data flow and its use in management decision making.

High-level SQL skills and a clear understanding of web services is required

Job Title: J5 Operations Research Systems Analyst - COA
Job Description:
Threat Tec, LLC, a Veteran-Owned Small Business, is the leader of Operational Environment (OE) replication and Threat Emulation/Wargaming solutions. Threat Tec brings innovative thinking and extensive experience to complex challenges for public and private sector customers. We work alongside our nation's defenders, developing solutions that drive success and protect our future. Join a team that is embodied by an unwavering commitment to professionalism, honesty, and innovation.

We are seeking a highly qualified Operations Research Systems Analyst (ORSA) to join our team in Tampa, Florida, for the J5 Plans and Integration contract. The ORSA will play a critical role in supporting our client's strategic planning efforts and ensuring data-driven decision-making.

This position is contingent on contract award

Responsibilities:

Possess an MA/MS in disciplines such as Social Sciences, Public Policy, Applied Statistics, Operations Research, or Systems Analysis, or military education equivalent, such as CGSC Equivalent or Higher (SAMS or equivalent; War College or equivalent; JPME II).
Utilize operations research systems analyst (ORSA) experience.
Utilize advanced analytical skills and expertise to provide data-driven insights and recommendations.
Collaborate with command leadership and stakeholders to conduct in-depth analyses and assessments.
Apply knowledge of various optional specializations (One or more areas preferred): 5+ years in SOF; PSYOP; MILDEC; CWMD; CYBER; AT/FP; SNA; Special Programs; Interagency Experience, Intelligence, CCMD.

Qualifications:

MA/MS in preferred disciplines or military education equivalent.
MS degree or higher in Operations Research.
10-15+ years of operations research systems analyst (ORSA) experience.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and independently as needed.
Exceptional written and oral communication skills.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to delivering high-quality results.
Active Top Secret (TS) clearance and eligibility for Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) access.

Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. This description reflects management’s assignment of essential functions; it does not proscribe or restrict the tasks that may be assigned. This job description is subject to change at any time.

Threat Tec, LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employers (EEO/AA). All employment and hiring decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs without regard to race, religion, color, sexual orientation, nationality, gender, ethnic origin, disability, age, sex, gender identity, veteran status, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability and/or a disabled veteran, you may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to access job openings or apply for a job on this site as a result of your disability. You can request assistance by contacting HR@threattec.com or calling 757-240-4305.


#TT

Description:

SKUx is a leading fintech innovator giving brands and retailers the ability to deliver secure, serialized, intuitive digital offers anywhere, anytime, at the speed of today’s consumer. An offer Powered by SKUx™ also can provide first party consumer data throughout their offer journey, providing brands, retailers, and agencies the ability to develop personalized connections and retargeting with consumers. We make campaigns simple and customizable for the ultimate control over our customer’s direct spend, offering complete trust and transparency.

We’re planning for growth and continued innovation, and it’s an exciting time to join. If the below sounds like you and the kind of journey you’re seeking, we want to hear from you!

What You’ll Do

The Director of Product Management will be focused on defining the vision of the solution that aligns with current and future near-term market demands to deliver a robust roadmap. The candidate will have a true passion for technology, customer experience, and the marketplace bringing a blend of technical background, business analysis, tactical marketing, and operational execution skills. The ideal candidate will be a highly organized and self-motivated leader who designs customer-obsessed products, expertly manages a product roadmap, flexibly adapts to internal & market forces, and looks to execute with precision.

The Day-to-Day:

Develop and own the product vision & roadmap.
Collaborate with functional stakeholders and strategic partners to package and effectively deliver new products and features to market.
Partner with the Product Leadership on product strategy to meet revenue and market share goals through product design, packaging, promotion, and margin management.
Work closely with technical stakeholders and product development to ensure new functionality supports uses cases and is aligned to user needs.
Conduct qualitative and quantitative research to identify customer needs to support product strategy; maintain market vigilance of competing products and market impacts.
Provide feedback to the Product Owner on the content and prioritization of the product backlog.
Define and track metrics that inform the success of product initiatives and bring innovative products to the market.
Stay up to date on market trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in product management and implement the latest learnings into our process and product.
Evaluate and integrate with third-party vendors to meet our customer’s needs.
Define and align consumer and customer UI/UX journeys.
Requirements:

What Supports Success in the Role

Bachelor’s degree in business administration, marketing, finance, or related field; master’s degree preferred
10+ years’ experience in product and/or partnership management in the payments, fintech or financial services industries
5+ of direct payments experience; a demonstrated mastery of the payments ecosystem (Program Managers, Issuers, Payment Networks, Acquirers, Gateway vendors and System Integrators)
Familiarity with the digital payments and Loyalty industry a plus
Experience working in a startup environment, highly preferred but not required
True passion for making frictionless products and being obsessed with the consumer and customer experience
Self-motivated team player who excels in matrixed organizations
Aptitude to learn, build consensus, and solve challenging problems
Strong working knowledge or modern technology stacks and agile methodologies
Experience creating wireframes to communicate concept and product ideas
An obsession with customer research, product fidelity, and user experience
Strong executive presence; comfortable interacting with and presenting to all levels of management
Strong influencing and partnership/collaboration skills to drive cross-functional teams
Positive, team-oriented attitude and inspiring leadership skills a must
Working knowledge of Jira, Productboard, Miro, Figma, and Confluence preferred


Why You'll Love Working Here

Full suite of benefits with eligibility on day 1 of employment
Paid Time Off – take time when you need it, it’s highly encouraged and supported, and we don’t track time
First week of employment is actually a week of paid time off courtesy of SKUx
Paid Holidays – up to 9 days
Free Parking when working at St. Petersburg Office
Hybrid work environment that blends schedule flexibility and valued colleague collaboration


Our SKUx Values

Teamwork: Unabashedly focused on a common goal, with high respect and engagement, empowered to deliver exceptional results. Dedicated to engaging with partners and empowering our teams to deliver exceptional results.
Transparency: To each other, our clients and in our products. We deliver transparency and live by the highest ethical standards.
Trust: We operate with integrity and are accountable to SKUx, to each other, and to our partners. We do what we say and say what we do.
Technology: Our technology democratizes digital incentives in service of the consumer. Entrepreneurship and education is in our DNA, thus we develop and optimize forward-thinking technologies to better fulfill customer needs.


More About Us

SKUx provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment. With diverse backgrounds, experiences, and knowledge, our employees make us who we are. We recognize the power of individuality and encourage respect and dignity within our SKUx team. When we come together and work collaboratively, we achieve outstanding results internally and externally for our customers.

Business Analyst

Rolling Contract (Indefinite contract end date)

Location: Tallahassee, FL (3 working days in office required, 2 days offered remote)

Brooksource is looking for an intermediate to advanced technical Business Analyst who is currently residing in Tallahassee or is open to relocating to Tallahassee to work in a hybrid environment. This position is supporting one of the largest state agencies in FL working to enhance applications and systems that support internal employees and agency customers. This business analyst will work within a full lifecycle development team, working as an intermediary between business stakeholders and technical teams. They will be providing oversight to development activities and have access to SMEs that have created and support internal systems and applications. This BA will be involved in, and work in concert with other team members, to analyze, design, implement, and test solutions.

Primary Job Duties/Day to Day Function:

· Research and understand business processes and their inter-relationships within the agencies central IT office
· Research and understand the Identity Administration and Governance Platform that the agency will be using and enhancing.
· Gather and document business and technical requirements.
· Coordinate and lead the activities of the development team.
· Collaborate with the technical and functional teams to develop technical specifications and other documents in support of the Identity Administration and Governance solution.
· Coordinate data migration and development teams.
· Create detailed use cases, business rules, and requirements.
· Develop Test Plans and Test Cases.
· Coordinate and oversee the User Acceptance Testing and Regression Testing.
· Track bugs and backlog items using Microsoft DevOps.
· Provide daily updates to the Project Management Team.
· Perform oversight reviews of deliverables for compliance with department standards.

Specific Knowledge and Skills:

· Business Analysis: Ability to perform detailed research, business analysis, as-is and to-be analysis, process modeling. Use of software tools is required and include, but are not limited to, MS Word, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel, and SmartDraw.
· System Analysis & Design: Ability to perform System Analysis & Design using a variety of modeling methodologies and techniques.
· Facilitation: Ability to expertly facilitate workshops and meetings with stakeholders.
· Technical Understanding: Technical knowledge and understanding of IT infrastructure and software development practices and techniques.
· Project Management: Knowledge of State of Florida Project Management Rule 60GG-1.

Required and Preferred Experience:

· A minimum of 3 to 5 years of solid business/systems analysis experience and software development projects is required.
· Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel, Word, PowerPoint, required.
· Experience working with Microsoft DevOps is highly desired.
· Experience with Microsoft DevOps is highly desired.
· Certified Scrum Master (CSM) is highly desired.
· Experience with directing and managing project resources is highly desired.
· Experience with configuration and customization of Commercial-Off-The-Shelf products, is highly desired.
· Experience with data migration is highly desired.
· Knowledge of change and release management is highly desired.
· Experience working with Microsoft Power BI is highly desired.

SUMMARY/OBJECTIVES

SouthState Bank is a nationally chartered bank that provides consumer, commercial, mortgage and wealth management solutions to more than one million customers throughout Florida, Alabama, Georgia, the Carolina’s, and Virginia. With its Correspondent Banking Division, the Bank serves clients coast to coast.

The Check Fraud Team is responsible for protecting the Bank and its customers from check fraud, minimizing check fraud losses, and supporting branches and bank personnel when check fraud occurs.

The Deposit Operations Check Fraud Analyst’s primary responsibility will include, but not be limited to, the monitoring of real-time queues responding to high-risk alerts for checks drawn on our SouthState Bank accounts. Resolve queued transactions within service level agreements to reduce potential losses.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS


Analyze check fraud alerts and identify fraudulent items when compared to legitimate ones.
Ability to research/analyze data and recognize/evaluate patterns of customer activity.
Escalate cases to the Financial Investigations Unit when applicable.
Meet or exceed the accuracy, productivity and all other goals assigned by management.
Interact courteously and tactfully with managers, co-workers, customers and/or vendors.
Can be flexible to work weekends, holidays and/or extended hours as needed.
Accepts other duties as assigned by the manager.
COMPETENCIES


Strong analytical and account research skills are required.
Ability to work well under pressure, maintaining composure and meeting deadlines.
Work as a team with co-workers to ensure all functions are completed timely and correctly.

Qualifications, Education, and Certification Requirements


Education : High School Diploma.
Experience : A minimum of two years of banking and teller experience is required.
Very good knowledge of Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) and other state and federal regulations pertaining to check fraud and check processing.
Certifications/Specific Knowledge: F amiliarity Fiserv Premier core system preferred.
Demonstrated ability to problem solve, strong written and verbal communication skills.
Basic proficiency with Microsoft Office including Outlook, Word & Excel with strong analytical skills.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to prioritize multiple assignments and to meet required timelines.
Must demonstrate initiative, be self-motivated, flexible and adapt to changing priorities.
TRAINING REQUIREMENTS/CLASSES


New Employee Orientation
Annual compliance training
On-the-job training
Continuously update skills by participating in professional training
PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORK ENVIRONMENT

Must be able to stand and/or sit for long periods of time. Must be able to effectively access and interpret information on computer screens, documents, reports, and cash denominations, and identify customers.

This position is located in a cubicle environment that may be noisy throughout the day. It is also located inside a cooled and heated facility with ability to go to a break room or rest room during breaks.

Telecommuting roles, no matter if hybrid or 100% full time telecommuting, must have a secure home office environment that is free from background noise and distractions. This area also requires a reliable private internet connection that is not supplied by use of cellular data (hot spot). Cable or fiber connections are preferred. Requirements are subject to change, as new systems and technology is delivered.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

TRAVEL

Occasional travel may be required for outside meetings and/or training.
